There is only one elevator, so you might as well take the stairs in the morning, when it's busiest, which is not the stairs right beside the elevator (they will take you to some fire door that goes outside), but are located all the way at the other end of the hallway. My biggest problem with this place is the shower. They have those rain shower heads that are pointed straight down from a high ceiling, so you can stand there trying to rinse the soap from your hair and body as long as you can stand it, but will still have soap on you. I guess if we ever stay here again, I will have to bring a big cup and fill it up with water to get rinsed, kind of like you would do with your kids in the bathtub.Pros:  Fabulous location. Incredibly friendly, responsive, & service-oriented hotel team. LEED property. Great common areas for hanging out or doing work.  Complimentary continental breakfast.  Complimentary coffee 24HRS.  FREE WIFI everywhere. On-site restaurant w/superb food & beverages.  Power outlets everywhere in the room. Cons:  Extremely slow elevator.  No in-room refrigerators.  Overnight parking of $30/day. Even with the cons, the hotel still deserves 5-stars!  Everyone was SO helpful and friendly. The women at the front desk were fantastic.  They were always good for quality restaurant recommendations & even printed out directions/menus.  Also, we had an issue with the a/c - it was addressed w/in 5 minutes of calling the front desk. George, the service tech who fixed the a/c, was super. He waited to ensure the a/c was cooling properly before leaving, instead of just saying "ok, it's fixed" before confirming if it was even working.Definitely recommend!Stayed a second time (two nights this time) and we still had a good stay.  It's a great location near everything.  The breakfast is not that bad, just the basics, and coffee is available 24/7.  We just hung around the Inner Harbor with our rugrats and they, too, had a great time.  I agree with another reviewer that just the one elevator is a pain when it gets really busy with check-in/outs.Visited the bar, and had dinner. Overall good food and drinks for happy hour. Just stayed here one night, very clean and comfortable. Nothing major, would stay again. The staff was very friendly, they arranged us a ride to our comedy show and were very helpful. Standard hotel as far as the room goes.Checked out this new Fairfield yesterday for the Sox game. I'm guessing my experience was not representative of a normal visit (not on a sold out Red Sox weekend). I would definitely stay here again.Pros:-One of the few Green LEED certified hotels-Bar serves $3 beers-everything is new and rooms are well appointed-good locationCons-Check in was brutal and staff seemed undertrained/overwhelmedNice, cozy hotel. The lack of self parking bothered me initially but the parking lot across the street sufficed. Environment was fine and clean. I loved that the Wi fi worked throughout the hotel, which is rare to find nowadays. Not a bad hotel if you're in the city for a quick night.stayed here this weekend and was pleased. very convenient location for doing things in the inner harbor/downtown/fells point/little italy areas of baltimore. it's nice that you can walk to many surrounding attractions. room was clean and nicely furnished. the free breakfast was pretty lackluster - only appealing thing i found was cold cereal, but better than nothing i guess. all in all great property and would definitely stay here again.I really had a good stay at this hotel. Location is great which is right across the street from power plant live and the inner harbor. A green hotel too! Service was great and they also have a valet which is $30. But valet is great if you take your car in and out. Bathrooms are spacious and it has a rain shower. But the bed o my it is super super soft. They also have a big lobby if you don't want to sit in your room and there's also a bar downstairs where you can eat and drink. I had a great time and every time I go back home to Baltimore I will be staying at this hotel. O and Use cash for the bar because you might drink too much and be charged a lot,lol.Great location but it could be a better hotel if it had more than one elevator which was always so difficult to take. The free breakfast offered is mediocre at best. The staff is friendly and helpful, nice & quiet rooms, very clean and secure. Nice architecture & interior design. Very convenient, close to attractions. I would recommend this hotel to a friend :)Fantastic hotel! Love the green makeover and so does the staff: They were proud to point out the eco-friendly features of this hotel.This Fairfield has no "cookie-cutter" feel to it at all. It's a distinctive place with gorgeous clean rooms, all modern and yet still cozy-comfy. It's not often that you take pictures of the room because you like the color combinations so much you think of duplicating them in your own home. But yes, I did just that.Complain about the cost of parking if you want, but it was on par with other city locations I encountered during a recent nat'l tour. Parking  security may be an ongoing issue -- our rental car had its window smashed. The hotel was great about helping, even paying for a cab to get us to an appointment while the glass was repaired. But the fact that they had a glass-repair place practically on stand-by suggests our incident wasn't the first such. This incident is the reason I had to knock off a star.But again, things like these go with a big-city experience. And I never felt personally unsafe in the hotel.I'm looking forward to returning for pleasure not business, and doing more exploring in this historic neighborhood. How many times do you get a chance to stay on the site where Betsy Ross sewed Old Glory while enjoying the comfort of a perfect modern hotel with a fantastic staff?Only one place, and I encourage you to visit.Nice hotel.  Good service, clean rooms, free wi-fi, free breakfast, and a good location if you want to explore inner harbor.Just as other reviews said- valet parking is $30, which I think is way steep.  Try looking for parking on the side streets and save yourself the money.I am staying here tonight for the first time and love it. Our room is so nice and spacious. Everything is up to date and Eco friendly. The sports bar is great and staff has been friendly. Would defiantly stay here again! Also great location next to little Italy in downtown baltimore.
review_content_40: Four girls, two beds.Don't get too excited - we're sisters.  Eh, perhaps that made it worse.Anyway!  This hotel is well-situated for people wanting to explore the Inner Harbor area.  Shops, restaurants, sights, and assorted nightlife are just a short walk away. The rooms were new and clean.  Four girls and didn't have to call the front desk to request more pillows for the bed or towels for our showers.  Trust me, I know these ladies - that's saying something.Tip #1:  Also, in case you didn't notice when you booked online, Fairfield is owned by Marriott, so the first sign you are likely to see as you turn off of Pratt onto President is the one for the "Marriott".  Don't despair, that's your hotel!Tip #2:  Parking is expensive here (yikes!).  However, if you are just meeting people in the bar for a few drinks, they will validate your parking and get you a discount.  Do it to it.You pay for location, simply put. Valet parking is expensive but if you leave at 3am, you might get lucky and not have to pay for it. Bed is super comfortable but the room was very tight. Free continental breakfast but no different than any hotel you would expect from Seattle to Miami and also, lacks selection. Coffee was never made on-time so people always had to wait for a fresh batch. If you value convenience to the Inner Harbor and parking priority, this is your place but if you're on budget... it will likely be out of your price range.If you don't have a lot of requirements other than sleeping this place is fine, not great, not bad. First off, DON'T GET SUCKED INTO PAYING FOR VALET THERE!!! They wanted $30 for the night to park your car, however across the street is a parking garage that charges you $18 for overnight parking. It's maybe a 3 min walk. The only advantage to using their valet is if you need to take your car in and out, which we didn't. If you are going to take it in and out, they don't charge you. The parking garage would. We just had someone stay with our car out front when we checked in then when we were done for the night we parked in the parking garage. The staff was pleasant. The hotel itself is very nicely done. The things not so great about the hotel were that the beds were super soft, not the good kind of soft, but the kind that leaves your back hurting like hell in the morning, zero support. Also, our heater kept overheating the room, we actually turned it down to 67 cause it was so hot, but the room temperature was at 72 and the heater just kept pumping out hot air all night. The water in the shower was luke warm at it's hottest temperature. And something else weird I've never noticed at another hotel. After we were tired from site seeing all over Baltimore, we wanted to relax and watch a movie in our room, however you can't buy a movie from your room at this hotel. We even called the front desk in case we were just not looking in the right place, but nope you can't do it. There is no pool. There is a bar downstairs we didn't use, but was very popular.Nice new hotel with clean, well appointed rooms at a fair price. Helpful and friendly staff. The bar on the first floor had surprisingly good sandwiches.  Location is great for visiting Inner Harbor, Harbor East or Little Italy. Would definitely stay here again. Parking is expensive but thats normal for downtown Baltimore.its ok, but for a green hotel i expected them to be able to give me directions from BWI on public transportation.  instead two people at the desk told me to take a cab.  its a long walk from the train, but hopstop will get you there.I specifically signed up for Yelp just so I could write this review!!I will never stay at or recommend this hotel to anyone!  First incident was when my mother and I got completely ripped off (we were charged $10 for a  1/2 mile cab ride) by a driver with whom the hotel placed us with.  A very disappointing situation but when we spoke with the Valet Manager, Karl, about this he made us feel like he wanted to help make sure this never happened again which was all we could ask for.The second incident that we experienced is what sparked me to write this negative review.  After a hasty checkout of the hotel, my mother and I hit the road back to NYC.  As soon as I arrived home a few hours later I realized I had left some clothing (2 expensive pairs of jeans and a few other items) in the drawer of the dresser in the hotel room.  I immediately called to inform the hotel of this and they told me to call back the next morning as the housekeeping manager had left for the day.I of course called first thing the next morning as I was very anxious to get my clothing back.  After a few hours of going back and forth with the housekeeping supervisor and manager I was finally told that they had "everything except for the jeans" aka the more expensive items.  The manager of the house keeping dept there, Baron, basically told me that the woman who cleaned my room was 4'2 and would not fit into my jeans which were a size 27 so why would she take them... He told me it's "your word against hers" and did not offer me any solution whatsoever. At that point I asked to speak with the general manger of the hotel and was told she would not be in until the next Monday (it was now Friday).  Monday morning and afternoon I left the GM, Roberta, two voice mails asking her to please call me back ASAP.  I finally got a phone call around 4pm from the assistant manager Elisia; she told me that the hotel had no proof that my jeans were ever in the room and therefore would not reimburse me.  She said that the supervisor of the house keeping dept was the one who cleaned my room and implied that there was no way my jeans were taken by her.  I am not about to try and figure out who took my jeans or what their motivation was but the bottom line is that my jeans clearly did not get up and walk out of the dresser on their own so someone at the hotel took them!!  Combined they cost over $300 and I will never get them back...nor will I stay at another Marriot ever again. Shame on the Marriot for not even attempting to rectify this situation!!Great hotel...brand new rooms,friendly staff and tavern 101 in the lobby has 101 beers on tap...only complaint they don't have self parking and make you valet for $27 a day...I was told you can park on the street behind the hotel but was unable to find a space and the front desk lady telling me "we keep the door locked cause there's crazys"...makes me kinda weary of returning to a car with all it's windows...all in all good hotel and within walking distance of the inner harbor!I have stayed at the new Fairfield inn and Suites several times and am always impressed.  It is a certified green hotel.  The courtyard has a rain barrel that is recycled from the Baltimore Brewery that stood there.  The floor of the courtyard is where the flag that flew over Fort  McHenry (of Star Spangled Banner fame) was laid out and handsewn.  it makes you feel good to stay here, knowing you are not leaving a huge carbon footprint on your travels.  The lounge has six large tvs and the booths have small private screens.  its a good place to catch the football games.  This is the first Fairfield Inn I have stayed in which has a kitchen.  The food is very good, especially the macaroni and cheese and the crab soup.  Drinks are reasonable.  The rooms are very comfy and the staff is attentive and helpful.  Special shout out to Lisa the bartender.

hotel_name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hotel & Conference Center
review_content: The best hotel I've stayed at, I went to visit my familly and this hotel is conveniently located across the street from the tavel plaza. I arived at 2 am, got off the bus crossed the street, checked into my room within 10 mins. The room was very neat, free Wi-Fi and when I got up at 8 I made coffee with the coffee machine that was in the room then I head out to the cafeteria and had my free breakfast then went about my business. Overall very clean and cozy I had a great experience I'll definitely be back.I will start off with I have not personally stayed at this hotel overnight. From what I have heard from friends, the process is complicated, the staff is disorganized and there were extra charges left and right that no one could explain.I recently used this hotel as a place to park my car while I was on a cruise. They charge you $50 for the entire week per car if you do not book a room. If you book a room it's free. There is also an additional $10 service fee for the shuttle to the Baltimore Port.Upon arrival I was told as per Best Western (via phone) all I needed to do to add a car to a room (a friend was staying overnight) was to come into the hotel, give the room number my friend was staying in and say I wanted to add a car to that room for cruise ship parking. I did this and was given a ticket to go put on my car. I had to move my car from general parking to cruise ship parking (identified by green lines) and hang the ticket on my mirror. I went back after I moved my car and hung the tag to pay. The person I had JUST SPOKEN TO had no clue what I was talking about. I'm an honest person so I explained 3 times that I was adding my car to a room for cruise ship parking and he had just given me the ticket and I needed to pay. A manager finally came over and I told the story again. She told me I had filled out the wrong ticket and needed to fill out a new one...walked back to the car to hang that one and finally paid. I asked when the shuttle service runs she asked me "where are you going?" REALLY?!Long story short, the only reason I'd ever use this hotel again is for my next cruise. It's cheaper to park here than at the port. The shuttle service they use is AMAZING (5 star rating) and deserves all the recognition.Hotel staff is disorganized, clueless and don't listen to a word you say. If you don't need to use this hotel for cheap cruise parking, I'd recommend you look elsewhere.Came here while visiting Baltimore Comedy Factory & decided to stay here! I would first like to say if your coming from out of town & needing some place to stay while attending a show, I would definitely recommend! We got a king size room, the room was OK, not so nuch modern looking, the hotel or self is nice. The view we had was Everything! The couch was worn out and need to be thrown away! They had everything we needed for our stay as far as coffee maker, iron, microwave etc etc! They also have a indoor pool, but didn't have time to go! Hotel gave use a free breakfast, in a little dinning area, basic stuff but you do get hot sausage,waffles,biscuits, & eggs!  it's FREE! I will stay again!Stayed here for a few nights before our cruise for several reasons 1) rates were low $99 Thurs and $139 Fri night. 2) rate includes shuttle service to and from the harbor/port for the cruise.  Pros : rooms are clean, staff is very accommodating, close to everything, free wifi. Cons: hotel is dated (furniture is in rough shape, elevator inspection certificate expired last year and the location isn't in the best neighborhood ( views of the backyards of row-housing was depressing ).  However, I would most likely stay here again due to the friendliness of staff and price. Rooms are clean and the Wifi is free and dependable. We also had a mini fridge and microwave.  First night we called room service and it never arrived (waited an hour ). I went to the restaurant and they didn't have it. However, the waitresses were super and put my order in right away, very apologetic, allowed me to wait and gave us a drink from the bar for free. They also threw in a container of cookies!  Food was great.  Lastly, I had to use their business center to print out cruise documents and the printer wasn't working so the lobby attendants made copies for me ( I just needed extra printouts of my luggage tags so I made copies instead).  In summary, if you aren't concerned with luxurious appearances and just need a clean and economical place to stay for a short time, then you won't be disappointed.We have been to this hotel several times and for the most part, the staff has been friendly. If you're looking for luxury, you won't find it here. This is your average run of the mill "motel" type hotel. I don't know how I would describe the cleanliness of the rooms or lack thereof. While they weren't filthy, they weren't particularly clean either. I actually requested that they have someone come up and reclean the bathroom. They did this without a problem. Though they did come back in and there was an improvement, the appearance of the grout in the tiled floor (shower pan) was grungy looking. The smell that emanated from the bathroom randomly was of mild sewage. We noticed that only in the room that had a handicapped accessible shower, but not the other one. There was a hint of mold and dampness in the rooms. A couple of incidents that could use some attention aside from the cleaning are  making sure that they keys are activated for the appropriate amount of time and checking their email frequently so that when guests arrive they know that they have a reservation and don't charge twice. They do offer a free breakfast which you probably can't beat anywhere in town at no cost. The food isn't bad and there is quite a selection. Just a few of the items are scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, DIY waffles, yogurt, bagels, cereal, a variety of fruits, etc. Other amenities are free wi-fi, cable TV, free parking, and free shuttles to and from the hospital. They also have an indoor pool. They have a restaurant with room service and best of all, they have a laundry room. Those are just some of the services they offer. A big plus is that they are very accommodating with Johns Hopkins patients and offer a discounted rate to patrons.Great staff. Price is reasonable forr what you get. We had  a wonderful stay in a difficult time.  The buffet breakfast was great .  It's not a perfect place but for a mid level hotel   we enjoyed it.Went to stay at this hotel before and after a cruise out of Baltimore-  it was advertised as offering "park and cruise" service, with a shuttle to the pier.  Turns out my Expedia rate of $97.00 didn't cover the "park and cruise" which cost another $70- $50 to park and $10 each  for the two way shuttle. The park and cruise rate was $137- so not much of a savings- (they gave us some malarkey about how if you book on line you cant get the park and cruise rate.  The shuttle was run very well by a company called "Elite Transportation"  that had a table there in the lobby.  I would recommend them highly.  Well, maybe it was a misunderstanding, but that was the first problem.  Next, we tried to get two ashtrays sent up for our "smoking" room.  Never got delivered until we went down to the desk to get it.  Same thing happened with our request for  a couple packets of regular coffee- (they were all decaf when we arrived.)  There was a free urn of coffee downstairs in the lobby but the coffee maker in the room only made ONE cup at a time.  What happened to those similar-sized coffee pots that made five or six?  and the cups in the room were paper.  The front desk staff was pleasant but not very helpful. The room itself was nice enough, comfortable beds. But ask for a bay-view room.  The ones on the east side overlook the back yards of a bunch of trashy row houses.  The hotel is not in a great neighborhood.  I didn't see much around it but there was a McDonald's next door.  One good aspect was the restaurant - Tradewinds-  good food at good prices- a full buffet breakfast was included in the room price and it was great.  We also ate two other meals there, a Saturday buffet at $15.00 and another routine evening meal at prices from $12 to $22.  I had a good chicken fried steak.  The wife had surf and turf which she enjoyed.  Service was very good- even at the buffet.  They also had several pizzas available for pick up or room service in the restaurant.  The hotel also provides a shuttle to the harbor area and to other sites.  not sure if they charge for that.  All told, a decent place for a nights stay.  The wi-fi was free and worked well.The staff at this hotel is very hot and cold. The girls that worked at the front desk were great, very courteous and helpful. The rooms are nice and clean, the lobby is nice etc. The staff in the restaurant are terrible. Very rude, unhelpful and so much attitude/negativity I was scared to eat anything they prepared and cancelled my room service order. They didnt have change for a 50, wouldnt let me pay with my card and said Id have to go down to the front desk to get change or pay. And they seemed really annoyed by me calling in the first place...not sure why. Either way, I wouldnt order from the restaurant. The older woman in the evenings sounds spiteful, I would not trust her food. Also, there was a man in the evening that worked at the front desk, he had maybe an arab accent, he went out of his way to try and mess up my check out. I called down in the evening and requested a late check out from him. He stalled, then said the latest he could do was 1pm. I said Ok and asked if he would put it in the system, he said he had. But, I got the negative attitude off him as well so I called again in the morning and asked them to check that I had my late check out. Of course, they said there was no late check out in the system. Which means I would have gone down at 1pm and they would have charged me extra. So I asked for one and the philipino guy in the morning kindly offered me a 2pm checkout, which was great...but it also means the man the night before was being unnecessarily terrible. All round, nice looking hotel...poorly managed, horrific staff (minus the front desk women, they were lovely). I wouldnt stay here again, too much potential for major problems...most of the staff have issues. Just stay somewhere else where you dont have to be paranoid about them trying to screw you over/take out their frustration on you.Worst! Worst! And I repeat the worst hotel! Do not go here. The concierge are rude and obnoxious!Save your money and go somewhere else. I had an issue with the hotel service which I reported and the manager was not helpful. Is this somewhere anyone would want to go? horrible I will never go to a Best Western Branch again.Ok, lets not get the review twisted, the stay was not bad, nor was it good. It was just plain average. The location is pretty neutral, its a little bleak if you ask me (I am from California). For most, the proximity to the cruise terminal is good. For us, we just needed to be in Dundalk and I couldn't find something better. We checked in late at night and were helped quickly. The couches in the lobby are ATROCIOUS. Like they have been sat on a trillion times and the padding is completely gone. You can stand there and watch people sit down and quickly get up. You are literally siting on the wood beams in the frame. Management really needs to address this. Our rooms were on the 12th floor. The whole hotel is dated, a little worn. It was not dirty. The room was large enough and had a microwave, fridge, king sized bed and nice TV. There was a couch and table as well. The decor was a hodgepodge of colors and textures. This is not the Westin. The bed was firm, but the wife liked it. They have a washable duvet on the bed which is good, I HATE hotel bed comforters which harbor germs like you can't believe. The bathroom was dated and worn. Tile floor had small chips and cracks everywhere. Wall paper had been cleaned/wiped with bleach one too many times. Understand that it was clean, but there were definitely stains on the walls. Shower was fine. Everything was just run down and older. We ate at the restaurant the first night and the food was .... edible..... It was likely cooked several days prior and warmed in a microwave. Breakfast was better (and FREE!). They had eggs, sausage, juices, fruits, waffles and a neat pancake machine where you just press a button and a minute later a pancake appears! I tried to use the business center and that was a fail. They had three computers and I needed to print my boarding pass. The website needed the pop up blocker to be turned off and I couldn't figure out how to do it. Maybe they had it locked? So I tried the computer next to it, that one wouldn't turn on. I gave up after 15 minutes. They have a little gift shop and you can buy some snacks and water. I noticed they have room service pizza. It was pretty cheap, we didn't eat it but were tempted! McDonalds is literally steps from the front door. Parking is in the lot, its free but make sure you get a permit from the front desk. Would we stay here again? Yes, if we had to go to Dundalk. But this was a rare occasion and we won't be returning to DundalkThis hotel is way below lackluster. The front desk staff aren't that friendly. Anastasia checked us in last night and it seemed like she really didn't want to. She gave us the room key she didn't say "enjoy your stay" or "thanks for staying with us". She simply gave us the room key and told us where the elevator was. The rooms are not the cleanest! There was a hair on the toilet. The ceiling looks like it could fall. The room smells like mildew. The beds look dirty and looks like they just threw the sheets and pillows on there. I'm so disappointed. What a waste of 187.00 dollars. Don't stay here! It needs an update! I called down and asked for toiletries and the front desk person asked me to come down at get it myself. I couldn't believe that. Breakfast was okay. Housekeeping doesn't speak.Reviewing the front desk service because I ended up not staying. Was staying in the lobby waiting for the friends to come from NY on a bus that often drops off nearby.  One of the employees came up to me and asked if I was staying there and told them that we were going go rent a room and had no reservations. Still waiting an hour later, for whatever reason they seemed upset ive been waiting in the lobby and told me I couldnt wait there anymore.  It was blatantly obvious that they thought I was lying as they didnt do a good job being polite - asking how many I had in my party and their names, to which I mentioned that we had no prior arrangements...  My friends did arrive and we ended up going to another place.  What a shame, but they lost business.I am back again. Our room is actually cleaner this time than the last, but staying here can be just plain frustrating. The key cards rarely work twice, and even if they do, we have yet to have them work two days in a row. Also, the staff rarely if ever check their email, which can complicate business check-ins because in cases like ours, the credit card authorization is in their email before our arrival and then they want to charge us on arrival because they didn't check their email. They need a little more organization. The price is right, though, and so is the location. I would give them three stars again if not for this problem.The room was small and tired,  but the shuttle into the Inner Harbor makes up for the room. The pool's filter system wasn't working properly and the hot tub was lukewarm at best. However, the Sauna was piping hot. The free buffet breakfast was nothing special.  With a little sprucing up, this hotel could be great.Staff was polite, and lobby areas were clean and updated. However the room itself was gross, AC did not work well, and the shower was beyond dingy. The "full gym" was way outdated and the pool looked like a swamp. The Jacuzzi part of the pool was not filled, and it was moldy and crumbling.This was our first stay at this Best Western Plus, it's very close to I95 very convenient to continue on your travels.  The staff was without exception friendly and customer service oriented. The room was clean and offered the general amenities such as toiletries, iron and ironing board, coffee maker, hair dryer, mini fridge, and microwave. The pool and fitness area were very clean with a variety of exercise machines to use. I would gladly rebook my next visit to Baltimore.First thoughts...oh crud... there's a cemetery across the street!?!?!?!?!?    But it's actually pretty far away, and the hotel sits high up on a hill, so you'll be good in case of the zombie apocalypse.  Here's a quick breakdown of my thoughts of the place...Pros-Indoor pool-Fitness center-They give a ton of amenities, even toothbrush and toothpaste and razor-You can make your own waffles!Cons-Fitness center is only cardio equip, no weights-Bathroom toilet sits too close to the wall(I don't like it when my knee touches the wall in any bathroom, and obviously, I'm sitting)-Bfast buffet is a little limitedFriendly staff, plenty of parking, and a restaurant in the hotel...always good signs for me cuz I'm usually so beat at the end of the day that I'd rather not travel even more to eat before bed...It's about a 10-15 min drive to downtown Baltimore from this spot so if you don't have a car, you may be cabbing it around a lot.It was decent. Better then most Best westerns that i have been through. Breakfast is basic.. but its free so no real complaintsI just learned, two days after checking out, that this hotel added a $100 smoking charge. I DO NOT SMOKE. This place is seriously disturbed and this is clearly the angry lady behind the counter when I checked in getting back at me. For what I do not know. She became seriously weird at check-in after I didn't say thank you. I. Do. Not. Smoke. Disturbing.Check was easy. Rooms were large enough with two beds.  Rooms were clean and hotel was quiet.  Breakfast served in the morning was eggs, waffles, oatmeal, cereal and fruits.  Would definitely stay there again.
review_content_20: My sister stayed her during her recent trip to Baltimore. The hotel is clean and well managed. They offer shuttle service to Johns Hopkins which is about 15 minutes away. They hotel is near to many attractions in Baltimore, including the inner harbor. This is a great inexpensive hotel that offers quality service and clean lodging.Stayed here for three nights and I can't really complain because I didn't have to pay a cent thanks to the conference my boyfriend was attending so I can't really complain.Or can I?The reason why I knocked off a star is because I saw a staff member being nasty to two of the cleaning ladies. Her tone was condescending and harsh. It appears that the cleaning ladies have difficulty understanding English but I don't think it warrants anyone to use that kind of tone on anyone. Also, just a heads up: no one cleaned our room for 3 days and when we asked about it, they informed us that it's best to take the do not disturb/please clean sign completely off the door knob when you are leaving the room. Since most of the cleaning staff cannot read English, they assume that all doors with the sign on, regardless of which side it's on, do not want to be disturbed. Free breakfast: Buffet style, they have those rehydrated eggs or whatever, toast, mini muffins, cereal, orange juice, cranberry juice, oatmeal, mini donuts, wafflemaker, etc. It's not an amazing meal but hey, it's free. Free wifi is available throughout the hotel. A pool and gym is also available to guests. Did not swim in the pool because the water was cloudy. The "gym" consists of about 5 machines. I remember seeing a treadmill and an elliptical. Parking came free with our room as well. The room itself was nice. I found the bed, sheets, pillows, everything super comfortable. The bed or room had no offensive odor and it was clean (except for a suspicious stain on our couch). Bathroom came with a coffee maker, coffee things, shampoo, conditioner, bars of soap, shaving cream, toothpaste, razors and lotion. Overall, I looked forward to coming back to the room to sleep every night.Great hotel for its price ($99/night) and free amenities (free breakfast, free wifi, fitness center, shuttle service, on site restaurant, free parking) which trumps staying at a 4-5 star hotel in the Inner Harbor to pay for parking ($20/night) and no free breakfast ...However, this location is less than appealing. It's near the Inner Harbor but not within walking distance thus the shuttle service. Not much around but Mickey D's and gas station, and Johns Hopkins Bayview.They renovated the hotel but the heart of the hotel is the same. Customer service is average. I found some to be rude. Too busy to finish their own conversation first to wait on me. Renovations were done half hearted...some water damage noted.Having stayed at numerous hotels in the area, this is just not worth it. Linthicum Area hotels offer better deals with similar amenities. I will not be back.I stayed here for the Park and Cruise special they have. It was well worth it considering I could leave my car there for a week and avoid paying to park at the cruise port.Anyway, the rooms were very very nice. I thought it was worth what I paid for it. The employees who worked there were friendly and helpful as well as the shuttle service that is provided. (The shuttle service isn't owned by the hotel, but I just wanted to put that out there too)I took one star off because the breakfast buffet was just okay, they could have had more options.If I ever have to stay in Baltimore again, I'll be back.Awesome staff, very friendly and helpful. The hotel was also very clean and tidy. You could also get a pretty decent nights sleep since the walls there aren't too thin hehe. Complimentary breakfast was also a plus (food quality was better than the Hampton Inn IMO). Rates are also decent considering the other hotels by inner harbor runs 200+.We checked in early and the staff was very friendly and accommodating! Very clean rooms and maintained hotel. Would def stay again and recommend this hotel!Location is fairly far from inner harbor. They have free shuttle service but if the bam doesn't see you immediately, they leave you (which is what happened to a lady today at the surgical eye center!). The quality of the 'breakfast' is extremely low. The pool had an in identifiable foam on the top of it. The ice machines weren't working. And our bathroom was missing tiles. Definitely not worth the money. Would gladly pay more for better quality.When I first checked in I thought it was ok. A few minutes after getting into my room I realized how dirty everything was. Bathroom floor was not swept and room appears not vacuumed. Later I realized that the entire hotel was really dirty.Checked in today and have already seen 3 roaches and a bed bug. As soon as I post this I am looking for a new home for the week.If you're visiting Baltimore with a car and are looking for a decent but cheap hotel, Best Western definitely fits your bill. If you want a little more luxury that is a little closer to the action, you should pass.We fell into the have-a-car/want-a-cheap-bed category and this hotel was a-ok for us. There aren't many frills, as you might expect, but neither were there any upcharges that come with a more expensive hotel.Here's the good:~Free parking. This becomes an even bigger perk when you pay to park at the Inner Harbor. (My tip on that is don't pay $10-20 to park in the Inner Harbor - find a side street and stalk a spot. You're going to walk your ass off anyway, adding a few more blocks won't be a deal-breaker)~Free breakfast. It's only a step up from a continental breakfast (hot eggs and bacon) but it'll fill your belly with food on the cheap.~Free wi-fi. I'm not sure why the cheaper hotels are the only ones giving away their wi-fi, but I guess I'll take it where I can.~Free shuttle to and from the Inner Harbor. We had a car and didn't feel like messing with the shuttle (you have to reserve your spot both ways at least an hour in advance) but it's there if you want it.~They're only a couple of miles from Fells Point. The Inner Harbor is where the tourist action is at, but Fell's Point has a much more local feel. Want to eat at a non-chain restaurant and then bar-hop more than a dozen pubs/taverns/bars in a 2-3 block radius? Fells Point is your destination.Here's what kept this review at three-stars:~Everything about this hotel is old and worn out. But it puts a pillow under your head and a roof over your head without putting a serious dent in your wallet.Bottom line, we stayed at Best Western the first and last nights of our trip and it worked for us.Not bad...I have some mixed feelings about this hotel. I've stayed here on multiple occasions for work and each time, I've been given a different style of room. The first time I stayed, I had a cramped room with two queen beds, which was fine since I was there alone on business, but it was pretty tight. The television was not flat screen, and I'm not trying to be snobby, but it was tiny and difficult to watch. Also, I left a pair of nicer tweezers (Tweezerman brand) on the bathroom sink counter and they went missing, which upset me.The second time I stayed here, I was given a HUGE room with two queen beds. Again, there was a bulky television and the same furniture as before, but just spread out in a bigger room. I had no problems during this stay.On my most recent stay, I was given a room with a king sized bed and it was fancy! There was a nice, big flatscreen that had a computer/dvd player hooked up with a nice lap desk for you to use in bed. I was really pleased with this room.Overall, the hotel is clean and comfortable and I like that they offer free breakfast in the morning, though, it's nothing special. They have eggs, sausage, assorted breads/danishes, Belgian waffles, and cereal. The rooms are decent, but I didn't like how the quality of the three rooms (all at the same price) differ so drastically. I know now to request a king-sized room if I stay here again. The location is great - it's right by Greektown and it's a short drive from the Inner Harbor (and they offer free shuttle service) and it's right off of I-95, so it's a convenient place to stop. The free wifi cuts in and out from time to time, but is decent.This Best Western was hosting a New Year's party that my boyfriend and some friends were attending with about 2000 other people. We decided to get a room for the night so that we wouldn't have to worry about driving home afterwards. The party didn't start until 9 pm, but my friend and I went around 5 so we could check in and get ready in the room and just hang out. The hotel is not in the nicest place. It is actually in the Baltimore Travel Plaza, right off of exit 57 on I-95. It is kind of a shady area and is not in the middle of any downtown action at all. You will need to take their shuttle or drive down to Canton, Fells Point, or the Inner Harbor if you want to tour the city. There is plenty more to do there and I would not recommend walking because there aren't any sidewalks and doesn't seem too safe. However, for the price, it may be worth it to stay at this hotel and just make the short drive to the city everyday. Hotels around the Inner Harbor are ridiculously over priced. Even though the hotel is not in a great area, the hotel itself is pretty sweet. Our room had a king size bed, sofa, table, and a decent sized bathroom. It was clean and we were on the top floor and had a great view of the city (once you looked past the travel plaza parking lot and construction zone). All the rooms in the hotel were booked. Consequently, the staff was overwhelmed upon check-in, but they made up for it by being friendly and checking us in as quickly as they could. The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast, but it was over by 9 am and we did not wake up in time to experience it so I cannot comment on the breakfast. Since we did not have breakfast at the hotel we headed over to Miss Shirley's Cafe for brunch in the Inner Harbor. I highly recommend this place (yelp.com/biz/miss-shirle...). Nice hotel in a shady area, but the price can not be beat.I can't believe how high this place is rated. I ended up here on a work trip and it is by far one of the worst hotels I have stayed at. The conference center is under construction. The rooms smell, I believe this is because they still allow smoking in the hotel on some floors, the room I had was in need of an overhaul. The room had patches on the walls, cracks in other parts, the door had light coming in all the way around, the bedding had stains, there was paint on the celining. Old out of date TV's. the lobby did look nice but the workers were uninvolved to the point on rudeness. I would not stay here again and I would suggest that anyone else do either.The AC and heat was very loud, I could hear everything that went on in the hallway and there were no closets, just a cubby that was hardly big enough for a suitcase.I stayed here for a two-day business meeting. I spend 70 plus nights a year in hotels for business and pleasure.This property is fairly run down. The room I had was clean, but needed major updating. Smelled old and the carpet and furniture had seen better days. Price was reasonable and included a very basic breakfast. There is nothing around this property. No restaurants, stores, places to walk or relax outside. There is an indoor pool. This property is geared toward those leaving on cruises from the nearby port or for those that need to be near Johns Hopkins. The hotel does have a complimentary shuttle for getting to the Inner Harbor and other attractions, but it must be on their schedule and the last one leaves Baltimore at 10:30 pm. And strangely, no airport service. There is free parking. I am 60, and was one of the youngest guests staying at the property.This is not a four star hotel by any means, but then again, I am a barely-getting-by college student, so I'll take what I can get. I recently traveled to the Baltimore area for business- I had a couple of interviews in the area, one at Johns Hopkins-Bayview and one at the University of Maryland, and I wanted to book a place that was convenient to both places and relatively cheap. I ended up booking this place on hotel.com and spent about 190 dollars for a two night stay. This was the best rate I could get for something a little better than a Motel 6 for example. Overall, I was incredibly impressed by the hotel and so glad that I made a reservation here. Check in was easy and I was pleasantly surprised to find that I was entitled to the morning breakfast buffet even though I thought my reservation explicitly stated that I was excluded. But even more than this, the shuttle service provided by the hotel was easy to use and extremely convenient for my purposes. Shuttles run every hour and take you to a variety of places, including Johns Hopkins-Bayview as well as the University of Maryland Medical Center and Inner Harbor. And even though I was told that they didn't have a drop off point in Canton Square, the one shuttle driver dropped me off directly at the restuarant in Canton where I was meeting people for dinner on one night of my stay. The facilities themselves are about average- the indoor pool was a little sketch, made even more sketchy by the fact that I was the only one using it. But overall, would recommend this hotel just for it's overall convenience factor- especially if you have business at one of the local medical centers.I was in Baltimore for two nights and couldn't have asked for a more comfortable spot. The employees were so welcoming and helpful that it made my stay in Baltimore so much better! The breakfast had many tasty options and room had everything I needed. I left Baltimore not only thinking that I'd eventually return to such a vibrant community, but knowing which hotel I'd call to make a reservation, the Best Western on O'Donnell Street.Best service ever. The management is the most professional and friendly that I have experienced in a long time. The rooms are extremely clean and well stocked. This is where I will stay every time I am in Baltimore.This hotel is awesome. I travel to Baltimore all the time. I have stayed in expensive, nasty places. This place has been remodeled. The beds are amazing...as nice as the fanciest hotel. Management is super spectacular and it shows all the way down to the friendliness of the staff. Rooms are big, with couches, lovely bathrooms, great furniture set up. Shuttle service. Close to everything. I highly recommend this place for your business, family, trip. STAY HERE!cleanest most sparkling gleaming freshest comfiest most immaculate good smelling hotel I think I have ever been in with no mold of any kind no rips no stains no chips and the fluffiest most comfy pillows and awesome sheets. Seattle's Best in multiple locations...free parking ...free wifi....Pantene...toothpaste!....decent food options inside the hotel as well as a 'dinner theatre' and right on top of major arteries, DC, Inner Harbor, galleries....Broadway Diner a stone's throw...pricey but reliable and good...Chaps Pit Beef two stones throw...fantastic food options inside and out. This place is a gem. Room 703 close to elevators directly across from ice and vending (Coke) and slept like a baby. No noise. Separate floor for 'families'. Only negative is no outdoor pool. Otherwise perfect. I felt totally comfortable walking in barefeet in this hotel something I never ever do. Immaculate. and a MacDonald's 24hr in the parking lot. Fantastic shuttle to save time and money on very challenging parking.

review_content: Great location near both the Inner Harbor and Fells Point.  Staff was very helpful, our room was spacious and clean with great views of the city.We had a very comfortable stay here for New Year's Eve. Valet parking was a little backed up, but the attendants were patient and helpful. The room was spacious with a full kitchen, desk, couch and loveseat. Slept through the continental breakfast (happy new year hangover) but that was a nice touch. Starbucks and Whole Foods conveniently nearby!Significant problems with the room.  No batteries in tv remotes, no PLUG for the tv.  Doors to closet hanging off hinges.  Cheap mattress, paint patches on the ceiling.  Moved rooms and got one with fewer problems, though still with issues.  At least the staff is friendly and helpful.  Overall, very disappointed for a Homewood Suites property.  My general impression is dirty and pretty beat up....Very comfortable stay as I decided to do a little staycation over the weekend. There are no real complaints and that is saying something since my room was right next to the elevator and I not once was awakened by people utilizing it. I did opt for valet parking as everything you could possibly need and want to visit is within walking distance.For those of you that want to keep up on your exercise regime you get complimentary access to the Maryland Athletic Club located on the second floor.  I had every intention of utilizing it but you know how that stories goes.Breakfast was good and you have an option for room service but with so much to choose from in the area I doubt if you would need to use it.Parking: Self or valet optionsValet parking is located in the front of the hotel.  This includes in and out privileges. $35 a day.Self-parking entrance is located on the opposite side of the building on 650 S. Exeter St. (across the streets from Wholefoods).  Self-parking is operated by a third party and not with Hilton.  There is a parking ticket machine near the parking elevator on the hotel lobby floor where you can pay in advance before leaving or pay on exit at the gate.  No in and out privileges. The rate is hourly with a maximum 24 hour fee of $23.00. Everything is in walking distances so I self-parked for 2 days.Staff is very friendly during check-in. They were able to provide the lay of the land and answer all the questions we had about the area.Starbucks, AMC and Wholefoods are all in walking distance of the hotel.Breakfast is located on the 2nd floor lounge. Do not expect the same type of offerings as an Embassy Suites, but it was sufficient.Definitely a big fan of this property and would return again soon.This property is newish and well kept. Our suite was spacious with great views and beautiful light. There is a full kitchen that we did not use. The property is well located in the East Harbor area with the harbor walk, little Italy , stores etc all within walking distance.   Lots of restaurants nearby. Access to the enormous fitness club on the 2nd floor is included. Overall, a good value for the cost.Comfortable stay. Fantastic location. Complimentary breakfast and dinner Monday through Thursday was a nice money saving feature. Loved the apartment feel to it. I could stay up and watch tv while my other half snoozed behind closed doors in a separate room. My evil insomaniacal twin enjoyed that a lot. Adored the rooftop terrace and access to MAC gym.I've been staying at this Hilton Property for the past 4 years, Love the location. Access to everything and anything and it's very convenient to Little Italy, the inner harbor, etc. The people that work the breakfast do an outstanding job every morning. They keep everything very clean. Room are getting a little tired. The first room I was given had to be changed, I had requested a queen or kin size bed, but the receptionist insisted in giving me a with two double beds. Mind you I checked in at around 5 and apparently housekeeping had not finish ding all of the house cleaning. I've tried calling the front desk and got no answers. I decided to go back down, then bumped into the Assistant General Manager Hatice Meral who asked me if everything was okay. I decided to address the problem and she personally took care of it and found me a more suitable room. One overall comments, I think the decor is starting to look tired. Will have to look for something newer next time.A perfect dog friendly hotel right in downtown Baltimore. The location is great, one block away from Little Italy and walking distance from Fells Point. There are restaurants, movie theater, 24 hour CVS and a fresh market all within one block of the hotel.The room is set up perfectly. You walk into your room from the hallway and you are in a little kitchenette that has a microwave and stove top and then the living room that has a pullout couch. The pullout couch is not comfortable and kind of springy, but I still got a good nights sleep nonetheless. The bedroom with a shower (perfect water pressure, I could shower in there for days) and bathroom are through another door. The separation of these rooms make it a perfect situation if you have a dog. You can put the dog in the bedroom with the tv on so they don't have to hear people walking up and down the corridors. They have a HUGE courtyard on the eighth floor that you can go and walk your pup. This is really nice because I would not want to walk around Baltimore at night all by myself. We did not hear any other dogs during our stay, no barking or running around, so we really felt that we got all the positives of being a dog hotel with no negatives. Another great thing about this hotel is the free breakfast that they offer is open until 11 AM (at least on weekends) When you're on vacation sometimes you can't make it to the breakfast at other hotels because it closes too early. It was a breakfast buffet, don't expect the four seasons, but it was good nonetheless. Definitely satisfied our family. Lastly, there is a full-blown gym connected to the hotel which apparently you get free access if your hotel guest. We went to check it out as we were leaving and we saw yoga classes going on and it looked really nice and clean. Next time we're in town with the doggie, we will definitely be back!We stayed here New Year's eve.  I normally stay at Hilton properties and chose Homewood Suites because it's close to Fells Point and I was able to get a room with a view of the Inner Harbor.  It was very cold and windy that night, so we watched the fireworks from our room while having cocktails.  The room selection worked out perfectly.There is definitely a difference between Hilton and Homewood Suites.  The bedding at the Hilton is almost luxurious.  There is a variety of pillows from firm to plush and the sheets and comforters are always soft and inviting.  The bedding at the Homewood Suites wasn't as comfortable and consisted of a thin scratchy comforter and a top sheet and no variety in pillows.  The other substantial difference is that Hilton offers a cooked to order breakfast with all of the other food items being relatively fresh.  The staff at Homewood didn't seem to be concerned that most of the major breakfast items were empty.  It might have been that it was New Year's Day, but I've experienced the same thing at another Homewood Suites.Homewood Suites and the Hilton Garden Inn occupy the same building, but on opposite sides.  Between them is the Maryland Athletic Club.  As a guest of either property, you get to the use the gym.  I've been to a lot of hotel gyms before, but the MAC is definitely worth checking out.  They have squash courts, a full line of fitness machines and free weights and a variety of cardio equipment.  There is also a pool and Jacuzzi.  I'll be back to Fells Point, but will probably stay at the Hilton.  In my opinion, Homewood Suites doesn't compare favorably to Hilton.  I definitely prefer the cooked to order breakfast and bedding at the Hilton.  Each property caters to a different demographic, but Hilton will continue to be my home away from home.My Hilton property of choice has always been Embassy Suites but I gave Homewood Suites a try, and glad I did. As a compact suite property, it offers the comfort of home including a kitchenette, living room, desk work space, private bedroom and bathroom. Additional property perks include a complimentary hot breakfast and dinner buffet, and a beer and wine reception. Recommended for the extended traveler!We stayed at this location recently and loved the location. It is in a prime location within walking distance of the harbor, Little Italy, Under Armour flagship store, the aquarium, and more. It is unique in that it is connected to a Hilton Garden Inn. They share a lobby. The hotel is nice and the staff was very friendly. Our room was just what we wanted in the location we asked for. It was nice and clean with a great view of the city and a nice courtyard. They had small windows that opened up so we could enjoy the fresh air! One of the biggest perks is the fitness facility. There is a nice gym in the building connected to the hotel and you have free access to it with your room key. It was a very nice gym with 2 pools, hot tub, sauna, free weights, cardio equipment, and fitness classes. Very nice benefit to staying at this hotel! That evening my husband and I went up to the restaurant/lounge to watch a game on TV and enjoy a drink. It was quiet with a nice city view and friendly staff. Overall great experience!I am in town for four days so I decided to get a suite and I am very happy with the room. I have a kitchen with stove, fridge, micro and dishwasher - as well as dishes and pots/pans. A dining bar and a living room sitting area with a pull out loveseat and chair, desk and tv. 2 free wifi options via the Hilton and AT&T for the duration, at good connection speeds.The bedroom has a king bed, tv, dresser and dressing area with sink and closet and a nice size toilet/shower.I don't have my dog but if I wanted, I could - and right next to the inner harbor - it's a great option if I had wanted to bring her along.There is free breakfast and light dinners four nights a week if I want and the Whole Foods is 2 blocks from the hotel across from a 24 hour CVS.I love staying in the Hilton Homewood Hotels and prefer them to a single hotel room.    Stayed April 2013We stayed at the Homewood Suites for a long weekend with our 3 year old twins and another family with two small children.It is really nice and the location is awesome!  We were able to self park our car (cheaper than valet) and not have to move it all weekend.  We were able to walk to pick up dinner at a local restaurant, get groceries at Whole Foods, and even have pizza delivered to our room.  It also was a short 5-7 minute walk to the aquarium which we did on Saturday afternoon.  Pros:1) the separate bedroom and living area.  We were able to put the kids to bed and then hang out till we were ready to go to bed.  2) the ability to use the gym that is attached to the hotel (affiliated).  They have 5 pools including a relatively large one for kids.  We went to the pool two nights and the kids had a blast.  And I got to sneak in a few minutes at the hot tub!3)free buffet breakfast every morning :)Cons:1) the beds were horribly uncomfortable and small.  They were doubles but wish they were at least queen2) no DVD player or real children's channels.  We had to buy the Disney jr on demand package for $8.99 for some in room entertainment for the kids.Overall, really nice place to stay in a great location.  I would recommend for families for sure!Clean, comfortable and spacious rooms. If the weather is good, the location makes for  a terrific walk to the convention center - right along the water. One small comment: one night I returned to my room and found it had not been serviced. When I called the service number they said it was quite late and there wasn't much time to have it serviced. But they would service it if I wanted. Huh? I later asked the front desk if i was required to request service but they apologized for the comment. Okay, no problem if it was an error.What a great hotel! I was lucky enough to get a great deal through Priceline. Firstly, the location is great. It's in walking distance to Fells Point, Inner Harbor, and if you're a city-dweller like me, Federal Hill. Check in isn't until 3, but since we arrived at 10:30, we decided to see if we could at least drop our bags off. The staff was welcoming, and not only was our room ready, but we had still enough time to grab some complementary breakfast. The bed was comfy, and the hotel room was big enough to live in. Much bigger than some studio apartments I've been in. I'd stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a centrally located hotel.This was a great hotel. I had a wonderful experience. Stayed in April for a fun weekend in the inner harbor with my friends. It was clean and comfy and the staff was helpful and nice. The location is great and walking distance to the inner harbor and fells point. I would definitely recommend this hotel as an affordable suite to stay in for an extended stay in the baltimore area.Great hotel!!!Excellent staff, good food, nice rooms . . REALLY nice place.Well deserved 5 stars!The bell staff in particular are GREAT and VERY helpful.This is my go-to hotel now at the Inner Harbor.Whole Foods one block away, theaters next door . . Great locationNow . . .That being said:I texted as requested for my car. 35 minutes later, I went downstairs, (they request 30 minutes) and no car . . They tell me another 30 minutes because someone called in sick. .There were about  10 SERIOUSLY upset people who waited longer than I did!!!The valet's themselves are great, and really try to do their best, but their company policy that prevents them from simply giving people their keys, and letting them get their cars from the public garage located adjacent to the hotel, is RIDICULOUS!!!!EDIT:I spoke with the management at the Hilton desk at check out this morning, and they advised me that were meeting with the Valet service to determine how to avoid this situation again.Hopefully this will resolve the valet issues.I stand by my praise of the staff at this hotel, and will certainly stay with them again.Check In:  Fast and efficient early check in around 2pm with the clerk from the HGI side coming over to help out since the HS clerk was on the phone. Location:  While not right in the mix of Inner Harbor tourist sites, the hotel is close enough to still be convenient and it's is located right by a CCC Green and Orange Line stop. Food:  They serve a light evening dinner Mo-Th and breakfast is included seven days a week.  When we were there the Homewood Lodge area was closed for renovations so everybody was eating in the HGI area and that led to some confusion that I'll get to.We came for dinner on Thursday night and even though the in room menu showed Meatloaf when we got there about twenty minutes before shut down time there was no Meatloaf in sight.They had out salad, a very creamy Tomato Bisque, rock hard breadsticks, and personal sized Red Barron-like pizzas.  The reception attendant had no idea what the menu was supposed to be nor why the kitchen was putting out pizza.That aside, we ate because it was free and other than two guys who stopped in for some of the free beer there was no one else there and it looked like no one had been there for quite a while as all the tables were fully set and cleaned.Breakfast was quite chaotic both days because the Mo-Fr staff did one thing and the weekend staff on Sa did something else.  You are suppose to show your room card to let the staff know where to seat you and if the breakfast is free (HS) or if you're paying like a sap $12.95 (HGI) for the same thing.On Friday we were never asked for our room key.  At 8am the breakfast area was dead and we were allowed to sit where we pleased.On Saturday at 9am the place was quite busy yet we were told by a HS staff member to sit wherever since it was so busy.  After sitting down we were approached by a very pushy and rude HGI staff member who I'll refer to as the "Breakfast Nazi" who told us that we had to move to the HS side, which was full, or we had to go down the hall to an adjunct meeting room that was being used for overflow HS breakfast guests even though the HGI side only had two of maybe twelve tables occupied.Eventually after the Breakfast Nazi conferred with the HS employee "A" who told us to sit wherever we wanted to sit but BN exchanged several shitty glances with my wife and I the remainder of the time we were seated in "her area".Housekeeping:  We kept the DND on our door for our entire two night stay so I can't say.The Room:  The king bed was standard and comfortable and the pull out sofa was thin and hard as you would expect.  We did take advantage of the full size fridge, microwave, and two burner range top to help keep our food costs down and all worked well.We didn't use the gym/pool/or overpriced parking so I have no idea about them.Overall this Homewood while quirky, because it's one building with two hotels that are separate (One side Homewood and the other side Hilton Garden Inn)yet share some amenities, is definitely a place we will return to the next time we are in Baltimore.Just watch where you sit at Breakfast or else the Breakfast Nazi is likely to say "NO WAFFLE FOR YOU"!(Minus one star for the Breakfast Nazi's harassment.)I enjoyed everything about my stay!! The room was efficient. Everything was clean and the staff was very nice!!
review_content_20: I booked a room at this hotel for a "get out of dodge" birthday weekend for my boyfriend and me. Having been to Baltimore many times, I still was not well acquainted with the Fells Point neighborhood that the hotel is located. I was very pleased when I discovered that my plans for the weekend were going to work out since we could walk to Little Italy, the Inner Harbor and the area of Fells Point where all the night life is located. Additionally, it was just a short taxi ride to Camden Yards. We used the valet parking so we could take the car out for day trip to Annapolis. They were responsive and quick with car retrieval.Everyone I encountered of the hotel staff were very friendly and smiley. The breakfast attendant struck me as so cheerful that he really started me off in a good mood for the day. The breakfast was so so - good enough to get you through to the nice lunch you should have later. At some point our card keys both did not work and I went to the front desk to get them fixed and the front desk agent was playful, friendly, and helpful. It is so nice to interact with these type of people on your trip.Our room was very nice. We stayed on the 11th floor and had plenty of natural light. It was quiet, clean, modern, and the kitchen was handy since we made drinks and appetizers prior to our nights on the town. We used the MAC, Maryland Athletic Club, that hotel guests have access to and it was great.Overall, I would definitely stay here again.I do really love this place and plan to stay again the next time I am in town.Positive:  Free beer Monday - Thursday, Free breakfast is okay but the evening social food was very good.  Hotel staff are awesome!!!!  Beds are comfortable and cozy.  View was beautiful.  Gym.  Pool.  Full kitchen.  Not much space to move about in the room, but it was still a great room.  Water pressure is great.  Name brand shampoo, soaps, etc   LOVE THIS PLACE!!Negative:  Valet ($32/ each night) takes up to 30 - 45 minutes to get car in the AM.  Self park ($22/ per park) is also expensive, but you can get your car when you want.This is not a group I would do business with again. When you make a reservation at any of the hotels of this group (Homewood Suites by Hilton) it is very difficult to cancel. They tell you there is no refund or changes that can be made. What hotel does that? And it isn't any easier if you are merely changing to another Homewood Suites by Hilton at a nearby city. You would think that an organization with hotels in different but neighboring cities would be able accommodate your request. I don't care how clean the place is - they can't be 'all that' if they can't provide great customer service. Not only would I not recommend this hotel, I would dissuade people from using it until they change their customer service policies.I have been staying at the Homewood Suites on a business trip since Saturday and it has been one of my worst hotel experiences. First, I had to fight just to get the air conditioning fixed in my room on Saturday. Second there is no hot water in the entire building and will not be until Tuesday at 6:00 pm. I check out Wednesday morning. Sure, we can go into a connecting fitness center to shower but their water isn't very hot either. Alternatively, I've been told by the front desk that I can go out of the hotel, around the corner and down the street to another hotel to use their showers. They claim it is a "utilities" issue but it seems to me that if there was a utilities problem there would be no water at all, not just a lack of hot water. Finally, the television in my bedroom doesn't work but I haven't even mentioned it because it's not really worth it at this point. I will never stay at a Homewood Suites again.Excellent location.  Great room value.  We stayed in a one-bedroom suite.  At 400 sq ft you're not going to host any parties, but just enough during your visit to Baltimore.  Stayed Saturday into Sunday and enjoyed the free hot breakfast (eggs, bacon, corned beef hash, pancakes) as well as juices, coffee, cereal, yogurt and danishes.  Only thing to watch, if you valet, is that you only pay $32 per night -- our bill had two charges for some reason, but was quickly corrected.  Great location near shopping and Eastern harbor attractions.THRILLED WITH MY EXPERIENCE HERE!HERE ARE ALL THE GREAT THINGS!-----PRICE: At the hotel across the street (Mariott) for a single room with just a bed and bathroom, the cost per night was what we paid for our entire stay. With my AAA card we only paid $150 a night for an entire SUITE at the Hilton.-----ROOM: Huge, Clean, you literally could live out of your room if you went shopping at Whole Foods (right behind the hotel) since there's a small but fully functioning kitchen right in the room! The living room area made the hotel feel more like an apartment or condo and we actually enjoyed spending time in our room, as compared to other hotels where you only want to return to go to sleep.-----AMENITIES: The Gym, FANTASTIC!!! It is a MAC (Maryland Athletic Club) that city residents belong to too, so it is a fully-functioning gym with all the equipment and classes you could deam of. This is also where the pool is located. Main Hotel staff is friendly and hepful. I requestd a non-smoking room that had never been smoked in and we got exactly that! Wi-Fi was a little slow but the room came with an internet cable, that when plugged into my laptop provided much faster internet.-----LOCATION: We were so close to the Inner Harbor that you could see it from our room! (I posted pics). My boyfriend and I both don't mind walking so the 0.7 mile walk to Fell's Point in one direction or 0.8 mile walk in the other direction to the Inner Harbor was not a big deal and really pleasant. You can pay $20/person/day for the water taxi and take it anywhere around the Harbor you want.-----FOOD: We ate at the complimentary breakfast that runs from 7-10am. There were some little kids running around but they were all in good spirits so it was not obnoxious at all. I would recommend getting there before 9 so that you can get the best food ;-). There were scrambled eggs, hash browns, baccon, breakfast burritos, a make your own waffle station, bagels, pastries/muffins, yogurt, cereal, juice, water, coffee/tea, etc. We were never disappointed and were rather impressed with this breakfast compared to other hotels we have stayed at. The only negatives I can draw are that I called for a new hairdryer because mine was cold and it took the staff nearly an hour to come to my room, but it turns out the cool button was stuck so it didn't even need to be replaced or repaired and that parking was $25 a night; we parked ourlselves to avoid an additional $10/night valet charge. There is another garage near Fell's Point that is only $10 a night but it's probably 3/4 mile from the hotel. The hotel elevators go right to their own garage, which was definitely a plusStayed here for a long weekend with the family,  Been to Baltimore a few times but usually stayed over near Camden Yards.     This area is so nice - within walking distance of everything (a bit of a stretch coming home from the ballpark at night but not awful).  Staff was friendly and they had a good breakfast buffet.  This will definitely be my go-to next time I am in Baltimore.DO NOT STAY HERE if you want high speed Internet (speedtest had them at .15mbps which is like dial-up speed)Hotel is a pretty good location, new area of the harbor they're trying to develop.  Not the feel of the convention center/camden yards area, but nice.  Great restaurants, movie theater, walking areas nearby.  Rooms are standard for newer Homewood Suites in urban areas.  The rooms are in good shape.Stayed here for 2 nights about a week ago and thought it was a comfortable, clean and overall decent place.  We loved all of the space in the room (kitchenette, separate seating area).  The location was also great (East Harbor), close to pretty much everywhere we wanted to go.There is a CVS and Whole Foods right around the corner.  The front desk staff was super friendly and gave us restaurant recommendations.  Parking is a bit high at the lot connected, but I think that is normal for the area.I have only two issues with our stay: 1) no one told us about the breakfast that was included with our room - so we didn't get to take advantage of that and 2) there was a fan in the bathroom that ran continuously - as far as we could tell, there was no switch for it.  It wasn't that big of a deal, we just shut the door to minimize the noise.Really great location for seeing all the Inner Harbor sites.  It's a short, safe walk to Little Italy, the Aquarium, and all of downtown.  Parking is in the garage for the shopping center next door.  Parking costs about $25 per day.The rooms are modern and nicely laid out.  I heard almost no road noise.One confusing thing, the lobby is shared with a Hilton Garden Inn so you may do a double take.  Breakfast, while not great, is a step above most other Homewoods I've stayed in.Great room - extremely spacious.  Great value.  We did have one problem, though, when the fire alarm went off in the building not all floors heard the alarm.  I happened to go down to the breakfast room before my family so I heard it, but when I went outside I didn't see my family.  I called them and told them what was going on.  There was no alarm on our floor.  I tried to get an answer from the local firemen about the seriousness of the incident and could not get a straight answer.  I did report the faulty system to the front desk who seemed unaware of the problem and really did nothing about it.  In the end, the incident was minor and no one was hurt.I would have given this hotel 4 stars if it weren't for this incident.I would recommend finding another spot.  The valet was not helpful and told me that it was too cold, so he would check my car and move it later.  The front desk experience wasn't any more pleasant.  I had to sign a "no party" policy which made me inquire - I learned that signing didn't mean following when the party next door got out of control at 3 am and no one came when I called the front desk.  I got a kick out of the front desk asking if I wanted a higher floor, and then telling me they were sold out and it wasn't available 30 seconds later when I said I would like a higher floor.Someone had smoked in the room, and the solution was to open the windows in 40 degree weather....a great cold greeting in the room.  My roo m had a large iron burn in front of the sink, and it was a constant source of snagging my socks or scraping my foot.  I was floored that I probably paid the same as other guests and got a crappy room - I wasn't going down for another exchange with the "don't care" attitude at the front desk.Overall, I presume a clean room without burns is nice.  The pull-out bed in the couch has obviously dirty sheets - I called housekeeping and they brought new sheets for us to make the bed (they were unhappy when I asked them to take the dirty sheets).  The breakfast is okay, the location is great, and the access to the athletic club is GREAT (thus they are getting 2 stars instead of 1).Management at this hotel should invest in some training on a culture of service and caring about a customer.  This hotel was not a "Home", and I think a better attitude by all of the staff could go a long way.  It is disappointing when management doesn't care, and I hope that they improve.Another great stay at Homewood Suites. The hotel is clean and comfortable with a great location, nestled between the Inner Harbor and Little Italy. Parking is in the attached garage and costs approximately $20 per day. Several restaurants, an Irish pub, a Whole Foods Market, and a CVS drug store are literally steps away.This place is decent. There were some highs and some lows. The high is that it is in a really good neighborhood. The Cons: Shabby carpets, expensive valet that is always backed up and slow( there was really only one friendly happy valet -Chase) breakfast isn't great or even good, the dinners are worse. My window was opened some days (in decemeber), they left the bed totally unmade one day - when I called down they laughed but sent up someone who complained the whole time (they left it unmaid with no sheets, etc). There was a laundry area but one had a broken washer, the fire alarm went off while we were there, but it only went off on floors above 6, which means part of our party never heard it. The TV stations were boring and the internet connection was slower than dial up in 1996. Pros: Free wine 4 nights a week, Great area with lots to walk to for dinner and entertainment.Area felt very Safe!Great hotel! I've been to Baltimore about 8 times now for medical reasons and will never stay anywhere outside the Harbor East neighborhood again. I have not found a good hotel in the city, even the Monaco wasn't good. Stayed in an apartment for the last trip which was amazing, but next time I go up I'm staying in Homewood again. Good price a night, and if it's too pricey for you, you save money on food because they serve a good breakfast and and dinner at, and for the Homewood side only, free whine and beer. Just be sure you get there before the end of the time period, because they won't refill everything, and staff will get a bit pissy if you do. The Hotel is in a great area, and you also have access to a REAL fitness center next door, not just a tiny room with 5 pieces of equipment. The hotel didn't have a pool, but the gym did. Staff was great!The only few (small) things I would complain about, 1) the rooms were not as big as they looked online. I got a suite-which from online, it seems like you only get a suite or a studio, and the suite has the kitchen, dinning room table, desk, and separate bedroom. And online it looks huge, but I opened the door and it was just a kitchen and small living room. Not a big deal whatsoever, but need to investigate to see if they are showing another option. 2) Other small issue, I asked for a room with a view, and the front desk associate, put me in a room on the 8th floor, which is a big outside area connecting to the adjacent office building, and also a place where people can let out their dogs. This isn't a bid deal, but the door that enters that patio, let out right next to our room, making it a bit awkward since everyone can just see in your room.
