All the hotels downtown are pretty pricey, but this was not a bad deal.Okay, guys, it's a Hampton Inn...you aren't going to the Ritz.With that said, I think this place really served up plenty of bang for the buck.I was in Baltimore (again) for a wedding (again - yes, wedding number 5 in the last 6 months!), and this place was the one suggested by the couple. The hotel also offered shuttle service to the ceremony and reception, so that was part of its draw.  Yes, I am totally down with being lazy and having door-to-door service. Total plus column wins:1) Affordable rooms.2) Well-located hotel.  The Inner Harbor area and Federal Hill are easily walkable, and Camden Yards is literally right across the street.3) Large rooms that are clean, well-maintained, and quiet.4) Really comfortable beds with big plushy pillows.5) Free wifi and free plug-in wired Internet.6) Free continental breakfast.  It's not super fancy, but it'll totally get the job done.  There's a make-your-own-waffle station, two hot trays (first morning was cheese omelettes and turkey sausages; second morning was scrambled eggs and some hash browns (I think?)), fruit, cereal, oatmeal, toast, yogurt pastries like muffins, etc., and the usual juice, milk, coffee, and tea.  You really can't beat it for the price.One questionable thing:The private driver service that took me to a destination that should have been ~$7-9 via taxi tried to charge me $15.  I asked the front desk lady beforehand how much a cab would typically cost to X destination, and she said "no more than $10." Tried calling for a cab, but then the valet guy instead suggested using the private driver guy. I was wary b/c those are usually expensive, but then they said the private driver guy (who I assume is contracted to service the hotel or something) would charge no more than a taxi's rate. So yeah...$15 is not what the taxi's rate would be. I know this because the next day, when I took a taxi to the train station (a destination that is FARTHER away than my X destination), the metered charge was $7.60. Yup. Note that there is a taxi stand across the street on the lefthand side.Of note (or maybe I'm just crazy b/c I couldn't find it):There IS a closet in that room. It's behind the mirror. Yes, the full-length mirror that looks like it's only a wall mirror.  Yup, there's a lip to the mirror that you can pull away to reveal - ta da! - a closet. I was baffled when I entered the room and couldn't find a closet, so here's hoping that little tip helps you. :)Overall, I thought this hotel was a fine choice for an easy, no hassle, clean and comfortable location to call our home base while in Baltimore.I needed a last minute hotel for a trip to Baltimore and this was the cheapest one I could find. I was ready for a bare-bones minimum room with pay-to-use wired internet and a musty room.My expectations could not have been exceeded any more than they were.The Hampton is by far the nicest hotel room I've ever stayed at. A giant King-size bed with the comfiest pillows on the East coast. Also a chair + ottoman, desk, flat-screen TV, refrigerator, microwave, and a bathroom that was almost as big as the room itself. The bathroom was insane - so much room in there and they even had dispensers on the shower wall with soap, shampoo and conditioner in it. Next time I'm not even going to bring shampoo!The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. From the valet who kept my bags since I couldn't check in early to the front desk clerk at 2 AM who printed off my boarding pass for me. Everyone was extremely nice and always had a smile on. The Hampton itself is a 5 minute walk from the harbor, so it's a perfect location that's not too far away from anything entertaining. My walk every day was to the former Sonar compound and it was a straightforward, easy walk each time.I will definitely be staying at this hotel many, many more times.these guys know what they're doing. we booked a room on Ravens game day.  we got in around 9:45. the valet took our car and told us to go in and check in. our room wasnt ready, of course its 6 hours before check in, but they took our luggage. the entire area was crazy with people getting ready for the game but the entire staff was super calm and friendly. I havent even seen my room yet and I love this place.Every year when Otakon comes around I have the daunting task of finding an affordable hotel, that not only doesn't mind a bunch of otaku filling its rooms with weird ass cosplay, lolita, and gaming materials; but also is comfortable enough to fit all of that crap and be a great refuge after a long day of standing in lines. This hotel is that place. We have stayed here three times. Last year being the most recent 7/26 - 7/29/2012.When you first come in you're always greeted by the most friendliest staff you will find at a hotel. They are so helpful and any questions you may have they go out of their way to make sure you have a satisfying answer. They also provide for their guest fresh baked chocolate chip cookies (or peanuts) while supplies last of course. The hotel is clean and the decor still looks as fresh as when they first opened.We always stay in one of queen suites. Which has two wonderfully comfortable queen beds with fluffy pillows and duvets that you just melt into at the end of the day. A sofa bed, a mini fridge, a small sink (separate from the sink in the bathroom), and a microwave. This hotel provides free Wifi which is always an automatic plus for me, and free breakfast for it's guest. There is also a pool, gym, business center, and laundry room. So basically if you need a home away from home this is place to go. The area it's centered in is perfect because you're within walking distance of loads of different bars, restaurants, and entertainment. As with any hotel the pricing depends heavily upon the date you go, but normally this place isn't too bad in comparison to the other surrounding hotels. Especially considering all of the things you get for free by staying here. (Just an example the Hilton Baltimore Convention Center hotel charges for Wifi per night, provides no free breakfast, rooms are smaller, and valet parking $40 a night)We will be back again this year in August for Otakon 2013 and I can't wait to stay here again.Stayed 4 nights and thought the hotel was great - the only negative I even remotely come up with is the lack of on-site parking ($29/night option for valet park available).  Even factoring in the valet costs, I still got a very good deal.The hotel was very clean and had nice, contemporary decor.  I found all of the staff to be exceptionally friendly and helpful - especially Tim at the front desk and the valet staff at the front door.  They have a nicely appointed business center where you can print your boarding pass, etc.The daily breakfast bar is easy to catch (6-10am) and the dining area is relatively large compared to most.  Food selection is good - always an egg dish along with a meat or potato side, fresh cut fruit, oatmeal, cold cereal, pastries, make your own waffles, coffee, juice, etc.  They also have some sort of 'treat' available later in the day and coffee available all day as near as I could tell.My room was spacious - king bed w/ a sofa - and very clean, contemporary, and well maintained.  The bathroom was especially nice - large, nice vanity, glass enclosure shower, tile, etc.  Despite being on the road, had some of my best sleep in ages because the bed was so comfy!Easy walk to the Inner Harbor and U of M campus, but you are on the western edge of the 'generally considered safe' area, so familiarize yourself with a map and don't stray too far west on foot.Overall, I was thoroughly impressed and my expectations were far exceeded.  I would definitely choose to stay here again.The best thing about this hotel is the location.It is within walking distance of the convention center - and this is what I was looking for. I typically stay at Sheraton's but I was a bit late on making reservations for this trip.free continental breakfast - I will say it was ediblefree wififree laundry (washer & dryers in basement for guest use)No restaurant at hotel. I got in pretty late from my flight and all I wanted was room service. I could have gone next door to a bar or my other option was to walk a few blocks to go and find if anything was open. I was not a fan of that.The last day (I stayed for 5 nights)  I was in the shower and the fire alarm went off in my room. The desk called my room and asked if I was ok. It was only my room that the alarm was going off and it could not be turned off. It was on for 45 minutes! They tried to tell me it was the due to the hot water and the shower but then they admitted it was a malfunction.  The fire alarm sound was a horrible sound that left my ears ringing for hours and gave me a horrible headache. I had to quickly find clothes so I could let on of the staff in to take a look. I ended up being late for my conference and really out of it due to my headache. Next time I am in town I will make my reservations sooner!Great Hampton, I stay in a lot of hotels, this is a very roomy place, up to date, clean and great amenities.  Good price, great room.Yes, it is a Hampton Inn.  Don't expect room service or mints on the pillows.  But the people are great, the service is great (if something breaks or you need help finding something), and it is very close to the Inner Harbor, Convention Center, and both stadiums.  I was not out after 10 or 11 pm, but during that time and between the hotel and Little Italy it always felt safe.  And, of course, it is significantly cheaper than the HIlton, Hyatt, Marriott, etc.Staying at this Hampton Inn was a pleasure! Everything was nice & clean. It was super convenient for going to the Camden Yards stadium just across the street. What made our stay special was the professionalism and courtesy of Tim at the reception desk and Lemwood who I met while he was making popcorn. They both made our stay special. I definitely recommend this place! Rick Thompson 6/7&8/2014Great location would be an epic understatement.  Hotel is right across the street from Camden Yards.  Lots of places to eat, things to see and do.  Even as a business traveler here for work and not play the game night traffic was negotiable.  My only recommendations for improvement would be to increase the dining space and improve its layout.Great location, decent hotel.The "free" breakfast is horrible.  Beyond that, it's a decent hotel.  Really friendly staff, clean rooms, located next to the ballpark bars and across the street from Camden Yards.This place is sooooo nice- the staff is great, breakfast is good- conveniently located- and just about the ONLY hotel Ive been to (and Im on the road about 40% of my life for work)- that use of the laundry facilities are FREE- (they even have baskets for you to use)- I will DEFINITELY stay here again !
review_content_40: I came for a conference. The room was nice and the hotel is in a great location. 5 minutes from the harbor and from the mall. The free breakfast is really nice and it also has free wifi. I liked the pool as well.Has to be the best hotel I have ever stayed in! They are always prompt, courteous, clean, professional, and reasonably priced! I have stayed several other hotels before and will always choose a Hampton Inn over anything else!This hotel is immaculately clean, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and the location is unbelievable for the price. I threw a party at Camden Yards and had guests come in from all over the country.  The rooms are sparkling clean, spacious, well appointed and have great views.  The sales team gave me regular updates on bookings before our stay, they reserved the best views in the house for my guests, and gave me access to a meeting room to use as a hospitality suite.  The manager sent a birthday card, champagne, and chocolate to my room, and made me feel extremely comfortable.  They had a nice dining area where my friends congregated for breakfast the day after the party and the sales manager came over to thank us for staying at the hotel.  They don't have parking but when you see the location, you understand why.  But valet was painless.  The immediate neighborhood is attractive and I felt safe walking around at night.  I will absolutely stay here again when I am in Baltimore, assuming that I get my room for around the same price.I booked Hampton Inn as my hotel for my business trip last minute because there was no room in Marriot / Sheraton, or other big name hotels, and I am really glad that happened!UNLIKE Marriot, Sheraton where the rooms design are outdated, and kind of dirty (yea, you know it!) Hampton Inn is still so clean and new!!  The beds were so comfortable.  I love that I can just go back to the hotel after a day of hard work, without worrying about the room hygiene, and sleep like a baby  =DThe price is a bit expensive (I would not have selected this place if the trip for personal), but I think that is only because there is constantly conventions 10 minutes away, so it is more suitable for business travellers.  As for the service, I lost something very valuable in the hotel room, they helped me to retrieve it very quickly.  When I found out, it was around checkout time, but despite how busy they were dealing with the convention attendees, the receptionist and his manager helped me to call the cleaning lady a few times, and I got the item back within 20 minutes, so I really appreciate their help!Additional Info:-there are good iron and iron board. -Free breakfast has fruits, sausage, egg, etc.  Many types of coffee, tea, juice.  There were a lot of people, so the food containers seem small, and it seemed overcrowded.  -The only thing that I wish Hampton Inn has is disposable slippers. (well, I did forget to bring mine...)I will book this hotel again next time!This is an excellent hotel. Not only is it in a great location at a great price, but the staff was very pleasant. The complimentary breakfast was great, plenty of hot options. The room size was extremely nice and the hotel and a well kept, clean feel. I would definitely stay at this Hampton Inn again.Staff was very friendly and helpful.  A stones throw away from Camden Yards.  Continental breakfast is pretty tasty.I stayed in this hotel for a visit to the University of Maryland, Baltimore and it's perfectly situated at a mere 5 min walk to the Admissions Office.The rooms are very nice since it's a brand new hotel and they offer plenty of towels and amenities. The bed is comfortable and the pillows are probably the softest that I've ever felt. There are ironing boards and irons in the rooms and a shoe cloth as well.The staff is relatively friendly too. You can approach them for just about anything and they're happy to help you.They offer free wi-fi internet throughout the hotel and will give you a PIN when you first check-in. You have free wired connection in your room, as well. If you don't have a laptop, there's a free business room on the main level with printers if you want to print your boarding passes or other documents that you need on your trip.The food options are limited around the hotel, however, but it comes to a decision whether you want to be close to campus or whether you want to be close to the food.The area around the hotel is also very safe.My first complaint is the breakfast, which is terrible! Then again, the hotel doesn't have its own restaurant so this is probably to be expected.  You'll be better off sticking to a bowl of cereal than eating their attempts at food.My other complaint is the price. It can be rather expensive, but if you make a reservation as a friend of the University of Maryland, you'll get a slight discount. I chose this hotel primarily because the other (cheaper) hotels close to campus were full.====Rubric: 5 = Mindblowing 4 = Excellent 3 = I see the charm 2 = Disappointing 1 = Never againI stayed at this hotel for one night at the beinning of December.  I was in town for the Monday Night Patriots Ravens football game.  This hotel is very close to the stadium - at check they ask why you are there - if you tell them for the game they make you sign a form saying you will not party in your room.  Ok.  So everything was just fine got pretty drunk at the game and dont really recall much.  Well, the following morning attempted to call valet to have my car brought up - no answer - great.  So, I manage to fit my pounding head into the elevator to check out and retrieve my car for the 5 hour ride home - what was I thinking.  So,  there are plenty of valet employees standing around when we get down there - I had over my ticket to one guy - he opens the cabinet that holds the keys and the following conversation takes palceVALET "Yo, your keys aint here"ME "Excuse Me?VALET "Heres your ticket back.  I dont know what to tell you"ME "Are you EFFEN kidding me?"VALET "Sorry"Mind you I have this car for about 10 days at this point.  So, at this point another valet comes over and takes the ticket and begins to look for the keys.  I end up pointing out my own keys hanging in the cabinet.  So,  I assume they drama is over - oh no.Valet #1 takes the keys and says he will be back in 10 minutes - this hotel doesnt have its own garage and the park in a few different garages in the area. Ok Dude just please get my car I am starting to sweat out the booze from the night before.Valet #1 returns with the keys.  "yo, your car aint there"and he hands me the keys.  I am about to freak out when Valet #2 appears again and says he will find it.Valet #2 returns with the keys - no car Valet #3 steps in - in attempt to avert my nuclear meltdown and after another 30 minutes he finally finds my car.This process took over an hour...

review_content: Stayed here for a family weekend away. Staff was amazing.  Room was great with a good view.  I would fully recommend.Only worth two stars.  It will do for families or business trips but they offer nothing that would make you seek this place out.  Gym is 3Treadmills In a room. Downstairs bar and restaurant is airport quality.  Front desk girls couldn't get my bill right, I had to call corporate.  Likely won't be back.Stayed here for a recent Saturday & Sunday night. A little pricey, but the area is worth it.Walking distance to the inner harbor or fells point! Pros: The lobby is very pretty, functional & modern. The bed was amazingly comfortable. Small, but very efficient. A ton of HBO channels. Paul Mitchell bath products.Cons: No fridge or micro. I don't know if this is standard for Courtyards, but I definitely missed them. The inly big issue happened on the day I was checking out. I locked myself out of my room, and had left my wallet in the car. The guy at the front desk required me to show ID to have a new key made. I've NEVER experienced this before. I offered him my business card, and to recite ANY information associated with the account, but he wouldn't budge. I had to walk all the way back to my car to get ID.I don't know why anyone gives this place more than 2 stars. Being clean and nice aren't "pluses" they're givens. Here for work and wifi is weak and horrible; not strong enough to hold outlook. I literally have to go to Starbucks to try and get some work done. (!!!) and the "cable" or whatever this is goes on the fritz every 2-3 minutes. There's not even room service. You have to go downstairs and pick it up yourself. If I'm ordering room service it's because I don't want to leave my room; it's not because I think the overpriced food is so great. Wished I would have booked the Hilton. And THIS place was even MORE expensive. Stupid. Courtyards suck. I'll never return.Due to a blizzard a few years ago, my job put us up here to ensure that we'd be safe and get to work in the morning. The staff was awesome, and tried to assist as much as possible due to the storm. The room was clean and the bed was comfy.Downstairs, there's a cafe. Great wings!I've stayed here about 5 times for work so far and I love it. The staff is AWESOME! I think it's a policy never to say 'no' to a request from a customer service standpoint. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The gym could be bigger but they offer you free workouts at a local gym during your stay if you want. Breakfast in the morning is pretty good and Internet is FREE. Walkable to many attractions and restaurants.We had our Family Reunion based here and the staff were extra polite and accommodating. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed was to firm for me but good for my wife. The walls a bit thin in my view. But nothing interrupted us really. Super close to shopping and #7 water taxi stop.Firstly this hotel is in a great location.. Conveniently located to restaurants, shops and the harbor. The place is clean and the staff are friendly. Will definitely stay here again.Visited this hotel while in town for a wedding.  This is in a good location, if you want to check out the Inner Harbor or Fells Point.  We had a wedding discount, but the price was still high (and parking was $23 a day... yikes).  The room itself was decent- nothing special.  It seems like a good place to go if you have a family- safe neighborhood, walkable to the attractions, and has a little snack stand/Starbucks to get breakfast in the morning.Classic Courtyard inside; the great thing is the location in Fells Point as well as the staff. Just some of the finest staffers I've ever seen in all my years of traveling.The hotel itself is 3 stars, but the staff there are super awesome which lands them a 5 star for service ! Always helpful and really made our stay pleasant. We had to go to the Fair Field Inn down the street for a couple days due to the the boiler being repaired and that place was crap compared to this place.Thanks everyone for the nice East Coast welcome!Now to start off I was using a free night certificate which I waited until the day before it was to expire to use it. What was I thinking? Really didn't have much of a choice. I was a little disappointed when I was informed that the other Marriott that I stayed in before that was a category 4 was now a category 5. However this Marriott that was once a 5 was now a 4. Anyway That was the first of disappointments. Second of all I was informed before I actually booked that this Marriott was going through renovations. Ok............And the pool and exercise room would be closed. So not good for me. Oh and I was also informed that NO King beds were available. So, I had to stay in a room with double beds when I was the only one in the room. So not fun. So, I arrive to the hotel at check in time. The front desk person was very friendly.I checked to see if just by luck they would have the king bed availble but, the didn't. I get my key and off to my room. The room was clean. However when you have stayed at higher category Marriott Hotels this one was disappointing. Don't get me wrong it was clean but, small in space. I felt like I was turning around in a box. I couldn't just stay in the room and relax like I had plan. I had to get out.I did like that there was not a lot of in going and out going traffic going on to the hotel. I returned when it was time to go to bed. I slept well because the Marriott mattress is the best. Woke up on time just as I planned.Because they were doing renovations they did offer a complimentary breakfast in which they don't normally offer. This room too was also small. Everything felt so compact to be a Marriott Hotel. I was glad to have good choices available to eat for my healthy choice of eating. Grapefruit, hot tea, Special K with splenda,water and skim milk. The eating area was clean also and the attendant in that room was very friendly also. I checked out this morning right after breakfast so that I could head out to work. Check out was pretty easy. I was gonna purchase a yogurt but, the person at the front desk said that yogurt was availble in the dining area complimentary. However, I took the yogurt with me but, when I went to open it when I got to work I found that the yogurt had expired.This was not a terrible experience at the Marriott However, I have to say that If I had paid to stay the night here I would not have been satisfied considering the Marriott's high standards.Awful hotel! Go anywhere else and pay through the nose if you have toThe MAIN REASON I gave 1 star is because the walls are paper thin in the room and I could pretty much hear everything such as the elevator dinging, people coughing, rude guests talking at 3 a.m. -- absolutely paper thin! There is nothing the staff can do to correct the problem as this is a structural issue. The shower must have been designed by a corrections officer. It needs a total remodel. The TV had grainy analog picture on most of its channels.The mattress was uncomfortable. I never had this, but it gave me severe leg cramps. I didn't get one restful nights sleep.Fitness center: A DISGRACE. It consists of a tiny room about 150 sq ft, with aerobic machines, bench and weight set. Its a very small space that can barely accommodate 3 people. If 2 people need to do yoga, you might as well come back later.The windows look out on some apartment building over. The buildings are so close together that you can see them and they can see you.So.... I would recommend this if you're a VERY heavy sleeper and don't care to stay in shape.For all others, check yourself into anywhere but this place.Nice night at the Courtyard last night. The staff was very accommodating and the bed and pillows were wonderful.I called the day before to see if I could change to a king sized bed instead of 2 dobles as our child was no longer accompanying us. That was done with out a problem.Parking was not my favorite thing here, but the staff apologized for the lack of valet and as this is a very walk-able location, it was really a none issue. As others have commented, the walls are pretty thin, and there was a couple of times during the night that I heard vacuuming. we had to jet out in the morning, so not sure about the breakfast ect.Place was overall decent, but I might pass the next time. For the money, I would rather not be staring into someone's living room as I was last night. They seemed nice enough though.We stayed here in April while we were in town for a conference.  First of all, the positives: GREAT location.  Walking distance to shopping and restaurants, close-by parking, etc.  Good food options in the actual Marriott itself, which we utlized since we were starving and it was too early for dinner :-)  Great service, minues the incident below.The negative, which brought this down 3 stars: I wasn't aware we booked a DJ for our club.  I mean our hotel room.  I'm sure our neighbors had a great time, but we did not.  Pretty sure our walls were actually thumping.  We called the front desk to handle the problem multiple times, which was really disappointing.  It should have been handled immediately, and potentially with the offer of something comped!I stayed overnight at the Courtyard Baltimore Downtown overnight with my husband using his Marriott points.  He travels extensively for work and always stays at Marriotts.  Reading the reviews on Yelp, we were a little concerened but luckily we were pleasantly surprised.   He said that although the hotel was nothing special, it was comparable to other Courtyards he has stayed at in the past.The front dest staff was phenomenal and provided excellent service.  Our room was clean and the bed was super comfortable.  The pool area was nothing special but we only used it for a short amount of time during our stay. If the pool is something that is very important to you, this could be a downside.  The location was great and within walking distance to tons of restaurants, bars and shops.  The main downside as others have pointed out was the thin walls.  We could hear everything the people in the room next to us were saying at one point during our stay. To be fair, we were in a room with an adjoining door to the room next to us, so I don't know if that factored into things.Overall, we had a really positive experience and would absolutely stay here again!Just stayed one night and my favorite thing about the hotel was the location.  Walking distance to the Harbor and Fells Point.  Had a Whole Foods in the same complex.  A nice location to stumble back from Fells Point.  Clean hotel, most of the staff was friendly.  A nice area where they have computers for surfing the Internet but I really don't use them, never log into your email or facebook or anything else for that matter.  You never know what someone has put on them.  My only issue was our room was right near the elevator, we heard everyone getting on and off all night long.  The room next to ours had an issue with the door some they had someone drilling at 10:30 at night fixing it.*3.5 Stars*Not your usually priced Courtyard but very nice nonetheless. Located in a great area of Baltimore and down the st from plenty of restaurants, bars and nightlife. Walking distance to Power Plant and Fells Point. It's a great place to stay if you are in Baltimore and don't want to worry about your safety. The check in area is small as well as their eating area. Elevators are a bit slow and they have an elevator that goes to the parking deck so you don't have to be outside for the walk. It's a bit pricey but you are paying for convenience. Their rooms are nice and and clean. Bathrooms are decent size with roomy shower area. Towels are eh. I don't expect much but I also am pleased with my stays at a Courtyard. This one no difference. ENJOY!Not writing about the hotel.. Writing about the marriott courtyard "bistro".. Hotel package came with an app and a couple cocktails from the bistro. Now, I've eaten at many a courtyard bistro so I am very familiar with their food and simple menu. As simple as it is, the BBQ chicken flatbread I ordered would be better eaten with a spoon. Undercooked flatbread, sopping with BBQ sauce led to it being Non edible. Sadly, the barkeep Marti was so blissfully ignorant as to customer service that when she asked me how it was a good 10 min after it was served  and I told her it was soggy.. She just said sorry and walked away. Maybe she was in the weeds from the other 3 people in the bar (sarcasm) that she couldn't speak. Or more likely, she is just poorly trained on customer service. Either way, boo for marriott. Such a simple dumbed down menu should require barely more than a heartbeat to execute. Congrats.... You found how to make simple a complete f up.  Thank god she knows how to tilt a bottle of wine to clearly marked lines on impossibly small wine glasses to avoid over pours. Your Food and Beverage costs must be legendary. Only reason for the second star above is that it was part of a package I paid an additional 20$ for upon checking in and the wine was worth 20$. Let me get back to my BBQ flatbread soup. Cheers.I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, but the parking is WAYYYY too expensive.  Also, it seems the towels are thread-bare and the walls are very thin.  I could hear people traipsing down the hallway at all hours of the night.On a positive note, my room had a balcony with a lovely view if I craned my neck.  It's close to the harbor, and the neighborhood seemed safe and fun.  The bed was UNBELIEVABLY COMFORTABLE.  I'd go back again but make sure I bring ear plugs.
review_content_20: Major downside to this hotel, and I'm surprised how much it does show up in all of the reviews-- the walls are paper thin. I've actually never experienced anything like this in any large chain hotel, only boutiques or even hostels. In the morning we could hear everything in the room next door-- they were up with their child and talking about their weekend, playing games with the kid, etc. We felt terribly knocking on the wall and asking them to keep it down, because they were using regular voices and enjoying their room as a hotel guest should. We could also hear all the details of anyone's conversation in the hallway, as well as any opening and closing doors of rooms around ours. We were really looking forward to a Sunday morning sleep in, the bed was comfortable and we were exhausted from a long week and a great wedding the night before. But at 8am we just game up. It was impossible to sleep with the noise anymore.Everything else about this hotel is above average for a Marriott and really quite lovely. But, the main thing you're looking for a hotel room is some peace and quiet. Not found here.Although I did not stay here, I had to make some arrangements for delivery of a gift to this hotel for a guest.THANK YOU EMMA, for your amazing service and attention to detail.  You made everything so easy and simple.  Outstanding service!Rooms are Clean and Quiet. Hotel is right in the middle of everything. Had a package to stay here for the weekend and enjoyed the weekend getaway away from home. Would love to visit again soon.Stayed in this Courtyard for a couple of nights while in Baltimore for a weekend away. The hotel is one where it's part of an overall building that also encompasses stores, offices and a parking garage. Personally I prefer my hotels to be just hotels and not mixed use. The Room was pretty average, nothing bad but certainly nothing great and the price was ok. The location is very good, it's just off the Inner Harbor and walking distance from Fells Point.All in all it was an OK hotel experience. Although I will probably try one of the other hotels in the area next time to see if I can do better.I am a Marriott fan but this property is in need of an update.  Old Courtyard decor, but great location on inner harbor.Location was great, I could walk to the harbor and to many of the nearby restaurants.Room was nice, it was clean and it had everything I needed, including a small fridge.  Pool and Jacuzzi were okay, maybe a little smaller than the photo made them look and it tended to get crowded even if it was only less than 50% of capacity of 45 people.  Parking was $25/night but I was only there for 2 nights so the price did not bother me. There is lots to do in this area and I had a fantastic time.  The girls at the front desk were kind and genuinely interested in helping me make the most of my stay, I even got a coupon for free Lobster Pot Stickers at Roy's (worth $16).  I did end up leaving early and even though It was already 10pm when I checked out I was not charged for the parking ($25) and the room rate was reduced by about $30 (their weekday rate). I never even asked for the deductions and that is the sort of thing that makes this place stand out. I loved Baltimore and I will definitely return to this hotel and stay a bit longerI agree with the previous reviewer. I've been to some bordering on luxurious Courtyards, but this is not one of them. I picked this place for the value and location, which is very good--smack dab in Harbor East (lots of great eats, movie theater), easy walk to Fells and the Inner Harbor. If you want to really enjoy your accomodations, go further in towards the other Marriott or the Renaissance. But if you want to be able to enjoy everything else around you, this should do.The front desk staff was a bit busy, which was slightly annoying (had to stand and wait for check-in while the staff was manning the phones, which kept ringing). The room was standard and clean. Nothing luxurious. There was even a little cube fridge, which is nice if you're staying around. The parking is $23 a day, but you can go in and out w/your room card.Stayed here for one night for a wedding in town, better than having to drive home or taxi it. All i can say is that my stay was great. The staff was friendly and cordial. The room was comfortable and clean. My requests were all taken care of. And the breakfast sandwich i order was fantastic. Parking is a bit expensive, as is the case for most of the hotels in the city, but the easy in and out access was nice (would recommend that if you do park in their garage you do so on the upper level, more open spaces and less of a fight for the spaces with the other tenants in the complex). Also the location can't be beat, located in harbor east (which has plenty to offer its self), you're a short walk from the Inner Harbor, Fells Point, and related attractions. Needless to say when and if i need an overnight in the city, assuming the courtyard has a room, it's defiantly i hotel i would take under consideration.Clean spacious rooms, a small gym, and free breakfast.  Unfortunately I never woke up early enough to partake.  Oh well, next time.Hotel is close to a bunch of restaurants and shops at the Inner Harbor so it is quite convenient...if I came back, I'd stay here again!Good hotel for the price. The walk to the Inner Harbor is very short and it's in a cool area itself. The pool and hot tub are nice as well, and the room was good. We were on the 14th floor and the view was awesome. The workers here were very courteous and nice, so it was overall a great stay.As most of the folks here will tell you, there's nothing super special about this Courtyard, but there's really nothing bad about it, either.  If you frequent Courtyard's you're probably familiar with this place already.The rooms are nice, new, and clean.  The location is great.  There are plenty of restaurants and shops around to walk to.The restaurant is typical Courtyard.  I ate breakfast one day.  Nothing to write home about.  It might be more beneficial to head over to the Whole Foods and pick something up there....Parking is a bit expensive in the garage, and they have no valet.  Often the key they give you doesn't work the garage anyway....The staff is friendly and helpful.  No complaints here!I've also stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn around the corner, and for the price, that may be a better bet.  Plus it's connected to the MAC, so you can walk right over to the gym.  But if you're tied to Marriott rewards, this will do the trick just fine.It was so noisy at night in the hallway. Awful.Do not stay here. They put charges on your account that you have not authorized. Hotel is going through remodel also so it is very noisy.work puts me up here for 8 days every other month. some staff are courteous, professional, and helpful. others would do better as unpaid doorstops. only stay here if you're saving money.Good, clean, & comfortable.  Looking foward to my upcoming stay for the Fell's Point Fest!If you are going to use the pool, call ahead of time and make sure you are knowledgable about their limited hours, especially during the week.The front desk people won't tell you, but there are cheaper places to park.  Try the lot on Eastern & President for $7 a day instead of $22.Don't order a movie.  The TVs only go up to a certain volume, and you'll have to starin to hear throughout the entire movie.Also, there are no lakeview rooms at this hotel.There's nothing special about this Courtyard Marriott. But there's nothing bad about it either. They fulfilled the standard work-travel lodging expectation. Nothing too cool. However, they get points for location (great restaurants all around). It also shares the building with Whole Foods. That's pretty cool.

review_content: Came here for a quick visit. Nothing really negative to say here. Yes, it's an older building and has been renovated...but this place is clean and simple. And when it comes to hotel rooms, cleaniness is most important to me. Customer service was pleasant. And what else could I ask for? I didn't get a chance to see the gym which is one of the reasons why I booked this place. So yeah, decent pricing considering the harbor, clean, simple, and good customer service...a Marriott fan? Then why not give this place a shot.We stayed three nights here.  I'ts a really old hotel that used to be a bank.  I'm not usually a fan of these older hotels.  This place is different.  They can't help that it is old.  The remodeling job is great.  The only place you really notice it is in the size of the hallways and the old elevators.  The rooms are great.  We had a suite, one of the nicer places I've stayed.  Refrigerator and microwave in the room, great coffee choices. The room had two televisions, one for the bedroom and one for the separate living room.  I own a cleaning company.  I know clean when I see it.  I travel a lot and am mostly disappointed  with the level of cleanliness at most hotels. They have a great staff here.  From the front desk to the cleaning staff all are very professional.  Great valet parking attendants too.  I was walking around the downtown area looking for a Chinese place late at night so I called the front desk.  The woman knew just where to send me and even knew when it closed.  She gave me directions over the phone so I could walk right to it.  I'll go back..Very nice place to stay. Very reasonable price for downtown Baltimore. Half as much as the other hotels around. Room was spacious. Had two separate areas. One had a couch, desk, kitchenette and a tv. The other had the bed and bathroom. Very nice. Only stayed one night so I paid four dollar to park out on the street. There is street parking out front from 8-6 Monday -Saturday. Free Sunday. $2 an hour. The breakfast is good to. Waffles eggs cereal fruit. Would definitely recommend itQuite a comfortable hotel and from the ninth floor, very little street noise made it up to here. The occasional slammed door made it through the walls but otherwise, it was very quiet.The room had the same layout as other SpringHills where I have stayed. Two beds on one side of a half wall with a fold-out sofa and work desk on the other side. Small fridge and microwave with coffee service. Clean bathroom with tub/shower plus a separate vanity area. Armoire rather than closet, with a folding ironing table. Two TV's in the room (one for each side of the half-wall). Internet was easy to access and worked quite well.Market in the lobby has snacks and drinks. Breakfast is served in the morning with the usual scrambled eggs, meat, bread/bagels for toasting, fruit, yogurt, etc.$32/day for valet parking. Yikes!I recently stayed at this location. The staff was helpful. The rooms are nice with plenty of places to eat and shop within walking distance.Our water went out again - the damned polar vortex, same as last year, only our plumber was unfortunately out of town on vacation.  Gah!  So we had no choice but to stay in a hotel for a couple of days, and I went on Priceline in desperation to try and get something of a good rate.  This was the hotel it picked, and I must say that, for the money I paid (61 a night), it was WELL worth the price.  It's a Marriott, first of all, which I've always had a bit of luck with.  The room (204) was VERY spacious - a separate "sitting room/office" combined with the bedroom made for a LOT of room.  Two flat screen TVs?  Well, I don't know what one would do with that, especially when they're right next to one another, but it was a help when my husband wanted to sleep and not be disturbed, so I was okay with that.The Wifi is complimentary and runs VERY nicely.  I had a paper for grad school due this weekend, so that came in VERY handy.  No interruptions, and plenty fast enough.  I was very pleased.Complimentary continental breakfast in the mornings (7:30 to 10am on weekends).  The offerings were actually quite generous, much more so than most other hotels.  They had a choice of hot oatmeal, make-your-own waffles (with toppings, yet), eggs, sausage/potato/pepper medley, all types of pastries, plenty of juice and coffee available, yogurt, cereal... really, it was much more than I'd expected, and it was all pretty good.  I don't know what people are expecting from a hotel-provided breakfast - this isn't going to be Miss Shirley's quality.  It was good enough for me.Laundry facilities here, and that was REALLY handy for me, since we weren't able to wash clothes at home.  2 bucks a shot for a big washer or dryer, and they're efficient.  Laundry supplies are available at the front desk for a buck a pop.  Worth it to me, I want clean clothes.Exercise room/gym available.  Weight room is a bit skimpy - ONE machine! - but it's multi-functional and gets the job done.  Cardio room is equipped a little better, though if it's busy you won't get a machine.  I went at 3:45am to exercise and it was blissfully silent.  Well, except for the horrible squeaking from the elliptical that I could hear through my headphones, but hey - it's there, it works, it's available.  I won't complain.A couple of negatives, though they're minor:- I don't know what it's like on other floors, but the 2nd floor is extremely close to the street and therefore you can hear people yelling quite clearly.  I was woken on Sunday morning by the people shoveling the snow off the sidewalks outside.  I know they have to get it done, but for Pete's sake, it's Sunday morning.  Be aware of the noise factor - if you wake up when a pin hits the floor, you may want to avoid the lower floors altogether.- It was a little loud in the "office".  Some kind of rhythmic humming going on in there that, quite frankly, drove me batshit.  (Although it's oddly soothing at night, like white noise.  Put me right out.)- Walls are paper-thin.  You WILL hear people talking/yelling/arguing next door if they're particularly loud/inconsiderate.- No direct way to the basement where the exercise room/laundry/conference rooms are but for one elevator, and it doesn't always come.  You have to take the stairs the rest of the way down, which was okay by me, but if you're disabled or have limited mobility it may be a pain in the neck/impossible to navigate.The bank vault/conference room is AWESOME, by the way.  Beautiful architecture.  They just don't make 'em like that anymore.We had a good stay here.  Don't know if I'd pay full rate (120 a night?  Ehhh...), but for 61 a night in dire circumstances, unbeatable.I stayed here for an entire weekend and for the three days I was a tenant in this hotel, there was no hot water available. The benefit of staying in a hotel is the ability to shower (obviously) and this hotel did not even have the courtesy to inform me of this ongoing issue upon check-in. I was appalled at how the situation was handled not only during my stay, but after my stay. The hotel provided me with a minimal refund despite the huge inconvenience of not having the ability to shower. I would never stay in this establishment again. The management is shaky at best and the front desk people are clueless.I really enjoyed my stay here at the Marriott Springhill Suites. My room was spacious - and I mean spacious (compared to NYC "suites") It was clean , comfortable and cozy. The architecture of the hotel is gorgeous. It was an old postal office/bank and I love the fact they kept some of those vintage pieces like the mail chute and vault. I didn't make it to the continental breakfast they serve so I can't review that but overall it was an awesome stay.This hotel is both historic and in a great location. The building is lovely (check out the vault gone conference room in the basement), the breakfast is plenteous (though not as much as an Embassy Suites or other upscale locations), and the cleanliness is good on the first night but the maids skip tasks and leave visible gaps in their cleaning if you stay more than one night. There is NO parking apart from Valet unless you're willing to use public garages a block over in either direction (and those will be full if it's a game night/weekend), so expect to spend an additional $35+ per night in Valet fees and have a 30 minute wait to pick up your car upon request. If you're walking to attractions, this is a 4 star; otherwise, it's a 3.A little pricey, but clean and with a nice open lobby and dining area. Full breakfast (yogurt, sausage, eggs, coffee, etc) and free wifi. Places nearby didn't have that. I enjoyed my stay and would return.Cleanliness is not capitalized. If the first what you see when you step in the  bath room a dirty towel that hangs over the shower rod, then you has to ask yourself  here the rooms are not controlled by the housekeeper supervisor. If someone had checked the rooms, he also would  notice  the totally smeared mirror and   that the front door had a similarly looked like the mirror.Obviously, the Hauskeeper use a swab for everything.Disgusting!!!Remnants of the guest he stayed before at this room was found at the moderately vacuumed carpet.Positive is, the hotel is close to port and is centrally locatedNegative is, there are homeless people everywhere. What however is not the fault of the hotel.Stayed there for one night. Long time since I was in a hotel that allowed smoking, and on top of that it would appear that I got bitten by bedbugs or similar creatures - any bare skin was covered in bite marks the following day. However, there was free WiFi and OK breakfast, but I will think twice before I go back to this place.Room was excellent, the staff was friendly and accommodating. The location was convenient to my conference and the amenities were far superior to my colleagues at the host hotel. Also, the room was cheaper than the blocked rooms at the host hotel. Overall I would recommend this hotel again and will stay there again if/when I return to BaltimoreThe room - excellent. We had a nice corner suite on a high floor. There was plenty of space. The location was also convenient, and within walking distance of many nice venues. The breakfast... it is what it is. Bad enough to make this place lose a star. No excuses, but they need to be able to handle the late Sunday AM rush a little better.SMALL BUT CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS INCREDIBLE: Stayed here this weekend for a bachelor party. There were some pros and cons but the customer service we received was the tipping point. LOCATION: (Grade: B) - Hotel is in a fairly nice neighborhood.. About 3 blocks from some of the filth. The location is about 2 blocks from the inner harbor which is close to The Gallery, Cheesecake Factory, Hooters, Phillips, etc. Close to nightlife with bars and POWERPLANT Live within blocks. Also about 10 blocks from Camden Yards. There is a valet park overnight option for $30 which seems steep - or you can walk 5 blocks and pay $25 for overnight. HOTEL AND AMENITIES : (Grade B-) - The room was somewhat spacious but on the smaller side. The building itself is smaller. Beds were comfy. Clean. Neat. Free continental breakfast with eggs and some waffles - eggs were runny - I'd clean that up to make it better. EXPERIENCE : (Grade A+) - After eating we wanted to watch the O's game but when talking with the manager Bryan MASN wasn't offered. No Orioles game in Baltimore? However, he asked if he could make it up to us (5guys) and offered us 10 beers of our choice from the lobby convenience nook. WOW! IF I OWNED A HOTEL.. I WOULD STEAL THIS GUY AND HIRE HIM! Overall for $120 a night it was worth it and I would stay again.I've stayed at many of the hotels in the Baltimore area and most of the chain hotels downtown. I checked in for several days with three coworkers and stayed a few nights here at the Spring Hill suites. We found the rooms very spacious and clean.The front desk staff, the valets, and the other staff that we ran into in the hotel were very friendly and helpful.This is a chain hotel with a little bit of character. My traveling companions and all I all have decided that we had an excellent stay here and will stay here again in the future. This is an incredible bargain - and bargains are harder and harder to find in Baltimore.I stay at a whole lot of Marriotts, and this hotel is one of the better facilities that I've stayed at under the Courtyard/SpringHill/Residence Inn/Fairfield banners.The first, and probably the best, reason which sets it apart is that it's unique - it's not a cookie cutter hotel.  The building was converted from an old bank to this Springhill Suites and it looks like it.  They kept all of the charm and look and it all comes together nicely.  You can even see the old bank vault if you walk downstairs (from the lobby).  I posted a picture of it in case you want to check it out.The second is the fact that it is a five minute walk from the Inner Harbor - FIVE MINUTES!  Believe you me, I try not to patronize the chain restaurants there, but I sure love walking around the water, checking out the skyline, and visiting the aquarium.  It's beautiful.The third takes into account the first two - the price.  This hotel is cheap for what you get in the location get it in.  Last year when I stayed there I paid $115/night, and this year I paid $145/night.  C'mon now, those prices are awesome for only being two blocks from the Inner Harbor and staying at an attractive hotel.The staff is very friendly and helpful, the happy hour specials at the bar cannot be beat (see my "tip"), the rooms are nice - two wall mounted flat screens, mini fridge, and microwave.I have been staying here, and will continue to stay here on every trip to Baltimore.I have stayed here a few times on work trips in the king suite.  The suites have a fridge and a microwave and are overall very well decorated.  The front desk staff has always been friendly and helpful.  There is no hotel-specific parking, so they encourage valet parking which is over $30 per day.  I usually choose to park on the street. My one pet peeve is that they do not provide lotion with the toiletries.  The breakfast buffet  has a good selection of average food.  It is not impressive but it gets the job done. If you are on the lower floors, noise can be an issue.  Overall, the hotel is great.Had a quick trip to BWI and had a 6am flight out. Picked this hotel and was ok with the pick. I prefer full service hotel, but ended up here. Nice peopleStayed June 2011I came a few weekends ago to celebrate my anniversary with my boyfriend. Every person we encountered from the staff was very nice and helpful. The room was great and very comfortable. The location was also ideal as it was just a 10-15 minute walk from the restaurants and attractions we wanted to visit. We took full advantage of the valet service which really comes in handy when we wanted to travel a little farther out of the inner harbor for restaurants or shops. Otherwise, we stayed local and walked. The only thing that really interfered with my ability to give this place a 4 or 5 rating was that every night between 2 and 3 AM, a bar nearby would let out and loud obnoxious people would be screaming up and down the street. We were on the 6th floor and found it unbearable. We considered calling down to the front desk but what could anyone really do? I wish I could say that I'd stay here again as the staff was really very lovely but being woken up every night, unable to fall back asleep for a few hours negatively impacted our trip as we tended to sleep a bit later than expected and were a little grumpier. If we come back to Baltimore in the future, which I'm sure we will, I think we'd have to stay somewhere that's not as densely populated.
review_content_20: We stayed here because we needed a hotel in Baltimore close to Federal Hill and Fells Point (where our friends live) and M&T Bank stadium.  So this was it.  We got a great deal through Travelocity and had no problem finding the hotel.  Valet parking is a little steep at $32/night but you do have unlimited in/out privileges and when all is considered, it beats hoofing it to a garage only to schlep all your stuff back to the hotel.  At any rate, the staff at this particular hotel is so friendly.  From everyone from the valet, to the front desk, to the housekeeping staff and everyone inbetween, they were so friendly.  No question was unanswered and no request too small.  This particular building is an old bank - I believe it was the bank that became the First Mariner bank.  The Marriott bought the building in 2007 and began the conversion.  It is important to note that the building and all of its charm was totally preserved throughout the entire process.  First off, the chandeliers are still the original ones, the ceiling in the lobby is in great shape, the tables in the lobby are the old tables where you'd find bank deposit slips, there are gorgeous marble floors and stairs, there is a mail chute on every floor, but the creme de la creme is the bank vault.  From the lobby, go downstairs and you'll see the bank vault that was converted to conference rooms.  Really cool and definitely worth it.With that said, yes the building is rather old.  However, we found our room to be spacious with a tiny "kitchenette" (sink and fridge), living room area, spacious bedroom, and an ample bathroom area.  All in all, for the price we paid, it couldn't be beat.  But the only downside were the walls that were practically paper-thin.  We could hear full conversations from our neighbors -- including the music, despite the waiver signed upon checking in refraining from "partying."  Especially on game day weekend, I can understand.There is a small continental breakfast served each morning.  Take it or leave it, but if you're looking to grab some cereal, yogurt, milk, and coffee (in 16oz cups!), this is your best bet.  There are also various breads, muffins, and croissants available.  Eggs and sausage, too; but I skipped that.  The proximity to major attractions and the stadiums are great.  The area around the hotel can be a little dicey, but we had no problem finding cabs and feeling secure.Overall, I would certainly recommend staying here and will certainly keep this on my list for hotels to stay in next year.I came here for Otakon 2014. While the walk was a bit more of a hike than I would have preferred,  the customer service was simply amazing. Because this hotel is small the employees go out of their way for you. I would absolutely stay here again if given the opportunityI really enjoyed my stay at the Marriott Springhill Suites. The front desk was very friendly and helpful, from the moment I went in to the moment I checked out. Parking can be a mess, but they do offer valet parking which was $32 a day. The hotel also served a breakfast in the morning, which was perfect because you didn't need to walk around to find food. The hotel is in a great location to the inner harbor, it's about 2 blocks walking. There is also a CVS,  711, and Dunkin Doughnuts around the corner which was good to know. I would definitely book with Springhill againI prefer the Residence Inn or the Marriott at Camden Yards... for what was paid here, we could have gotten one of the others for the same price, in a less dingy and dirty setting.The location of this hotel was nice since it was in downtown Inner Harbor, but the accommodations were not as nice.  The elevators were extremely loud, so every time someone requested an elevator you could hear it beep when it arrived on the floor.  This woke me up EVERY morning.  The breakfast was not that good, and I'm pretty sure I got sick from something.  I'm guessing it was either the eggs made from some powder mix or the sausage that had a weird taste to it.  The room was a decent size, but our toilet made a weird high pitched noise every time we flushed.What really bugged me is that when we asked for a taxi the morning we checked out, they reserved us an executive car which was much more expensive and we couldn't get out of it so we ended up paying much more.  I probably wouldn't stay here again, since there are lots of hotels in the downtown area.Spectacular! Five minute walk from Baltimore Convention Center and Inner Harbor. Suite had two nice double beds and a sleeper sofa, and they brought in a cot upon request. Help was exceptionally friendly and forthcoming. Complementary breakfast was large and tasty. 24 hour complementary coffee. Free in-room wifi. Cannot recommend this place enough--if you're coming to Baltimore, stay here.We got the 2 bedroom on the 11th floor. The room is huge!!! I will always stay here when in town. The front desk lady was very nice and professional. She made sure that i got the best rate possible. We have two micro waves and two fridges.  The valet parking folks are wonderful.Proximity to Inner Harbor was great and within walking distance (2 blocks).  The whole place looks like an old bank.The valets here were nice... BUT they mixed up keys/cars/tickets, which was NOT good whe they offered us the wrong car, scrambled asking each other where are car was, then finally found ours and brought it out with a "here ya go."The corridor to get to the elevators was really small and the room, despite 'non-smoking', of course smelled a bit ashy.The room itself was fine; odd nooks and angles to the room and bathroom, but overall fine (i'm ignoring the a/c vent that looked pretty ominous). The worst part was a blinking light coming from the cable box that we could not get to turn off.  Second worst was another bright light coming from the building next door.For the same price as other Inner Harbor hotels, you get a large suite with updated furnishings, & free breakast.  It is somewhat walkable to attractions, depending on who you are (age, fitness level, etc.).  While there are a few metered parking spots on the street (2 hour max), all other parking was ridiculous in price (but in all fairness about the same as other inner harbor hotels).  Elevator was fast, place was clean, rooms were spacious (though I was in a corner room, may have been bigger and/or brighter with the extra windows).  Definitely recommend this hotel.After reading some of the reviews up to this point, I honestly believe people should go to a place maybe more than once before popping off negative comments left and right (plus how come the Springhill at the 16 Calvert address which is the SAME HOTEL as this one got better ratings??). I mean; seriously if its that close to the stuff you want to do and the people are nice; unless the freaking bed was made of nails; why can't you either give it another try or try not to give ONE star for heaven's sake. But I digressI loved this place. While it was 3200 to valet here; that is the norm for the area; it is walking distance from so many cool things. I'm a traveler so I wasn't just staying here to be closer to the baseball fields So as a traveler, this place was excellent HUGE rooms with fridge and microwave, two flat panel tvs, a bar downstairs and a super helpful and friendly staff. I will be staying here on my travels to Baltimore over the next month or so and ditching the car in favor of the short taxi ride from the airport and enjoying the convenience and comfort this facility providesBy the way it WAS an old bank back in the day and it has a cool Vault conference room downstairs and I almost forgot; complimentary breakfast in the AM with actual eggs and a meat instead of heat and eat biscuits to go :-)This hotel is beautiful, well at least to me (I love historical buildings). It used to be an old bank back in the early 1900's, I believe the Maryland Trust Bank is what the desk manager told me. Anyway, the original vault is still in the basement and you can actually have meetings inside of it which I think is super rad...oh and the original mail chute and ceiling/chandeliers are also still in place.The suite was huge - ours was on the very top floor (10th) on the corner so we could actually see a bit of the harbor. We had two separate rooms - one with the traditional king bed/TV and another with a pullout couch/chairs/TV. The bathroom was also pretty large but the space was a bit odd - you can tell that they had trouble remodeling the place into a hotel.The staff is friendly and accommodating, and they were willing to extend our check-out to 1pm which I think is pretty generous for a Sunday morning.My only complaint is that this hotel is right next to two or three nightclubs. So be warned - if you want any sleep on a weekend I'd recommend not staying anywhere close to this street. People wait in line to get into the clubs and then spill out loud and drunk when it closes. Not fun for sleeping :[Stayed here last night and was impressed with the size of the suites, the history behind the hotel (there's a meeting room in the basement that is in an old vault), and the service. I'm giving it three stars given the property is a bit older, the fitness room sucks and the bed was not really that comfortable.We originally booked another hotel that did not meet out expectations. Luckily SpringHill Suites had availability. From the moment we walked in, the staff was courteous and helpful. This was our first trip to the Baltimore area and the staff was very helpful in helping us find our way around. We will be staying at SpringHill Suites from now on!I don't mean to go off on a rant here, but this hotel was not what it claims to be...at all. The rooms are tiny. The workout room was not available to use. There are LOUD clubs on the same block so a good nights sleep on weekends is rare. The parking, though while we all knew going in was expensive, is unarguably egregious. I'm not one to rail on a business for their shortcomings like this, but when you pay nearly $200.00 bucks a night and have to shell out an additional $35.00 a night for parking, well, I think it's valid with all the others issues we had. Speaking of other issues, I came down with congestion in my chest every morning while staying here. I'm not one to get sick. I don't smoke. I don't have seasonal allergies. The next morning I was fine and have been since our departure. Oh, yes, our departure. We checked out on Sunday morning to head to yet another Reds v Orioles game at Camden Yards, and as I stated before, the rooms are not what the pictures show them to be so we moved some furniture around to make our stay more comfortable. As we left we didn't move the furniture back and quickly realized we left our ipod in the room. Needless to say they denied finding said ipod even after hearing that we moved stuff around, etc. They never called us back and it took repeated calls to get the answer we knew we would hear in, no. This is our fault for not realizing until after we left the room, but we realized it quickly and to get the "ehh, that's a shame. come again" shtick was off-putting. I feel bad for leaving a review that is this harsh. We had an AMAZING time in Baltimore and will absolutely come back, just not here. EDITORS NOTE: After reading this back to myself I came to realize that I sound as if I am 72 years old "that hippity hop music bruised my ears all night long at those doo-wop dance halls below our room...". Let me make this clear, I'm 32. Oh yeah, if you're visiting Baltimore you must go to Joe Squared Pizza. Nacho Mama's. Mama's On The Half Shell. They will make you forget you have to pay $35 for parking and will be waking up every morning in B'more with SARS.Just arrived and everyone was friendly. The room smelled old, like no one's been in it awhile. We went to the window to check out the view. We have a view of an abandoned building. Oh well, we fixed that by closing the drapes. Valet parking was $30 but everywhere else is about the same. Breakfast was same as other SpringHills by Marriott.I actually signed up for Yelp in order to write this review because I had such a poor experience at this hotel.  First, I booked the room through a 3rd party site that does not mention that valet is the only option for parking and valet costs $32/night. The photos exaggerated the condition of this hotel - it's a 2 star AT BEST.  The walls are paper thin.  When I first arrived I could hear 2 men yelling off-and-on for an hour.  Then, at 1am, the couple staying next to me arrived back at their room and got into an extremely violent fight.  It sounded as if the man was choking the women and then they screamed at each other for over 30 minutes.  I called the front desk (out of concern for the woman) and no one ever came to check on things.  It was the worst night sleep I have ever had.  I don't blame the hotel for the couple's fight, but I do blame them for the paper thin walls and I did not feel safe there at all.  DO NOT STAY HERE.Most of this review is based on my room location; I never asked to move because I arrived late the first night of my stay and had to be up early the next morning only to get back late that night.  I was in the room above the check in desk so I could hear everything going on In the lobby, it was loud and annoying.Ehhh ok hotel..looks like it used to be an old bank...room was big with a kitchenette and relativly clean except for the a/c vent falling off the wall and there's no pool...close to the aquarium and inner harbor...if it's cheaper stay at the Fairfield inn (see my yelp review)...it's a way newer hotel...Oh the parking...they only have valet for $32 a day...but there's plenty of street parking if you can find a spot!

review_content: I booked this hotel for a 2-night stay during a soccer convention (at the Baltimore Convention Center located nearby). I booked through my credit card rewards program and got a great deal...I think it was about $180 total for both nights. I liked that it was a boutique hotel and not some corporate chain.The staff here were pretty bad, but I'm still giving 4 stars since we really liked the hotel itself. The night before we were coming, my husband called to ask if there was any way we could do an early check-in, as we were getting in around 7am from a redeye and would love to get some sleep. The lady on the phone was super unhelpful and didn't even look up our reservation or place a note on our reservation, just refused to help us out. When we arrived the next morning and were super exhausted from not much sleep on the plane (the hotel was easy to get to from the airport via the light rail which was only $1.70), the guy at check-in was pretty much as helpful as the lady on the phone the night prior. He insisted that there was not a single room available in the entire hotel, and that we would have to wait until at least noon. We were too exhausted to argue and had nowhere else to go, so we plopped down on the couches in the lobby. I think that did the trick, and once the guy realized we weren't going anywhere and didn't want us to ruin the look of the hotel by having us bum on the couches all day, a room suddenly, magically became available even though we were right next to the front desk and no one checked out. We went right up to our room, which was miraculously completely cleaned and ready for us as well. The lobby was very nice looking, and there is a nice bakery attached to the hotel that has some good sandwiches and salads, and a bar/kitchen in the lobby which had great food for fair prices. The elevators were nice, and our room was great. The king bed was super comfortable and we slept great during our stay. The bathroom was clean and had everything we needed. Internet was also complimentary, although very slow. The location was great for us and a quick walk to the convention center and to shopping and restaurants. When we went to check out the morning that we were leaving, the guy at the front desk was again unhelpful and was unable to give us a receipt since we booked through a third party. I had never heard of that, but whatever. Despite the staff being very unhelpful, we really liked the look and feel of the hotel, the location, and the great value we had gotten.Pretty decent stay for the price; wouldn't recommend for long stays, or if you plan on staying in your room often, but if you just need a comfortable bed, decent water pressure and a TV - this is a nice place to fit your needs.I'd definitely come back.it is ok. Not the best hotel I have ever experiended.......but ok.. Lots of what appears to be touristy stuff.....but it is ok. A friend of mine who's husband is being treated by Johns Hopkins for an issue that is not mine to share. However I can be there for her, and her husband as a friend. Tough time for them.Despite its fancy name, this is an okay place to stay, but maybe should be called Mr. Baltimore. It's pricey, but you're downtown. So that is to be expected. The folks at the front desk are friendly. The room is fine. The housekeeping....I was able to check in early at 11am, which was impressive. The next morning when housekeeping knocked at 8:50am it made sense. She came back at 10 while I was still in my room. I felt bad for messing up her schedule, but I was working online in the room. So the next morning, I woke up at 8 and hung a do not disturb sign on the door. I made myself some surprisingly decent coffee - it's one of those single serve machines where you insert a little packet of coffee - ironed my clothes, got ready and finished my conference calls. At 11 I left for my conference, but first I left a tip and a thank you note for the housekeeper (important to tip housekeeping!). I came back to the room mid afternoon to make more phone calls. And that's when I noticed that the toilet seat was up, the toilet was clogged and my used coffee packet was floating in the bowl. Also, the staff had ignored my request not to leave any more towels, because I care about the environment, but let's focus for now on the coffee floating in my clogged toilet. When I told the woman at the front desk, she was bewildered. I showed her a picture and she said she would send an engineer. I left the hotel 2 hours later having seen no engineer. When I got home at 9, the toilet was still unloved. This time, the guy at the desk radioed engineering in front of me and a very friendly engineer came promptly and fixed the problem. But nobody at the front desk seemed concerned that housekeeping had left my bathroom that way (or tried to flush coffee???). So, no harm done; but what the heck?!? Housekeeping didn't get a tip the next day...Outstanding stay. There are three places to eat with the hotel, a nice bar, adequate gym, and walking distance to most of the places you come here to see. The staff is extremely polite and all the renovations appear to be complete. The first impressions are lasting and this hotel does a great job at setting the tone for the rest of your stay. The rooms are nice and like others have reviewed, the shower is small and old but gets you clean!I have been staying at this hotel for literally 20 years on and off for business; long before it was the Lord Baltimore. It was a Hilton, then Radisson, and I believe a Hilton again before "going boutique". I like the location and price - this is why it's one of my "go to" hotels in this city I frequent.My most recent stay was on 8/19/2015 and I was in town for pleasure this time; my son's 18th birthday and we came to see the Mets VS Orioles. There were 3 teenagers + myself and we had 2 connecting rooms. Check in was super quick, and the employees at front desk and curbside were all super friendly and helpful as I have come to expect here. Rooms had 2 queen beds each and were recently renovated, clean and comfortable. VERY good size I should add. Free internet was crawling slow, but I didn't feel like paying to upgrade. Hey, it was just 1 night and I survived. Everything about our stay was pleasant and we booked through hotels.com for $120 per room. For a clean and decent hotel with 2 queen beds that's a very fair rate in my book. So, recently updated, friendly, efficient and inexpensive - that why they earned 4 stars!The down side; no free coffee in the lobby - need to hit the pastry shop ) I'm a coffee addict and the in-room Kureg doesn't cut it for me). Also, at night the neighborhood can be a tad sketchy (which is why they close the front door at night) - 1 entrance only (side). There's major construction across the street - building was demolished and not sure what will be going up but it's not a pretty site, and many homeless have set up shop in the courtyard across the street as well. Typical urban stuff though - everywhere in every city for the most part.Overall, one of my favorite hotels in town especially at this price point.I stayed at this hotel a couple night when I was in town for a job interview. I had a room on the second floor. First of all the room was nice and seemed very clean. The window was dirty and I had a terrible view (into an alleyway) which kind of sucked. The light on the desk didn't work and would flicker if it wasn't unplugged which was a little creepy.I was a bit disappointed that this hotel didn't have any kind of room service. The bakery downstairs was fine, but I would've liked more than a croissant for breakfast. Their in-house restaurant didn't open until 11:30 so it was completely useless for breakfast. A few people mentioned noise from the city but I was on the 7th floor and didn't really notice it being noisier than any other hotel in a city! Overall, not a bad place to stay! I would recommend this hotel if you like historical hotels and don't mind no room-service!Great location, apparently built in 1928, nice, but a bit quirky, and rooms lack the finer amenities...no glass cups or glasses, but paper and plastic.The Lord Baltimore seemed like a great idea on paper. A historical spot with old-time charm and recently renovated. We thought it would be a great place to stay for a fun wedding weekend in Baltimore. We were however, very disappointed with our stay here.Before I get to the negative parts - there were a couple good things about this hotel. The beds were really comfortable and the room was decently sized. The lobby was nice and clean. That is about all the good things I can say about this place. First off they do not have room service available which was really annoying. Their showers were very outdated and looks like were not included in this "renovation". Not only were they outdated but they were pretty gross and I tried not to look around when I was showering. The maid service was very rude as well. We were getting ready around 2pm when they came to clean the room. We told the lady we had to get ready for a wedding and they could not clean at this time. The lady insisted that she come in to clean and when we told her no again, she then rolled her eyes at us. Very unprofessional in my opinion. Then on our last night of our stay, we lost power and water completely. It was like a furnace in our room and everything was out until our checkout the next day. Very miserable. All in all, I would not recommend staying here. There are plenty of other great options in this city.I stayed there Valentine's Day weekend and I had a terrible experience.the rooms was small and they had a cheerleading competition there that weekend and they decided to give a party right in the hallway outside of everyone room,they was loud throwing trash under people doors .so me and my husband decided to leave to go to the gallery shopping for a while but when we opened our doors they wouldn't move you had to step all over people.so we complained to the manager and he said he would take care of it but he didn't so I had to call down to the front desk 2 more times and he said our stay was free but it got so bad we didn't even stay we left the same night. We never got our money back on our card from the hotel and every time you call about it they tell you a bunch of lies. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody cause they don't care about their guest .Stayed here for a mini Valentine's Day vaca. Rooms were clean. Everything worked. Unfortunately, my car broke down a night before time to checkout. we checked out of the hotel and decided to wait in the lobby for a ride. Lobby was entirely TOO COLD. I don't even think they have heat in this area. But there was a downstairs area where they sold coffee, sandwiches and muffins. We decided to wait there. It was barely anybody in there.
