They also have a couple fun robes in the closet- a zebra striped and leopard one, which was cool but they were not soft, along with a yoga mat.The bed was comfortable but you could definitely 'feel' the springs, and I was a bit disappointed there were no additional pillows, though I think we could've asked for more no problem.  We actually forgot toothpaste and in the bathroom they have a sign saying they will bring you complimentary (!!) toiletry items like toothbrush, toothpaste, etc.  I felt silly asking them to deliver toothpaste when I could've walked right down to the front desk, but they insisted delivery was no problem, and the toothpaste arrived in less than 5 mins!  My only complaint about the room was that the walls were very thin- you could hear doors slamming and people talking in the very next room.  Thankfully it was during the day and not when we were trying to sleep. They have free wine hour from 5-6.  I recommend getting there right at 5 as they also have hors d'oeuvres that were completely gone when we arrived at 5:45.  I don't like wine so can't attest to that but they also had coffee and water, and the bf said their red wine was meh. It's free- do the math- you get what you 'don't' pay for.We ordered room service because, well, when in Rome!  We only wanted the experience so we ordered their chocolate chip cookies.  They said they were a bit backed up but should arrive in 45 minutes.  Over an hour later they finally arrived, but we were blessed with  more than the 2 cookies listed on the menu- and they were warm and chewy and perfect!  They were a bit thin though, and as an avid baker I might suggest chilling the dough first before baking- it decreases the odds the cookies will spread while baking...just a random tidbit.They have valet parking- which was super expensive at $38 for the day/night. But I'll pay a good amount for peace of mind my car is safe. Overall not a bad stay.  Pretty pricey but decent room and very friendly service.This place is an excellent value for the price. We stayed here over Labor Day weekend this year, and felt like it was perfect for our stay. Our room was spacious and clean, and very comfy. We usually stay in places like Four Seasons or Hyatt and we felt like this place was as accommodating for a much more reasonable price.  I loved the historical aspects of the building as well, and it is centrally located. The staff couldn't have been better to us and there were plenty of Uber cars, Hotel cars and taxis at the ready.  I would come back, for sure. The only thing I would critique was the all hours dining menu wasn't so varied with options. But we had room service breakfast and it was awesome.  Get the lox plate! Mmmm...Oh and hubby had the french toast and loved it.I love Kimpton, as I am an Inner Circle member,  but after this experience I will not be staying at this hotel again. I primarily stay at the Surfcomber in Miami for work, but business has taken me to Baltimore this month. I stayed last month for a just a few hours (checked in at 11pm and out at 8am) so barely got to really experience the hotel. Onto today... checked in late thanks to a few delays with my flight - figured I would be comforted by getting to a trusty Kimpton property. Right? Wrong!!!! Staying for two nights this time and dreading it.  It's only been about an hour and I'm ready to head to the nearest Hilton. Pulled up and no valet to be found. There was some homeless guy hanging out across the street yelling, so I was nervous to get out. Parked the car and got my own suitcase and work bag out of the car and started walking inside...oh finally, the valet shows up. Great. Head up to get checked in and the girl at the front desk is just kind of blah. Nice enough though. I get my keys. ..no raid the mini bar coupon. No welcome Inner Circle member. Nothing. The Surfcomber gives you a glass of champagne on arrival!!!I ask for the room service details since I'd been at the airport all day. No room service (it was 11pm). Figured there'd at least be an overnight menu? Nope! I asked for delivery options and got ONE menu which upon checking yelp, had literally one and a half stars and had already been reviewed by a Monaco guest who said it was HORRENDOUS. So glad this was the menu given to me.OK brushing it off, I decide that I'll have a nice big room with my amenity waiting, so I can eat that! Head upstairs and I was not upgraded even though it's guaranteed. There's a leak over my window and the wallpaper is peeling off. And no amenity.  Not even a bottle of water. I am so used to Kimpton being spectacular that I am beyond disappointed at this experience.  Going to bed hungry and pissed. At least I know tomorrow to eat before getting here. Kimpton lovers steer clear!!!!!Centrally located and clean, historically significant, gorgeous, long elegant marble staircases, high ceilings, sexy modern bathrooms with two headed glimmering chrome shower heads, fun, full wall murals for the kids, complete with bunk beds and complimentary Xbox!  Terry cloth robes, well-stocked fridge, soft comfortable white dressed beds with tons of extra fluffy pillows, modern and way-above-average friendly service especially the best most understanding office manager, Vernon Drummond, this is THE place to stay in Baltimore!We always have a fabulous stay here!  The decor is amazing...very chic and retro fabulous.  The marble stairs and crystal chandeliers add to the charm of this boutique hotel.  Our room was clean and nicely appointed.  This location is close to Inner Harbor with ample restaurants and shopping.  The B&O restaurant downstairs is also great to grab drinks, dinner or a quick bite.  Staff is friendly and attentive which made our stay even better!
review_content_40: I'm really starting to dig Kimpton Hotels. As far as this Monaco goes, there's almost nothing negative I could say about it. The space is beautifully re-purposed and the rooms are a good size for a downtown hotel. The high ceilings and design features (like the sliding door for the bathroom) make the room feel big, even though the square footage is probably not so high.Check in/out was quick and easy. Every staff person I interacted with was friendly. And the evening wine reception is simply awesome. The location is OK, but leaves something to be desired. It's close to the Inner Harbor, but not in the Inner Harbor. By no means does the area feel dangerous, but you'll want to be on-guard if you venture out after dark.I know. I know. Could this hotel really be worth 5 stars?? Yes.Nervous as all get out about staying in Baltimore, I had to find a hotel that had nothing but good reviews. Luckily I work for a big bank and was able to score the bank rate. Knowing that this was on the bank negotiated list, I knew that it would be a good one. And I was right. I haven't experienced hotel services like this before. I would go out on a limb and say that this hotel could be close to comparison with The Ritz. There. I said it. Two totally different styles, however same awesome hospitality, flare, and luxury.This hotel is in a perfect location. Close to the inner harbor, and close enough to walk (a mile...) to the stadium. We arrived and like ninjas, the doormen (like three of them) open our doors and had our luggage out within minutes. We arrived in time for the end of the manager's reception and the bellmen asked me "red or white". 0__0 huh?? Giggling husband said "white" and I was still confused. Apparently the manager's reception was a cocktail hour and the bellman was asking me if I wanted red or white wine. I laughed. "White please" After a LONG arse drive, I was almost in tears as the glorious white wine was handed to me. "hello, you" is what I thought. Check in was a breeze. Up to the room we go with the friendly bellman. Room was AWESOME. Spacious, clean, comfy bed, nice flatscreen, and a GIANT shower....I was in heaven. Every time we left the room, either the cleaning crew or the doormen were asking us if they could help us get to our destination. I felt like a rockstar. I felt like they REALLY were genuine and were just happy that we were happy. We'd leave the hotel, and they would open the doors....smiling. We'd come back and they'd say "hey! it's you two again! welcome back" giving us high fives. I couldn't believe it. Beautiful hotel with a grand marble staircase. It's inside the renovated B&O railroad and I loved it. There is a manager's reception that provides lite bites and wine from 5-6 Mon thru Fri. It's an amazing place and will now be a fan of Kimpton Hotels wherever we go.Ah, I so wanted to give this hotel five stars! Alas, I can't.Husband and I were only in town for a night -- wanted to get an early start at the aquarium the following day. I based my hotel choice on Yelp reviews (and a hotel.com credit), and got a King-bed room with a soaking tub for us. We were happy to see we could bring our dog, though we opted not to as we wouldn't have a place to leave her while in the aquarium. (Good to know that Kimpton is pet friendly for future trips, though, as we travel with our dog often.)Parking is expensive in downtown Baltimore. Self-parking at a nearby lot and getting the ticket validated helped, but there are light rail and metro stops very, very close so definitely look into mass transit options. The building itself is gorgeous and they've done a great job preserving historical bits such as the marble staircase. Lobby is tasteful with a nice lounge area complete with squishy chairs and a decorative fireplace. Staff was very friendly and helpful -- they even loaned us a goldfish to keep us company overnight! (They didn't offer to help us get our bags up to our room which is fine by me - I can handle my own luggage - but I know that's an important thing for some people.)The room itself was a decent size and the tub was perfect. The clashing patterns and colors really should be eye-smiting, but they weren't, for some reason I can't fully understand. The bathrobes made us both smile - one zebra-striped and one leopard-spotted. The walls were a tad thin and the AC a bit on the loud side, but neither one bothered me too much. What was a problem, however, was the bed. Despite being a king, we were mashed together in the center of the mattress because there was a huge sag right in the middle. No center support was present, the mattress itself appeared old, the pillow-top was very lumpy. It kind of defeats the purpose of getting a huge bed when it forces you to sleep in a space the size of a twin.So very, very close to an excellent stay, but so ruined by a terrible bed.Impressed from start to finish. The lobby is gorgeous the rooms are gorgeous the wine hours is nice & you can't beat the location. We came for a four-day weekend with our two children and got the family room which has an attached room with bunk beds for the kids. Wow!! They have their own tv & Xbox too! The rooms are sophisticated and well done. I travel a lot for business & I would stay here again.This is long overdue review. Like at least a year. But better late than never, I always say.Upon walking into the hotel, you barely remember that you are still in Baltimore. Statement staircases, marble flooring, grand lighting and a rich sense of style make this Kimpton boutique hotel just as posh as all the others.I have stayed overnight in 4 Kimpton hotels including 1 in Washington, D.C. and 2 in New York City. All were stellar but the visual appeal of this hotel is memorable. Maybe because you can tell the building is one that was build perhaps in the '60s or '70s but given the modern touches it has great modern appeal with great historic "bones".The wine happy hour is quaint and the wine selections are appealing for those who like white, red, dry or sweet.The room definitely had a moderate upscale presence. Light and pristine bedding. Thread count is apparent in the sheets and they are so endearing to the skin. I just melted in the pillows and there were several of them for me to get lost in the clouds of softness. Spacious bathroom and a shower that has great power stream of water. Great attention noted to the updated and contemporary design. Clean lines but great flow of colors that are not too obnoxious or overpowering with each other.I have nothing negative to say about my stay here. Whenever in Baltimore again, this will definitely be a first choice for me.This place is wonderful! The staircases of marble are so spectacular. This makes the hotel so elegant and historical. All of the employees are courteous, helpful, and friendly. There also is a wine and bite size pieces of pizza available as a courtesy between 5:00 and 6:00, which was a nice touch. Easy walking distance to Inner Harbor. I will definitely stay here again!As good as it gets, yes a truly great hotel with all the amenities for a great place for you to stay.We stayed at 2 "Kimpton" owned properties (other in OldTown Alexandria) Our two nights in Baltimore were awesome, and close enough to Fells, Pt. Inner Harbor but was extremely cold to walk so we used Lyft/Uber to get around GET APPS AND FORGET TAXIS...better prices for better service and ride. The hotel is the old railroad offices and was terrific, garden tub, spacious rooms and has that historic feel. We ate and had drinks at the lounge and a two blocks away are a couple of pubs, (O'Sheas) and other food places to enjoy. The food and drinks were really well made and priced accordingly. I would highly recommend this hotel.My only complaint was the (homeless) people inside the lobby and the demolition of the old Morris Mechanic theater next door. The noise during the day was off-putting, but the hotel graciously allowed us to move to opposite side of hotel away from noise. The construction was not really early a.m. but constant. I am not a complete ahole without compassion since it was in the low teens temperature wise, but when a homeless woman went and helped herself to hot drinks/chocolate and placed her "unwashed" hand in to the marshmallow bowl and began eating them...I had to speak to the front desk clerk and asked to have them remove the contaminated leftovers....5 stars across the board for this stay..thanks KImpton/Hotel Monaco I will returnvery clean and chic! friendly staff. awesome service. spacious rooms. kimptons are consistent.My husband and I stayed at Hotel Monaco last Saturday night for a business trip and thought this hotel was beautiful. We have stayed throughout Baltimore over the years for this annual business trip and my husband decided to take a chance on this hotel for a change. The valet was welcoming, the front desk girl was informative and our room was so comfortable. The room had high ceilings with a comfortable bed and a large bathroom but the best part of the room was that is was so quiet. In the morning we were amazed at how late we slept because there was not your typical hotel noise of doors banging and people talking in the hallways...great nights sleep. We had cocktails and appys in the restaurant bar and found it to be friendly and comfortable. The food we did have was delicious and the bartenders were attentive. If I search for a complaint the only thing I would say is that the water pressure in the shower was low...which is minor but I try to give pros and cons on my reviews. Also, walking distance to Inner Harbor and convention center. We will be back.A grand hotel! Highly recommend this hotel. This is a lovely stately hotel. Marble staircase, brass fixtures but still an uber modern feel. Blocks from Inner Harbor. Lovely room. Extremely high ceilings. CO Bigelow toiletries. Modern furniture. Plenty of electric outlets to 'recharge'. Trip: Business, Date: 10/7/2013Stayed in Baltimore for the weekend over Xmas. This hotel is great. Upgraded to the Mediterranean Suite, which was very large, had a whirlpool tub, and nice views. A hotel is only as good as its staff, however, and the staff here were very nice, cheerful and helpful. Tamika at the front desk was awesome, and the restaurant staff were as well, specifically Maria at the bar and the Ozzy Ozbourne looking guy in the restaurant.What a beautiful place! The entrance is spectacular, what a beautiful restoration of the B&O location. The room was huge with high ceilings, and everything was spotless. The valet (Ahmed) was so friendly and helpful, the front desk was great from check-in (they let me in 3 hours early) to check-out. Excellent service. The restaurant has an amazing breakfast and great atmosphere.This is our 3rd stay at Monaco Baltimore and it didn't let us down!!I'm looking forward to staying at another Kimpton Hotel.We love Kimpton hotels and this one is awesome! Beautiful building and rooms. Our original room was near the elevators, but the staff worked to find us a quieter room. Huge thanks to Julia McCarthy! Super helpful in making our stay wonderful and relaxing!I had the opportunity (and pleasure) of staying at the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore this past weekend for a wedding. Let me just say -- Kimpton Hotels know exactly what they are doing. I am not sure I'll stay anywhere else when I'm not necessarily looking for a budget stay.First, the building itself is very aesthetically pleasing. A lot of this has to do with so many of the older buildings in Baltimore being historical buildings with original architecture (to include the dual marble staircase in the entryway to this hotel). Everything looks very nice from the moment you walk up to the moment you enter. It's clear that the designers for Kimpton go above and beyond to present a luxury hotel.The room itself was excellent. It was honestly comparable to the Four Seasons room I stayed at in Atlanta. Whether that is a function of Atlanta's Four Seasons hotel not being "up to par" with its counterparts or not, I cannot say. But Kimpton is decidedly different as well, opting for more modern appointments than the traditional classics of the Four Seasons.12-foot ceilings in all the rooms here, modern furniture and linens, and an absolutely phenomenal bathroom...honestly, the bathroom is something I would like to put in my own dream home one day, albeit with more storage/function. The shower is nicer than some home custom jobs I've seen, and I'm pretty sure the floor features travertine tile, which isn't exactly cheap.All of this for under $200/night with a pretty awesome restaurant/bar on the ground floor and minimal, non-invasive staff. You'll never have to wait long for help, but the staff isn't overwhelming and all over the place either. Pretty decent city views of Baltimore too, for what its worth (it is still Baltimore, after all).I would definitely recommend the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore for anyone looking for a remarkably comfortable and luxurious stay for a short or long trip if your wallet can make it happen. Kimpton Hotels are now my new favorite line of hotels thanks to the Hotel Monaco in Baltimore. 5 Stars.Just arrived. Elevator smelled of vomit. Woman at front desk was reading some paperwork and asked us to wait a min. Ok, we waited.... Then she took a phone call, still waiting (no one else there but us) finally a gentleman came out if the back room to check us in. Got into room, no remote control for TV. Had to call down for one. Room is nice. Large with two queen beds. Cute bathrobes in closet. Lots of toiletries. Parking was $30 per day or $38 for valet. We were not offered a goldfish, but I did see someone going up the elevator with one. To use elevator you must insert your room key.I live in Baltimore, however my boyfriend and I wanted a romantic night away from dogs, roommates, etc. This hotel was beyond our expectations! The whole hotel is gorgeous, the room was large and immaculate, clean, smelled clean, and was beautifully designed. The kind sized bed was SOO comfortable, we didn't even want to get up in the morning! We also used the jacuzzi tub and it was amazing. Staff was also very friendly and efficient. Only complaint was the $38 valet parking. We ended up parking 1/4 of a mile awhile at a cheaper garage. Wish they had a cheaper parking option. Otherwise, we loved everything. Will be returning!This hotel is amazing! My wife and I recently stayed here for her birthday. We were made to feel very special from the very start: from the email two days before our arrival from AFOM Vernon Drummond to confirm our stay and inquire if we had any special requests; to the free upgrade to their Mediterranean Suite; there was champagne & fresh fruit; candles around the jacuzzi, and candies shaped like a heart on the bed. And my wife loved the yoga mat! She felt very special indeed. Monaco is minutes from Inner Harbor, is clean, has a great lobby, foyer, and stairs leading to the front desk.Enjoyed a delicious breakfast both mornings at B&O Brasserie. If you are planning a trip to Inner Harbor, this is the place to stay.Our first time in Baltimore and first stay at a Monaco. Absolutely loved this hotel! No complaints!! The entire hotel is beautiful. The room was very big with a big bathroom as well. High ceilings. Have to use your key to access elevators so it feels safe. Nicely appointed, modern decor. The staff was helpful and friendly. Lots of elevators so you didn't have to wait long. Good location within easy walking distance to the Inner Harbor and lots of shops and restaurants. Loved the C.O. Bigelow soap/shampoo etc--it smelled SO good! Would love to return here or to another Monaco!One of the best and most beautiful Kimpton hotels I've stayed in (and ALL Kimpton hotels are great)! The room was comfortable and quiet. The hotel is housed in the historic B&O Railroad headquarters, which only adds to its charm. Be sure to grab a bite to eat at the B&O Brasserie downstairs, as well. The food was amazing. HIGHLY recommend this hotel!
review_content_60: This is the second Kimpton Hotel I've had the pleasure of staying at (Burnham in Chicago being the other). I must say, Kimpton is becoming my favorite chain.The building used to be the corporate home for the B&O railroad, and if you look around, you can see through some of the modernization. It's a really cool space, and I'm fond of unique properties with charm.This hotel is beautiful. The bedding is very good, and the high cielings really make it feel spacious. The bathroom benefits from modern touches and fantastic water pressure - even on the 9th floor. The restaurant hotel (which I really need to review separately) is also very good. It's not your typical hotel restaurant; it's good enough to draw in locals. Customer service well exceeds what you may be used to at the usual large chains.I would strongly recommend this hotel if you're in the area.Got to be a friend's plus one here during her book's publicity tour. Loved the quirky details like zebra and panther print dressing gowns and the wine hour - should have had soft drink option and veggie canapes tho! Not a huge fan of the room-service food (we ordered a lot and only enjoyed about a third of it - the breakfast burrito was awesome tho!) Good choice of movies on the in-room system though it was a bit fiddly to use...Lovely large bathrooms and helpful friendly staff. What more could you ask for...!My first time in Baltimore and we chose this place. The moment we walked up to the front door we were greeted by "Big Dave" who was super friendly and funny. He escorted us to our room and told us a little about the hotel as we made our way up to the 8th floor.This place is beautiful inside and out. Our room had a giant King sized bed, very high ceilings, and big windows overlooking the streets. The bed was very comfortable and clean. Bathroom was beautiful but had limited privacy due to the sliding door and no switch for a fan. Even though we didn't have our pups with us during this stay, I was pleased to find out that this hotel is very pet friendly. Overall this was a great place to stay if you're only in town for a few days. Not far from the aquarium and water. My only complaints were the lack of parking and wifi wasn't working. It got to be a little pricey to park in the garage across the street and valet parking was just as much. It was also a little annoying that you had to sign up for some program and give the front desk a code # to get the wifi for free and a $10 mini bar credit. It took longer than I expected to check out of the place. Other than that minor stuff we had a really great time here and would most likely return.Inaccurate accounting, incorrect, unauthorized charges, absolute failure to correct mistake despite admitting having charged my card extra $459.70 in error. Despite repeated promises by Harold in accounting no corrective action has happened since July. I have opened disputes with American Express on 5 charges they have placed on my cards following my stays here, that have no mention in the check-out bill.I stayed at this hotel at-least 6 times since January 2013. Each time I am seeing false and unauthorized charges to my cards in the amounts varying from $35 to $500. I have prohibited any of my staff traveling to Baltimore to stay at this hotel. Stay away or at-least check your credit card statements 2-3 months following every stay at the Hotel Monaco Kimpton in Baltimore.Pros:- Beautifully decorated interior- Clean and comfy- Free wi-fi & $10 Raid the Mini Bar credit if you are a Kimpton Rewards member (free to join)Cons:- No coffee maker in the room. Although, you can request one and if they have it available they will bring you one. - Expensive parking (look for nearby parking garages as an alternative)- Customer service was hit or miss- Asked for late check out and found the cleaning lady camped outside of our room- The area is a little sketchy but I guess that's just BaltimoreThis was my first visit to Baltimore in about 20 years and I can say that the area is much nicer than I remember. This is the first time that I stayed at a Kimpton Hotel and I can say I was impressed. This is a very secure property with keyed elevator access and nice security personnel on the first floor. Everybody that I interacted with was very pleasant and professional. The historic building was very nice and my room was clean and the 8th floor was very quiet. I thought that the 5pm wine and appetizer tasting was a nice touch. The only negatives were that that hall carpets were pretty worn and the the leopard print robe in the closet looked a little sketchy. I do have allergies and this is a pet friendly hotel so be aware of that but I had not issues due to the clean room. Some people mention the cost of parking but their are other options very close if you want to self park. I opted to pay to have to hotel handle parking and you pay per day and can take your car in and out for the day price. All in all when I return to Baltimore I will be staying at this HotelI LOVE Kimpton hotels. They have incredible customer service, and are always willing to go above and beyond. This particular one is in the old B&O railroad station, so it's a gorgeous building inside, with large marble staircases.From the minute we arrived, the staff was incredibly accommodating, helping with our luggage all the way from curbside to our room. They provided us with maps, recommendations, and best of all, are pet friendly! They provided a bag with treats, a poop bag, and a map with directions to the nearest dog park. The wine hour in the lobby is awesome---everyone brought their dogs down, and mingled with dogs, wine, and appetizer samples from the restaurant downstairs. Kimpton hotels never charge a pet fee, which is an added bonus. Unfortunately, I don't think this hotel is in the best area, but it is certainly not the hotel's fault. I lived in DC for a few years and am not really scared away by city living, but others seemed to be wary of the neighborhood, and a girl at the dog park told me she was mugged a few months ago. Just be careful walking around at night.Gorgeous hotel. Everything is up to Kimpton standards (friendly, helpful staff, comfortable beds, great towels, nice bathroom, etc.). There's even a nice, big gym! But there are a few kinks...*Valet. Gosh almighty this was a pain. We'd call downstairs to the front desk (you can't reach valet directly) for the car at least 20min ahead every time and not once was the car ready when we came down. In fact, there was not one time when someone was even on their way to get the car. We had to allow an extra 15+ minutes to any trip for this during our stay. *Front Desk Staff. Guys...if you're during prime check in or check out times, please staff your front desk with more than one person. We had to wait on a 5 person line both upon arrival and departure. Not a huge deal but could easily be solved. I will say that for the price, staying here is a killer deal...Just bring a little bit of patience.The hotel was very good. The rooms were huge and unique. Most of all they were clean. We only stayed for one night but if I come back through Baltimore, this is where I would stay.This was a great hotel, especially for the price. Everything was clean, and we liked the large windows and tall ceilings. I will admit that I'm a bathroom snob, and this one didn't disappoint. Lots of room and a clean, modern shower with no yucky shower curtain that reminds you of everyone else that has stayed there. My only complaint was that they are a bit stingy with bath towels - they should just stock three in the room instead of two.Chic. Sexy. Fun. Clean. Hot (in a chic, sexy, fun, clean way)! I love this hotel. I freaking hate staying in hotels. They give me the creeps, even some nice hotels really make me uncomfortable. It's the UNKNOWN...who slept in this room? Who did what in this bed? Who pooped in this toilet?Well, once I opened the door to our room at Hotel Monaco all my quesitons of the unknown were immediately answered as I felt like I was the ONLY ONE to ever walk into this room, with the exception of the maid (who got a very hearty tip from me).It was so clean! It was so comfortable. It was so BIG, for a king size bed hotel room in a metropolitan city. It was not expensive. My fiance had the mental capacity to look on hotwire.com as we were coming down for a weekend for a wedding and didn't really want to stay in a best western/holiday inn/etc. We wanted a nice hotel and he saw it was a four star hotel...and on hotwire they don't tell you the name of the hotel until you book. HOT FUCKIN DAMN did we get lucky with the Hotel Monaco.We checked in and immediately went up to our room to unpack. I don't really ever unpack since I don't like my clothes co-mingling in the drawers of the unknown so I decided to hang up my dress for the wedding and we headed down to the bar for drinks.When we are on vacation we definitley want to have three square meals a day and we tend to drink with most of them. It was around 2:45pm and the wedding was at 6pm so we had time to kill. We had a great bartender who made me a gin drink. I had a couple. We had the bacon wrapped dates, not amazing but ok. Then we had homemade donuts. THESE WERE AMAZING. You must get them.Then we had to get in our fancy clothes for the wedding but first, we needed to attend the free wine session in the lounge. We had some wine (beringer or some brand like akin to that). Not my fave, but free is free and I had a few sips.Then off to the wedding. After the wedding I was looking forward to returning to my room to sleep. And sleep I did. It was a beautiful sleep and I woke up after 9am. Please note, that I NEVER can sleep in a hotel room. I can't fall asleep, stay asleep, I just can't get comfortable. I was so comfortable here that I could have just died and it would be ok because I was doing something I loved. SLEEPING.My fiance stayed out and came back to the room much later than I. I didn't care. I had a great shower before bed and put on a fabulous robe (I believe it was a leopard print one) got in my jammies and off I went to saw some wood. ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZWe got up in the morning and had breakfast. I don't remember what I got, but I know it was good because I would have complained here if it was bad.We then went out all day, ate, drank, saw an O's game (they won), drank, walked, and then I ate another meal in the hotel. And got my gin drink,I will absolutely come back here again. In fact I really want to return to B'more just because of the Hotel Monaco.It's a great place!I frequently stay here in Baltimore. It's a good location, walking distance to the harbor, Mt. Vernon and the stadiums, but also often has on-street parking available. The inside is very beautiful and historic, they have free wine happy hours, a nice lounge with fireplace. The rooms are always very nice and clean. The price is usually very reasonable for a hotel of it's class. Service is excellent. This is my go-to hotel for when I want to stay in Baltimore and don't want to bother staying with a friend.Simply the Best. It's a Kimpton. An outstanding hotel in a gorgeous historic building.I am a Kimpton junkie so I was excited to try a new (to me) location. Unfortunately it was a quick stay for me so I did not have the opportunity to get the overall experience, but I can comment on a few things that are important to me when I'm travelling for work:#1 The staff is super friendly. That's pretty standard for Kimpton hotels but this staff seemed to be having fun at work - while still being very professional. #2 My room was great. Big room, high ceilings, clean clean clean. There was one specific element of my room that I let the front desk know about, otherwise the hotel would have received 5 stars. It wasn't anything that detracted from my overall stay.#3 Overnight room service. I didn't use it, but you know when you've been flying all day and haven't eaten and get to your hotel super late and have to venture into the howling unknown for a sandwich ... ? I'm looking at you, Portland.#4 They have Bravo TV. (Am I the only one who cares about that?)Combined with Kimpton's InTouch loyalty program, this is a no brainer. I can't wait to come back.I love Kimpton Hotels! The attention to detail at each hotel is amazing and my stay at the Baltimore Hotel Monaco was great. This specific hotel's theme was world traveler in which was carried out through the light (train decal) and the night stands which are luggage cases! The room had great tall ceilings, beautiful tall windows and a grand bathroom. The hotel offers bike rides (call ahead), yoga amenities, and is pet friendly during your stay. They have great coffee in the morning until 10 am and they do offer wine at 5 pm every day.The only complaint (if you even want to consider it a complaint) is the bed as it was not as plush as I would have hoped for a california king bed and wifi is not free unless you sign up for their rewards club.Overall, my stay here was comfortable and relaxing!We absolutely love Kimpton Hotels - between the beautiful decor, helpful staff, and great amenities, Kimpton is always our first choice when it comes to hotels. This hotel didn't disappoint us. As always it was clean, comfortable and convent to where we wanted to go. We also were able to enjoy our $10 free raid the mini bar reward.An outstanding find for our family! Hotel Monaco is breath of fresh air in the cookie cutter world of hotel chains. From the moment we pulled in front of the hotel we were treated as welcome and appreciated guest! Every staff member we encountered was beyond pleasant! The management team knows exactly what they are doing. The check in process was painless and seamlessly smooth. Our bags were brought to our room with great efficiency! The room was clean and well decorated. The room had a very modern feel to it, that is a welcome change! To sum it up we were pleased with the high level of customer service along with aesthetics of the hotel decor. We have found a new brand of hotels that we will look for in other cities when we travel!Very courteous and friendly staff. Bathrooms and bedrooms are very clean. Bathrooms are supplied with C.O Bigelow bath products (basic shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion, and soap). Make sure to joint the free rewards program to enjoy free wifi at the hotel!I got a stain on my blouse and the hotel supplied me with stain remover towelettes when I asked if they might have anything to possibly help remove it. Also, unlike other hotels, they provide you with basically anything you can possibly want such as toothbrush, toothpaste, sewing kit, mouthwash, and etc.This was the second time I had stayed at this location. The building is very old, but decorated really nicely and it looks really cool at night with blue lights shining up the side of it. About the only complaint that I have with this visit was that the door lock to our room did not work correctly. Overall though it was a good experience and will be staying there again.Everyone who I encountered at the Monaco is exceptionally nice and helpful. The hotel is in a beautiful historic building but is done in a cool, modern design - best of both worlds. The room was nice and comfortable, and very quiet. I liked that the comforter was covered by sheets - much cleaner than having a blanket that probably isn't washed all too often. Plus there's free Internet, unlike some 4 star hotels that charge $10+/day.I like Kimpton hotels because the chain is environmentally responsible. There are recycling as well as trash cans in the rooms, housekeeping changes sheets and towels only upon request, not every day (which is silly anyhow - who does that at home?!) They also adjust thermostats while guests are away to be energy efficient - no point blasting the A/C or heat all day if you're out. They also have bikes that you can use, not sure if they are included or extra, but regardless, that's great!I also love that you can request a goldfish to make your room feel more like home, and also a yoga kit - a yoga mat and block. The hotel usually has a yoga channel on an in-house TV station with classes you can follow, but it wasn't working so they delivered a DVD and hooked up a DVD player. After check in, the guy called to ask if my goldfish had arrived ... how great is that? When I mentioned that the goldfish seemed too big for the little vase it was in, he had someone bring a proper goldfish bowl right away. Kimpton hotels are pet friendly and you can bring your dog, I saw one coming in as I was walking out. The General Manager was also really helpful when I wanted to extend my stay another day at the same rate, which wasn't showing up online.There is tea/coffee and newspapers in the lobby in the a.m. (even the Sunday New York Times!) and fruit infused chilled water the rest of the day. I didn't make it to a wine happy hour but they don't serve cookies anymore. There's valet parking (I parked on the street.) One tip - if you have a preference between a bathtub and shower, let them know on check in.
review_content_80: I'm addicted to Kimpton Hotels...They are hands-down the BEST with customer service.    This location is particularly opulent.  The building used to be the executive offices of the B&O railroad.  The hotel is filled with old world charm.  Beautiful marble, brass and stained glass.  Kimptons are all dog friendly and my puppy was treated to a goody bag on arrival that had treats and directions to a nearby dog park.  As for us, we used the secret word at check-in and were upgraded to a beautiful suite.  TLove, love, love Kimptons...we'll be back. he rooms are spacious and clean.Found this by accident and truly loved it. Staff was very helpful and the rooms were great. If you are looking for old style class with modern touches. I recommendI called reservations on this hotel and asked for a room on Valentine's Day with an in-room Jetted Tub. I was promised one and requested to book the room... After booking the room  a few days later I received a 20% off coupon in my e-mail. I called back and asked if I could use it.. While speaking with that representative I decided to surf their website photos to catch a glimpse of the awesome tub I would hav in my room. When I didn't see an example of one on the website, I asked the rep if she could confirm that my booked room had one. She stated that the type of room I was booked under did not have that available... Long story short. I ended up speaking with 5 different agents and managers before one of them (almost blatantly) called me a liar and said that would have never happened. She also informed me that the calls were recorded (as if that would have made a difference in my "story") I lost my reservations and had to reschedule my trip to a completely different state. I will now will be staying elsewhere for Valentine's Day. Never again will I book with any Kimpton Hotels location with service like thisOn the positive side... Some of the agents were quite nice and onsite staff were quite nice while telling me that there was nothing that they could do for me about their mistake.I love Hotel Monaco! The entire hotel had this "expensive feel" to it, yet it was only about $119 + tax (a little less than $140 with tax) for a deluxe king bed room AND valet parking. I reserved their Park n' Play package which included valet parking (better than paying $36/night alone on valet parking + tip!). The check-in process was very easy and quick. The room itself was beautiful, the bathroom even more gorgeous (with a marble shower). If you sign up for their loyalty program (it's free), you get complimentary internet every time you stay there (although their internet sucks...) and a free $10 raid towards the minibar (all the items are already in a fridge in your room and you just take whatever you'd like and mark it off - even if you don't mark it off, obviously something will be missing so they'll notice).Every time I needed my car, I just buzzed the valet and was downstairs in 15 minutes and the car would be ready. The valet parking people were extremely kind as well.I'm deducting one star because 1) housekeeping comes at 10am (TOO early for a Sunday morning! Please consider coming at 11am at the earliest) and 2) I left an article of clothing at the hotel and called a few days later when I noticed it was missing. I called the hotel and noticed the phone wasn't ringing anymore and someone was chit chatting in the background for little under a minute. I didn't want to be rude and gave them some time (even though the first thing you should do when you pick up the phone is greet the person, but whatever) until I said "HELLO?!!?!" and I heard the front desk person say to whoever she was talking to "Ugh hold on. Hotel Monaco, blah blah blah how may I help you?" Yes, that is how you should greet a client...With the exception of both being on water, Monaco and Maryland aren't exactly super alike.  The Hotel Monaco Baltimore bridges the gap a bit with elegance and sophistication that even Princess Grace would have admired.When I stayed there though, I was hardly graceful. It was after a night of hanging out with my sister-in-law and our cousins.  She was staying at the hotel because she was in town for business.  I wound up staying there as well because our night involved too many drinky drinks and I didn't want to drive back out to the 'burbs.  LOL!With beer goggles this place was gorgeous! Thank God, when I woke up and the goggles were gone, it was even better! lol! The high ceilings and beautiful furniture made for a classy feel, but the rooms themselves were more modern than traditional - dimmer lights, platform beds, spacious bathrooms. It was really, really nice.For a chick who is sprung off W Hotels, Kimpton's Hotel Monaco was giving them a run for their money.  I live too close to really use the hotel again, but I recommend it often... in fact, it's the only hotel in Baltimore that I recommend without hesitation.  It's centrally located downtown, close to shops, attractions, and great food, and a charming addition to Charm City!Kimpton hotels are becoming my new favorite.  You can join the In Touch rewards program for free and get benefits like free wireless and $10 mini bar voucher every stay.  After so many stays, you can earn free nights, etc.  Definitely worth it!  The Hotel Monaco of course was no exception to the great experiences I have had at Kimpton hotels.  A beautiful historic building (old B&O railraod building) with wonderful white marble everywhere.  The staff here is friendly, helpful, and will go out of their way to assist the guests with their needs.  As with the Kimpton line of hotels, they have a free happy hour (usually between 5-6) in their living room with wine and appetizers, what a lovely plus!  The rooms here are beautiful, tall ceilings and windows (lots of windows!), a granite counter in the bathroom and a beautiful shower with glass door.  The Aveda bath products are a nice benefit, I plan to use the hotel products and don't bring my own like when staying at other hotel lines (saves space in my suitcase!).    Upon checkin, we received a helpful list of local restaurants, bars, etc. where the hotel offers free vouchers, coupons, or rides!  So helpful!The bed and pillows are actually comfortable!!!  There are plenty of spare plugs for your phone and computer charger and each room have an iHome!I definitely recommend staying here, great location (Inner- Bay) that is close to museums, Power Plant Live!, dining, bars, etc.  We got a great deal by booking through Priceline Name Your Own Price, and that just makes me like to hotel more for the great deal we received!I Loved this hotel!Great restaurant, beautiful indoor decor, great rooms, all the Kimpton goodies :-)Minus 1 star because I have been immensely spoiled by other Kimpton's service, and the front staff (bellman, valet) were lacking significantly in this department :-(Nevertheless, I hope to stay here on my next trip to MD!Have been meaning to update my review.  The hotel management contacted me after my bad experience and were very apologetic.  They asked if I give them another chance.  Because of the genuine apology from the hotel,  I decided to give them another chance and my experience was quite nice in every way.  I would definitely go back again.What a great hotel.  A+ service all the way around.  Some of the most professional hotel staff I've seen in a while (from the front desk folks to the valet guys).  The design and decor was beautiful inside and out.  I loved the high ceilings in our room (12-15 ft at least).  It made it feel very spacious and open.Wife and I stayed here as a quick weekend getaway for our 2-year wedding anniversary.  When we arrived to our room, there was champagne on ice and a lovely card from guest services congratulating us on our anniversary.  There was also a cute goldfish the hotel provides for companionship.  Don't worry, they care and feed it themselves. You just enjoy it.We booked the King deluxe room but were given a complimentary upgrade to the Mediterranean room which included a 2-person spa tub...very relaxing and romantic.  We booked a couple of in-room massages, as well.  The animal print bathrobes they have in the rooms were fun and the umbrella in the closet is handy for rainy days.They have complimentary wine in the hotel living room each night from 5-6 and coffee and tea in the mornings.  We didn't take advantage of the wine since we had dinner reservations at the connected B&O restaurant (see my separate review).Great place and would recommend this place in a heart beat to anyone looking for something more than a Best Western or Motel 6.Very dog friendly. Comfortable beds. Nice sized bathrooms. Clean. Very friendly. Got a great price. I've always been impressed with this brand of hotels. I wasn't disappointed this this time either.Cocktails and cookies...for free. Need I say more? Yes, because this place is fabulous. I can't compare to other hotels in Baltimore, because I haven't stayed in any...this was for a splurge for a nearby wedding...but I've stayed in plenty elsewhere and the Hotel Monaco is top notch. -Unique. This place does is not cookie-cutter. The interior is gorgeous. From the lobby and the common areas, you get the feel that you're in jazz-age Baltimore, and you're rich...when actually you can score a fantastic deal on Priceline. -Comfortable. Compared to the historical feel of the rest of the hotel, my room was plush, modern, and big! Fluffy white sheets and towels--check! All the amenities were there and despite the fact that I faced the street, my room was pitch black and dead quiet at night. -Location. You're slightly away from all the tourist traps of the city and Inner Harbor but only a short cab or free circulator ride away from them if you must. -Service. The free cocktail hour and wine tasting and nightly cookies are just the tip of the iceberg. I really got the feel that the people here wanted to go above and beyond for me. When I arrived, I was running extremely late for a wedding and the staff could see that I was harried. They let me skip the whole check-in ordeal and threw me a key. While I ran upstairs to throw on my dress and attempt to do my hair, the woman at the desk WRAPPED MY GIFT. My savior. Seriously. I ran back downstairs after getting dressed and there was a hotel car waiting to take me to my destination stocked with bottled water and mints....and that's how it's done.I booked a room here in order to see Bill Burr last night. Btw he was funny as hell as usual. L0ve that man!The hotel is beautiful and very secure, the rooms are clean, and customer service is top notch. FYI they have a loaner bike that you can use if you want to explore the city on 2 wheels.  Self-park is right around the corner for $20. If I ever need to stay in Baltimore again, this is the place.We stayed at Hotel Monaco for my birthday weekend and it was a great experience.  The rooms are cute, clean and have a great view.  The staff is very helpful and they have a free wine hour included every day between 5-6.  Also, I love the fact that such a nice hotel is pet friendly.  We'd definitely go back or visit another Kipton hotel in another city.  My only complaint is the shower in our room was not designed very well.  There was no door, just a partial wall, so water got everywhere when we showered.  Not a big deal, just a little bit annoying.A stylish hotel with very friendly service. Everyone was so nice and the room was gorgeous. Gf's fave - the leather wallpaper in the bathroom!When booking, the agent asked if this was business or pleasure. It's our 13th anniversary. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite and greeted with a bottle of bubbly. Two huge surprises! Also mentioned that we were bringing our furry friend--the website says they are pet friendly but wanted to make sure. The doggie bed and dish were already in our room when we arrived. Everyone was so sweet to the dog; we arrived too late to enjoy Santa Paws, where the staff took pix of the dogs with Santa (which my dog would have never agreed to, but it would have been cute to watch the other dogs). They even provide a little bag with pet treats.  So - check - extremely pet welcoming.Also appreciated that by signing up for the free Kimpton program, you get $10 of free goodies from the mini bar. Which just feels really luxurious b/c I have NEVER eaten anything out of the mini bar. I had some cheese crackers and bottled water while we were waiting for our dinner, but they have everything from Tom's toothpaste to liquor and nuts.Order carefully with the room service. For dinner, we had the chicory salad, fisherman's stew, the farmer's market pizza and the pork osso bucco. The salad needed something to balance the bitterness of the greens (endive, radicchio, chicory). The stew was very good but a tad salty. The shrimp, fish, clams, etc. were all perfectly cooked in a nice broth with a little rice. Be sure to ask for spoons. The pizza- the crust was pretty bad. I think the toppings would have tasted better if it wasn't overcooked. The osso bucco was a huge portion. Gf would not order it again b/c it was just so-so and the accompanying potatoes were undercooked. Lacked the typical red wine sauce. So dinner was pretty meh. A minor gripe - a bread basket with the entree would have been nice.For breakfast, we had the healthy bennie and assorted breads and fruit with coffee and tea. Had to call to have them send up spoons again. Gf loved the healthy bennie, she said it was the right portion and nicely cooked though it looked really small to me. I wanted to try all of the freshly baked breads. Go for the croissant, it was very good and buttery. The muffin was oat something and just meh; the scone was meh as well. Also tried the doughnuts, which were too heavy and smothered in an overpowering red berry sauce. Our fruit cups were honeydrew, strawberries, blueberries, and pineapple -- pretty good, and we both had a small pot of coffee or tea.For parents, if you are trying to bathe a child in the tub, you may have some trouble. It's like 3 feet deep and the taps empty onto the 2 seats. So in order to bathe a child, you would need to sit in the tub with the kid instead of being able to lean over the side.this hotel is so gorgeous. i wish i can take a chunk of it home!! the checkin desk is slow but they get their things done so no complaints there. its just a shame this place is lacking a swimming pool !! when we stopped here it was mega hot !! prob as hot as florida!!i love marble standing showers. the hotel will tell you that only the mediterannean suites have that. theyre wrong!! if you are looking for a king bed, ask for room 1228 with standing marble shower. if you want a tub only then ask for 1229!valet is super pricey (they literally either leave your car on the block where theres a spot or theypark in the underground garage a block away). my advice is to search online for an overnight deal for garage parking... that way you will save loads of money!! i got a corporate rate on this hotel so it made everything so much sweeter. my corporate rate also got me and my guests free breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel! it was a great breakfast!! i went during a busy weekend for baltimiore. it wasn't deserted/dead til night time came. during the daytime, plenty of people out and about. yes, the area a block backwards is questionable with shops boarded up and whatnot but if you are ina small group, i'd recommend sharing a cab everyhwere. also sign up for kimpton intouch program! they give you $10 to raid the mini bar, whcih at checkout you can tell them what you spent it on so they dont charge your room. i believe u also get free wifi when you become a member so thats also a plus!definitely ask for a companion goldfish! why not???!! this hotel has so much charm!! such a shame that the location is not by the water! the hotel is definitely walking distance to the water.. if you tend to speed walk, i'm sure you can make it to the waterfront by 10mins. otherwise i'd say 20mins is a good estimate of the distance.also don't forgo their snack hours! they have morning coffee/tea available in the living room til 10am. cookie hour is 3pm(i missed that !! darn)... and then at 5pm wine reception. free alcohol and there was 1 hors duerve being served. i think smoked salmon crostini! delish!!! ive also heard there is free wii games at night for the kids but didn't get to check that out.baltimore is a city that you can prob stay 1-2 days and be satisfied with some nice activities. its a very low key place and more relaxed.Lovely romantic weekend here this weekend. We came up from DC to fancy things up for a few days. This is a beautifully appointed place, classy, but not too much. Free fresh baked chocolate chip cookies every afternoon, and a free wine hour each evening. I had called ahead to see if they could do anything special for us for the weekend, and they had a complimentary bottle of champagne sent up for us!If you're looking for a nice place to spend the weekend with lots of access to downtown and the harbor, a great friendly atmosphere, and nice rooms, this is your spot.What's there to not like about Hotel Monaco?  Other than the price I guess.  Its gorgeous and worth every penny, if you have that many pennies to spend.  By far the best hotel in Baltimore.  I won't stay here every trip, but when I'm interested in a splurge Monaco is my first choice.this hotel is drop dead gorgeous!  in the old B&O railroad office building, you can feel like you are walking back in time.  they don't make buildings like this anymore.  the rooms were nice and we really enjoyed the social hour from 5-6 in the lounge, free appetizer and free wines.This is a really nice hotel.  I stayed here this year for the first time when I was catching my red sox who were in Baltimore.  I usually find myself commuting from Annapolis, but this time I wanted to be able to get out and do more while I was there.  This hotel was in walking distance to inner harbor, little Italy, and Fed hill, and most importantly the stadiums.  You could not beat the location, and the price.   We stayed Friday and Saturday night.  When we arrived I got offered their free wine hour.  Talk about classy, who offers free alcohol these days.  The rooms are a great size as well.  The room we were in had nice high ceilings, and was decorated eloquently.  The only complaints I could say was lighting.  While the room was gorgeous, the lighting was not so good.  It made it very hard to see in get dressed at times.  The day we checked out, we were to tired to get out of bed, and decided to order room service before we left on Sunday.  The food was pretty good.  I did not try the place downstairs, but will next time when I come back.  If you are staying in the downtown Baltimore area, I recommend checking this place out.  You can't go wrong and the staff was wonderful.  Its a treat in its own.Had a pretty nice one-night stay here for a reasonable price ($135/night with AAA).  The room was clean and comfortable, with a comfy bed and nice high ceilings.  Overall, it was pretty good.  A few minor complaints - there was a sort of weird, ad-hoc sliding door into the bathroom that didn't lock, and honestly I thought the carpet was pretty ugly.  Can't have everything, I guess.  They do have free WiFi, which is a big plus for me (I hate it when hotels are so cheap as to try to take advantage of you that way).The common spaces are very attractive, with a grand old staircase and a nice lobby with comfortable seating and a nice gas fireplace that doesn't pretend to be a wood one.  Because it's a retrofit building, the front desk and lobby are on the second floor, which is a bit odd but only a minor inconvenience.  Still, it's quite nice.  They've also got a nice happy hour with free wine and snacks from 5-6, which was nice.They charge too much for parking - I think it was $35 per night.  You can get parking much cheaper elsewhere.A nice hotel near Inner Harbor for a pretty good price.  I'd stay again.

review_content: Excellent customer service as we asked for a harbor view and I think they upgraded is to some sort of suite??It was a massive room AND came with free breakfast.I don't know how we lucked into this for $124 a night but they were generous with this upgrade!Great views and medium but excellent workout area.The water view restaurant had a delicious brunch with tons of options and omelette and waffle bar.Will definitely consider staying here again!Staying at the Renaissance Harborplace was an indifferent experience for me, having travelled enough and staying in an array of hotels from bottom of the barrel to absolute luxury, I'd comfortably put this hotel right in the middle. I was in Baltimore for a convention at the Baltimore Convention Center. It's only a couple of blocks to the hotel from the convention centre itself, and directly across the street from the Inner Harbor tourist area. If you were staying in a room on the outside of the hotel, great views of the surrounding neighbourhood (and the accompanying city noise)- however my one huge praise is staying on the courtyard (inner) side of the building, inward facing onto a very quiet sun patio so there's no city noise to bother you! The staff were very friendly, and very accurate- providing my room with a couple of requested extras upon checking in. That's about where my list of good things will end. If you end up with a room on the far side of the hotel, away from the elevators, expect a bit of a walk. Internet is rather pricey for a hotel of this calibre (13 or 14 dollars/per day for access). The rooms are nice, but I noticed that the corners of the room and the air conditioning vents apparently lacked a good cleaning in a while, and were quite dusty. The bathrooms were spacious, though dated- and the paint on the ceiling was splitting and peeling over the shower and sink. Now my one major issue I had over the week I stayed, one day I opted to grab a couple bottles of soda from one of the pepsi machines in the ice/vending rooms at one point later in the evening (probably close to 11:30pm/midnight). Both bottles I received from the machine were expired, one by about 9 months and one by about a year- to add as well, neither of the vending machine's buttons selections matched what you received after you paid. I decided to try the vending machines on the floor below, and had the same problem. Product out of date by nearly a year and one of the bottles was leaking and half empty. I called the front desk at this point and let them know what was going on, they sent up room service with fresh product from their kitchen. However upon checkout I had found they had billed me for the bottles they sent to the room despite having paid for 4 out of their in-house vending machines. I had that corrected upon leaving. There are many options in the Inner Harbour to choose from as far as places to stay. This hotel has decent customer service and "location, location, location" but not too much else going for it.5 stars here. Not the greatest hotel you will stay in but 5 stars because it hits on all the major points and stands out for 2 major reasons.Location and design of lobby area.The hotel is located in the heart of the inner harbor, right across from the aqaurium and connected to a mall.This lobby was so well designed, hit on every note. Modern sleek furniture, with color schemes and design that are subtle yet pop when you look again.Took tons of pics of the lobby area. It's huge, well spread out. Great to have meetings and just gathering if you with a big group.Service was awesome here from valet to bell service to front desk. Everyone was kind, helpful, just seemed overall to be pleasant.Stayed in a king size room. Everything was nice here. I won't say great but nice. Bed was comfy, it wasnt super loud all over the hotel, you can get your sleep in. I woke up at 2 am and there was a huge commotion outside yet the hotel is so quiet you could not even tell.The price was awesome under 300 a night for king size suite was great.That is a steal, I mean I can't remember when I stayed in a suite for less than 600. One thing I guess i did not like about the hotel is the length. Whoever built the hotel or renovated it just kept making it longer and longer. Feels like to get from the elevators to rooms was a block long walk lol. The service here was phenomenal. From checkin, recommendations, room service, and checkout. Just a plesant experience. So if you are looking for a hotel in the best part of Baltimore I highly recommend this place* Wedding Venue Review Only * The traditional Chinese tea ceremony was understaffed (actually, no staff helped us) in a room that was way too small for the occasion. Maybe nobody in this area of the country has ever heard of it, but the lack of staff for the tea ceremony was jarring. Thank goodness we stepped up to the task to help my cousin during this important ceremony.Other things appear to be overpriced - parking is ridiculous, thank God we were smart enough to park elsewhere. WiFi was not free except within the area of the lobby.Food: extremely salty - the soup was just a ball of salt. The steak was overdone, the fish was better, but still, quite salty. The chocolate dessert cake was great!Service: people were relatively responsive during dinner!Decor: beautiful view.We loved 99% of our stay here.The lobby is gorgeous, with a Starbucks and a connection to a shopping mall.There is an elevated walkway to the Inner Harbor and all of it's attractions. The proximity to the Inner Harbor is a huge plus.Our hotel room was spacious, with great AC, huge television, and a roomy bathroom. The shower worked great- good pressure and temp.The concierge louge was a nice perk, with a terrific breakfast, plus snacks and beverages.  It was a great place to relax.The three buffet breakfasts  for our convention were all very good, a mix of cereal, pastries, pancakes, eggs, egg whites, sausage, turkey bacon, grits, and oatmeal. Not everything every day, but a changing mix.Our convention had 2 sit-down meals here, and this is the only area I had an issue with. The pork tenderloin served at lunch was not very good, it was very hard to cut and tough to eat. This wasn't just my reaction, it was a common complaint among our group.Secondly, we were served the identical dessert twice (a very good cheesecake) - but it's a curious observation since we only had two sit down meals here.But overall , this was a terrific stay.Large Baltimore hotel with a great location in the inner harbor. Modern decor with that traditional Marriott feel. Coffee bar in the lobby and is adjacent to a mall. A good place to stay for events in the area. Comparable prices to other Renaissance properties. Clean rooms with Aveda products in the bathroom.This is by far one of the BEST hotels we ever STAYED in!!!! They offered me a FREE upgrade and a COMPLIMENTARY bottle of wine and a SMALL personal chocolate CAKE!!!! The stay were AWESOME!!!! They did ANY and EVERYTHING necessary to make sure my BOYFRIEND enjoyed his stay on his BIRTHDAY!!!! The hotel is directly across from the harbor so everything was conveniently close!!!! The room was GORGEOUS the VIEW was MAGNIFICENT!!!!Overall good hotel! I am not sure a regular rate as I had special rate with a conference.Wifi works well and everyone is friendly here. Room is specious and quite new. I liked Aveda toiletry. Sunday brunch buffet was great as you can get everything (waffles, fruits, oatmeal, eggs and pastries) including made-to-order omelet with crab meat.  Fruits included not only cantaloups but also plenty of blueberries, blackberries and strawberries. You can also get cappuccino and nice harbor view.Executive lounge was also great as they offer great breakfast (including egg white scrambled eggs, boiled eggs), evening snacks (hot food and salad/cheese snacks) and desserts and non-alcoholic drinks. Wine/alcoholic drinks were offered at small price.One downside is expensive parking but it's all the same in Inner harbor area. Park in the gallery garage attached to the hotel as this is the best deal for overnight stay. Only weekend is a little cheaper when there is no Raven's game. No free street parking either.Great hotel! Close to the harbor. The hotel was beautiful and everyone was so nice! We ordered room service for breakfast. It came when they said it would and the food was really good.Best location if you plan to stay in the inner harbor area. The breakfast buffet has a great view of the harbor.Get a room with the harbor view if you could, I got mine through the free upgrade. Also got my free wifi with my gold member status. It's a great deal.A perfect hotel to explore the Baltimore area.After being on a red eye and not sleeping at all, I was greeted with big, warm smiles. My bags were taken out of my hands and I was escorted to the front desk where my the agent sent some wine to my boyfriend and I for his birthday. We had dinner at water table, the restaurant in the hotel, and it was a lovely view with delicious food. The bed was so comfortable and the room was so homey. It's also a 10/15 minute walk to a whole foods that you can get to by taking a short cut through the inner harbor. There's a wine cellar next door, you can't buy liquor in Baltimore unless you go specifically to a liquor store. I would also recommend going to fells point. Such a lovely little city.Came out to Baltimore on business this week and had a pretty great time staying in the whole time the "Snocalypse" was supposed to blow through..I rate hotels on a number of standard items (please see below!):Cleanliness/Service - The hotel was pretty nice and cleanliness was top-notch..especially for a luxury hotel, you would expect it to be nice and clean. Service didn't blow me out of the water though..when I checked in and walking through the hallways, no one was exceptionally nice - they did provide me with a general sense of comfort though.Layout - This is probably my biggest gripe about this hotel. The layout doesn't effing make sense! Its because there is one set of elevators in one corner, and the rooms wrap around a huge (empty) middle square so if you are *lucky* enough to land yourself a room at the far corner from the elevators, such as yours truly, it takes friggin' foreverrrrr to get from one end to the other. This clearly was not thought out... *shakes head*Lounge - The concierge lounge was pretty spacious..definitely props for having full size bottles of water. Marriott chains usually have those small bottles of water that you have to take 2-3 of..so definitely liked that. Breakfast in the morning was exactly the same for the 2 nights I was here, dinner/desserts were different. The food was good..the cake was really good for dessert. lol..of course, i would like the cake though..Fitness Center - Really impressed with the fitness center. It's not HUGE, but it is well equipped enough to accommodate the morning workout crowd! LOTS of treadmills..and it now faces a Shake Shack...which is kind of cruel. *sad face*..Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Renaissance Hotel and it is a really nice, clean hotel. Next to a Starbucks and only 20 min from BWI airport in downtown.As a side note, that the common areas here are COLD in the winter..including the conference rooms..so bundle up if you are just here for a meeting/conference/luncheon.I have stayed here twice.  Once in a normal room and most recently in a very large corner suite, all windows.  Dining table for 6.  VERY LARGE bathroom.  Comfortable beds, as all Marriott's.  Striking view of the harbor and the tall ships.  We were pleasantly surprised by the brunch price on Sunday, $19.99.  The selection was awesome, fresh, even fruit smoothies and a made to order omelet station.  Parking right underneath the building.  Only issue with the all windows room in August was the AC couldn't keep up and the room was a tad warm, but we were leaving for a day and night on the town anyways.Great location, great hotel.  Front desk staff and bellmen are just fantastic!  Anticipating your needs well before you even know you need something.  If you are coming to the harbor area of Baltimore, this is the place to stay.Awesome hotel for a 2 night stay right after New years eve. I think this was the quiet season since the prices were amazing! I reserved a King room for $99/night and ended up with a sweet upgrade to King corner suite with a view of the harbor. The room was huge! There was a dining room table and large seating area with couch and chairs and coffee table.  This was perfect for having a few friends who live in Baltimore area hang out with us in the room.  This is a very kid friendly hotel.  Attendants were welcoming to my 20 month old toddler and the bellhop brought out a wagon of plush animals for her to pick from when we arrived. I requested a pack and play for our room which also included a johnson& johnson baby anenities kit for our daughter. These little touches definitely add a lot to our overall experience of a hotel. I signed up for loyalty membership just before booking and it certainly helped! We even got access to the club lounge which offered a good continental breakfast that included HOT eggs. The attendants were very cheerful and accommodating. There was a very nice selection of food esp considering it was complimentary!  And they even had high chairs. Most exec lounges are adults only so i was really happy we were able to bring our toddler and eat together. The hotel is connected to the galleria mall which made it convenient for shopping and has food court. It's right across the street from tourist attractions and close to the Aquariam and the Port of Discover which was on our itinerary for our trip.They also have a nice size indoor pool and jacuzzi which we took advantage of in the late afternoon after we got tired of walking around.My one negative was the bed was not totally comfortable.  I couldn't figure out why there were so many layers of flat sheets and there was a crinkly noisy plastic somewhere buried under the layers which might have been a waterproof sheet since we were with a toddler. Overall really great service and quality hotel.I stayed at the Renaissance for two nights while attending a business conference. The staff was very pleasant, and the room had all of the standard amenities typical of a hotel in that area in that price range. What I found notable is the fantastic location, the mall that is attached to the hotel, and (surprisingly) the food.The Renaissance is located directly across the street from the harbor (as the name suggests), and a block or two from the baseball stadium. It's also in walking distance of the national aquarium, African American history museum, restaurants, a movie theater, and I'm sure many other attractions; however I can only speak to what I was able to cram in between conference sessions. The mall seems more than adequate, but I was never able to make it past the main floor which has stores that I frequent (if only to window shop). I say that the food was 'surprisingly' good because in my experience - even at expensive hotels - hotel food can often be just "good enough" or unremarkable at best. The roasted skin-on bone-in quarter chicken with vegetables was anything but dry or devoid of taste, as was the filet of fish served with a lemon butter cream sauce on a bed of orzo. Given there are several comparable restaurants within walking distance to include McCormick and Schmick, even if my meal expenses were not covered, I would have no problem indulging in the luxury of convenience and dining in the hotel restaurant or ordering room service rather than hitting the streets for similar American fare.Terrible! STAY AWAY!!! That is my one word sum up. $30 for parking! What an outrage. Even the lot across the street is $10 all day. $13 for Internet access! News flash, most places, including the park down the street from this hotel, have free internet. And now for the details of the room: dirty, outdated, health hazard, dangerous, disgusting. In short think "a pig wearing lipstick". And at a total base room with no extra room service charges, just room and tax and parking, of $306.05 it's a complete rip off. Please take the time to look at all my photos. In particular the one that shows a sharp nail, from what looks like carpet tack strip, sticking out of floor that all four members of my family had stuck in our foot!!!Great, convenient location in the Inner Harbor with nicely furnished rooms and well-appointed common areas. However, the layout of the hotel leaves something to be desired. There's only one bank of elevators, so if you have the misfortune of being placed in a room away from them (as I did), you better be prepared for a haul to get to your room. My main issue with this hotel is that they charge for wifi. At a hotel of this caliber and price point, charging for wifi is ridiculous. Even low-end lodging establishments offer free wifi.We stayed for one night over Easter weekend; there's really nothing remarkable to say about it.  The staff was as courteous as you'd expect at a hotel; the concierge greeted us and the bellhops courteously opened doors.The elevator traffic was a mess; we think this was because all the elevators, including one of the only ones to the parking garage, were all in one little hallway.  This caused traffic jams and sometimes people were so desperate to get in an elevator that they wouldn't let you out.Be sure to take the hotel up on their parking offer - the $30 they will charge you is better than the $52 we ended up paying for parking about 24 hours.We paid about $200 for a Saturday night (all taxes and fees included).  The room was clean, no extras or anything special.  There seemed to be a wifi fee so we didn't use it.  We declined the extra $50 for a 'harbor view' and got the 'city view' with another building in front of us and an alley below.  The walls were paper thin inside the room and out - I could hear people sneeze in their rooms while walking down the hallway.  My husband remarked that the pillows were 'the little crappy ones'.We had enough to do that we didn't spend much time in there anyway.Beautiful place! I attended a couple of events here and both were fantastic. Not sure if the food and drinks was catered by the hotel itself but it was great. Music and dance were a lot of fun.
review_content_20: Not a bad deal at $70 on Priceline. Cha Ching! This is located directly across from the Harbor (hello Phillips!) and has a self park garage that is $12 less expensive than valet. Hotel is one of the nicer places I have stayed while in Baltimore for Baseball or visiting the Aquarium. It is walking distance to Camden Yards and the convention center. They have free fruit infused water for your hangover. There is a Starbucks inside the hotel. The room was very spacious and larger than some of my friends manhattan apartments. The bed was just the right level of firmness. Cons: elevators are confusing. There are two sets and one takes you to the parking garage the others take you to the rooms. They are not clearly marked. -valets wouldn't let me leave my car to check in/use the bathroom. I am not going to state what I did, but a girls gotta do what a girls gotta do. -parking garage is confusing to navigate. Great hotel. Would stay again.I stayed here twice in the last month this a great hotel and close to almost everything you need.I would recommend this place to anybody and great service.I can only summarize my experience in two words: Excellent Service. I left my phone and my watch during my recent stay, I called the hotel immediately after realizing my mistake and was provided with the most understanding and professional help in getting my items back. I travel for work a lot and I have left behind countless of items, from flat irons to valuable pieces of clothing, this is the first time where the hotel employees have taken the time and care to return my items. I am so grateful for their support and service. We received the expected greetings at the door, easy professional check-in, nice clean rooms, helpful staff and service, but their actions in returning my forgotten items was beyond what i have ever experienced. The views from the higher floors are very beautiful too.This was a very "swank" hotel....i guess that's a good term for it. Even though there was a huge conference going on it wasn't as loud as you would expect it to be in the halls.This was next door to their galleria and a plethora of shops and restaurants, (and of course Cheesecake Factory for the to-go order of Crispy Chicken Costoletta.)We had a private bar on the 12th (can't remember the exact floor) and we had a blast.
