The service was top notch, and they even stayed open another hour and a half just for our group.Hats off to this Renaissance. I will definitely be coming back to this location if I'm ever in Baltimore again.The stay was pleasant until I was selectively asked for a room key inorder to enter the building. I say selective cause they were only asking people of color. Mind you I am in town for an engineering confrence were most companies are paying $300+ per night. If you want to room key someone how about the pissy drunk white sailors infront of me. not the engineers of color who just came back from dinner and light drinks.I normally don't write reviews in this format, but there are so many good/bad things about this hotel.We stayed 05/24 - 05/25/15, king size room, 7th floor, harbor/city view.PROS:Location is super close to the inner harbor, downtown, sound stage, and ram's head live.Great view of the harbor from our room.They allowed us to check in 5 hours early, for a $20 "upgrade fee".Parking ramp under hotel, and elevators that go right into hotel. Huge TV. Room was big, bathroom was nice, bed was comfortable.CONS:Sheets didn't fit, I had to keep re-making the bed.NO microwaveNO free wifiI tried to go to sleep around 10:30, but there was loud dance music playing, it rattled the ac vent on the wall. I guess I didn't hear it as much when the TV was on. Around 11:30, I called the front desk, and asked how late the music was going to play (i thought it was a night club). I was informed that it was a wedding in the ballroom on the 5th floor (I was on the 7th), and it would end at 12. At 12:30, frustrated, I called back and spoke with Patrice. She told me that the wedding was paid for until 1:30am, and they could have the music on until then. I asked to be moved to another room away from the music, but she said they were all booked. I fell asleep around 1:40 after the music stopped. I had to wake up at 7am to start my 10 hour drive home, and just as we were leaving a note came under the door apologizing for the inconvenience, and offering us a free breakfast. But like I said, we had to start our journey home. I drove home tired from the night before. Based on that I will not stay here again. A free breakfast was a nice gesture, but I really needed a good nights sleep.My Sweetie's Office Holiday Party was in January, after everyone returned from their lavish holiday vacations and the kids were back in school. It's held at the Baltimore Renaissance Harborplace hotel. We made a getaway weekend of it. Check-in was smooth. The valets and bellmen were very nice and helpful. The reception area and lobby are lovely. Not over the top gorgeous. But understated elegance. Hot or cold beverages are available as well as an apple.The room had a partial harbor view even though he is Marriott Rewards Silver Elite and requested harbor view months in advance. Oh well. It's not like we were just standing there at the window looking out of it all the time. We were busy so being able to see the harbor in the AM or harbor lights in the PM was very nice. Very nice.The bed. O~~~M~~~G!!! Can it be anymore comfy shmumfy? (That is for you Corbo E.) (LOL!) The sheets were like a billion threads per inch and there is some kind of magical comforter atop the whole setup that warms you to perfection then stops so you don't wake up in the hotel hell sweat box thing. I love that bed!We took advantage of many hotel amenities such as the bar, the fitness center (very well equipped, mind you), and room service. All of these amenities are great. Oh, by the way, even though there are plenty of cups and plenty of water in the fitness center, don't drink too much of it: there is no separate fitness center bathroom. U have 2go back2 your room 2p. Do get the room service breakfast though! 1 egg/meat dish plus one bready/sweet dish will be more than enough for two people. We ordered the two egg breakfast: two eggs, three bacon, three sausage with two pieces of toast and hash browns. Amazing. And complimented it with the french toast with fresh berries, butter, and fresh maple syrup. Toss in a pot of fresh hot coffee and get your ported in bottle of prosecco out of the complimentary fridge and pour it in the champagne glasses you had sent up with the brekky and you're good! Other than that, I'm a fan of this hotel! I hope to come back again! [Original visit January 24, 25, 26, 2014.]Renaissance Harborplace Hotel - Inner Harbor, Baltimore, MDmarriott.com/hotels/trav... Marriott owned hotel and conference center centrally located in the Inner Harbor. In my opinion this is the best centrally located hotel for a variety of eating, drinking, entertainment. Constantly filled with business, conference travelers, and of course, tourists. Recently renovated. Indoor pool, gym, laundry facilities on the 7th or 8th floor. The rooms have a great view of the harbor, but they might charge you for it. Lamps with outlets at their base, alarm clocks compatible with iphone 4 or less. You'll need an adapter to charge your iPhone 5. Toiletry brand - Aveda. Shampoo, conditioner, lotion, bar soap, shower cap standard.I enjoy staying here due to the nice furnishings, staff, and convenient location.On site restaurant, the water table also has approachable meals/bar specials with a great view of the harbor. Starbucks in lobby. Taxi stand located on Pratt Street and are also available on South Street side. If you are checking in, come through South street entrance.5th floor escalators go down to the attached Galleria Mall but you cannot come back up them. Enter the hotel using the 3 street level entrances: Mall, Pratt Street, or South Street.Tip - there is a club lounge on top floor for Elite Rewards members. Free appetizers and breakfast. Alcohol available for purchase. Appetizers: 2 hot dishes and a salad with ranch or balsamic dressing. Breakfast: Scrambled eggs, 2 types of bacon. Various carbs: bagel, toast, muffins, pastries. Fruit. Orange juice, milk, coffee, tea. Dessert bar: a few cakes, cookies, brownies locally baked. Don't forget to tip the servers!I love the contemporary feel of the common areas of this hotel but the rooms (at least my room) leaves something's to be desired. Upon literally walking into my room (which smelled faintly of smoke) I was greeted by room service with a 6 pack of craft brews and 6 waters -- that I did not order. After trying to dismiss the mistake, I was assured that it was for me. I thought this was a hospitality effort by the hotel because I am part of a large conference but after my first night I have decided that it's because I am right by a heavy utilized stairwell. I'll have to confer with colleagues to see if this the case. The fitness center is well equipped although it lacks anything so that you can clean up after yourself when you are done using the equipment. If you want to be in the thick of the tourist scene, then this is a great location.We loved our 1 night stay! We visited the pool and Jacuzzi and it was nice, and the room was awesome :-) the bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! Everyone was very nice too.Beautiful hotel in a great part of the inner harbor. Came here for a special event and free happy hour with my wife. We were totally surprise when we walked through the door and seen the layout of different foods from oysters to meatballs and free beer tasting. Including a wide variety of pastries.We left this event impressed and stuffed. The service from the employees we had contact with including the different catering companies was knowledgable about the different foods and drinks they served at this event.One day soon me and my wife will come here for a overnight stay and enjoy the room and outstanding view of the Inner Harber. This hotel obviously has an eye for a beautiful hotel. I think we deserve the best from time to time.Ate at Hotel restaurant for breakfast.My husband and I stayed here for a getaway night, and I mistakenly left my jacket behind in my room. I was pretty upset because it was one of my favorites, and I called to have security check for me. After two failed attempts, I spoke to a wonderful woman named Antornette Owens, Safety & Security Supervisor, who promptly found my jacket and even overnighted it to me! I was so pleased and grateful for her kindness and professionalism that we will definitely be returning. Thank you so much. :)This place is absolutely beautiful! The a staff at check-in was friendly and efficient. The room is absolutely gorgeous! The hotel is marked by refined sophistication. I hope the experience continues this way.NEVER staying at this hotel again! Came to this hotel for a convention because all of the other hotels in the area were either $400+ a night or completely sold out. I made a reservation for a room with 2 queen beds and when I arrived at the hotel I was told there were only rooms left with 1 king bed. They offered us a room with "1 king bed and a pull-out couch". When we got to the room, the "king bed" was smaller than the sofa bed. This was the first hiccup, but we were exhausted after traveling to Baltimore, so we decided to deal with it.Second problem, the hotel tried to charge us the full amount of the room AT CHECK-IN plus $50 a day for "incidentals". This policy and fee ARE NOT LISTED ON THEIR WEBSITE!! They may have done this because of the convention weekend, but I talked to other people staying at the hotel who said they were not charged like this and had no fees. I had called and spoke to the hotel several times before arriving asking them to explain the checkout process. I was told we would pay at checkout and may be charged a fee ONLY if we used a debit card. Maybe they have had bad experiences with con-goers destroying rooms or skipping bills, but we're still hotel GUESTS.Lastly, the hotel doormen and security were extremely rude and disrespectful to anyone staying for the convention. At 11pm they locked the main entrance to the hotel and WOULD NOT let people in without showing their room keys. Many of the events at the convention center run late and this was a huge inconvenience. Also, while inside the hotel lobby guards blocked entrances to the restrooms and demanded to see room keys. EDIT: Need to explain this better- we were told the initial charges were holds on our account and would be taken off at checkout and then we would be able to decide our final payment method. This DID NOT happen. On Sunday morning everyone staying for the convention was given a bill under the door stating that all pending charges had been processed. There were security and staff waiting in the hotel lobby outside each elevator to collect room keys for "express checkout". It was obvious they REALLY wanted us con-goers to leave, haha.TL;DR:Pros: + Location close to harbor and convention center+ Connected to The Gallery mallCons:- Disrespectful staff harassing con-goers- Unexplained fees- Hotel locked up at 11pmThis is NOT a convention friendly hotel! They do not offer any room rates for the convention and in general seemed like they were not happy to have us. This is a Holiday Inn trying to pass off as a 5 star luxury resort that's too good to host all these crazy people in costumes. (At least Holiday Inn gives you free WIFI.)My family of 4 stayed here as a stopover after our overseas trip. The hotel is very close to the airport and has a complimentary shuttle. This is a very attractive hotel and includes a valet, concierge, etc. The rooms are modern and the beds are VERY comfy. There is a also a hot tub and pool with comfy chairs and chaise lounges. I didn't use the fitness room but it had way more than the usual hotel, including free weights. My hotel package included a breakfast buffet. The buffet was delicious and included fresh fruit, pastries, real bacon and omelets/eggs cooked to order. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would absolutely stay here again.Bed was a little soft for me, but that is a personal preference thing. Other than that, the room was large, the service was very friendly, and the location was fantastic. If you park in the garage below, they will validate your ticket and stamp it with something that allows you to go in and out of the garage without having to re-pay or take another ticket - if that makes sense. We liked that!We chose this place partially because it had a pool, but never ended up making it there. Whoops! But that was a positive. We got a pretty good deal here through priceline over Valentine's weekend so are pretty happy. Regular price I would say the place is overpriced but if you can find a deal I think its a great place to stay and would definitely recommend! Minus one star because they charge sky high prices for Wifi and were trying to sell a $4.50 average-size bottle of water on the countertop. Asses!Nice hotel. Perfect location. Just disappointed with concierge who recommended the perfect restaurant but said we didn't need reservations. We waited for an hour. I would stay here again!!!!I had a great experience with this hotel. Then staff was super friendly and helpful. I was here for a conference at the convention center and enjoyed my time. The only thing I would say is that it's kind of a walk to get to the convention center and some of the other hotels like Hilton (attached to the center) and Marriott are closer. This hotel is closer to the harbor and has a mall attached to it which is fun. There's a Starbucks in the lobby and plenty of space to lounge. The room was large and spacious. I liked the bathroom amenities. It also sounds like they have a 24h gym. They also had a pool and jacuzzi which I wish I had checked out.There is plenty of eateries around the area and all walkable. It was also the cheapest hotel in the area out of the hotels the conference recommended!We stayed here for one night and found it to be thoroughly ... okay.Our king-bed room was nice, though its fifth-floor location meant our windows looked directly onto a odd internal courtyard that seemed to be largely a waste of space. If anyone had actually been taking advantage of the lounge chairs out there, they could have knocked on our window and said hi. But, in any event, the room was large, with comfortable furnishings. The common spaces in the hotel are pretty nice as well. They've clearly tried to W-ify the hotel, with cool blue lighting and hip-hop music. Not necessarily my style, and it seems somewhat affected. But it's not a dump.We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, and it was quite good, with a good buffet spread and friendly waffle-and-omelet makers.My beefs are:1. The elevator situation is atrocious. Apparently, one of the four elevators was out of service for "renovation." The remaining three elevators were woefully inadequate to move sufficient numbers of people. We had to let many elevators pass because they were too full. Ultimately, the only way to get down from the fifth floor was to get on an up elevator (which would already be pretty crowded) and ride it up then down again. Indeed, the situation was so bad that it's hard to believe a fourth elevator would have solved the problem.2. Look, internet access is a utility now. You don't make me pay for my water and electricity when I stay in your hotel, so don't make me pay for my internet access. Even places that make you pay for wireless usually give you a free wired option. Not so here. Very bothersome and not consistent with the "cool," modern vibe they're striving for. Were this place $100 cheaper, these things might not bother me as much. But it's not a cheap hotel, and customers shouldn't have to put up with frustrations like this.
review_content_40: Was able to book a room at a great price via Priceline!  The hotel room was nice and the normally exorbitant prices may be for the view.  We had a fabulous view of the harbor.  We did request a crib upon check-in and it was being brought to our room as we were walking towards the nice guest assistant lady.We ordered room service and the NY strip and glass of blush Moscato w asparagus and mashed potatoes hit the spot.  I even snagged some of the delicious fries from our sons' grilled cheese plates.We ordered room service for breakfast and there was nothing out of the ordinary good about it, but it was not totally bad.Just wish there was more information about what amenities were available at the hotel and nearby and had to call for a room service menu since it was not there.Self parking was ridiculously price, but considering it was inner harbor....we get it!  I was stoked to wander into the attached shopping mall directly adjacent to the hotel and hit up Godiva for my free chocolate for the month.  I would have wandered into Coach13.95 for slow internet. 16.95 for "fast" internet. No free breakfast, 10 'cheap' pancakes. IF you went to the business center for internet? 40cents a minute... Welcome back to 1990 and the AOL Highway Robbery express train to empty wallets.For the price of undiscounted rooms, you'd expect something free. Not so here, where the business model is: if you can afford a $230/night room, you can afford 20 dollars a night for internet.  Rooms nicely appointed, yet showing their age. Room doors shut loudly, so that at 4am when guests return it jolts you awake. Staff: 4.5 stars. Totally attentive (to all but preset prices on internet and breakfast and parking) and very polite...Parking: 2.5 stars, convenient but pricey (no surprise)View: 3 starsBilling. Minus 100 stars. The bill that was signed, and the amount billed on the credit card differ by over $150 AND there is a phantom charge of $13. No beuno, and no es frio. Not cool.Remodeled hotel. Rooms can still use improvements doors are cheaply made. Bar on 5th floor is nice and staff is very helpful.Having attended a conference here, I was able to discover the amenities of this conference center. I did not stay at the hotel, but rather spent 3 days in conference rooms and in public spaces. My favorite aspect of the center was the coffee shop on the ground floor and the bar areas. They were a great respite from the conference itself, which had us packed in to the point we could barely move. The World Cup was going on and there was ample seating and televisions screens to watch Germany vs. United States. I had never considered lounge spaces as an important part of conferences, but the Renaissance did a great job of considering the needs of attendees who may need some space.The room was fine, the staff was great. I booked the room for 4 days for a convention. The convention is huge so I reserved the room with my personal card while my company arranged payment. The lady in the Marriott's reservations office assured me that my personal card wouldn't be charged once they received the third party authorization form from my company. Our executive assistant filled out the form and sent it right away. I called the front desk to confirm that they received it. They said they did. I also have the fax receipt. I get there and day 3 of my 4 day stay I noticed that the entire room bill had been charged to my card. My bank account was in shambles. The hotel said they never received the 3rd party authorization form which just pissed me off. I also asked when I checked in, the front desk said it was paid for and that I would be responsible for incidentals as stated on THE THIRD PARTY AUTHORIZATION FORM. They eventually switched the payment to the correct card but now my account is in the negative until this is all sorted out. I have $150 on overdraft fees bc I have bills in auto draft. I couldn't unschedule them in time. Thank God I have funds to live off of but what if I didn't? Pay day isn't until next week. The customer service person filed a grievance today but I won't have a response for 3-5 business days. It's Thursday. I feel like they're not empathetic at all. A friend who travels for business told me that this used to happen to her all of the time. I am most shocked that the hotel office refuses to take responsibility and insists that they didn't receive it, essentially calling me a liar. Why would I lie? I'm so frustrated with the whole situation and the lack of urgency that to resolve this.The Renaissance is an upscale hotel. The rooms I saw were large and tastefully decorated with plenty of polished stone. The location is great-- across the street from Baltimore's Inner Harbor, 2 blocks from the convention center, and less than 1/2 mile from the ballparks. There's a shopping mall on the lower floors. The hotel was pleasantly quiet during my 3 day stay, but the presence of a uniformed police officer plus 1-2 house security staff in the lobby throughout my stay left me wondering how safe the neighborhood really is. The rates here seem to run a little high compared to similar hotels in the area.Very average hotel.  2.5 stars.  This is an old hotel that has undergone a remodel or two.  The rooms are nothing special.  Old carpets and doors, popcorn ceiling, unspectacular view in most of the rooms.  Nice beds though, nice mahogany headboards...can't complain.  Room service menu - unimaginative and overpriced (31 bucks for soup and sandwich?  I think not.)  I stayed there for a work conference.  Conference facilities were nice.  Easy access to shopping center (adjacent to hotel) and a number of inexpensive restaurants. Good convenience store on main level, next to Starbucks.  Very close to the harbor so you can take a nice walk.  Internet was horrible.  You had two options, the $12/day one or the $15/day one.  They were both equally slow and kicked me off multiple times...reminded me of the old AOL days.  The door key situation was not good either.  I think the system in the hotel was a prototype one of the first magnetic ones ever installed.  I had to swipe my card across the magnet over and over and over before I could get into the room.  It didn't help that there was a marathon going on in the morning, on my last day/morning there.  The streets were all closed off and I started to panic because I didn't know how my cab was going to get to the hotel!   Fiasco was caused when a room full of partiers were thrown out by security in the middle of the night, and one of the angry evictees pulled the fire alarm, causing evacuation of most of the hotel.  The elevators are under lockdown whenever fire alarm is pulled so everyone is forced to walk down the stairs.  Extremely unpleasant.  I don't think that made a difference necessarily, in my opinion of the hotel, but it didn't help.  With the fairly high rates they charge, it is surprising that this hotel seems more geared toward partiers/tourists and not professional folks like myself.I have passed through the mall which is connected to the hotel but I've never stayed in this hotel before.I was here for a conference for work and the experience was wonderful.The staff were wonderful and always got me my starbucks in the morning (that is a plus)The comp. breakfast sandwiches were good as well.The crabcake horderves were bomb!The rooms were clean and had everything I needed to have a comfortable stay.I had a little episode where I needed a band-aid and they sent like 2 people to come down and check to see if I was ok.I was a little embarrassed but oh well!Great place to hold a conference.We had such a great experience at the Renaissance that it'll probably be our go-to hotel when we're in Baltimore from now on.Every member of the staff that we met was super nice, helpful, and simply fun to chat with. The rooms were large, clean, and modern, AND in a city with so many one way streets, it's nice that there's a two-way street outside of the front of the hotel. That may seem like a strange positive, but having stayed at numerous hotels in the city, it really saves you the hassle of driving in an extra circle to enter or leave the hotel.The parking costs are reasonable for in/out privileges, and the hotel is attached to the Gallery and also has a solid restaurant & bar, so you can shop a decent selection of stores and grab some pretty good food if the weather isn't great outside.All that on top of the fact that you're across the street from the Inner Harbor, so it's a great central location if you're in town to explore!For Valentines weekend, I decided I wanted to get away from my home without being too far away. As a Baltimore native, I never thought to stay at a hotel here. I choose the Renaissance because it is a Marriott property and I wanted some bonus points (lol). This hotel is lovely. Very clean, I like the layout and decor. Our view from the 10th floor was decent. The beds were comfy and room size is great. I love the Aveda products in the bathroom. This hotel has a convenience shop located near the lobby and the Galley is just a few feet away. Breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was great also. For $18, we ate buffet style with waffles and omelets.  We order room service late on Saturday and it arrived pretty fast and hot. The gym is also nice. Check in and check out was painless and parking is convenient. My only complaint was the noise level outside but that something that cannot be control by the hotelI would stay here again.This rating is really based on what I expect out of Renaissance more than anything else. The suite size was quite large and the rooms were nice and comfortable. The location was also really great in the inner harbour area. I was expecting more on the service front based on how much they were charging. For example, I asked for mouth wash and tooth brush that was never delivered even though someone checked in on me after 30 minutes to see if it was delivered. They were charging $54 for valet parking even though parking in Baltimore really isn't very expensive. So I felt ripped off by that.Such a nice hotel, and such exceptional service to boot.  I will say that this hotel is ginormous and it can be quite easy to get lost, or take the long way to your room, but for the most part, everything about our experience here was top notch.Clean rooms that were very large, friendly and attentive staff,  updated and modern interior and a convenient location make this one of our top choices for a hotel in the Inner Harbor area.  I would highly recommend staying here and visiting the restaurant and bar here too.Of course it's a nice hotel, since I live close I've never had a reason to stay in the hotel but I've been here for happy hour and it's a perfect go to bar if you need to work to meet with somebody. There's big windows to see the harbor so you can see everything going on, theres also TV's for people to watch a game. They have a wide variety of seating with seats at the bar, tall bar tables behind the bar, comfy couches/chairs, and another big table. I'm sure people over look it because it's a hotel but If you're in the area around happy hour or want to catch a game on TV I'd suggest to stop by this place.Stayed here a night, got a great deal on the room, and had a  great experience--beds were comfortable, room was quiet, clean and spacious, and staff were extremely polite and friendly. We arrived early for check-in by a few hours (arrived at 11:00 AM) but our room was ready and everyone was extremely pleasant.  In the afternoon, they had surprisingly good rum punch and iced tea at the front desk for free.  The gym has nice, updated equipment, and there is a pool.  The hotel is in walking distance to the stadiums and harbor, and directly connected to a mall that has a bunch of standard mall stores in case you forgot something.I didn't stay here, just walked through the lobby.  As you would expect from all Renaissance hotels, it is a nice place.  Location is perfect if you are visiting Baltimore.  Right across the street from the Inner Harbor, restaurants nearby, attached to the Gallery, a nice shopping mall.  Not walking distance to the sports stadiums that the Baltimore Orioles and Ravens play, but pretty close.  Also close to the convention center.  Down the street, but again driving distances are Little Italy and Fells Point.  If you are visiting here, this seems to be the place to stay, if you can afford it.In town for a conference and requested a room away from the elevator. Snagged a corner room so far from the elevator, it takes me about 4 minutes to walk to the elevator (first day, was lost trying to locate the elevator!).Other than that, my room was large, quiet and clean. The rooms do not provide robes so call the front desk to request for one.The indoor heated pool (depth up to 7 feet) and the jacuzzi are open until 10pm and has a lifeguard on duty.  During our working lunches, the crab cake and the rum chocolate balls were my favorite.In consideration of the cooler season, complimentary hot cocoa is served in the lobby. Danielle at the front desk was extremely helpful troubleshooting technical issues with the printer, which was the perfect opportunity to enjoy a cup of hot cocoa.I haven't arrived for my stay yet, but I wanted to have my hair done when I arrive in a few weeks and it states there is a Beauty Salon on their website.  I called and the woman said they don't have one.  I recommended she tell the person that manages their website, to delete it. I explained where it was located, then I asked for her name.  She stated, " Oh, we don't give out our names due to security reasons".  I've never been to a hotel and spoken to an employee at a hotel that does not give out their first name.  I suspect she didn't want to be responsible for following up to delete misinformation on their website. I hope my stay won't be as disappointing as my initial experience with this hotel.  I usually enjoy my stays at the Renaissance's.Really comfortable beds!  I've stayed in hotels all over and this was one of my favorites because I fell asleep like a baby.  Food was great - short ribs were my favorite thing on the whole menu.  Tender and very flavorful. Service is great - people are very friendly and willing to help.The Gallery is connected to the hotel for easy shopping.Parking is a little steep - $28 for hotel guests and $40 for non.Overall really good experience and would be interested in staying there again!This is a somewhat atypical review in that while I never got the oppty to stay here, I had reservations that I had made a long time ago and had a miscommunication (def more my fault though) and forgot to cancel before i was supposed to arrive.  this hotel was very understanding and gracious and credited me back my one day room charge.  this decision was made specifically by the renaissance baltimore, and was much appreciated and as an avid traveler something that they, clearly, did NOT have to do.  thank you renaissance baltimore.  i will def. be rebooking there next time my travels take me to baltimore.We had to be in Baltimore early Sat AM so we stayed one night in a local hotel.  Knowing you have to be near the Inner Harbor to avoid scary areas in Baltimore, we chose only from those very close to downtown.  Of them, I was looking for value.  It was one night.  There were a lot of selections in the $125-150 for a standard room.  So I chose this place because they had queen beds instead of double.  (Pay attention competitors - QUEEN INSTEAD OF DOUBLE, it makes a difference.)It was easy to find, and easy to park.  The lobby is beautiful... quite fancy in fact.  It's attached to a mall that is attached to a catwalk over Pratt so it's super easy to get to the waterfront.  Great location, esp convenient to the Aquarium where we were headed the next morning.  We did not check out the pool or restaurants or other ammenities.  I did not realize that parking was an extra $28 a day (valet is $40, and a "day" is 30 hours exactly).  YUK.  I guess a lot of people come straight from the airport in a taxi or something.  In hindsight I wonder if the other hotels for the same price included parking.  Maybe this one (at $149) wasn't the value it appeared to be.  I don't honestly know, but I will be sure to check next time.The room was very comfortable, especially compared to the hotel we were in last weekend (not comparable, not a touristy area, etc.).  I think it was the SPACE.  For a standard room it was roomy.It did not have a fridge or microwave or even a coffee maker.  I found that suprising for this level of hotel.  We did order room service breakfast.  The pancakes looked beautiful but were not fluffy tasting, kind of rubbery... my guess is they were reheated.  The fruit plate was YUM.. not the oranges (which I had to spit out ) but the other stuff.  The muffins were fine, but not inline with the expectations I had (they looked like the cheap Raga muffin mix I sometimes make at home, but not quite as tasty).  My son said the fruit loops were just fine (wink).  It was EXPENSIVE, and when the gal who brought it up asked me to sign and I commented... "oh gosh, I can't do math this early... how much should the tip be?" was when she said "Gratuity is included".  Hmm.. she was gonna let me tip on top of the tip.  Not sure how I feel about that.Check in and out was easy... I guess... we just left our keys in the room.  Do people still "check out" these days?Bottom line:  I'd stay again, but would double check the pricing, and I'd bring instant coffee and skip the room service breakfast.
review_content_60: I got a BEAUTIFUL harborview room on the 12th floor using my Marriott rewards points. I'm a Platinum Elite member so the entire experience was quite cushiony! I got the room for a two night getaway for my boyfriend and I and the hotel was right in the middle of everything that we planned on doing that weekend. Parking was probably the biggest expense that entire weekend. It was $28 for overnight parking and the lot wasn't solely for hotel guests. However, it's steps from the harbor, the aquarium, and a slew of good seafood restaurants (which I really miss since temporarily moving to the mid-west). It's also really close to the Powerplant district which is home to some good bars and lounges to hop around if you're looking for something to do after hours. The hotel treated us to a free movie that could be ordered on the room tv so we didn't mind staying in the first night after dinner and wine. We ordered breakfast the next morning and although we forgot to place our order the night before (as the hotel requests) they still took our order and promised to deliver in less than 30 mins, which they did. The breakfast was absolutely lovely and delicious! The attendant who brought up our food offered to pour our hot chocolate (we aren't coffee drinkers) and uncovered our plates so we were set to dine as soon as he left. The view from the room was absolutely stunning and the staff was wonderful! Love this hotel and would recommend it to anyone!This is a great hotel, in a fun location on the harbor. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The restaurant was pleasant and food was fine. Prices were fair. I would choose this hotel again if I could do it over again.Beautiful hotel in a great part of the inner harbor. I was very impressed with the service from the employees we had contact with. The front desk was knowledgable about the area and the  bell hop fellows were are nice as could be.We found our room to be impressive with an outstanding view. This hotel obviously has an eye for standards and I would come here over all other options in the area. They leave noting wanting. BTW our room and a fun retro feel to it. I thought that was  cool. It had red carpet! I think I deserve that from time to time.  :)I only stayed for a night so this didn't matter too much but we were on the 7th floor with a room overlooking the rooftop courtyard area - meh, so much for "beautiful" Baltimore. Would have been way better if I could have actually seen the city since it was my first time to this city but whatever. The biggest issue I had is despite the be courteous and keep quiet sign, I kept waking up at all hours of the night to screaming guests. It started with a girl who kept yelling down the hallway repeatedly "mom, I have your phone!" And then a huge group came up around 2am and started cheering like it was NYE. -_- worst night of sleep. Sometime around 8am, someone headed to the lobby walked the halls singing the 12 days of Christmas extremely loud, it was ridiculous. That being said, the hotel was nice, large lobby with lots of plug to charge electronics while waiting for your travel companion. Good coffee bar. Across from all the touristy stuff and a short walk to the aquarium. My bf forgot to pack pants so he went on a quick sweep of the connected mall (unfortunately all the stores open later in the day - weird). The valet is super nice and helpful too!I stayed at the Renaissance for a conference.  The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in (I usually have trouble sleeping when I travel).  The staff could not have been friendlier.  Everyone I encountered greeted me with a smile and kind word or two.  The Water Table restaurant food was delicious both for lunch and for late dinner at the bar.  (I recommend the fish and chips).Still a great location, wonderful view and great service. However the elevators which seem too few to begin with were not in good working order and that presented a problem every day. At one point in our stay only one out of six elevators was operational. Frankly, that is dangerous. Also the bed was quite uncomfortable. The mattress was very hard with no pillow top and the entire bed was slanted. I had a hard time falling asleep because I thought I was going to fall out of the bed! Also it took over six hours to get a roll away bed delivered. I traveled with my family but have been thinking about going for a girls' weekend. However the gang of thugs lined up in front of the walkway leading from the Gallery to the hotel entrance was problematic. I would not want to have to walk to this hotel without my husband. I would think the city and the hotel would make sure there were not people lined up shouting at visitors and hotel guests and it is pretty dark over there.I don't know if they had an off weekend or if things are going down-hill. I think they definitely need to replace some of the beds.Great hotel experience! Hotel may be a classic to Baltimore but the interior of the lobby and rooms appeared very stylish in a current way. The view from our room was amazing at night but also neat in the morning, too (the marine layer gave a "in the clouds" feel on the 10th floor!!). We were upgraded to an amazing suite w a studio style dining room, and living area in addition to the "bedroom zone" we had expected. Super closes the some fabulous restaurants and night clubs. We are already planning another overnight!!Pssst.  Don't tell anyone, but when I want to work while drinking on the job, I come to the lobby here.  It's perfect.  Set up your laptop at a big, comfy chair/table combo, order a wine at the bar, and commence to getting your work on.  If there's a game on the TVs, it can get a little noisy, but not anything you can't work through.  Hungry? There are plenty of options both within the hotel and without since the Harbor is right across the street and the mall is next door.  It's a great spot to stop into for meetings away from the office or just after work drinks as well. The wine selection is A-OK and there are enough plugs and outlets that you don't have to go on a scavenger hunt if you need to power up. All in all, a great place for my purposes!I am from Baltimore, originally, so I am picky about the locations in where I stay when I return for visits. This location cannot be beat for downtown. You overlook the harbor and are a hop, skip, and a jump from all surrounding neighborhoods and attractions. The hotels itself has easy parking and not too expensive for that area. The lobby is clean and inviting. The staff is incredibly nice. Our room was an interior two-queen that was very clean. My only cripes: 1.) You can hear EVERYTHING. I could hear toilets flushing at all times of the day from inside of my room. Even when away from the elevator area, the halls were pretty noisy. 2.) We ordered hot tea to be delivered to the room in the morning. All the teas and accoutrements were fine. But the hot water was given in a carafe that you could tell was used for coffee previously. I don't like to taste coffee in my tea! 3.) The soda/bottled water machine. It costs $2.25. And they sell Pepsi products. 4.) The bathroom could have used a little more upkeep. The showerhead wasn't functioning fully properly. The shower curtains needed to be replaced. All in all, a decent stay in a clean environment in the perfect location. If you want a simple breakfast, try Lenny's across the street. Or for a blowout breakfast, try Miss Shirley's.I've stayed here a few times with a great deal on Priceline. Loved it when I lucked out with a harbor view. BUT if you can't get that, not worth it- a hike to the elevator, noisy courtyard, staring into other guests rooms. Check out fells point. I've stayed there a dozen times, at the Mariott- always a water viewRooms were nice, very quiet. Staff was friendly and very accommodating. Great location.Great location.   Nice clean, luxury rooms and my kids loved the pool!Only giving 4 stars because I was able to name my own price on Priceline for eightynine bucks and ended up with a room here. Although it was only a courtyard view (of the center of the building) and not a city or harbor view room, it was nice. The bed was VERY comfortable, ie - fluffy. Not sure what you'd do if you prefer a firm mattress.The best thing about this hotel is the location. Conveniently located across the street from center of Inner Harbor, made it especially easy with the baby. There is a business center on the 5th floor, and also an airplane check-in kiosk where you can print boarding passes.The water in the room was $4. Luckily there's a 7-Eleven just a couple of blocks away where you can get some drinks and snacks even at odd hours of the night.The elevators in this building aren't designed too well. Of the 6 elevators, only 2 of them are dedicated for parking. The other 4 elevators are for everything else. This means you'll be waiting a very long time to get to your car.Parking is public, and not dedicated to the hotel. Self-parking was $26 for one night but lasted 30 hours from the time of check in. That allowed us to check out but still leave the car in parking lot while we explored the city.For the price we paid, it was a steal. Great deal = great experience.We stayed here for a five-day visit to Baltimore; and, it is, by far, one of our all-time favorite hotels. Foremost, the parking area is well-lit and clean. This area suffers from a large indigent population which can deter many families from visiting. Nonetheless, know that this Renaissance is devoted to customer care, safety, and comfort. We saw no loiters and no suspicious behavior in this garage.Check-in was surprisingly quick and extremely courteous. All front-desk employees were well-groomed, friendly, and helpful.The rooms were positively immaculate and aesthetically pleasing. They are modern and generously sized. And, the beds are a dream! The linens were soft and super clean. The consensus was that after a long day of shopping and touring the area, the room was a welcoming space in which to "unwind." We have not a single note of criticism for this hotel! Keep up the fantastic work!I only paid $50 for one night stay with my brother and parentssince I was a Marriott associate kkk Anyways awesome hotel,near a indoor shopping mall which is good if you want morechoices and inexpensive areas for food. Overall nice spaciousrooms and decent service!all the chargest that the manager said would be removed were still on my credit card. PLUS, there were more random charges added. When I contacted the hotel, they wouldn't believe the final receipt I was issued. It took some time and effort to contest and remove the charges. The hotel wouldn't do anything, but the credit card did. So beware and check your credit card statement.really nice roomgreat front desk serviceawesome view of the harborwalking distance to everything in downtowna bit pricey....but it was a vacation so meh! what the heck lolVery nice hotel with excellent location at inner harbor. Parking steep but convenient; just do the self park with in and out privileges from the beginning. I tried a cheaper option the first night of our stay but regretted having to walk several blocks back to the hotel at night in a somewhat sketchy neighborhood. Starbucks in the lobby is the worst service and product ever but I heard there is another stb in the mall attached to the hotel. Just enjoy a walk in the am to fells point for good coffee and breakfast. But can't say enough about the excellent customer service by Terence, who greeted you at the front door and managed to miraculously fix any problem with his quick, spot on attention. Would definitely stay here again. He made it all work out.stayed here for work. great location. your standard modern decor, nothing surprising. comfy bed. super friendly staff. decent gym. cheapest Starbucks coffee I've ever had ($4 soy latte???).  elevators take forever in the morning. I hate paying for WiFi.Great Hotel! Staff was very nice. But there are things you should know, the pool has a life guard and goes to 7 feet, if you want WiFi you have to pay for it ( Which i thing is stupid due to the price of each night and all the other stuff), and there is a mall attached to the hotel. But its a wonderful hotel.
review_content_80: What an awesome place! It is super convenient to shopping, restaurants, and the Aquarium. We had a room with a partial harbor view and it was great! I did find the location to be loud--both with road noise as well as the noise from people in adjoining rooms. This isn't the hotel's fault, of course. We thought the staff from the bellman, the valet, front desk staff, and pool life guard to be super helpful and professional. It was well worth the price to stay at this hotel. It truly made my daughter's birthday weekend!What a disappointment this entire stay was.  For a $200+ a night hotel I would have expected better service.  First, I am put in the SMALLEST room that also happens to be farthest from the elevator.  With a hotel the size of a city block, it isn't very fun to have to drag a suitcase for that entire block just to get to your room.  Then, the room is VERY tiny.  It was stuck off in the far corner and smaller than any of the other rooms at the hotel, which was confirmed by the "you are here map" on the back of the door.  Not only was the room tiny, the bathroom was even worse.  VERY dated fixtures and a tile was ready to fall of the shower surround.  Clearly updating the crappiest room in the hotel is not a priority.Two days in a row I called for laundry service.  Both days no one showed up to pick up the laundry bag. I called during the allotted time for laundry pickup, but obviously even their staff doesn't want to hike down to this corner crappy room.  Twice I asked for shower gel and twice I received none.  Twice I asked for an extra coffee cup for the morning and twice I received none.  All three nights I was kept up by the constant sirens outside my window.  Because hey, if you've got the crappiest room we might as well stick it in the farthest and loudest corner of the hotel!  And leave the extra bed from the room next to yours outside your door partially blocking it so you have to move it to get out.The ONLY positive thing I have to say about the hotel is that the room service staff is at least willing to walk a block to get to this otherwise forgotten room.  Of course by the time the food arrives it is basically luke warm from the ridiculously long trip to even get here, but the gentleman who delivered my food was polite and courteous.  I have no complaints about the service he delivered.  He was the only good thing about this stay.I paid the same amount as everyone else did who stayed here, but in no way received the same experience.  I will NEVER stay here again, and if you have the misfortune of staying here and getting room 11072 RUN, don't walk to the nearest exit.  You'll have a miserable stay.Great location and nice facilities!I visited here very briefly and did not stay overnight - but I sure will consider it.Right across from the Inner Harbor.The "Ground Floor" bar & cafe is very nice, too.Renaissance Baltimore Harborplace - where everybody knows your name.This place makes me feel like I'm living in the epicenter of Southern hospitality, and it's not even really the South!  In fact, it's in the homicide capital of the US, or so my brother informed me.  If that's true, you should definitely check into the Renaissance and stay there, if you ever need to be in Baltimore.Every employee smiles with weight of sincerity, goes beyond doing everything he/she can to help you, and ends his/her extraordinary efforts with the most heartfelt "Have a wonderful day" you've ever heard.Well-stocked coffee stand, brightly-lit fitness room, easily accessible ballrooms, delicious whole-wheat flatbreads offered for room service: these are some of the things you'll enjoy at Renaissance.  I'd say that really beats having to stay out of danger in the questionable downtown Baltimore area.Overall a great experience. Check-in was a breeze, and the rooms are clean and spacious. Especially enjoyed the super comfy bed and high quality bath products. Also, the hotel offers a great exercise room and convenient meeting spaces. Only thing I did not love was the exorbitant fee charged for Internet access.   May be just because I'm from a different area, but I'm accustomed to hotels with free wifi!Will stay at this hotel every time i visit area... Location is perfect, hotel staff are extremely courteous and professional. The valet guys are great... As busy as the hotel is they always had my car ready inside 5 minutes and they also shared inside info about the city.  The rooms were very nice, comfortable bed, great linens, pillows, room was hospital clean. View from 9th floor room with harbor view was great. The 5th floor restaurant was good for breakfast, quick service and good selection.Next to aquarium puts this hotel at 4 stars.   Breakfast included in cost was worth it.   If you want to be in the middle of the inner harbor this is the place to be.  Bathrooms need upgrade but are clean as is the room.  One thing I noticed is the door to the rooms have a 1 inch air gap  and sound comes in easily and you can see the reflection of people walking by.  Pool is a plus for the kids.  Plenty to eat around the hotel so no need to eat there.I'm a Marriott Elite rewards member so I'm always loyal to Marriott and their brands. There're several Marriotts within a 6 block radius to choose from.  So I'm in Room 11113 during the weekend of June 3-5 and there are problems at this hotel.  #1 Internet wasn't working so I had to waste 10 minutes of my time to give them the MAC address to my computer to allow usage.  I guess their DHCP server was down.#2 All local TV stations were not working in this room.  I don't know if it's the entire hotel or not but I like to catch up on local news wherever I go.#3 the water pressure was inconsistent!!  I had soap in my eyes when the water went out for 25 seconds!!!What's good about this hotel:#1 Service was very good and attentive something you'll find in a 5 star hotel.#2 Location is the best of all hotels as you are in the middle of the inner harbor.  6 blocks to Camden oriole park and 8 blocks to Lexington Market and less than a mile to the eastern harbor. But this hotel is actually connected to the Gallery Mall!!!  That allowed me to wake up and get the latest Retro Jordan at Footlocker!!! #3 The Watertable restaurant was very good (Located on the 5th Floor)#4The fitness room was excellent and had all of the machines that I needed!!!So why the 1 star????  All of my complaints should always be addressed ahead of time!!  Whether you're a budget or luxury hotel these are the basic needs of a hotel guest!!  Continuous water, Internet and Local Channels!!!!The husband & I had a great 2 night stay. The room was outrageously spacious & the staff was welcoming and helpful. The location is fantastic; close to shopping, restaurants, the harbor (obviously), and to the Charm City Circular, a free bus route that hits several of the major sites.The free lemonade in the lobby didn't hurt, either.My husband was able to get a free hotel room through work so, Baltimore date night here we come!  Our room was beautiful and clean.  The AC works great.  The bed is comfy.  The bathroom is large and clean.  Nothing smells funky as with many hotel rooms.  The decor is also modern and fun.  Why not five stars?  The hotel bar is really expensive.  Captain and diet was a shot of captain with a splash of diet for $9.  Ouch.  The valet was also really slow to get our car this morning.  We called before we left our room and it still took 20 min.  Bonus: There's some animation thing going on at the convention center so holy dork alert batman!  The people watching was entertaining (yes, its mean, but....) so lots of people in capes, white suits with their shirts unbuttoned, and other crazy looks.  We had a good laugh because they all seemed to be staying at our hotel.  Oh, how I love the tourists!I will have to say this Hotel is the most unprofessional. I had the worst experience with this hotel this last weekend, I was told upon arriving that because I was given the family discount( my family works for marriott headquarters) that my room was given away and that they put me in the Marriott down the street. Upon arriving the comp. room they gave me, I noticed that they changed my reservation. I had booked 2 rooms and was only given 1,( 2 families were present). I was told that, Baltimore was booked and that it was nothing they could do. And I was comp. a room, so basically why am I complaining. The room wasn't even really a room, it was a pull out sofa bed and two rollerway beds. I have never been treated so disrespectfully. I called back Renaissance and spoke with a manager that was present on 4/26/14 that evening. Mike (the manager) was insincere and told me that because of my discount, he couldn't help me. I had a previous great experience with this hotel after my wedding ( without a discount) and was treated great, but after this treatment I will never return ever again nor recommend to my family that come to visit Baltimore. To make a long story short a Hilton worker saw me crying outside after getting off the phone with "Mike" and told me that had a beautiful suite available and we decided to stay there and had a great time. There customer service was very acceptable, and they even gave us a voucher for a free breakfast for me and my husband. I have always stayed at marriott's all my life, even before discounts but after this experience I doubt I will be staying at any marriott's for a while.Nice business hotel. Good functions area. On the water. Lots of bars and restaraunts. 15 shuttle or 35 dollar taxi from airport.On 8th floor you can find yourself walking a full city block and a half to the one elevator...... StrangeHorrible customer service with no disregard to our concerns!!! The hotel engineering department thought it would be a good idea to drill before 7am in the room above us.  After calling twice and going downstairs to the management they  had nothing to say other than it's not our issue and basically gave us no other options or resolve.  So be forewarned...if it's under construction stay somewhere else.I had a short stay at this hotel only 1 night, but from what I saw I loved it. Great location. My only complaint 's... the difficulty finding the hotel entrance from the mall. And the valet pulls up offering me keys to my rental, I get inside and realize he pulled the wrong car!I No apology, I read some reviews about the parking garage, I can see why. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, just maybe not valet my car. Yes this was another stay via Priceline. I saved over 60% on the retail price.Great hotel!! Smack dab in the middle of it all, its within walking distance of all of the harbor action, attractions, and restaurants. Our room had a view of the mall downstairs :/ but still very comfortable. The bathroom was nice (just missing a flat screen) with the separate deep tub and shower stall, spacious of course. The heated pool was a VERY nice size. Kids were there playing and not once did that interrupt our small adult party. The jacuzzi was chlorine laced, had to get back into the pool a few times bt I'd rather smell chlorine than bo. Easy access to the mall downstairs, Starbucks, harbor shopping across the street, basically whatever you want. I never did catch the bar or bistro-looking area. The local teens did tend to hang out in the area outside of course, bt after a certain time, no key, NO ACCESS. Great place to stay and the location couldn't be better! Did a LOT of easy, carefree walking :)I came here to celebrate my four-year marriage.  It was nice.  The location is tops--it can't be beat.  I remember this hotel being around for a long time, yet the inside did not feel dated or worn.  It must have been recently remodeled.If you book on Priceline, as I did, be prepared for the clerk to announce loudly to no one in particular, "I see you booked this on, uh, PRICELINE."  And you can say proudly, "Yes, yes, I did, and I saved a buttload of money."I wish I would have had time to check out the pool and fitness center but my stay went by too fast.If possible, I'd give this hotel 3 1/2 stars. It's definitely a more than decent hotel, I'm not sure it's worthy of 4 star status.I got a deal for this place on Priceline that was 60% off the regular price, so I can't complain about that. I found the hotel staff to be very pleasant and the person who checked me in at the front desk was very nice.The room was large and the bed was very comfortable. However, I was very disappointed by the pool. I was looking forward to taking a swim, but when I entered the pool area I was overwhelmed by the noxious stench of chlorine. It was so bad that I started coughing and there was no way that I could stay in there without getting sick.Also, when we were leaving the the hotel on the morning of checkout, it literally took about 10 minutes just to be able to get on an elevator. There was a sign in the elevator bank in the lobby that said the hotel was doing some repairs on the elevator system, so I think they're were only two working elevators.For $28, the parking was actually a pretty good deal. We pulled into the parking lot at noon on a Saturday and didn't leave until 4:00 p.m. the next day, so we actually had some time in the lot before officially checking in and after checking out.The hotel is in a very convenient location right in the Inner Harbor and about a 10 minute walk from Camden Yards.There were some issues with the pool and elevators, but I think I'd stay here again if I could get a similar deal on Priceline.Wow. We got a lot more than we expected staying at the Renaissance Harborplace. We had reserved a city view king room. What we got was an upgrade to a harbor view executive king suite. Can you imagine my excitement? Our room was a corner suite, taking in views towards Camden Yards and all of the Inner Harbor. The room was huge and beautifully decorated with a lot of special little touches. The bed linens were soft and cozy.  Plus, everything seemed brand new, like no one had ever stayed in it! I can't believe how lucky we were. Valet parking may seem a little steep at 36 bucks. However, it's really worth it, to be able to dump your car off, walk everywhere you need to go and not have to worry about it. The hotel is conveniently located near Camden Yards, The Baltimore Aquarium, The Hard Rock, etc. Plus, the Boston Red Sox's just happened to be staying at the hotel, so we had a couple player sightings. Not too exciting for me, but my boyfriend loves baseball. We would definitely stay here again!  Love the location, very nice hotel.Enjoyed my two day stay here.  Rooms were comfortable. The hotel is in an excellent location next to the Baltimore harbor front.   Some hotel staff were pleasant while others were crabby (especially the late night staff)I was really excited to stay at this hotel, but it ended up disappointing me and my boyfriend on several levels. First, parking was $38 per night which would have been fine had we known beforehand. Luckily there was parking available on the street (metered). Second, the shower was dirty. There were someone else's hairs all over the bottom of the shower along with the soap holder. It was disgusting. Next, the hotel was unable to accommodate our request for a king size bed. Now, I realize it is a 'request' (which the lady at check in rudely explained), but we were staying there for Valentine's Day and instead of having a romantic room, we had a room cramped with 2 queen size beds. Lastly, starting at around 7am there was a very loud buzzing noise coming from the wall. At first I thought it was an alarm clock, but we concluded it must have been a pipe acting up in the wall. It made noise for 5 minutes at a time nearly every 20 minutes until we checked out. Some positives are the location (right on the harbor, walking distance to everything), the hotel bar (open late and tasty drinks), and the price we received off priceline ($75 per night I think).Although there are some positives, the negatives definitely don't even it out. I definitely would not recommend this hotel.

review_content: Well earned 5 star review for an excellent all-around stay.Room: Comfy Bed, large TV, beautiful views downtown, large walk-in shower with granite tile.Other perks: super nice gym loaded with equipment, towels, water and fruit; fast elevators that overlook the harbor; pedestrian bridge over the street to aquarium and harbor; a bar that looked pretty decent.Service was outstanding from start to finish. Staff greeted me warmly upon arrival and helped me with my bags. I needed to dry my hoodie after it got soaked and they let's guests use washer and dryer for free! I later lost my car key and staff went above and beyond to help me find it. I ended up finding it in the drier I used for my hoodie!Conference facilities also worked out nicely for the training that I attended. I'm going to take advantage of future opportunities to go on work trips here!This is my latest (and most expensive) experience with a hotel that does not live up to the most basic requirement I have for lodging (besides the absence of bed bugs): the ability to get a decent night's rest. I was there for two nights, tried two rooms, on different floors and on different sides of the building, and achieved two hours of sleep each night- and that was with two separate noise makers operating (one came with the room). Admittedly, I am not a heavy sleeper; however, the amount of white noise present in my rooms should have been more than enough to suffice.The first room, ninth floor, harbor side would have been fine, if not for the constant reflected traffic noise, which only abated from 2 AM to 4 AM. I don't honestly know how soundproof hotel windows can feasibly get- but these had a long way to go. A loud car would go by about once each minute, beamed right through my window.For my second night, I was moved above the pool (eighth floor), with the hope and assumption that the extra roofing below would block some of the traffic noise. It blocked about half; meaning that, while I could not hear every car going by, I could still hear most of the ones starting from stoplights and/or stop signs. Additionally, the refrigerator in this room was loud, and turned on frequently (every 10-15 minutes, for 5 minutes); it could be heard clearly over even the traffic. Also noted, hallway sounds (doors) were more noticeable in this area of the hotel. Finally, there was an odd dragging, scraping sound from above or beside the room, that continued throughout the night. I still have no idea what caused that one. Not sure I want to.The only other two issues I had with my stay was the price of the food (expected) and the inconsistency of the shower temp- both of which could have been easily overlooked, had I been able to sleep.The workout room was well appointed (even offering hot towels and complementary fruit), the rooms and public rest rooms were clean, the staff professional, the view (from harbor side) was gorgeous, the location was ideal- sadly, all hard to appreciate on two hours of sleep. I have several other conferences coming up soon, held at the Hyatt, and I am seriously considering staying elsewhere.I lived in Maryland all my life and when we were young, visiting the Inner Harbor was a treat. I thought it would be cool to stay at that hotel with the mirrored windows - heck, we always parked in their garage because the pedestrian bridge offered great access to the Inner Harbor.Fast forward a number of years to 2016 and I had a couple of Hyatt Diamond Suite Upgrades to burn before they expire in February. I self-parked in the garage, took the elevator down and walked into the lobby. Check-in was very professional and before I knew it, I was wowed by the Superior Harbor View 2-bedroom Suite. These rooms are on the corner edges of the building, rooms X45/X47 and offer a spectacular view of the Inner Harbor. Both rooms offered a flatscreen (a 42-inch in the bedroom and a 55-inch in the living room), a bathroom, desk, coffeemaker, and fridge. Free Hyatt Wi-Fi was also available. I wasn't able to enjoy all the amenities at the Hyatt. The fitness room is on the 4th floor and there's also a rooftop pool, open in season. The hotel restaurant, Bistro 300, is on the 3rd floor. I only had their breakfast buffet. The service was very attentive and the food was pretty good.Overall, I enjoyed my stay at HR Inner Harbor - the price was right at $99 (plus parking and taxes coupled with a Diamond Suite Upgrade), but don't expect this price the rest of the year! I stayed here on Jan 1, post holidays, hence the fab rate.Great location..  Bummer that the mini bar in my room wasn't full.  Called front desk to have refilled.  They said it wouldn't be refilled until the morning.  What?   Luckily, the bar stayed open a little late for me.  Rooms clean and beds comfortable.We ordered room service and my wife's egg whites were undercooked and runny.  My burger was ok.  Pretty much equivalent to a Denny's burger.  Expect better from a Hyatt.  There was also mold in the grout in the shower.   That is a new one on me.  I stay in many Hyatt's.  I have never experienced a shower like that.After perusing a few hotels in the Inner Harbor area for a quick weekend trip to the National Aquarium, I went with the Hyatt because they had a package that included passes and discounted parking in their attached garage. Convenience! I rejoiced, because the other hotels I looked at didn't have obvious parking information and the costs just added up to too much when you factored in aquarium tickets.Anyway--that's a long-winded introduction to say that choosing the Hyatt for our weekend was the best choice I could have made. The service was impeccable. I emailed regarding the aquarium tickets because we wanted to arrive early on Saturday, and Andre from the Front Office responded almost immediately. He was there when we arrived, shook my hand and wished my husband a happy birthday. When we got back from lunch and finally relaxed in our room, we were welcomed by a handwritten note and a special birthday treat. Andre is exactly the kind of person the hospitality industry needs; he goes above and beyond the call of duty, striving to make sure the guest has a good experience. We stay at Hyatt brand hotels when possible, and this is--by far--the best service we've had.The hotel itself was very nice. The walls are a bit thin, so we heard someone's baby, but that's to be expected in hotels. Our view of the harbor was gorgeous. This Hyatt probably has some of the best views of all the hotels in the Inner Harbor. There are pedestrian bridges to easily cross to the Light Street Pavilion and into the Harbor complex. It's walking distance to all of the Harbor attractions.I kind of thought this trip to Baltimore would be a one-off thing, but I'm already thinking about when we could go back. The Hyatt Regency will make an excellent home base for exploring other Baltimore attractions--and going back to the Aquarium on a day other than a summer Saturday!The Hyatt Regency is THE place to stay when in Baltimore!  The staff is professional--the rooms are clean--the service is impeccable -- special thanks to Melvin for taking time out of his day to guide us with directions over the phone the last few miles when we needed help the most.!  We will never forget that "little extra". See my 300 Bistro review!  This place is second to none w/out a doubt.!!Thanks to the entire staff for making this trip one we will always remember--not to mention the 1D concert we are here for.!  My daughter loves 1D and the Hyatt.!!Positive feedback - the staff was pleasant, Joel the best!Negatives:  stayed for 5 days and three mornings I had a cold showerbecause they were fully booked - no excuse!  Every time the room above flushed the toilet water would drip down from the light over our toilet. We reported it three times but it wasn't fixed.  The kicker is I woke up with a bed bug bite on my butt and another couple we were with had a bite on his leg.  Will never stay there again. The construction of the hotel was of poor quality.  Again the staff was very pleasant.Staff was lovely.  The building was lovely and looked newly re-modeled.  The look was modern.  Location was great. There is currently construction on the 2nd floor.  Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable.  My reason for 2 stars is the room was very sterile and uncomfortable to me.  We did book on Priceline so I cannot complain.  The new furniture looked nice, but there was one uncomfortable little chair at the table and one fancy appearing chair.  No counter space anywhere.  Only one nightstand between the 2 double beds so each outer side of bed had no table.  This room was good for sleeping only, but I guess that is what one does when they come to a hotel :-)I'll keep this brief--I don't often give five stars, but the hotel staff treated us very well and were extremely helpful, the rooms were lovely and bright, and breakfast at Bistro 300 was excellent. The beds were very comfortable--just enough support as well as cushioning.Excellent customer service-- amazing place, with very cool elevators. We spent a fantastic weekend here, right in the heart of Baltimore, within walking distance to all of the good stuff:)Nice location, rather forgettable but nothing terrible about it. Perfect for conferences. Overpriced but everything in the Inner Harbor is. Check in and out was quick enough. Rooms were standard. Bathroom on the small side. I know I'm a snob, but I hate the Hyatt brand of toiletries - KenetMD. You don't want to use body lotion and shampoo by a brand that sounds like a prescription while on vacation. If we didn't have Hyatt points, I probably wouldn't stay here again.I have nothing but good things to say about the Hyatt.  I just stayed here and from booking to checking out the experience was ubiquitously warm, positive, and welcoming.Check in was easy and the gentleman at the desk made sure to ask how my trip in was, could he help me plan anything, would I like to speak with the concierge, etc.  Great service and made me feel at home.On my walk to the room I passed two flavors of infused water and fresh baked chocolate chip and oatmeal raisin cookies, a great touch.The decor is modern, open, and warm.  The room was clean, neat, and very comfortable.  Large flat screen TV, adequate size fridge, single serve coffee maker.  There are plenty of outlets scattered around the room and a nice desk space if you're there to work.The concierge helped me look for a couple of local services and even took my cell number and spent 20 minutes looking for 2 options for me.  Wonderful service.The only reason I wouldn't come right to the Hyatt the next time I need a hotel in Baltimore is because of the plethora of upper-end hotels all in the same area.Love this hotel! Clean and modern, close to everything, friendly staff. Love the view of the harbor and really nice and romantic outdoor pool. And it's affordable! Every dollar was worth it! We will def come back here! We came here for forth of July and we got a great view of the firework right from our room!Very pleased with this hotel although my stay started off with a slight plumbing disaster in my room which required a move. However, the staff was very apologetic and eager to please. The hotel overall is very nice and clean. The workout facility is top notch. I have to admit it is one of the best hotel workout areas I have ever seen. The rooms themselves are nice. Good bed and clean bathrooms. That truly matters. Decent area attractions are easily accessible which is a plus. All in all, I will keep them in mind for my next inner harbor visit.Nestled along the inner harbor is a gleaming mirrored building that stands amidst the darkened buildings like the Emerald City of Oz. It towers over the waterfront as a beckoning oasis and as you enter it almost seems as if you are being taken away from the hustle and bustle of urban life.The rooms have been tastefully re-done. Nothing truly wow-ing or special, however they do feature the very comfortable grand bed and the rooms are nicely sized so that it doesn't feel claustrophobic. No matter what the view, whether the harbor or the city, they are all comfortable so that you aren't looking into the awkward naked person in the bathroom over in the building next door. Its location is definitely a highlight and it is convenient to many of the cities attractions. Whether it is the nearby inner harbor that is connected by a skybridge, the stadiums, or perhaps the downtown core. It is all a short walk away. Yet, if you do park a car, valet or self parking are available. If you're into saving a few bucks, self-parking is easy and there is another entrance off S. Charles street, although there is a separate garage elevator that means a few extra minutes.Staff are pleasant and helpful. I asked for tips and directions on several occasions and they were really personable and nice. Over all, it is what I would look for in a hotel and they offered a great choice that I would definitely use for my next visit to Baltimore.Awful value!! Stayed 3 nights last week on the 7th floor.   Hallway carpet was stained and literally coming apart at the seams.  Room was extremely tired.  It had no reading chair/ottoman, bathroom sink took forever to drain and the "Ken and Barbie" coffee maker and supplies were a joke!  This room and hallway are in dire need of a total renovation.  Paying top rate of $279/ night for this room was completely inappropriate!!Based on the poor conditions noted above, the rate should have been heavily discounted or, better yet, the room should not have been available for booking at all.Nicely done renovation makes this hotel attractive again.  They still need to work on the Charles Street back entrance which is dirty and worn.Took the boyfriend on a getaway weekend and stayed in a Grand King View Room. Expensive, but worth it. The room was clean, spacious, and the view was to die for. The bed was absolutely amazing. Best night sleep in a while. Room service breakfast Sunday morning was on time and fresh. The orange juice tasted like it was just squeezed! Everyone was polite and helpful when checking in, out, and dealing with the valet. Great hotel!! Expensive, but wonderful.Great people and love the new web check-in capability, but they need to upgrade rugs on some of the floors, and my bathroom window blind needed replacement. Also, they need to keep gym temperature at 68 during the summer. There are always folks who wanted hot and others cold in the gym so lets just stick with average, and please make sure to have enough towels in the peak times.I spent Tuesday and Wednesday nights this week here for a client meeting. I don't know how much the room cost. The client reserved a block and charges were direct billed, so I can' speak to overall value. Here's a quick net of the good and the bad:Pros- Excellent location - a 20- to 30-minute ride to/from the airport, in the middle of the central business district, adjacent to quaint Federal Hill, on the water at the Inner Harbor and a short walk to the much cooler Harbor East neighborhood.- A very nice staff.- Hypoallergenic, thrice-cleaned Pure rooms with HEPA filter, white noise machine and fragrance-free toiletries.- Touch card entry. No need to insert or swipe a card key. A timesaver.- Very quiet. Every guest I saw was a business traveler. No bachelorette parties, frat boys or screaming kids. - Comfortable beds with decent linens.  Cons- The food. Absolutely horrible. For that matter, I have never had a good meal at any Hyatt. Eat elsewhere.- No bottled water in fitness center. And every time I went (3X) there were no towels. In addition, while it's nice that they put out a basket of apples, oranges and bananas, they should swap them out every week or so. There was rotten fruit (see my photo).- The bathroom had insufficient vanity space, just one hook and no towel rack. I had to put a clean towel on the toilet to avoid walking across a tile sopping wet to get one. - Ironically, found a silver dollar sized dust bunny on the desk in my Pure room. Oops.- They have obviously tried to update the 80s architecture and decor, e.g., the water feature in the third floor lounge that reminded me of the one in Willowbrook Mall in Wayne, NJ when I was a kid.I wouldn't object if I had to stay here again, but nothing I experienced fostered brand loyalty or would cause me to switch from the Marriott program. Please let me know what you think of this review by clicking a bottom below. Thanks!
review_content_20: Great location, unremarkable service. Except for the front desk staff, who were extraordinarily helpful, this hotel has a mediocre staff and mediocre food, and worse banquet catering. Mainly, it was a staff issue. The Good: it's a great location. A bridge will take you over to the waterfront Inner Harbor area and it's a half mile walk to beautiful Camden Yards. And a short half mile at that, you'll spend more time mounting the ramp to the upper decks than you will walking to the park.  Parking is next to the hotel--swing in from Light Street on the right (beware of the MBT buses that peel off and cut you off as you try to turn in, get into the right lane immediately. Or you'll have to go around the block.) It's twenty a day self park and not difficult to maneuver.The hotel public areas are  nice looking. The architecture is 80's--glass and steel and concrete, with those glass pod elevators everyone was so hyped about thirty years ago. OOoo! Look! We can see down into the atrium! Yep, the Eighties were all about that.The rooms are unremarkable and not that big, but adequate. The decor is a paean to Bland (plain abstract pictures, beige and white on beige decor). The bedding is hypoallergenic and covered with dust-mite-excluding polyester covers. These tightly woven covers prevent dust mite infestation and are a brilliant touch. Only--the bedding had feathers (the pillows) and those are allergic beyond belief. But the staff did have non-allergenic pillows available. The sheets are a bit slick because they are not cotton but a blend. No minibar. There WAS a minibar but it was empty.
