On top was one of those one cup brewers for coffee or tea and Starbucks Verona and decaf Verona pods. Lipton tea and the usual skimpy one sugar, one pink packet and one tiny creamer. Paper cups. No bottled water. They also have a number of toiletries you might have forgotten available at not charge...but you have to ask. What's laid on in the room is basic; toothpaste, lotion, shampoo, a bar of soap. Nice soap. The bathroom is a bit small and the vanity shelf is only as wide as a stick of gum--so it's hard to put out your dopp kit AND a makeup bag, if there are two of you. And only one sink. The shower had one of the best shower heads I've used, loved it--you swivel the head inside a ring and it goes from rain water to pulse to stream to flat jet. Likey! The Bad:The beds are just ok, not great. I had a double, not a king, but it was tolerable. Some other of my party felt the bed wasn't comfy. Maybe not all the beds were updated. The room wasn't serviced. I was at early events, then late afternoon needed to rest up, shower, and dress for evening festivities. Room not done up, no new towels and the staff beating on the door during nap time. If you can't get to a room before 4:30pm, don't knock on my door. So no clean towels or anything for the entire stay. I was too annoyed to go chase down housekeeping and get them to do up the room. They had from 7am onward so what's the hold-up?The rooms are noisy--older building, thin walls. There is a white noise generator in the room to help you with this issue but they don't work on thumps. Just traffic noises and voices.The catering: wow. Our entire table was neglected. No water, no wine, no coffee. The entire evening. And what was funny was we were by the wait station, so it's not like they didn't see us. And one of us specified NO NUTS and every dish had...NUTS. THe entire table was laden with nuts and even though a nut-free option was ordered, they didn't come by with the no-nuts to our table (because we were apparently invisible the entire evening.) When the dessert of NUTS showed up, I complained and was offered a vegan cake (which I was suspicious about, as vegan food features a lot of ....NUTS) and a tiny tiny fruit cup, the size of a baby food serving. Two pieces of melon and a blackberry. So that's what my dinner consisted of, along with one piece of dried out bread--as they'd cut it and put it out hours before.The steak we were offered was so tough it couldn't be cut by the plain (not steak) knife. Was supposedly "filet" but it was tough, overdone, and soaked in a salty brine. The fish was dried out.  The asparagus was completely raw, in the cheating method of caterers these days, who do not blanch vegetables, but coat raw ones with butter to prevent overcooking. By not cooking at all. I hate that--happens all the time with haricot beans as well. It's raw. Gross when buttered.  The breakfast was the usual greasy eggs, pastries, no toast, fruit showed up sometimes, and no plain non-sugared bread, sausages and very sorry bacon.  There was the usual sugared and sugar free yogurt. If you want plain, that's for European holidays. Americans want sweets.Summary: pretty much what you find in an American "five star" hotel these days unless you are lucky.This place is terrible. Charging ports on my room don't work, phone died over night as a result I was late for an appointment. "High Speed" internet I paid $10 per day for us slower than a 36.6k modem. Customer service doesn't care about you and the air conditioning is a joke, a fan would keep me cooler. Stay anywhere else, think I would have been better off at Motel 6.Spacious, welcoming rooms and bathrooms, excellent conference space by the water, but...My company booked my trip and Hyatt charged ME!  This is a HUGE issue for me, so I am not a happy customer.Stayed here for thanksgiving 3 nights . Really nice hotel . Big . Good food in the bar and restaurant . Drinks were a little pricey and there was construction going on inside hotel . Rooms were big and nice . Great views of the harbor . Customer service was perfect . Great location . Super close to all dining and activities in inner harbor .Definitely will stay here again .Some friends and I were in town and decided to stay here because of location and things to do within walking distance. I was surprised how clean, friendly staff and renovated it is inside. I will definitely be staying here again should I visit Baltimore again.Exceptional customer service. Everyone staffed here was SUPER friendly. The hotel itself was very lovely and the rooms were clean. The bed was so comfy. The lobby had infused water. The strawberry one was rockin'. If you love chain restaurants right on the water then the location is stellar, I hate chains so I was a tad disappointed with that. Overall a nice place!Came into town for a night to attend a friend's going away party.  We HotWired this hotel and got a great deal.  We arrived a little early for check-in but the staff was really friendly and helpful and got us into a room a little early.  I signed up for their loyalty program which is free and they upgraded us to a King corner full harborview room and gave us 2 free things from the mini-bar.  Since we were out partying all night we ended up taking 2 free waters.  It's a great hotel with a good location and the cost to park your car isn't too bad.  I will say though that the toilet in the room was ridiculously low which is good I guess if you are short.  All in all a good stay.Nice and lovely hotel..a bit noisy in the hallway.comfy beds..nice big TV and good water pressure tooo.Our stay was excellent. Part of the positive experience was due to the fact that the Inner Harbor, and by extension - the Hyatt, was awesomely dead during the weekend before Xmas. The hotel staff was lovely. The only hiccup was upon check out when we ordered a bell hop and none showed up. Thought maybe they were busy, but when we got down to the car, they were standing around chatting with one another. That said, Duquan was fantastic. He helped us on the way in and again helped us to load the car up on the way out. If you stay here, do everything you can to get a harbor view. You won't regret paying a little more. I rate the view better than most and I've had some great views over the years - Boston, Times Square, even a rustic resort in Washington overlooking a white capped mountain. On the downside, the garage is not attached to the hotel. On the upside, you can get directly over to the harbor view the skywalk. Thumbs down on the lobby decor - it's outdated.  But the room was upgraded. Super quiet room; comfy solid bed.  All in all, I would absolutely recommend the Hyatt if you are staying in town.While not physically connected to the convention center, it is the closest hotel to the east side and harbor, and there is a sky walk that spits you out on the 2nd level.They have kiosk check in, for which you can use either your credit card or your Hyatt membership card.  There was always at least one employee standing there to help with kiosk check in.  More showed up at peak times or when lines were starting to form. The rooms are nice, the toiletries are nice, but the walls are thin and there's lots of noise.  There was a noise machine in my room, which I had to turn on each night since even on a Thursday night, they were doing construction work at 11pm on removing the elevated walkway on the side of the convention center.  I'm a little on the tall side, and the not-adjustable desk chair was too short, so I had to sit on an extra pillow.I left on Saturday morning for an early flight, and the cab to the airport is a fixed rate of $30.Decent convention experience, but bring your ear plugs!Attending a conference, I stayed here for a few days. The rooms are very nice and clean. The staff both at check-in, throughout the stay, and at check-out were very nice and professional. The irritating service at a hotel such as this is no free wifi. For almost $200 pet night, I expect it to come as part of your services. At a $50-100 per night establishment it is free. It's almost as if with at a more expensive place, they know you'll pay it. Here is the customer service excellence though. I mentioned it during my checkout about being unhappy with it and not expecting anything to happen. However, after leaving I was contacted by the hotel manager to help me work through this issue during future visits. I really didn't expect the desk staff to take my comments any further, little alone have the manager call me to rectify the situation. Excellent job to their desk staff, management, and internal communication.We went there for a company party and stayed overnight in a guest room. We had a great time overall! We were self-parking the car but the valets said it was fine to leave the car for a while when checking in. We used a self-check in kiosk, but when we had an issue an employee was quick to help us, providing room keys (TOUCH room keys, no dealing with the annoying card slot) and directions. The elevators are very quick and the views from the elevators are amazing!Our guest room was a harborview room. It was very clean and tidy, but kind of oddly shaped, with a narrow little corner to turn to go between the bathroom and the bedroom area. The coffee maker was well-stocked and intuitive. My only complaints are that the bathroom sink ran for several seconds after turning off, slowing to a trickle instead of turning off quickly and completely. Also, the toilet made an odd squeaky sound when it flushed, but those were minor complaints. The toiletries were good quality. We didn't use any of the food. There was a noise machine in the room, but our room was very quiet and I didn't find it was needed.There is NO extra room in the mini-fridge, so if you have something you need to store, you will need to remove some of their minibar items... just remember to replace them!Overall, this is a solid hotel. We stayed after an event on Valentine's Day. The room is well appointed but a little small. The bed very firm. The bathroom is well lit and the shower had plenty of hot water and water pressure.On the downside, this is a loud hotel and by that I mean the hotel itself. Every so often the in room heat/air unit kicks on and it is loud but settles into almost white noise. The minibar fridge kicks on and is loud. The air-handlers on the roof below our window were extremely loud. To top it all off, we could clearly (CLEARLY) hear the couple in the to next to us (ahem) celebrating Valentine's Day. The walls are thin, but that happens everywhere so I will give that a pass.However, the biggest complaint we have is that at 7:45 on Sunday morning the hotel staff started cleaning and vacuuming with a vacuum that was as loud as a power washer. So much for sleeping in, but hey it was only for one night and could have been much much worse.I had a wonderful stay at this hotel.The service was great, very friendly and professional staff members. The management did everything to make me feel comfortable while I was staying there. The room was absolutely fabulous and the bed was super comfortable.The staff are awesome making you feel at home while on the road. I will definitely recommend this location to anyone.Nice room in a great location, but the cable tv didn't work and hallway noise was extremely loud in the room because of poor design and lack of insulation around the door.  I don't watch a lot of tv, but like to have the news on in the morning while I am getting ready for work.  As I was watching, the sound was cutting in and out badly.   I ran into a man in the hall later and he asked if my TV was working. I told him it wasn't working properly, that the sound was cutting in and out. He stated that his was doing the same and he had been staying in the hotel for two weeks, had reported it several times and hotel management had done nothing. He asked me to report the problem too, so they would know it was not just him. When I reported it to the gentleman at the front desk at first he acted surprised. Then when I told him that the gentleman in the room next to me told me he had the same problem for the past two weeks the man at the desk suddenly seem to remember the problem.  He told me they were aware of the problem and we're working to fix it.  My question is, if they knew about the problem for two weeks, does it really take that long to fix and why weren't they letting guests know and perhaps giving guests an option to take a room where the cable was working.  On the plus side, the gym was awesome, with a lot of great equipment.I stayed here when I was in town for a football game.  The location to the inner harbor and the stadium is ideal.  Anything you would want to do in Baltimore is a quick walk from the hotel.The hotel looked very modern and had great views of the harbor.  The staff was very friendly and the hotel had a lot of energy because the Baltimore Ravens were staying here the night before the game.  They had a great breakfast buffet at Bistro 300.  I would definitely stay here again.this is a hotel with a great location.... got a wonderful price on the room.....bar and restaurant are pricey ....personnel here are great....have to pay to park.....Beautiful hotel. View was one to remember. And a nice pool overlooking Baltimore. I suggest this hotel, the Hilton over Camden yards and royal Sonesta if you come to Baltimore.The hotel was best in class. The rooms were clean, staff was friendly , and it was within walking distance to the ballpark.  Great place to stay!Beautiful hotel!  Awesome location!  We had a view of the harbor which was beautiful at night!  Well stocked mini bar and there is a Starbucks in the hotel.  I got a great deal through Priceline Make Your Own Bid, but feel that the room and service would be worth the money. My only slight con was that the room service meal was not as great as I expected it to be, but I like how they have the menu you can scroll through on the TV.  But, the menu on the TV had some differences than the menu in the room.We were there the day they were sending off the Ravens to the Super Bowl and it was right next to all the festivities.
review_content_40: This was my first trip to the Inner Harbor part of Baltimore.  I can't wait to go back and staying at the Hyatt is the perfect way to stay at Inner Harbor. I arrived early which was not a problem and was quickly in my room.  The room was very nice as you would expect in a Hyatt.  The Valet was very courteous and professional.  The reception staff were fantastic.  This staff really enjoys their work and the management team is truly doing a good job.   I stay with Hyatt's quite frequently so I had access to their Regency club.   They had  wonderful evening snacks and a nice continental breakfast.  The club staff were very courteous and friendly.  Jesse who was running the club in the evening is an amazing individual.  He was working hard but made time for all the guest.  He is extremely interesting to talk with and I spent a couple extra hours chatting with him and another guest.  I actually missed my dinner reservation but didn't care as i was having such a fun time.  Jesse is a true professional who makes you feel as if you were a guest in his home.My wife and I were driving in from Detroit on our way to Virginia Beach. I was pretty excited to stay in a world class city like Baltimore but, I wish I would have stayed somewhere else. I heard Hyatt hotels were pretty good so we booked one and used it as a check point to stop driving and reset. Hotel room itself was actually rather comfortable but, the staff was not so interested. We booked a room with a king sized bed and they initially stuck us in a two bed room. We needed a down feather free room and when we switched rooms after the complaint call it took an hour and two phone calls to get the down out of the room. Purifier smelled awful and was crazy loud. Room service was slow and not masterful. Overpriced for the hassle and laziness of the staff. I did like the free toothpaste though. woo hoo. View was bad as well. Will book a different hotel when we stay in Baltimore next time.Exceptional hotel for meetings (we had two conference rooms for two weeks)- the staff of the hotel ensured we had everything we needed. Great location- right on the harbour--TONS, and I mean TONS, of options for places to eat. One of the better Hyatt Regency's--check in is fast, especially if you are a Gold Passport member. I appreciate that they upgraded me and I was on Regency level, with a huge room. Downfall- there was some kind of cheerleading or volleyball comeptition at the same time and the parents of these kids who were staying on Regency Club level let all their annoying children take over the Club. There went all the food---all the areas to relax, and at some point some kids got into a scuffle and because I was entering and leaving the room at the same time, security told the hotel staff that I had started the altercation! It took a lot of investigating and by the end of the next day, as appalled as I was, the hotel apologized for their flub and banished the rugrats from the Regency Club. Understandable mistake, and especially as a then-Platinum member, I was taken aback and how abruptfly I was wrongly accused of some disturbance. OTHER THAN THAT, its a great hotel.Oh yeah, prepare to pay an arm and a leg for self-park or valet. Either way, there went half your gas $$ for the day!I got stuck in this Hyatt for 3 nights and days because of Hurricane Sandy (not 'superstormmediablowup Sandy'), so I think I can say some pretty informed things about this hotel.The rooms are impressive. I had a harbor view on the 6th floor with two full sized beds. The amenities in the room were nice. Nice bathroom, nice TV, nice view.. but the beds were too soft for me. Dining in the hotel is very pleasant. The staff were friendly, the bar tender attentive, and the food all-in-all decent. You will get tired of it after the 4th meal straight, just FYI, but I think that might be the case at any hotel. They did roll out snacks, coffee, and tea for the prisoners of the hotel during the hurricane. THANKS!The value was alright, I don't think it was worth $180/night, because I have stayed elsewhere downtown for much less with similar amenities. But the Hyatt doesn't disappoint as usual.This hotel is at a great location, very convenient/ quick to walk to the inner harbor area! The rooms were clean and modern, but our room was uncomfortably hot at certain times (even with the AC going full blast) because of the excessive sunlight. Also the wait for the elevators was pretty annoying, just to go to the lobby from the third floor there was always a wait. Same for the parking garage but that was even worse, having to stand around waiting with luggage is not fun. They are very strict with upholding the checkin time (which is 4pm) we got there around 2 and had to wait for the room to be ready. Also, we had the breakfast buffet for $20 a person- it wasn't bad but not great either just very mediocre. I would recommend going to one of the great restaurants nearby for meals rather than trying your luck at the Hyatt. Overall it wasn't a bad experience just mediocre and slightly over priced- parking for guests is also $28 for one night!!Stayed at The Hyatt this past weekend while in Baltimore for a professional conference. The location was great---in the heart of the Inner Harbor, within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and many sights. I really enjoyed this hotel's atmosphere & the customer service was excellent! Plus, the food in hotel's restaurant was outstanding!! One of the best meals I had all weekend was right there! Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Baltimore!We have stayed here many times and have always had a wonderful experience. Highly recommend getting a harbor view room. Views are beautiful. Rooms are spacious and the staff is very professional. We always enjoy a meal at Bistro 300 as well. Walking distance to harbor attractions and Camden Yards. Looking forward to our next visitThought Hyatt is a world class hotel, but they need to keep the rooms clean. The staffs are extremely helpful.I was in Baltimore for a week for a business convention (traveling by myself). I heard good things about this hotel and I have respect for the Hyatt moniker in general. Given that the hotel was within a short walking distance (I have bad knees) to my meetings. This SEEMED like a no-brainer. I had to check-in late because my room was not ready at 4:00. No big deal, the desk promised to give me a ring when my room was prepared. There is a ton of stuff to do in the beautiful Inner-Harbor area. I took a short stroll across the street. Phillips Seafood immediately caught my eye, so I decided to check out the rest of the harbor later...I will write a separate review for Phillips Seafood in the future, but for now I will say it was SUPERB! I started with a shrimp-cocktail, steamers, fried calamari, crab cakes, and for my entree, I had the triple mac-and-cheese boat... AWSOME. I finished with a chocolate cake and chocolate mousse desert. All good. Perfect timing too! My room was ready just as I was finishing. Before I went back to the hotel, I decided, why not splurge a little? I found a wonderful gelato stand in the harbor mall. Heavenly. Finally made it up to the room around 5:30. The view from my room was beautiful (a nice view of Hooters). The bed was nothing great, I like a little cozier. I was meeting a friend nearby for sushi and drinks at 7:00. I thought I had enough time to quickly go to the bathroom before I departed. This is where things started to go wrong for me. I used the bathroom and to my frustration, It clogged after only two flushes. Low flow? Ugh! I called the front desk to ask for a plumber and waited a HALF-HOUR for him to show up!!! Come on! Very unprofessional. I was going to be late for my dinner and obviously I could have left and just assumed it would be fixed, but I wanted to make sure it would be okay for when I got back. In case I had to go again before bed. I ending up meeting my friend a little late, no big deal. When I returned to my room, I needed to use the bathroom again. Guess what? It clogged again! When I called, I got the same woman. This time, I clearly detected a tone in her voice. Once again, very unprofessional. They sent up another plumber and it was fixed again. I went to bed much later then I intended. Not happy. Next morning I woke up early so I could try a nearby deli for breakfast. It was right across the street and very convenient to walk to. My buddy told me they had a local Baltimore favorite called "scrapple" (traditionally a mush of pork scraps and trimmings combined with cornmeal and wheat flour, often buckwheat flour, and spices). Of course it was excellent! After I ate, I went to my room to use the bathroom. I had just enough time to do this before my first meeting at the convention center. Can you guess where this is going? THE TOILET CLOGGED AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!! This time I flagged down a maid in the hallway and brought her into my room. She was very rude. Tons of eye rolling and attitude. She had the nerve to suggest that it was MY FAULT!!! I could not believe it. I did not have time to wait around for it to be fixed, so I left for my meeting. After a wonderfully catered lunch at the convention center, I stopped by my room to make sure it was fixed... STILL CLOGGED!!!!!!!! I immediately called the front desk and got a new woman (much nicer). She apologized and sent someone right up. The room smelt horribly. The maintenance man pointed this out to me very rudely. He didn't need to say anything! I was very embarrassed. I even asked the desk if I could switch rooms to get a WORKING toilet! Nope! They were full. Just great! I learned through hard experience to use the toilet in the lobby for the rest of my stay at the Hyatt. Not very convenient for me. The hotel itself and MOST of the staff were very nice. It still did not live up to the Hyatt moniker. If it wasn't for the horrible bathrooms, I might have even given it four stars.Ok I'm not a hotel food kinda guy but went here for a conference today...and to my surprise the dinner food was actually pretty good. I nibbled on a salad (greens were very fresh), and some kinda of fish (battered) which I rarely eat.  Looked like Cod. Not only was the food very delicious but the service throughout the hotel was quite friendly. My impression of Balto is not that good but this experience is helping to change my perspective...sort of.This hotel is in a perfect location to all of what Baltimore offers and even offers a walk way over to the Inner Harbor area. The service was good and everyone was friendly from check in to check out. Rooms were well appointed and the toiletries were excellent. The beds are super comfortable and we had a great night's sleep. All in all this hotel is a great pick for your stay in the Baltimore area.Good!If your here for a long time and need to order something not available downtown and have it shipped to the hotel, be prepared to cough up. $7.42 a package for a processing fee. This is crazy. Also several friends of mine reported bed bugs. Allergy free rooms are dustier than regular rooms.I am a travel agent and Hyatt Platinum member. I stay at a lot of properties annually and have had some great experiences and not so great experiences over the years. I am pleased to say that Hyatt Regency in Baltimore was definitely a great place to stay!Service is top notch--  the minute you arrive at the hotel, the staff makes a huge effort to get to know you and to fulfill all requests. Nicole, the FOM was really great about accommodating my standby requests and secured a great room for me. Kenny in the Regency Club was so polite, friendly, and helpful-- he definitely made my stay a memorable one.The rooms themselves are large and boast great amenities. While they aren't ultra modern or super luxurious, they do provide a high caliber of comfort and were very clean. I was also impressed by the Regency Club at this property. There are so many variations in Regency Clubs from Hyatt to Hyatt, but Baltimore really pulled out all the stops with a great spread of items throughout the day and evening. I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel!I stayed here for 1 night  and had a nice stay. They let us check in at 11am and let us check out at 2pm. The price was a high at over $400 per night but I stayed here on rewards points for free so I can't complain. Only negative thing to say is that the doors don't block out noise very well. They have a lot of signs up about being quiet after 9pm, but of course there will always be a few that ignore. It was short lived thought.    And the elevators are pretty cool!I can't say enough nice things about this hotel and staff. The room was immaculate and the hotel renovations are beautiful. The staff has gone above and beyond for us from upgrading our room to offering me a bottle of water on a hot day (I'm currently pregnant). I've stayed I'm many hotels in this area and so far this is the only I would feel strongly about staying in again. Wonderful staff who truly understand customer service!Great hotel and staff. Rooms are very noisy, you can hear the street noise and the hallway noise all night longRenovations are nice and so is the hotel......you can't beat the location.We expected quality from the Hyatt, so I'm not surprised our stay was pleasant.There is plenty of staff to answer questions, and point one in a direction upon entering. Rooms are clean, and spacious, and the view from the 14th floor was positively, panoramically, brilliant. I chose to book through Priceline, with the deciding factor being that parking was included in our package. This turned out to be a wise decision, as the parking at the Hyatt is highway (or parking lot) robbery.  For a two day trip, I easily could have spent 80 on parking.  Just a heads up for future guests.  Other than that, I can go ahead and give Hyatt Baltimore an endorsement.  Urqhart out.Stay somewhere else with the free breakfast.
review_content_60: Loved this hotel.  EVERYONE (valet to front desk to everyone in between) was FRIENDLY beyond belief.The hotel itself is nice and clean as are the rooms.  The bed was very comfortable.I had a view of the pool to my left and to the baseball stadium to my right.The hotel itself is located on the harbor.  Apparently this is a very touristy area ( I had no idea).   Once you walk out of the hotel and cross the street you are standing on the harbor.  There are lots of restaurants and things to do.Great location.** I do wish Hotels would stop charging for WIFI !!! ***i stayed here my second time in Baltimore for a trip to see a client and stayed here 3 nights.The front desk was amazingly courteous and helpful.The room was okay. I was stuck in a 2 queen (wish they would have fixed that) overlooking the pool. The room was fairly spacious and had a small chaise lounge to sit on. I always appreciate a sitting area that isn't the desk so I can lay back and work on my laptop. The main issue I had with the room was that it either was dirty, or that there was so much wear and tear that it looked dirty.The bathrooms didn't have any storage, so I had to leave all my items on the counter, which kept getting moved so the cleaning service could do their job. The tub was kind of gross as it had buildup around the edges. I wish I would have brought a pair of flip flops to wear in there.I wanted to go to the bar one night for dinner, but there's very little seating and it was packed. I ordered room service instead and it was quite good. It was a tad cold but came with all the amenities for a burger and fries so that I had everything I needed. The gentleman who brought it up was also very kind and cheers'd me as he opened my beer.I'd recommend this hotel to someone for business or short stays.Stayed overnight to visit the aquarium with my family and enjoyed every bit.The food was excellent and the room was clean. Service both at the front desk and at the hotel was like a five star hotel.This hotel, lives up to its ratings. Would definitely go again.I booked four nights here on line and then realized that I booked for the wrong weekend.  When I called the next day to change the reservation for the following weekend, the hotel was completely booked.  So, I decided to cancel my reservation and look for another hotel.  THEN, I found out that the reservation was completely non-refundable.  So, I'm not going to be in Baltimore that weekend but I have to pay $219/night for four nights.I realize the initial error is mine but who has ever heard of no cancellation policy.  I thought most (all) hotels were 24 hours.  You would think they could understand that since I called the very next day that it was a simple mistake.  If this is Hyatt's universal policy, I'll never stay at a Hyatt again.Be careful when you are booking a Hyatt reservation!!Stayed here for a couple days during the summer with a couple of relatives.Location: For Baltimore, you may not be able to get any better. You're right on the inner harbor, two blocks from the National Aquarium in Baltimore and a bevy of nautical museums. If you're lucky, you may catch the air show or annual collection of sailing vessels. Baltimore is known for being a dangerous city and this was actually one of my greatest hesitations when deciding to stay here. However, the Inner Harbor near the Regency is actually very safe at almost all hours of the day. Rating: 4Service: Probably the worst part of this hotel. With that being said, this is still lightyears better than others I've stayed at (Sheraton Meadowlands). The good: was able to switch from using cash to hotel points to pay for the room the DAY OF. Most hotels wouldn't push to process the change. The bad: We requested extra toothpaste and lotions to be brought to our room. Twice. Nothing. Rating: 2 starsHotel: The hotel itself is actually pretty nice. Some of the hallways look a little old but that's pretty much it. There is no funny smell. The rooms are spacious and clean. The lobby has vaulted ceilings and soothing background music. Sometimes you have a doorman who runs out to open the door for you, help with bags. Other times you wait. Flavored water and cookies sit near the lobby for the weary traveler. Elevators run pretty quickly so regardless of what floor you're on, you'll be back in bed in no time. Rating: 3 starsRooms: Spacious. Not as modern or high tech as I'd like it (see Hyatt 48 Lex) but enough to be comfortable. Otherwise, you basically get everything else you'd expect from a Regency. Rating: 3 starsOther: The pool had just opened up and so everybody and their mom's was sunbathing or doing cannonballs into the water. The "track" was basically the top of the building where you can run circles. The tennis court was taken down. The gym was more than adequate, containing free weights and machines. The spa was down for fixing. I didn't actually go to the bar but it seemed to fill up every night. Rating: 3 starsRecommendation: Not a bad place to stay. The highlight is definitely the proximity to the inner Harbor and all that it has to offer.Exceptional customer service!!  (Michael at check in, have year an angel in the bistro, and that lovely lady in the gift shop )Every staff member I encountered welcomed me warmly, and or asked if I needed anything. The check in desk staff were helpful and kind.  My suite was immaculate and everything smelled clean.  The bedding was luxurious and comfortable!  I used the business center and found it well appointed.   You need a credit card to get on the Internet and print copies.   There is a five dollar minimum for the first 10 minutes .   However, there is a free workstation in the lobby and there are signs indicating that in the business center so you can avoid paying if you need free Internet access.  Something I found very convenient was that it has a walkway directly to the convention center. Travelers going to any function at the convention center will find this hotel convenient with easy access to the convention center.  The breakfast buffet at Bistro 300 was delicious and the staff was warm, professional, and attentive.  The hotel has a wonderful view of the harbor and is centrally located.  Finally, Loved that they accommodate individuals with disabilities all the way down to the grab bars in the showers.   In all the common areas there is a very soft low-volume kind of New Age music playing everywhere you go and the hotel features interesting indoor landscaping and soft textures that provide a relaxing environment.  If I ever return to Baltimore this will be my top choice for a place to stay. Thank you Hyatt Regency Baltimore!.....Stayed here recently for a conference. The conference facilities were top notch and catering was decent. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms weren't anything special - my room just had a shower and no bathtub which bums me out. But the white ginger toiletries go a long way to make me forget that I can't chill in the bath.Location was good - right across from the Inner Harbor and a $30 cab ride from the airport. Don't rent a car if your conference is at the hotel, it is a waste as you generally walk wherever you need to be. Just note that it can be sketchy downtown, so be aware of your surroundings and cab it for short distances if you are alone.Great hotel, perfectly located.  Got a great deal on Priceline too!was here for a conference. beautiful hotel. no complaints. situated next to everything on the waterfront. would definitely recommend.This review is for the valet only.Upon arriving to the hotel I was disappointed, not with the prices, wait (other than two empty cabs I was the only one there) nor the rates but the state of humanity.In what world is it okay for FIVE grown men watch a lady (or anyone for that instance) wrassle her suitcase out of the car - finally turn off her car and approach the valet while five said valet attendants watch on. Then one valet genius says are you checking in? I think hmmm it's like nearly midnight so not sure what else I could be doing standing here with my suitcase in hand. So then they start filling out the paperwork and one of the shiftless quint asks how are you? I give him the stinkeye and grunt something I hope resembles good. What I really wanted to say is disappointed that you five men were just standing there watching me instead of doing your job. The one I can only imagine is the leader (wearing a suit) goes to another "how are you?" The other one answers something nice and happy and this leader dude says something to the effect of glad to hear it. Now I'm pretty laid back, but these hmmmmm not gentlemanly gentleman were clearly making fun of me. It took everything out of me not to let them have it. I really hope these five gentleman realize they are gentleman or EVEN just people and if you see someone in need of help-help. Next I hope this group realizes that if your job involves parking cars and helping guests - get to it. Standing behind your podium and staring at people won't make your day faster neither will it earn you tips.This hotel is in a great location. Great views of the harbor and near shops and restaurants. My husband used his reward points to stay here and when we checked in the hotel upgraded us to a suite. The suite was nice and clean and had plenty f space for a family of 4. The hotel staff is very courteous and professional. The only complaint I had with the breakfast we ordered from room service. When the food arrived, the food was not warm, and the coffee was not fresh. $70 for breakfast and the food should at least be fresh and hot! Other than that, I would stay at the hotel again.Stayed here for a conference and found the hotel to be OK. The location was amazing.....within walking distance to the harbor. I had a great view of the harbor, too. The amount of money that the hotel cost, I did expect a bit more. Also, I tried to go to the hotel bistro, but it was packed and had to go walking to get some food.After recently staying in the Hyatt Cambridge and having an amazing experience I was very excited to head to Baltimore. Unfortunately the experience did not measure up at all.The staff was equally as friendly and helpful, but the hotel is noisy all the time. I woke up multiple times every single night because of people talking in the atrium (many of whom were employees), yelling in the hallways, hearing people through the walls etc. Some of this they can't control, but if you are looking for a peaceful night this isn't the place to stay.It is located directly across the street from the harbor, which makes it ideal for seeing a lot of Baltimore without needing a to take a cab. I also loved it for a beautiful safe place to run.We also had a few issues with getting the room charges correct and let's be honest dealing with paying too much money is never fun either!5*     location5*     Lobby/hotel decor 4*     Room accommodations (minus faulty ac unit)1*     Noise due to construction/repair during early morning hours1*     Air Conditioning unit that didn't work1*     Rude Employees/Bad customer Service 1*     Unorganized 1*     Bad management total 2.4Great Location.  Decent Hotel and amenities.  AWFUL Customer Service.  I have stayed here many times but after several bad experiences I won't be returning again. My most recent stay was for a medical conference.  We were there on a hot sticky summer week and I received  a room with a faulty A.C. unit.  After a few hours in the room I realized it was not getting any cooler and called customer service to let them know.  They told me someone would return my call...someone did not.  After waiting three hours we did not hear back so we went down to the front desk.  We were told they would call maintenance and have someone come to our room. Nobody came. The next morning (after being awake all night) I requested a room change and the manager was very cold and unapologetic.  I got to the new room which was nice and cool and I was finally able to fall asleep.... Unfortunately, I was not able to stay asleep because about 20 minutes later I heard an excruciatingly loud noise (sounded like a drill against a metal door) I gave it a few minutes thinking it would stop but when it didn't I called back down to customer service and told them about the construction noises.  The young woman at the front desk was very pleasant but she said she was unaware of the situation and transferred me to a manager that told me that there was not currently any construction going on in the hotel and definitely not in the room next door.   Frustrated, I put clothes on and went out to the hallway where I saw the maintenance crew with power tools repairing the door to the next room.  I called back and asked to speak with the manager again.  I couldn't believe it, she continued to argue with me and said that there was no construction or maintenance currently going on and they wouldn't be able to change my room.  I went next door and asked the crew how long they would be, they apologized but said that it would probably be a few hours, I asked them to call the manager and let them know what they were doing.  They thought this was a strange request but they agreed.   I called back downstairs where they told me that they were unaware of the repair (obviously) but there was no apology.  They explained that they would not be able to change my room again without me paying for a more expensive room.   by far the WORST customer service I have ever experienced at a Hyatt!The service was definitely among the very best I've ever encountered. We encountered smiles and friendliness among every employee we met while we were there. It is a very convenient hotel, too --- just a short walk (via over-street bridge) to the Inner Harbor.We were given a Harbor View, simply because my son asked for one. It was spectacular!My complaint --- and this is a complaint I have about many downtown hotels --- is the exhorbitant room service charges. A 12-oz can of diet coke was about $5 when you factor in the service and mandatory gratuity. So an order of two sodas, a plain pizza, and bowl of soup somehow became $51 and change. But, no worries --- the person at the front desk agreed this was unreasonable and knocked a substantial sum off our bill.  This is what I mean about great service - no employee wanted to see us dissatisfied for any reason. We will definitely come back!Horrible food for $16 a person for breakfast, painful beds and TINY rooms. I got the biggest room in the hotel and it had 2 double beds and one disgusting bath room. You have to put your room key in the elevator every time you go past floor 4 which is a pain in the a** and NO FREE WIFI!! $10 for 10 mins!?? OUTRAGEOUS!! Horrible service at the hotel and restaurant, I will never come back!Great service! Was very happy with the staff during my 4 night stay here. They were all accommodating and helpful. There's an outdoor pool and the hotel is located in the Inner Harbor so good location. And Regency Club members get free breakfast, snacks, beverages etc.It is a nice place and has a good location. It is a bit noisy by the traffic and can be warm in summer. Their staff is very friendly.Pros: the desk clerks are incredibly friendly and helpful, and the location is greatCons: The walls are paperthin (you can hear everything in the rooms next door and in the halls). The security people are completely incompetent (they intentionally locked us out of our own room because of a noise complaint from the room next door, then when we complained about that same room later on in the night, they told us that no one was in there).Booked this hotel on Priceline. Got a great deal and was very satisfied with my overall stay. Conveniently located across the street from many restaurants and stores. The checkin and front desk people were very friendly and always had cabs waiting for me when I requested them. The personal attention of the bell staff was phenomenal, impressed me much more than my experience at the Hotel Monaco a few days later. Did not experience any issues with thin walls.I did leave a blazer in the room and was able to track it down and have them hold it for me at the front desk. Really appreciated the above and beyond service here. Kinda hate that they have 4 ESPN channels, but no Bravo or Lifetime (I wanted to see project runway!)Would definitely stay here again!
review_content_80: The location of this hotel along with the pedestrian walkways seemingly make this hotel a good choice. I stayed here for 2 nights to do some recruiting at Johns Hopkins Homewood.The Regency club at this hotel was a complete joke and I can't believe they charge extra for rooms on this level for access to the club. The complimentary hors d'oerves (sp?) consisted of roasted veggies, Costco cheese and canned nuts. Yes, this was on both nights and therefore not an anomaly. The room was absolutely huge although the layout was a bit odd. The desk was on the far side of the room facing away from the tv so I could only watch tv reflected on the mirror above the desk.When coming back to the hotel in the evening there was a HUGE lawyers reception blocking the area from the pedestrian walk to the elevator. I was afraid I was going to get sued just trying to get to my room. Why the hotel set up the reception right in the way of other guests really baffled me as there were private reception areas available.All in all, I wished I were staying down the street at the Intercontinental and confirmed my belief that Hyatt Regencys are overpriced, inconsistent, and cater to convention centers.This hotel was beautiful!My husband and the boys were w/ me.  Hubs was there for buisness.  Everyone was so nice and helpful.  It is right across the street from the harbor.  Room service was nice for late night wings, fries and bread pudding. :)  We ate brunch at their cafe and that was an all you can eat deal.  The boys loved it and tried just about everything.  The food was not a disappointment.  The room was spacious w/ a nice view.  Clean and smelled good.Garbage, the parking lot has no signs so good luck trying to get to the hotel after you park. The idea of a kiosk check in is offensive. After a long trip the least Hyatt could do is staff the front desk in case a guest has a question or needs something.  I arrived at approximately 7:30-8pm on a Friday night in August and there were no hotel employees present so I had to figure out the kiosk check-in and then try to find out where the elevators to the rooms were. This hotel is crap.My boyfriend and I spent stayed at the Hyatt for Valentines Day weekend, and we were incredibly pleased with our stay! The staff was friendly and incredibly knowledgable and the hotel in general was nicely kept. Our only complaint was that our bathroom had a faint cigarette smell. it didn't really bother either of us, but we didn't want to risk being blamed for it at the end of our trip. I told the front desk and they offered us to change rooms, to have housekeeping take care of it, and then comped our parking fee. I was very impressed with their customer service.When we went out to dinner that night, we called down to the lobby and asked for a cab, and ended up having a shuttle drive us straight to our restaurant and then back to the hotel after our meal. The driver was very friendly, and even gave us a complimentary ticket for a free qppetizer!Overall we had a great trip, and I would recommend this Hyatt in particular to anyone.It's a great location if you're attending something at the Convention Center, and the rooms are entirely decent. The staff is courteous and the elevators are fast, but they seem to be a bit incompetent.We faxed in a credit card authorization form to bill a company card *twice* and they still managed to screw it up and bill our personal cards. Apparently whoever received the authorization form just stuffed it in a file somewhere instead of entering it into the system, so the automatic billing just proceeded with our personal cards.I had to convince the desk guy that they actually did have the form (which he found after searching for about 10 minutes) and wait for him to correct all of the reservations while I waited. He kept apologizing, but was just barely competent enough to fix the issue. I don't know about you, but I like dealing with businesses that have their affairs in order and know how to deal with issues decisively and confidently. These guys barely squeaked by.Location is fantastic (right across from the harbor), room is beautiful (comfortable bed, gorgeous wall to ceiling windows with views of the harbor, flat screen TV with ESPN2 -- to watch Euro 2012, of course), nice lobby, and great service make this hotel a solid choice.  Minus one point for no free wifi, often expensive rates, expensive parking, and fine but not amazing food.Everything was fine except for the following:$27 per day for parkingFee to use the wi-fi internet serviceDirty swimming poolJust back from a two night stay at this Inner Harbor location   June 12 & 13   I flew in from Ca to meet my sister who came from PA. Great location for a game at Camden Yards and just about any other activity in and around the harbor.   Can't say enough about the staff.  Incredibly friendly and helpful.  Ryan who greeted us Wed in the lobby was especially charming.  The only reason I'm not giving five stars is a housekeeping detail.  We had a room with 2 beds.  The room only had one robe.  When I called the front desk to ask about another robe the gal basically said no, they only put one robe in the room.  I'm a Hyatt Gold Passport member so I found that response a bit off putting.  Also, when housekeeping changed out the towels Thursday they did not replace the washcloths or hand towels.  Other than these two incidences our stay was quite lovelyLet's start with the deplorable: it took me nearly an hour to check in.  On a normal Saturday evening, say 6pm, they had only two check-in clerks working and at least five people waiting in line for each.  After ten minutes of waiting, I was pointed to a self-check-in kiosk by a staff member (who inexplicably wasn't checking people in).  I stepped out of line to use it, only to have the stupid thing tell me to see an agent.  More waiting, I finally get checked in.  But on arriving at my room, the door won't open.  Even more waiting.  By now I'm late for dinner, great.  When I finally got into a room, the place was clean and modern, just what you would expect.  Plus the usual Baltimore touches where perfection is marred by the odd bit of sloppy work (misaligned plumbing fixtures).  Ahh Baltimore, how I've missed your charm.Between $27/day self-parking and $10/day internet, they're catering to the business types who just expense it all.  Pleasantly, the garage is obviously patrolled by security, so my convertible felt safe.  I loved the automated voice on the parking garage elevators:  "welcome to Baltimore, please remove all valuables and lock your car".  You would be wise to heed that warning.A polite complaint about the checkin process got my internet fee waived without argument, so the hotel earned back a star.  A solid 3, but rather soulless and greedy.My organization hosted an event for our community partners and the venue was great. I'm glad the hotel had a space that wasn't in a stuffy ballroom. Review will change once I actually stay at the hotel. Parking is pretty expensive - but what downtown hotel isn't?Overall, this is a great Hyatt...very clean, modern, and the accommodations are superb. The service is outstanding, and it seems there isn't anything they won't do for you. Location is great...you have the inner harbor just out the front door and you can take the skywalks from the 2nd floor to just about everywhere.My only beef is the fact they have nice HDTVs in each room, but the signal is not HD. You don't have access to changing the settings, so you get a really bad, stretched out picture that is extremely pixelated. Other than that, this Hyatt is great...if I ever visit Baltimore again, I will definitely stay here.I've been staying here since the mid-90's when I come to Baltimore and I've never had any complaints.  The rooms have always been clean, beds comfy & the breakfast buffet or sit-down breakfast in Bistro 300 restaurant has always been wonderful.  I also like the gift shop and the lobby.  It's very nice and we always come back to stay when in Charm City, plus it's right at the Harbor with nice views.I stayed at the Hyatt this past weekend while in Baltimore and was very happy with this hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodated our early check in.The room was a perfect size and the king bed was very comfortable. It also had a partial harbor view which was a nice surprise. The bathroom had a nice tiling detail that reminded us of the ocean.The hotel pool, located on the sixth floor, is a great addition to this hotel. It is clean and very big, with a large selection of chairs. Also there is bar at the pool. The location of the Hyatt is the best in Baltimore, seconds away from the Inner Harbor.I will definitely choose to stay here again!I don't ever write reviews on hotels, nor do I ever write reviews on chain places.  But this Hyatt is an anomaly for me.  I'm actually a Hyatt-ho ever since I used to stay at the huge ass one over in Ann Arbor and collected a trillion points doing so.  I even got married at a Hyatt. But this one was a special experience all together and for one reason only. We got to our room after checking in; we had to settle for 2 queen beds because there was a conference in town and there were no more single kings available - the beds were so SMALL (which is why I docked a point), so I called downstairs.  Nice guy Adam at the front desk told me there were no more king rooms available - and then said hold on.  After a moment of silence he said "come downstairs, I have another room for you".  We get downstairs and Adam is nice as pie, he apologized for the small beds (what can I say? my husband hogs the space) and hands us the new keys. We get to the new room, which is like a closet compared to the first room; but had a huge bed; I walked over towards the closet and notice a huge mirror, floor to ceiling.  As I go closer, I notice that it's not a mirror, but the entrance to a WHOLE OTHER ROOM!  We basically got a sweet penthouse sweet on the corner of the building with some sick views of the Inner Harbor and downtown buildings.  Not to mention, I got a late checkout too. =) Thank you Adam!Two stories - both of which are pretty awesome.First, I showed up atypically early to check in on the 15th.   Turns out I accidentally made a reservation for the 25th!  The short version is that the amazing woman at the front desk, Khahn, 1) didn't make me feel like an idiot, 2) rebooked me for the 15th even though the hotel was near full occupancy, and 3) was able to get me a good rate (and it even had a harbor view).  I don't know what I would have done otherwise.Second, I made a follow-up mistake by leaving my suit in the hotel room when I checked out.  I realized it four days later when I needed to wear it....  So I called up the hotel and spoke with John in security (near Thanksgiving weekend).  After nothing showed up in the system, John went back to the lost and found area and searched through everything until he found the suit.  So I didn't have to go Black Friday shopping.I dislike making such silly mistakes, but I am thankful that the incredibly great staff was there to help me get through it.  Aside- the room (parlor) was quaint, reasonably priced, and had a great view.  I would definitely go back.Can I just review the hamburgers at the bar? Oh dear lord, that was probably the best hamburger I've had in forever. Kinda raw on the inside, a little burnt on the out, on a fresh bun that was just sopping up the juices spilling down my hands. Oh, burger, I want you now. And the fries! The fries too were awesome. Drinks, on the other hand, are highway robbery. The hotel, you ask? The hotel was beautiful, had a great (and I mean great) work out center, and was really attentive to our needs as a huge conference. They even discounted us a ton of money because our needs changed. Not locked into a contract = awesome hotel. Beds are comfy, and my friend even got upgraded to a harbor view because it was her birthday. Love these guys. Eat the burger!I have been here since Tuesday for a conference and I am very impressed and pleased to indicate that the service, food, and facility has been fantastic!I've stayed at Hyatt Regency hotels in Philly, Chicago, and this one in Baltimore. This review pretty much constitutes my take on all three (and probably many other similar properties) although Chicago's doesn't have a rooftop pool like Philadelphia and Baltimore. The good news: great location, friendly staff, impressive atrium and lobby, many nice amenities, small but adequate rooftop pool, very well stocked fitness center, BUT... ENOUGH with the constant nickeling and diming! Just because expense account wielding, per diem brandishing, porn-renting business travelers and the blackberry/airport shuttle/never-leave-the-hotel-crowd are willing to pay for internet doesn't mean non-business, leisure travelers should have to. It's 2009, and internet should be, if not free, at least NOT BLOCKED IN THE LOBBY!! [NOTE: You can take your laptop across the street to the Renaissance Hotel lobby and your wireless will work there.] I suppose $27 a day self-parking is pretty standard, but there's ample street parking available behind the hotel and one block over. And what's the point of having nice new flatscreen, high definition televisions if you're not going to pump in an HD signal? Oh, and I saw Dick Gregory at the hotel bar. I thought he had died, but (if I may paraphrase Mark Twain) reports of his demise apparently have been greatly exaggerated.Atteneded a weddding In Baltimore and This was the Hotel of choice.I couldnt be happier to be Downtown walking distance from a lot of bars and restaurants. About a 15 min drive from the airport. Costs about $30 by cab.The rooms are in keeping with this class of hotel as was the service.My only issue was that the Parking was expensive.We ended up here after our other hotel was flooded. It's quite the story. The staff was professional, friendly and adaptable, and we were very grateful for that! I thought the rooms were really quite nicely designed, the bathrooms in particular.A gripe is that one thing I love about hotel sleeping are the blackout curtains. There are not. The glow a soft orange in the light.

review_content: We went for a weekend getaway and really enjoyed ourselves!  We were within walking distance of many great restaurants with high rating on Trip Advisor and even some featured on DDD!Upon entering the hotel we were greeted by staff and appreciated the grand, big and beautiful entrance way.Our check-in was nearly perfect (we just didn't get the king bed room we booked). The clerk who checked us in was very nice and professional and smiled the entire time.The room we did get was very nice and had an AMAZING view of the harbor (see our pics!).  Room temp control was perfect and quiet.  Bathroom was functional, clean, in perfect working order and had an AMAZING shower!  Bed was comfy but it was good that we got two beds to choose from in our room as one was broken and one side of it was 6" lower than the other side.The staff that we encountered were all friendly, with exception of one complaint we made about a server in Apropoe's, who was rude and not attentive.Concierge was very helpful and friendly.Good attention to detail was noticed in the upkeep of this beautiful grand property!We really enjoyed ourselves and will most definitely be back!Valet pricing is unbelievable for Baltimore... I could see maybe in NYC, but Baltimore? Get real. Came here on a Saturday night for my husband's holiday party. His company has held their event at this location for the last 2 years. They rented out one of the ballrooms and had a cocktail hour, formal dinner, after party and brunch the following morning. The food here was pretty terrible. The bison served at dinner was okay, but the accompanying horseradish tasted and resembled sour cream. The root vegetables were extremely undercooked and all of the water (at dinner, at the after party and brunch) had way too much lemon in it. It was impossible to find water that did not have very pungent lemon in it. Also, none of the bartenders know how to make an Old Fashioned the correct way. Really? That should be like a basic drink that all bartenders know how to make. Following the dinner and dancing, there was an after party in a private room connected to the bar. Again, the food was underwhelming and almost inedible. The sliders were bland and the griddled onions were ice cold. The pizza was not cut all of the way through, so multiple people were tearing pieces apart with their hands and placing the leftover back on the platter (gross!). Brunch the next morning was pretty much a repeat of the night before. For an expensive hotel, you would think the food would be way better and higher quality. If the food wasn't bad, the room sure was! There was a space for a mini fridge, with no mini fridge in it (cheap and tacky). The room walls were paper thin! At 5 a.m. I was woken up by the next room showering and running water and a child crying. This went on for hours. If my husband's company decides to choose this location again, I will make sure to NOT book a room and just go home for the night and also eat a big dinner beforehand.I've been fortunate to stay here several times a year for work and every time is better then the rest! The veiws are stunning and rooms clean and staff friendly. I like the big counter in the bathroom and variety of furniture in the room. Room service is also a bonus! This is one my favorite hotels in Baltimore because I know it will always be a fabulous stay!The only horrible part was the parking.  I phoned down to have my car retrieved, I was told 10 minutes. I was fine with that because checking out and gathering a child under 3 is a task.  I got to the valet stand and they told me they are running behind (it's been 15 minutes or so) I went out side to wait... So after 20 additional minutes I asked for my keys... I told them keep the $45 bucks for valet I requested my car 30 minutes ago and this is far from convenient.  So after 35 minutes my car finally comes and they guy still expected a tip! My tip was fix the incorrect pricing marked at $38 bucks for valet. I think I will be a Hilton person going forward, I feel more valued.This is one of the nicest Marriott hotels that I've ever stayed at!  We were partying in Baltimore for a night and chose to stay here.Check-in was slow due to other events going on that evening (wedding, One Direction Concert, Moonrise Festival, etc.) but check out was swift and they allowed us to check out late.  Valet was also accommodating during our stay. The room was comfortable -- the pillows were plush and there were plenty of towels in the bathroom.  We also had a lovely view of the harbor.  The location is prime and within walking distance to the Inner Harbor area.Let me start by saying I am a frequent marriot user. The hotel itself is great. Newer. Great location. So why 2 stars...... THE STAFF. front desk was fine. But the concierge is a joke. The desk in the lobby was rude. Would not look at me. Ignored me. And when they finally looked up we short and snappy..BTW I was asking about the in house restaurant. But end up going elsewhere due to the impression the concierge left with me. Next day, concierge lounge for breakfast... rude rude rude! No good morning. Just rude blank stares and frozen milk. Usually these lounge are happy, fun places! I will probably look to stay at the another property next month. If this place gets some nicer staff, it would be a 5 star.We only live around 20 miles from the hotel but we love coming to Baltimore and staying here at least twice a year. We've been coming for 5 years now and the hotel just keeps improving. The view has always been amazing in every room we've been in, the breakfast is awesome and of course nothing is better than a Marriott bed. What made our stay last night the best ever was the service. The service here in the past was always a solid 4 star. The service last night went well beyond the maximum 5 stars I can give it. Everyone that we dealt with during our stay was top notch professional. I won't stay anywhere else when I'm in Baltimore.Not the best and not the worst... just okI expected the Marriott Waterfront to be beautiful.  And from the outside, it is.  Even the lobby is beautifully appointed.  Scratch this glossy surface and you see the real Marriott... an aging hotel struggling to keep up.  The room was clean but decor dated.  Perhaps a decade old in appearance.  The furniture is quite worn.  The mattresses are way too soft.  I suspect not by intention but by wear and tear!  My back was stiff every morning from the lack of support.  I could literally feel my body sink into the mattress.  I had to order room service twice.  The first night I had the caesar salad which had a dressing so thick I had to dab it with a fork!  The crab cakes were too dry and rather bland.  The second night, I had the green salad with ranch dressing (not the best ranch I have had but at least fresh greens).  The grilled salmon with broccolini and mashed potatoes was quite good however.Service was not great.  Housekeeping forgot to tidy my room one day and I called the front desk to send someone up while I was out for the evening.  That never happened.  When I checked in, the staff member swiped my card so many times it triggered a fraud lock from my credit card company.  That took 30 minutes to fix.  The only cool thing was the a member of the cast of House of Cards stayed here and was extremely friendly.I have stayed at the Hyatt near the convention center and that was much nicer.  Marriott has some catching up to do!Nice hotel. Great location. Room is comfortable but the hallway on the 27th floor is freezing.My stay at this Marriot was great!  I was impressed with the ambience of the hotel and the front desk reception.  Thanks Iriana!  She was awesome and soooo helpful, she is one of the few reasons why I am still married to Marriot.  She and the staff at this hotel work hard and are superb in giving customer service, professional, and exudes the Marriot brand. This hotel will be on the map for me as a returning guest and suggesting to others to "get married" and visit for those who want to be treated as a royal!I thought this hotel would have had more to offer! The location is nice! Parking is tricky!! $27! No real signs in the garage to let you know where to go once you exit your car. The lobby was cute, fresh orange infused  wAter when you come in, we were greeted right away! The front desk staff were really nice and fast, but not hasty! She gave me a ton of coupons for local restaurants. The room was small. Had some water stains below the thermostat but clean (505) . My tv kept  scrambling!! I couldn't watch a thing!!!! I had a ton of towels, no shower cap, no toothpaste! I guess I expected more from this hotel! I had a good drink at the bistro for happy hour!! Very strong for $5!! Breakfast was not free either it wasn't nasty but again not what u expected for this flagship!! Maybe I had higher expectations for this hotel!! The staff and bed comfort are why I am giving 3 stars ! I just don't think it's worth the money!! I had bigger rooms and more personals offered at a cheaper and lower star hotel!!My wife and I stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary. Wonderful room, excellent view, but the service at the hotel was not up to par.Suite package came with champagne and strawberries, but they took more than 5 hours to arrive, and then only after I called the desk. Strawberries were not chilled, brown stems, still wrapped in plastic? Really? The apology from the person on the phone sounded like she was reading from a script. No follow-up after the fact. Disappointing to say the least.Excellent service and there was always attentive staff readily available to direct us and answer our questions. We had a problem with our room AC and after reporting, we promptly had someone in the room who fixed it quickly. My boyfriend forgot his belt and we were leaving for a wedding in 15 minutes, the manager hooked him up with a new Kenneth Cole belt and we didn't miss our shuttle! The rooms were clean and our bed was comfy. The place is in a nice area and they have  bar and restaurant on the main floor. This is our new place to stay when visiting Baltimore. Highly recommend staying here during your trips as well!What happened Marriott??!?  Guess I haven't stayed at one in a while but the quality has really gone down. Why are my sheets paper thin and the beds looking so cheap?  Is it because I'm on the 7th floor and I should have waited for a better room when I checked in?  My group is taking up at least 13 rooms here tonight and this is just a joke. I use to think Marriott was a decent chain but this experience has opened my eyes. My sink was leaking water so I called front desk. First person had an attitude and didn't apologize.  I had to ask for a supervisor. Then the supervisor offered sending someone to fix it but it's already 12am and I'm in my pjs. He told me that the cost is already being billed to the group. I don't care who's paying for it but where's the customer service?  It's almost seems like he thought I shouldn't care because I'm not personally paying for the room. Also, the door between my room and the adjoining room isn't completely sealed. Light shines through the bottom of the door enough to illuminate my room so I had to stuff a few towels in between. Location 4 starsCustomer Service 2 stars Cleanliness of room 3 starsBedding 2 stars (they used to have down comforters)Bathroom products 2 stars I will think twice before staying at another Marriott again. Did they recently have some budget cuts?  Normally my group uses boutique hotels so I'm surprised that we are even staying here. I asked for the manager to call me tomorrow morning for a solution so we'll see if that happens.This hotel is in Baltimore's Inner Harbor. The staff were friendly, polite, and supportive of our requests for assistance. They were able to help with vegetarian and vegan options for food during a wedding we attended. Parking is in an adjacent lot for $26 with in-out privileges. Pay slightly more for a harbor view room.Beautiful hotel right on the water.  You are able to walk to numerous restaurants in the area.  hotel staff super friendly and very accommodating.  Valet parking is expensive but that was expected for this area.  The breakfast buffet was reasonable considering everything they offered.  I would definitely stay at this hotel againLove the location. - it is right on the water with a watet taxi stop.  The associates a very friendly and helpful.  My only complaint is the bed.  The bed was too soft and the pillows way too fluffy.  My neck got a crick in it while I was attempting to sleep with it.  The bed  cost the Marriott one star; otherwise I would have rates it a 5 star.Now I had the pleasure of staying here for a work event for two nights. The stay was simply amazing. The view was very nice. I truly enjoyed my stay. They take customer service to another level and make sure all needs are met.The in house restaurant was one of the best I've been too in a hotel. They even have really good drinks. I was able to get my champagne and St.Germaine. The only complaint I have was the annoying alarm clock from the room next door which woke me up at 12:49 AM. I had to make two request to have it turned off. My suggestion would be to make sure you disable the alarm clock after a person checks out.If you need a place within this area, I would highly recommend them. I would give the 4.5 if we can do half stars.Great location and beautiful views of the harbor and bay.... it was an amazing hotel with a great elite club and breakfast. The room service, although expensive, was good. I would return for business or leisure.This location would get 5 stars if it had a slightly better room service for price, and was a little less expensive.  I feel you are paying for location not so much value.Was here for a conference and have to say this is a beautifully designed hotel. The bathrooms are great. I loved the bamboo decorations. I did not get into the hotel rooms so I can't speak to those.
review_content_20: Here on a work trip, this hotel was perfect location for many reasons.  Near an amazing running trail and some pretty incredible restaurants, this hotel needs to be considered on your next trip to Baltimore.  Impressive hotel bar and solid workout room, this Marriott ranks high on my list!  My only complaint is an odd one...be weary of the shower floor.  I fell as I stepped inside it this morning and laid there for a moment wondering if I broke something.  Please Marriott, put some grippers in your tubs or change to a different cleaning solution.This hotel is in a great location right on the water and soon as you walk out the door and make a right there is the water taxi landing. All of the staff was friendly and the room was clean and had great views of the inner harbor.  if you're in the area you should try this hotel out.I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times. Never any problems.  This time was awesome !! We were greated and checked-in by Jesus who we later found out was Hispanic like us. He give us an inner harbor view rather than the city view. That was much appreciated and thank Jesus for that. We had a great stay and will continue to go back to this hotel when in Maryland.Always seem to have an issue at this hotel, wether it's no hot water, a noise problem, or poor TV service. Plus, as a Gold Elite, I would expect at least a bottle of water in the room, but nothing. Also have a room adjacent to the elevators (despite my preference to be away from them) and have to listen to them all night. Plenty of other options in this area. I'm done with this property.Second time staying at this gorgeous hotel.I was injured on my job during my stay and needed a wheelchair and crutches.The entire staff took care of me and made sure I had everything I needed to be comfortable. The service has been impeccable and all of the staff went WAY out of their way for me.Food was excellent but it's the kindness and courtesy of the staff that keeps me coming back.The warm, salt water pool is great, also!I had the pleasure of staying here for the Kronos PCW  conference and was very impressed not only with the nice room (I had a gorgeous view on the harborside) but with the level of service and food they had for the conference. It's a beautiful hotel that is a little aged but still a great place to stay. The location is perfect as we all walked back from a dinner cruise across the harbor stopping at many attractions along the way. And on the other side you head towards Fells point and little Italy where there's lots of food and shopping. The staff was very attentive and were readily available for transportation when we needed it without having to wait. Definitely somewhere we would enjoy staying again.If you are staying in Baltimore, stay here. It's a gorgeous hotel, in a more than perfect location. It's within walking distance of the harbor, power plant, and countless restaurants and bars. We stayed on the 30th floor. Gorgeous view of the harbor from our room. Room was clean and well stocked. The staff is nice and helpful. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because of the following;We stayed here in late March. It was cold that weekend (30 degrees) and the lobby was FREEZING due to people not using the revolving door. They used the large handicapped ones that stayed open for a period of time, letting all the cold air into the hotel. You honestly couldn't walk into the lobby without a jacket. If you were at apropoes (their in house restaurant/bar) it was cold in there as well. We were missing a blanket on one of the beds. We didn't take notice at first because the duvet cover was on the bed, there was no duvet in it however. By the time we got in from our evening, it was late and we didn't feel like dealing with the hassle. And lastly. The Starbucks. Good grief. The people running the Starbucks were clueless. I waited 17 minutes for 3 lattes. There was 2 people working and  they were unorganized and didn't seem to be "with it" at all.Overall, it was an amazing hotel. Id absolutely stay there again.The location is positively perfect.  Staff is very nice.  Love the valet guys and the guy that facilitates out there who looks like Secret Service.  They were all so nice!  We had a corner King with an amazing Harbor View.  Very clean, nice and reasonable for the level/city/view that it is.For two nights, I have dealt with loud noises from the room next door. The first night, I couldn't sleep. They allowed some party. The second night (now), they continue. There must be 20 people in the room. I have called the front desk. They sent a security guard up who asked them to be quite.. but they have not. Wny would the guard not have told them of having too many people in the room? Can they be moved to another room? I am paying a signifiant price for this room and am very displeased with the experience.... The good side - the view was good.Beautiful  weather and that was the extent  of it.  Checked in and used the bathroom.  As I sat there, water splashed  up on my ass!  OK something  must be wrong.  This is not a bidet?  Called room service  and a very nice gentle came to check toilet.  As we asked him about the area, the toilet decided to flush on its own.  Marriott  decided to move us to another room.  View of the harbor was gone, king size bed, gone!   We asked to be moved.  We final move to a nice room with everything  we wanted.  My wife was freshening up and came out  of the bathroom  and almost fell!  There was water covering the floor outside the bathroon!  3:30 am in the morning  and this of all things.  Again,  called room service  and we were moved to another room.  And compensated for the night, really?  I have been running  around all night changing  rooms.  I was under the impression this would be a nice visit in a nice hotel.  Baltimore  harbor  was over priced and not really too much to do unless your an alcoholic.    Thanks but no thanks.This is the most gorgeous hotel.  The lobby is classy, yet inviting.  We ate in the restaurant quite a bit and the food was tasty.  All of the staff from reception to bell man to wait staff are top notch with their customer service.  The room was well-cleaned and taken care of.  The view was awesome!  I don't have enough good things to say about this hotel.  We stayed 10 days and 9 nights.  If you are going to the airport, take their flat rate vehicle back to the airport - much more reasonable than a taxi.  Love the location as you can get to all the activities around the harbor.  Restaurants are a bit expensive in the surrounding area - the James Joyce pub is very reasonable nearby, and the Hawaiian restaurant has impeccable food and service for a nice date night.I work in event planning and have worked with many hotels, including other Marriotts. If you are planning an event in Baltimore, I'd recommend finding a different hotel in the area. The event staff at this hotel is very difficult to work with.
