I called every day for two weeks trying to get a hold of an events person to book a meeting room. I was told there was only one events person I could talk to, and was always transferred to her voicemail, and my calls were never returned. I asked to speak to anyone else who could help me, and was told there wasn't anyone else in events. When I finally got in touch with that person, I was tossed around to two other people (evidently they had two other events people...). When I finally was put in touch with someone to work with, they didn't assist with booking the AV equipment, but told me I needed to call that office to do it myself. They also quoted me a different price on the food than was on their menu. When I would call to get clarification or help, they acted very inconvenienced and were short with me. I am trying to book a very small meeting - lunch meeting for 10 people - and it has taken 4 weeks so far. Everything still isn't done because they haven't sent me the credit card payment sheet. I highly recommend using a different hotel for your meetings.Stayed NYE.  Simple breakdown on the hotel:Cleanliness- 5/5Customer Service- 5/5 (Assistant Mgr, I think her name was Andrea, was so helpful.  Ordered and had terrible service getting take out Pizza they recommended.  She was so professional, friendly and helpful and helped me with my issues. Great Manager)Room Amenities:  3/5- We have stayed at SEVERAL lower value hotels in cities all over that came standard with microwave.  This room didn't have one which disappointed me but wasn't a deal breaker.  One thing that was terrible and made it unbearable to sleep was how silent it was.  The room felt so quiet, there was no fan fan option to keep a constant flow of air  and some noise and it was either cold or hot.  No in-between.  We were also stuck in a handicap room which felt strange, even more so when it took 5 mins to close our door and double that time to figure out how to turn the shower on.I would not stay at this hotel again for the price combination and lack of room amenities and comfortability but would recommend to someone looking to stay in the area for customer service alone.Thanks!Got a great deal on Friday night of opening day, room was much better than the game.  Walking distance to the harbor shops.  Very clean.  Nice cafe and bar. Shower was like a power washer, so no water pressure problems here.  Beds were comfy.It's a Marriott. It's a hotel. Nothing that makes me go WOW.  There are chain standards etc. My boyfriend and I were here for a conference he was attending. Good thing he double checked at check in, they were going to give us a room with two double beds, when he clearly booked a king. Because they "made a mistake" we were given a "free harbor view upgrade".  Eh, ok, whatever.  We got up to our room and that upgrade was worth it, as our nightly view has been amazing!That being said, these are PAPER THIN walls!!! We have a room that could be adjoining to the room next door, and the amount of things we hear, are ridiculous. We've heard our neighbor's "romantic interludes", as well as (no lie), a morning fart. (To name the more memorable things we've heard.) Doors slam, no bumpers, no soft close hinges...nothing.So to conclude: decent hotel, but bring earplugs.I appreciate the automatic room upgrade they do for platinum members , like yours truly ;).  We get the best view all the time. Great customer service.Great location and comfortable beds. Not so great service and unclean rooms. Our room had food on the floor and hairs in the bathroom. There are no vending machines and room waters were $4.Great ambiance as soon as you walk into the lobby.. Complementary Apple cider and fruit infused water also offered in lobby. Only compliant was that the door keys kept giving us a problem and we had to make multiple trips to main desk for new keys.After completely destroying my girlfriend's apartment's ceiling with a fire sprinkler (don't ask), I was unable to clean up in her completely flooded bathroom (don't ask) and ended up driving both of us - one of us (me) covered in flecks of ceiling and stupdiity - to the Marriott Waterfront for an emergency hotel room at 4:00 AM.  The man at the desk took my money, did not ask why I was covered in bits of ceiling, and let us stay in the room slightly past check-out time.  Enough said.Worst place that me and my family has ever been too !!!!!!  We went down over the holiday weekend 5/23-5/24, We get there we check into our room, the bathroom was not cleaned it had BM on the toilet yet !!!!!!! Then we get the room was by the elevator, weheard the thing going up and down all night. This wasn't the kicker. It was when we had ordered room service witch by the way sucks !!!! So we put the cart outside the door for them to take ( now mind you its 10:00 at night ) the next morning we got up to go out and it was still there. At 1:00 when we got back from going out it was still there and our room wasn't even cleaned yet !!!! So we call the front desk they said somebody will be there to clean the room. So they accommodate us by giving us chocolate bars , chocolate cookies and soda!!!!! REALLY this was not what we were expecting from this hotel that is very pricey!!!! I will NEVER return to this hotel again
review_content_40: I booked a one night stay at the Baltimore Marriott on Priceline- I was expecting a crappy, parking-lot view room, and so was pleasantly surprised to find myself on the fifteenth floor with a gorgeous harbor view.  Even though the rooms here feel a tiny bit tired (the hotel just seems in need of an update -- a fresh coat of paint, some brighter lights in the bathroom, and so on), the harbor views are spectacular, and the rooms are spacious even if, as is often the case at Marriotts, you might feel nickled and dimed a lot ($12.95 for internet, $25/night for self-parking).  The one piece of advice I have: this is a thin-walled hotel, and the staff seems to know it (the sign by the elevator on the 15th floor urged guests to be quiet as they walked down the hallway!) - you will hear folks in the hallway even when they are quiet, and you will hear when your neighbors turn the water on in the morning for a shower.  So I could imagine in the busy season when the hotel is full, things could be a bit noisy.If you're coming to Baltimore, this is certainly one of the hotels you want to put on your list. It has an excellent  view of the harbor, and It is also the perfect hotel for any wedding party. Expect to see a sea of brides making their way through the lobby during the summer months, The rooms are plush and elegant, and it is no wonder this location is so popular with those planning a wedding. The Baltimore Marriott Waterfront boasts a professional and excellent staff. However, my only complaint involves the valet and bellman service. I asked a valet to retrieve my wedding gift from the trunk of my car, and I even tipped him in advance. However, when he returned, my gift was missing its card, but to his credit he retraced his steps and found the card in the parking garage. This still would have been ok; hey, accidents happen. However, later that day I was tasked with driving 30 miles to pick up the wedding party's flowers. I was under a serious time crunch and managed to make it back with just 5 minutes to spare. I had to park my friend's car (not valet parked), so I asked a bellman to take the flowers to the bride's suite while I parked the car. I gave him the room number and the name of the wedding party in case there was a problem, but 15 minutes later I got a call that the flowers had not arrived. One of the bridesmaids went down in the lobby and found the flowers just sitting on a cart like so much discarded trash. Now, I don't know if you have ever seen a matron of honor on the warpath, but i can tell you it is not a pretty sight.To be fair, the wedding was a huge success and all was forgiven. Also, the bell captain was extremely understanding which means a lot. Except for this one incident, the weekend was flawless, but I still have to 4 stars instead of 5 stars. Still, this hotel would always be my first choice for its location, rooms, and genrally excellent staff.Waiting for my room and already I rate this better than the Hyatt Baltimore. The lobby / lounge / coffee/bar area has a cool vibe and a great place to hang out and kill time if you need to. Free WiFi for the day is also a bonus in comparison to the Hyatt, and almost a given with any hotel that wants to cater to any business traveller. Might change my rating once I see the room, but so far, including service, far and above the Baltimore Hyatt. Can't exactly complain about the waterfront view either...Staff is wonderful, the location is perfect and the rooms were nice.  I'll be coming back!Pretty hotel. Not luxury. Rooms were small and noisy. I could hear showers and movement in the surrounding rooms. Staff was great. Thier only restaurant apropoes was great for a bar and breakfAst, but the regular menu was pretentious and not kid friendly. The pool lifeguard was great. Nice sauna. The rooms need updating.GOODLocation is ideal and central. Gym. Swimming pool. Outdoor terrace. Restaurant. Staff was super nice and friendly.NOT SO GOODMy coffee cup had stains and lipstick - asked for a new one - got the same one back.Room was facing the same side as the outdoor concert space. Music can be played until 11pm, so check your room or the concert schedule in advance.What a wonderful location for a company meeting! Our company meeting this week has been amazing! The staff here has done everything possible to provide a fabulous experience for this company meeting, housing and feeding and providing for over 1000 people! Thank you, Marriott!!This hotel and its employees are top-notch. I stayed here in Feb. 2015 for a long weekend with 13 add'l family members (over 4 rooms), and our stay was terrific.We had a fantastic meal at Apropoe, and our waitress Ashley was a gem. She went above and beyond in making us feel well cared-for. I really like that this hotel is quiet, despite having a very full hotel that weekend, and running numerous private events in the ballrooms including a major fund-raiser and a wedding. The central location and beautiful views enhance the overall vacation experience.My only note for improvement is that the prep for our food and drinks in the bar and in the restaurant took way too long, but I got the sense that the kitchen was slammed. Fortunately the quality of the food and our our attentive waitress made it all worth it.I recently stayed at the Baltimore Marriott for a 3-day conference, and really enjoyed my visit. I don't typically feel super comfortable in hotel rooms, but my room at the Marriott was clean, the pillows and bed were comfortable, and the shower had normal water pressure, all of which contributed to my comfortable stay. The restaurant bar located in the hotel lobby is a fun place to hang out and meet other conference attendees. I can only speak for the white crab pizza, but it's delicious! The customer service at this hotel is also great. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The only con to my stay was that the noise in the hallway was somewhat bothersome, especially at 2:30am on the Saturday night of my stay. Given the large size of the hotel, it makes sense that there would be several events taking place at the same time; however, I woke up 2 out of the 3 nights of my stay due to people talking in the hallway and the sound of doors closing (i.e., bring your own white noise). Nonetheless, I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed my stay, and would definitely book with the Marriott again.A first-class business hotel and conference center in the heart of Baltimore's Inner Harbor. Little Italy and Fells Point are both just a short walk away, as are dozens of outstanding restaurants, shops and attractions. I can't imagine a better place to stay when visiting Baltimore for business or pleasure.Great location, but be sure to ask for the specific view and bed size you want or you will end up facing the parking lot like we did!  Walls are VERY thin, so there's nothing to be done if you have noisy neighbors.  Very corporate and busy hotel, so it's hard to receive consistent customer service.  Housekeeping barged in on us after knocking before we had the chance to say "come back later!"The Marriott was a really nice hotel in a great location. It is right near a water taxi stop, going to be right by a free water taxi (Harbour Connector), and also sits on the Green and Orange Charm City Circulator routes. The hotel is in a quieter area of downtown right on the water. There are offices, new condos and shops and restaurants nearby. It looks like a really newly developed area and there was still some construction, though not near or in the hotel so it didn't cause any issues. The free circulator routes get you to the main downtown or fun areas like Fell's Point very quickly. There are lots of great comfy seating areas on the lobby level of the hotel with free Wifi: a busier area by the restaurant and a smaller quieter area by the concierge. The gym is on the 5th floor separated from the lobby by two banquet levels. Rooms on high floors I would say are preferable and of course Harbour view rooms. I enjoyed the view of the Harbour from my 14 floor room. Even standard rooms come with three massive floor to ceiling windows which are just great for taking in the sunrise/set. The room did heat up quite a bit thanks to the big windows so I had to keep the AC on, but the view is still worth it. The rooms had a nice entrance to them, painted in an accent colour of red. The little coffee bar with glass shelves and the double door white closet were nice contrasts to this space. On the other side was the bathroom. It was pretty basic with a shower/tub combo and single sink. It was well stocked with various towel size options though. However I only found one bar of soap and no liquid soap so I had to share that one bar between the shower and sink. There were plenty of plugs both on the desk and on the lamp next to the bed for plugging in iDevices. Each headboard also had a little worm light coming out of it so you could read in bed without disrupting a roommate (not that I had one - there were only double bed rooms when I checked in). That's not a complaint however. I checked in at 0830 so I was really impressed to be given a great view, despite the extra bed, before the breakfast guests of the night before even cleared. Marriott made a move to win me over there! I didn't have a chance to eat in the restaurant as there are so many great spots nearby. There is a small cafe though with grab and go options I stopped in before check out. All in all a great stay and I'd do it again next trip for sure!Wonderful hotel great location and amenities recent upgrades to the restaurant called apropoe and the bar and inside seating area made this it must stop will come back here once a year in October like we have been for the past few years thanks Marie appreciate your hospitalityAs far as Marriotts go, this is one of the better ones.  I spent almost a week here for a conference, and while I didn't spend much time in my room (despite the fact it had FANTASTIC harbor view), I will say that every single employee I encountered went above and beyond.  There have been instances when I have been at a hotel for a conference my company was hosting, and the staff either wasn't friendly, was absent, or had the personality of a turnip.This was not the case here.  Everyone was fantastic, from the valets, to the front desk staff, to those who worked banquets.  I know many of my peers hold their meetings here, and I would recommend it to anyone.  Be forewarned, however, that if your meeting is large and you have a lot of breakout rooms/exhibit space, it will most likely be on two floors, although the escalator is very conveniently located.It does take some navigation, but with proper signage, it's easy enough to figure out.This hotel is in such a great location! They're just a short walk from a ton of bars and restaurants. The staff is so helpful and informative. Will definitely be back!Wow. What a fabulous hotel. The views of the harbor are absolutely spectacular. I stayed here for a work conference and really enjoyed everything about it. The location of being right off the harbor enabled us to be able to just take a walk around the harbor, or just grab a bite to eat at one of the many restaurants near by. Of course the weather being sunny and fall like just added to the experience.Our meals during the work day were catered by the hotel and the food was very good. The rooms were very clean and extremely comfortable. My co-worker had higher status so she got a suite which was very roomy...two sets of windows to view the harbor.For those who have access to and are into hearing about the concierge lounge...the views and food there were excellent too.Service overall was top notch. However I chose the self-park option ($27) versus valet ($40) for parking the car.Besides the hotel location being prime for the harbor view, it also was only ~20 minutes from the airport (though I am sure that can change based on the traffic).I really enjoyed my stay here, it was everything I could expect. The room was comfortable and spotless with great views of the harbor and downtown. There was a large wedding here during my stay and I didn't notice it at all except when I had to walk through people in the lobby, so points for the quiet stay up on the room levels. The staff was very helpful and answered questions, helped me out with a problem/adjustment to my bill, and were otherwise excellent. Room service was good, service was quick and friendly, and the portions were generous. I was able to leave my bags with the front baggage people and wander around the harbor for a few hours between check-out and when I had to leave for the airport. The staff outside is great at giving directions or grabbing you a cab in a matter of seconds. The location is excellent and within walking distance to everything in the Inner Harbor as well as down to Fell's Point. I walked maybe 10 blocks back from Fell's Point in the middle of the night after not finding a cab who would take me the short way and had no issues.The Baltimore Marriott Waterfront is a swank hotel located in a little shopping/restaurant plaza in Baltimore. It lives up to the waterfront name with an awesome view of the harbor if you pony up more money for a room with a view. However, you can name your own price on priceline and end up with this hotel for a good price, and the rate qualifies you for a room with a partial view. The lobby and room are both very modern and clean, and the staff here is really attentive and accommodating. My only complaint is that you have to park in the parking structure next door, and it's a bit cumbersome to take three elevators to get to your room. Also, there are no ins and outs, so you have to pay each time you enter and exit. If you plan on going in and out, it's better to pay the $5 extra to valet ($40/night) versus the $35 max for the parking structure.Beautiful hotel with a perfect location in Harbor East. I stay here whenever I can. Check in was fast and the breakfast buffet was delicious. They just re-vamped the hotel restaurant and the area is sleek and stylish. Definitely recommend this hotel for travelers.This hotel does not remind you of the Marriott property.  The staff does not do very well at communicating amongst each other nor do they even do a good job at communicating with guests. I called the hotel to check on parking and was told three different stories before getting to the facility and then when I get here there was a fourth story which is unacceptable. My faucet in my shower is leaking and has not been repaired. I advised the front desk of this leaky faucet Friday and it is now Sunday I am sure their maintenance on staff 24 seven with a facility like this. I would not return to spend personal money here.
review_content_60: Love it!I come here every so often for some fun in the city, the staff are competent and know what they are doing. Check in took about a minute and I was in my room in 2. Rooms are spectacular, and the views are amazing, no matter what angle.I really like the pool. But the lifeguards are nazis with the kids.Way over priced. Our rooms had a  beautiful view but the bathroom was tiny and cheep. Pillows were not great. And you can hear through the walls. Also we had terrible service at the restaurant. The waitstaff was disorganized. Waited forever for pancakes.  I will never stay again especially for what they charge. Next time it's the Four Seasons.I've stay at many hotels in my day and just recently started travelling again. Just finished a week at this Marriott and I had a very pleasant experience. My room was clean and I had great view of the city.The food at the restaurants were better than I expected.Everyone who helped us, from the front desk to the bellman was very efficient and friendly.I would highly recommend this hotel and it is walking distance to many great restaurants and things to do.Worse experience. My door would stay open and a man walked into my room. He said the door was open. I called  downstairs and they sent security and told me it was not an employee. This man was obviously coming into my room to steal my things. The entire rest of my stay I became very paranoid that this man would come back and try to get back in. I did not feel security was taking it very seriously. I then later realized he was coming off the street and going door to door trying to open doors and my broken door that would not close properly was his ticket in. Very unimpressed with my stay. They was also supposed to send an engineer to check out the door but no one came.Came here for the Emmy's (my husband was nominated, not me!). The hotel itself was gorgeous, much more so than I expected for a Marriott in Baltimore. Loved the huuuuge chandeliers in the ballroom. The service was also fabulous as our ~1000 person dinner service was flawless and every step of the way there was someone on staff to direct us.I stayed here last week and had a great experience. Very friendly and helpful staff. We came in town for an Orioles game and was able to walk there from the hotel. Nice stores and restaurants in the immediate area. I would definitely stay here again.Was a wonderful place to stay during my conference.  Friendly staff all around where they constantly greeted you and asked you for help if you looked lost.  Clean rooms, quiet, and relaxing.How does a girl almost completely ruin her engagement proposal from her boyfriend-turned-fiancee? Really, I have been silently giggling at the almost perfect night at this Marriott this weekend; and, how I managed to totally throw my fiancee's surprise plans out of the hotel's scenic window! The quizzical look on the staff member's face after she saw us standing in front of the room with bags at an unexpected hour - priceless. That's another story altogether... The hotel, itself, was beautiful. The valet service was a bit inattentive initially, but came through in the end. The location is prime, and obviously a major factor of why I'm giving it four stars. The room was nice, but the bathroom lacked a certain distinction that I've seen in many other hotels. The best part about our room was the view. Actually, we got a surprise peek at a "neighbor's" not-so-private party in his hotel window... All we saw were socks up in the air - perhaps he had just proposed to her, too? Although the bed was comfortable, I didn't sleep much from pure excitement. Overall, the hotel service & charm of the Waterfront contributed to its excellence, so if you're ever in town you know where to book.....The Marriott is a gorgeous high-rise of a hotel perched on the edge of the sparkling waters of the Inner Harbor. Uniformed bellhops assist with bags in an impossibly high ceilinged lobby lined with perfectly arranged flowers and polished marble floors.  Fancy-schmancy one might say.The desk clerks are cool; not the "hey, dude, welcome to this totally awesome hotel" but more  icy cool... efficient, professional, a tad snooty even.But, no mattter, the rooms are fabulous - remarkably comfortable beds, pillows like clouds, power strips smartly placed on desks, impeccably clean and well suited for business trips.Request a room on the highter floors with a view. Enjoy the delicious coffee from your own Keurig coffee maker. Beware of the wifi and inroom internet... $12.95 per day.Try the crab and smoked corn chowder at the downstairs restaurant... (out of this world!) Lots of great dining otions within walking distance and the aquarium is right across the bridge.Overall, excellent experience.Don't stay here during spring ... A/C is not on yet, rooms are hot, and they have nothing but thick comforters on the beds.  It's like sleeping in a Sauna. Apparently they have no woven blankets at all.  I've tried 4 times to get a blanket.  I just get more comforters.This review is NOT for the hotel since we live in the area and didn't stay here. My husband and I enjoyed the Star Spangled Celebration on Sunday and decided to go into the Marriott to grab a drink and some appetizers, because we had a Marriott gift card. I asked the bartender if he had any special margaritas, maybe a flavor. He said, "no just regular" My husband asked for a bloody mary and I agreed to the "regular" margarita and we each ordered the Caesar salads, mine with shrimp and his with grilled chicken and some waters. I said to my husband that he could have said that he could float some grand marnier on top, something! We got our drinks in 10-12oz highball glasses. No salt on mine, wasn't asked if I wanted salt or not but assumed a "regular" margarita came with salt. Also since we ARE in Baltimore that my husbands bloody mary would have been rimmed in some old bay. Both drinks were garnished with a lime on the sides. We had to ask for the waters 5 minutes later and for him to wipe the bar which was a sticky mess. A second bartender showed up and we watched him make more than one bloody mary for different patrons and he rimmed 16oz pint glasses with what looked like old bay, garnished with a lime and an olive. The 2nd bartender was in front of us and I asked him if those were bloody marys and he said yes. I asked why our bartender would offer us the 10-12oz glass, no old bay and only a lime. His response was that he was probably trained that way. WHAT? We asked our bartender for the check, we were so turned off we couldn't wait to get out of there. He gave us the check and said that our salads would be right out. I told him we no longer want the salads. He just rang our drinks and handed us that. We didn't even bother with the gift card, we paid cash. Then the 2nd bartender asked if we wanted him to make us another bloody mary---how about my drink?? Offer this AFTER we asked for the check? I asked my husband how much the check was since I saw him leave a $20, he said $9 each with tax $19.02. I would have asked for the change!!. I am certain we paid  the same price the patrons with the 16oz glasses paid for theirs. I believe I saw bartender #2 speaking to bartender #1 and we're hoping he was letting him know why we were leaving and left him such a small tip. We left there and went to the Four Seasons where we were offered impeccable service, great drinks, even got the happy hour prices and ordered some appetizers.The sad thing about this is we aren't nitpicky people at all, may sound like it if you don't know us and are reading this review. I've work in the customer service field and my husband works with the public. We are very generous tippers also, even if the service is just ok as long as it's not bad. This experience at the Marriott was bad all the way around.Beautiful hotel, comfortable room and bed, gorgeous views of harbor, good food...only gripe is that rooms are beyond noisy!! Can hear every little thing going on in adjacent rooms from toilets flushing, showers running, and the ice machine! I asked the front desk for ear plugs and they didn't have any, so I had to sleep with my tv on to try and drown out the noise, which is not something you'd expect to have to do at this type of hotel.While staying here I also attended a conference in the building. The conference rooms were comfortable and the food was great. It was nice to be able to get drinks (coffee, tea, soda, etc) throughout the day and for free.All in all the views were great and it was a nice place, but the only way I'd come back is if it was paid for by work again!The conference I just attended was booked here; while we were offered a special rate, I truly couldn't afford to stay in such a posh hotel, even at a discount. So I have no information on the rooms; this'll be about the conference area.The space was on a grandiose scale, with southern colonial architectural details (complete with a bar lounge tailored to feel like a GOP cigar-and-brandy gentleman's club). The ceilings were at least 25 feet high -- 50, in the escalator foyer between the third and fourth floors... and on the conference room floors, there was this interesting Alice-in-Wonderland feel -- giant oversized wing chairs in yellow leather, checkered walls, carpet in primary colors. I had to take a picture in one of the chairs; I only lacked a teacup and a giant hat for the picture to be complete.The conference rooms were HUGE. Vast, cavernous, and very cold. We sat shivering through lecture after lecture; I resorted to sitting next to the electrical outlet and plugging in my laptop so it would generate some heat. I understand that a room filled with people can get muggy and stuffy, if not properly air-conditioned; I just wish the system were a bit more responsive to the particular circumstances. It's possible that the ridiculously high ceilings made climate control on a human scale impossible.The service machine was very, very smooth. However, if you happened to be eating or drinking anything (there were multiple receptions), you had to physically hang onto the plate/glass, or it would be whisked away, no matter how full it was. I actually engaged in a tug-of-war with one such plate-whisker: with my mouth full of the bite I had just taken, I noticed a hand reach over my left shoulder, and latch onto my mostly-full plate."MMMM!" I said. She didn't actually let go of the plate. I scowled at her, my mouth still too full to swallow. She seemed to acquire the idea that something was wrong. "You're not done?" she asked. Thinking to myself, Does it look like I'm done? It's a full plate! I just sat down and I'm still chewing!, I say "MM-MMM!" She finally relinquished her grip on the plate. But I turned around, clutching my plate, and noticed that another dish-whisker had removed my glass of wine, while I fought for my food. Dammit, I paid for that! (I wonder if the food is just for show... they don't actually want you to eat any of it?) Regardless, the food was consistently excellent (and I have high standards).On Halloween, the hotel actually had free cupcakes, hot chocolate and hot spiced cider in the lobby... VERY GOOD hot chocolate (I couldn't make myself stop drinking it long enough to try the cider). They also offered Starbuck's coffee with every meal service. And while Starbuck's isn't my fave, it was at least REAL coffee, not some industrial truck-stop yuckwater. I drank entirely too much of it, trying to stay warm, and probably resembled an epileptic Chihuahua, to anyone brave enough to try to converse with me.As I was staying at another hotel, and required taxis to travel to and from it, I saw rather a lot of the doormen. They were universally wonderful, hailing cabs, hoisting my rolling laptop carrier into the trunk, stopping the cab that first tried to rip me off and then started to take off with my luggage (the cab-driver didn't start the meter, and tried to charge me twice what it normally cost to make the trip)... friendly, efficient, and professional staff. I made sure to thank them specifically when I left for the last time.Would I stay here, in the future? If I could find a roommate or two to make the trip affordable, I would, happily.What a wonderful experience--if only all hotel stays were like this! My boyfriend and I stayed  at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront on New Year's Eve, and the hotel pulled out all the stops. We were greeted with a champagne welcome and sped through check-in. The bell hops and front desk staff were extremely friendly, helpful, and professional. The hotel lobby and various sitting rooms were festive and lovely. Our room was spacious, impeccably clean, comfortable, and modern, with a gorgeous city/harbor view. As Marriott Rewards Elite members, we received a bottle of free champagne and New Year's Eve favors. We were also invited to a members' party to ring in the new year, but we had other plans for the evening.The hotel is in an excellent location in Baltimore--very upscale. Although we stayed only one night, it was an excellent experience. I highly recommend this hotel! We will be sure to return!Beautiful hotel with all the amenities- free wifi in the lounge, great fitness center, clean rooms and friendly staff. Also can't beat the views of the inner harbor! The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is the proximity to the outdoor concert venue Pier 6... my last night in the hotel there was a DJ playing house music there, and the bass was so loud that it literally shook the entire building for hours, until 11pm when the venue is required to close.Full Disclosure:  I'm a Platinum member with Marriott and used points/ free night voucher for this trip.OMG!!  What a great vacation!It all started with an email from my pre-arrival co-ordinator Fulden, asking if we had any special requests.  She followed up with another email telling us she was going to give us a complimentary upgrade to a corner room (more windows) with a Harbor View.  I loved the personal service!Upon arrival, our room was not ready (it was noon, and check in was at 4pm, so no biggie).  We dropped our luggage with the valet and headed off to lunch at Miss Shirley's and an afternoon at the National Aquarium.Once in our room, we opened all the curtains and lost our breath to the view.  Gor-geous!  The room itself was spacious-ly small, elegantly appointed.Concierge Level is open to the Marriott muckity mucks (not sure how high a level you need to be to get in).  It is open from 6am to 10pm, providing unlimited fancy Starbucks coffee and tea, water, soft drinks, internet and printer access, lounging area, etc.  We did breakfast one day (made to order omelet, french toast, fresh fruit, bacon), soup lunch another (crab corn chowder), and evening apps another (wings, hummus and pita, more fresh fruit, brie and crackers).  Very nice perk, and I'd recommend it to any Marriott elites staying at this location.  The staff was attentive and friendly.Hotel location is perfect - close to the touristy Harbor attractions, but also walking distance to Fell's Point and Little Italy.  There is a Water Taxi stop just outside the hotel also.All hotel staff that we came in contact with - front desk, housekeeping, valet, conceirge desk in the lobby - was professional, friendly and very helpful.Splendid hotel!Word on the street is that this Marriott is one of the nicest in the area.  I believe it.  The Waterfront Marriott is spacious, well-decored, and has all you could ask for in a hotel.  I came here for a conference and the staff did a superb job making sure there venue was well-organized.  Refreshments were well maintained throughout the conference.  The staff was courteous and polite.  I found the interior well designed with nice maritime details (such as pictures of sails and line), though the carpet could definitely use improvement.  Plus, the Marriott is located right where the action is in Baltimore, in the Inner Harbor.  Whether it's the aquarium or the Ritz Cabaret, the local destinations are a quick walk away.  On the small chance I come back to Baltimore, I'd come back to the Waterfront.Staying here for the week.  I'm not going to stay here again.  Service is REALLY slow and clean isn't their thing either - my room service tray came with lots of lint (ugh).We decided to stay here over the Renaissane for the night (don't know why lol) when in Baltimore. Check in was fast and efficient, and the gentleman at the front desk was funny and pleasant. Our room was on the 30th floor (WOW!).Upon entering the room, we noticed that it was an adjoining room and also near the elevator, both factors that could make the room noisy. We called the front desk to switch rooms, and the woman speaking (who was essentially whispering) said she'd send a bellhop up. 10 minutes later, no bellhop. We call again, and she says she will double check. 10 minutes later, you guessed it, no bellhop. Finally, one came after 25 minutes--totally unacceptable. Then, all afternoon, the housekeepers let all of the doors bang as they were cleaning--ugh.The room was well equipped with two beds, a flatscreen TV, and a gorgeous view of Baltimore and the Inner Harbor--it was almost as good as looking out on a beach and water. My dad is Marriott Platinum, so we also had access to the concierge lounge. One word: unreal. The concierge lounge is absolutely huge. Lots of food is available, and ice cream sundae bars for dessert. Breakfast consisted of waffles, fruit, pastries, bread, cereal, and really a lot more. It was the best concierge lounge my dad and I had ever been in--and he has stayed way too much at hotels. After we left, we left a complaint to the hotel, and we were immediately sent an apology and credited 10,000 Marriott points--nice. This kind of service makes me want to go back to the hotel. Thumbs up. Overall, it's a good hotel with a great concierge lounge. Make sure you get a floor looking out on the harbor and you're golden!I took my honey here for his birthday while we explored downtown Baltimore. I must say absolutely loved the front desk staff, they were the nicest, sweetest people I have ever met and very accomodating. The beauty of the views of the hotel are just amazing ( I mean I could live here, seriously!) I reccommend even if you already live in Baltimore, around the corner or next door, please take a moment to stay with these lovely folks. Marriott I will be back in the summer!
review_content_80: This is the best service I've received at any Marriott! Highly recommended! I booked a room here and received an email from Leishla Lee, one of the Pre-Arrival Coordinators, before my stay offering her assistance. Since my boyfriend and I had been separated due to work and this was our first getaway since then, I decided to splurge and requested a sparkling wine, wine, and rose petal "romantic" greeting.We arrived in Baltimore approximately an hour before check-in and received a key to a room that was described as having a "partial water view". However, as we entered the room, room service hadn't quite finished cleaning the room, so we dropped off our bags and headed downstairs for a 15 minute wait in the lounge. The lounge was actually a relaxing place...the seating areas were separated enough that each party sitting in the area had their own separate areas, and it was set to the side of the main lobby, away from the hustle and bustle of people checking in/out. When we walked into the room, my boyfriend was surprised by the rose petal spread and we enjoyed drinking our champagne while looking out at a phenomenal view of the water...there was nothing "partial" about it. Leishla called the room to ensure that everything was to our satisfaction and apologized for the room not being ready (which was no problem at all). I also got a voicemail greeting and email from Simon Tetley, a Front Office Supervisor, offering further assistance. This has been the nicest Marriott property I've stayed at and was blown away by the attentive customer service. I will definitely return on my next overnight stay in Baltimore.My boyfriend and I stayed here this past weekend, and we absolutely loved it.  The hotel is located in Harbor East, which is a relatively newly developed area near Inner Harbor.  We loved walking around, stopping in the shops and restaurants nearby.  It's really located in a great and fun area.  Parking was $26 a day in the garage that is connected to the hotel by a walkway, which was convenient and reasonably priced for the area.The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and the staff was very friendly.  Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so we left our luggage with the bellhop and walked around the stores nearby.  The front desk attendant took our cell phone number and called as soon as the room was ready, which I thought was very helpful and nice.The room, on the sixth floor, was beautiful and spacious.  There was a large entrance foyer, with a Keurig coffeemaker, which I loved.  There was a large closet with hangers, and a big bathroom, with a large shower and countertop.  They have the curved shower rod, which I love.  There were Bath and Body Works products available, as well.  The room had a gorgeous view of the harbor, and the bed was so insanely comfortable.  We both fell asleep instantly.  There was also a chaise lounge and a desk, providing more seating.  The flat screen television was a plus, as were the reading lights built into the bed.There were several restaurants in the hotel, and we stopped in the breakfast place for Starbucks iced coffee in the morning.  There was also water and some snacks in the lobby while we waited to check in.  This is definitely the best hotel in the Inner Harbor area and I hope to stay here again soon!What a great hotel! I recently attended a 5-day conference at this location and absolutely loved it. All of the staff were excellent, from the doormen, to the people at the front desk, to the housekeeping. The room was spacious, the location excellent, and the conference rooms above average. I highly recommend this hotel. The only things I would complain about is the cost of parking ($25/day) and cost of wi-fi ($12.95, except for where it's free in the lobby). I parked at the Legg Mason building for cheaper and the internet was included in my conference fee. Just wanted to give a heads up on those fees.Incredible harbor view.Rooms were nice and comfy.Our family had a room on the 31st floor and another on the 30th.Only thing I didn't like was their small pool. It took no effort to float, because all the salt in the water. I know, I know, It's not like you're supposed to drink the water, but let's face it, you're swimming in it, some of it's gonna get into your mouth.Trying to book a reservation at this hotel was a 45 minute endeavor.  They employ some of the most unintelligent people I've ever had the displeasure of dealing with. If you're going to call yourself a "reservation specialist," perhaps you should actually know how to help a customer book a room!  Telling a customer that you don't know how to reserve a room seems to defeat the purpose of you being employedA reasonably priced hotel in a very nice area of Baltimore. Located within walking distance of shops, restaurants, inner harbor and bars. The area seems to be the nicest in Baltimore. The staff is nice and their rooms are clean. Lobby area is spacious and you can walk outside to the walking area near the water. Parking was the expensive part but your options are limited.I usually don't leave reviews for hotels unless the experience was either memorably good or memorably bad. My stay here, I'm happy to say, was memorably good. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. All your needs will be taken care of. They pay close attention to the details (for example, if you're at the hotel for a conference, there will be coffee and tea served at break times, and water served at all times--and not just plain water, but varieties of citrus water). The bathrooms are awesome--I would hesitate to say that the women's bathroom contained 'stalls,' because what they have is too nice to use such a common word. The location is great--right next to shops and restaurants--and if you walk out the door around checkout time there will be someone there asking if you need a taxi--no need to worry about that yourself. And if you get a room on one of the upper levels, you'll have a great view.This Marriott is definitely better appointed than most of the FS Marriott's I hit. It's closer to a Renaissance than a JW. SUPER comfortable pillows, decently soft mattresses, and spacious meeting areas make this a great place to host an event.  The staff were all friendly and helpful, the catered meals were actually quite tasty, and they were extraordinarily accommodating for our event. That's the good side. The bad side, however, is one of those things that just /pisses/ /me/ /off./ Yes, I'm talking about the shower where the only thing resembling "water pressure" I experienced was when the steam condensed on the ceiling and started to drip on me. It was like trying to bathe with humidity, rather than a shower. When I'm three time zones earlier than I normally awaken, I don't need a gentle mist to wake me - I want the shower to press me, unmercifully, against the wall, scalding and flaying my flesh off of my very bones. Otherwise, I'm useless all day. If it's not like standing under the hell-equivalent of Niagara Falls, it's just pointless. So - fix your water pressure. So, there ya have it. Great views, good beds, decent amenities, but you can get yourself clean faster licking yourself like a cat than you can with the showers here. So, if you're ever in Chlamydia, er, Charm City, this is the place to stay!I stayed here during a conference and it was pretty nice as far hotels go. Ask for a corner room, you'll get more space. The views were great, despite the Legg Mason building construction. The hotel is in a great location - near lots of places to eat, including a Whole Foods.Parking is  a pain and expensive, but what other options do you have? There is a skywalk that connects the garage to the hotel and makes getting from one building to another a lot of work since you have to change elevators three times. The staff was very friendly and accommodating throughout the conference and our stay. They split the hotel bill four ways so  each person could pay their share individually.Decided I would do a weekend getaway from DC and boy was I surprised. For a getaway I was expecting relaxation and wonderful service. Unfortunately what I experienced was far from what I would expect of ANY decent Marriott chain.First and foremost the construction is incredibly poor. I have a great room at the end of the hallway with amazing views. Alas the kudos end there. I can hear anything and everything in the hallway, Whether it be unruly children running/playing in the hall to drunk messes of people coming home after a long night of partying I hear complete conversations, laughing, yelling and the like. Needless to say sleep before 2:30 and after 8am is unlikely or so it has been. Second, the customer service is incredible lacking. Example I ordered breakfast thru in-room dining. The meal was mediocre at best but hell it was the American Breakfast. I wasn't expecting five star. That's not my complaint. The dirty coffee mug is where my complaint lies and how the staff handled the situation. I immediately called the front desk to request a new cup be delivered almost as soon as it was delivered so I could enjoy my morning coffee with breakfast. After 45 minutes (and finishing my breakfast) I called the front desk again and inquired where was the cup. I was given a phone call a few minutes later to let me know it was in route. Almost 30 minutes later I finally got a cup. The one good thing is they delivered with a fresh pot of coffee. All in all its a well appointed hotel on the surface. The furnishings look nice but are cheap much like the construction. I'd only recommend the hotel if you were in a pinch or you Name-Your-Own-Price on Priceline and can't help but get it. I've had much better Marriott experiences in lesser chains of Marriott. If you can afford it stay at the Four Seasons which is right across the street. Its 1000 percent better in service, design, and comfort..The room had marvelous view of both the city and the harbor and waking up to it puts a smile to a sleepy face. My favorite part- the long board walk in front of the hotel. :)If you'd like to avoid paying $40 valet parking, you can park yourself and pay at the one of parking machines located in the hotel side after checking out. It cost me $25.My experience here was great, especially after the ordeal I had at the Intercontinental.I had originally booked with the IC for an overnight stay.  When I got there, after dealing with some crap from the valet guys, I was told (very rudely) that they were overbooked and I had been transferred to another hotel. And that I should be happy because they got me a good rate.  After some complaining at the IC, they said they would comp my parking at Marriott.When I arrived at the Marriott, I was pretty...upset.  Mostly because I had been treated so badly by IC staff.  The lobby manager promptly greeted me and after talking to me about my experience at IC, directed me over past the line to the Front Desk Manager.  She was amazing (I think her name was Jennifer).  She said that the IC had sent over several people and was comping their entire stay.  Then, she called the IC and argued with them until they comped our stay as well.The room was immaculate - clean and up to date.  We ordered room service and I would advise to stay away from the hummus and pita chips.  The quesadilla was fine though, and tasted fresh and was hot. In general, the services as far as the front desk, valets and bellhops were great.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat.Fantastic Hotel. The hotel is located right at the waterfront and there are many attractions nearby like the Powerplant, Barnes and Nobles, seaport, Aquariums, malls, etc. I love how right outside the hotel, it's water/bay/waterfront or whatever you want to call it.I enjoyed this hotel.  Very clean, good service.  The rooms were a very nice size.  My room had a mini fridge and a kuerig coffee maker.  The beds were clean and comfortable.  The view of the harbor was amazing.  I had the opportunity to enjoy several meals as a part of a conference and all of the meals were delicious.  My only complaint would be, that at a regular rate of $359/night, it is shameful that wi-fi is not included.We arrived at three in the AM after a delayed flight. I had called no less than four times during the previous day, including just prior to our plane taking off, to check that the roll away bed that we had requested be in the room when we arrive. Surprise, surprise, no roll-away bed at 3 AM. We had to wait another half an hour before they brought up a roll-away bet that they had requisitioned from the Spanish Inquisition. The next morning we spoke with the manager and she provided us with several options, a new roll-away bed or a room with a fold away bed or both. We opted for both since we were not sure that the fold-away bed would be any better. The manager sent keys up to our room so we could try the new room at our leisure and not have to go down and deal with the front desk crowds. Not only was the fold-away bed much more comfortable than the roll-away bed, the new room was great. I was trying the Marriott because I had become sick of the condescending service I had been receiving from Starwood even though I had been a Platinum member. Once they see you using your points for free stays, there is a different although only slightly more snotty attitude. At the Marriott I was a neophyte member of their travel program. Even their telephone reservation people are nice. If this is the way they treat everyone, good by Starwood.Stayed here for 3 nights for a conference.Hotel is beautiful and clean, with great views of the harbor.  I can't give it a 4 star for the following reasons.#1.  Bring your own toilet paper!   I would describe there's as 1 ply sandpaper.#2.  Wife had skin reaction to hotel soap, so bring some of that too.#3.  The sheets on the King bed don't really fit, expect to wake up with your face directly on the stained mattress....gross.When we checked in we asked for an extra night at the same conference rate which they agree'd to, then on the 2nd day I got a bill for 2 nights, when I called down they had no record of the 3rd night and wouldn't honor the conference rate for the 3rd night.Very nice lobby with kind staff.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  It is not far walking distance to the water.I recently stayed at this hotel for a conference for three days.  This was my second time at this hotel.  It is a very nice hotel with a very nice staff.  Everyone says hello, is very pleasant and wiling to help.One night when I was there I was going out to dinner and the bellman offered me an umbrella to use because it was raining.  I greatly appreciated that.The rooms are nice, and clean with a nice view of the inner harbor or the city.  The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms nice.  They have a Keurig in the room with a selection of coffees and teas.There is a restaurant downstairs which is nice, but a bit overpriced.  There is also another area where you can by sandwiches, drinks and snacks.The only problem that I have with this hotel is how they nickel and dime you.  There is seriously a charge for everything!  The thing I disliked the most was the fact that you have to pay for wi-fi!  For $200 a night for a standard room, Wi-Fi should be included!  I just really felt like there was an extra charge for EVERYTHING.  This is why I only gave this hotel three stars.I just returned from a four night stay at the Marriott Waterfront, while attending a conference held at the hotel.  Service, food, accommodations, location - everything was excellent.  Of special note is the friendliness and professionalism of the hotel staff.  I highly recommend this hotel for business or personal travel.I. Love. This. Hotel. !  I was there for 5 days on business.The rooms were clean, comfortable, very spacious, nice! Views were great! Staff was super-helpful. The bar is the place to be! Great place to meet up w/ friends and people-watch. We hung out in the bar every night and people from other hotels came over to hangout there as well. The restaurant and mini-store/bakery were equally great. Food in the restaurant and bar get 2 thumbs up! Loved the crab cake. The mini-store has all types of snacks and they have soups/desserts.. The hotel is in a great area! Movie theater, shopping, Starbucks, convenience store, around the corner. Its also a quick walk to everything downtown. I walked to work each day. One night I went out to dinner and came back with left-overs. Called downstairs to see if they had a microwave in the cafe area that i could use. She said "we'll bring one up to you right now". A couple of mins later, a lady brings up a FULL size microwave for me to use, no charge.. Awesome. Internet was quick. I was able to work just as i would in the office.The 'only' negative complaints i have.. One lady at check-in was rude and not helpful at all. She had that "Im more important than you" attitude. However, she was the only rude person i encountered during my entire stay.Also, the hotel seems pricey and they charge for internet service. I was there on the corporate dime so it wasn't an issue for me. However, if I was there for a leisure trip that may have been a problem.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton Baltimore Inner Harbor
review_content: I went for a conference there this pass weekend. The employees were a Hugh help. The hotel was on point. The conference rooms were super cold. No matter who we asked they could not it warmer. The food was Delicious. The employees went above and beyond to get use what we needed. Fyi the oatmeal raisin cookies were hot and YUMMMMMMY.I was here for an event (we hosted) in June. This hotel is a little bit away from the actual Inner Harbor tourist area. It is within walking distance as I did walk it. At check in there was no mention of the complimentary breakfast or free evening happy hour but I read it somewhere otherwise I would not have known about it. My room was on the 17th floor and pretty spacious. It was a double bed room with a sitting area and a desk. Pretty standard but was not cramped. I wish the pillows were firmer as I ended up stacking 2-3 to make it firmer. Personal preference so no big deal. As a business traveler the one thing I didn't appreciate was that there was not a clock in the room. I use my phone for an alarm but I like to be able to just glance over and see what time it is and keep me on time (or close as possible lol). Another small annoyance is the auto scrolling tv guide on the TV and no printed channel list. Print outs are always appreciated or the option to page up/down through the on screen guide. Kthanks. The elevator seemed to be slow at times so plan accordingly. So I was here for an event, as previously mentioned, and our event space (which I didn't know ahead of time) was in a connected building. I had to go to the 5th floor of the Embassy Suites, walk pas the business center and through the connected hallway where there was another elevator to take me to the 2nd floor of the event space. Once at the event space the entrance was at the front of the room so I had to direct attendees through the room next door to find me at our check in table. This was the only way to navigate the space (trust me I tried to find another route and got lost). I ended up the night before our event making directional signs to assist our attendees in finding their way. The event space is nice and they were going through a transition period with management and staff. It showed but our sales manager made sure we were taken care of and she went above and beyond for us unlike our banquets contact (ooops I wasn't going to go there..let me stop). Thanks Crystal for your hard work for us! :-)Horrible place. Elevators slower than a sun dial (looks like only one of four work), trash in stairway that is dark and narrow and creepy, smoke detectors taped over, other guests with the manners worse than a NY cabbie. Won't stay here again. Free drinks gets the one star.Awesome suite for a very reasonable price. Great staff and we will stay again when in Baltimore.My fiancee and I stayed here during our Poe sightseeing trip in Baltimore. Upon arrival the valet staff was very professional and did a damage inspection of our vehicle before parking.Check in was pretty quick and easy (booked on hotels.com) but apparently they overbooked? and ended up giving us a free upgrade from a 1-room king suite to a 2-room king. So far everything was going well, the room was very nice and spacious. Things started to get a bit strange after that though. A few moments before we were going to leave for the evening someone else was trying to swipe into our door, not sure if he was at the wrong room or booked there as well but it was odd.Upon our return to the room our keycards wouldn't work on the door either and we had to take the elevator down 34 floors again to resolve the issue at the front desk which was handled quickly.Overall we had a nice stay, and a great sleep. The bathroom was also very nice, a more luxurious shower would have been nice in a room like that but then again we did get a free upgrade. Overall a nice place to stay, great price too however some miscues by the staff made things a bit inconvenient but all in all very nice.I wish I could give half stars, because I would give this place 3.5 stars.Service: 4 stars. Really excellent.Quality of the room: 3 stars. TV was not working and extremely loud air conditioner Breakfast: 4 starsInternet not connected in the business center: -1 starNot a bad place. Service was really really excellent. The made to order eggs during breakfast was also really really great.I'd probably stay here again, but I would make sure that things are working in my room.I stayed here with my family for a wedding recently! We booked two rooms one king bed and one with two beds. That is not what we received! We got two kings instead! Pros: 1. The hotel is connected to the grand venue which is where the wedding ceremony was taking place which was very convenient.2. The breakfast was good! Many options and it was all you could eat ! Omelets could be made to order.Cons: 1. The staff seemed very unfriendly and unwelcoming. They didn't seem to care how the customer.2. The room is spacious but, just okay! Nothin amazing.3 only one elevator worked out of three 4 parking is 35 dollars or 16 at the garage but you have to pay each time. They don't tell you about parking so just prepare yourself.Overall it was okayThis place has really gone downhill in the past few years. The primary negative that is enough to keep me away for good is that apparently, now they charge $12 per night to access Wi-Fi in the room. It's 2015. Every other hotel out there has free Wi-Fi. Never coming back due to that alone, unless it changes.Other things bothered me less... giant dead cockroach on the floor last time; taking three minutes for the shower to warm up this time, over half the laundry facilities out of order, and the slowest elevators on the planet.The only redeeming factors are the helpful and polite staff, free drinks and snacks during Happy Hour, and the free breakfast in the morning. But food is available anywhere. I'd no longer recommend staying here and don't plan to again.Great location. Room was very clean and comfortable. Parking next door. There is a shuttle service available out front that got us where we needed to go. Walking distance to Inner Harbor. Some tasty food options in the area as well. Staff was very friendly. Stayed on a weekend so, the area wasn't too crowded. Can imagine it would be bustling during the week. Would stay here again.Where should I begin? First, the parking situation. The Embassay Suite charges $32 for parking and neglect to advise visitors that there is a parking structure immediately adjacent to their building that offers $6 if you go after 5 pm. That's shade. I could see these rates not being advertised for their guests but visitors, that just foul. Next, the room that we visited was allegedly the "Presidential Suite". Umm... Not quite. The room had carpet that I'm sure was procured from a discount carpet warehouse. If this room was so "presidential" why not at least have hard wood floors. Hell, they could have at least had marble countertops at these rates. The view was ok. Although, most suites are equipped with thicker walls. You can hear each and every sound that came from the adjacent room. Frequently, we were forced to hear the cry of a baby and some kids who seriously lacked discipline. My friends were forced to leave the room due to noise complaints. Due to the amount that she was spending, it would seem that she could have received a courtesy call from the front desk. I hate to play the race card but the front desk called the police and she was forced to leave. It was a birthday function, which management was duly advised. In fact, she was moved to the Presidential Suite to have fewer neighbors. However, due to the lack of craftsmanship in the construction, surrounding patrons could hear EVERYTHING just as we could hear them. To add insult to injury, the cabinets in the bathroom fell off. I would NEVER stay here especially with the policy of eviction without warning. Then to send 4 officers. Everyone in the room were well educated, non violent, and had clean criminal histories. I have stayed at MANY Embassay Suites in my lifetime. This is the WORST experience ever!This hotel is in a great location for events at Royal Farms Arena. The two bedroom suite gave us plenty of room. The staff is amazingly friendly especially Jess and Jay at the front desk. The breakfast buffet gives plenty of options. The downsides to this place is the elevators. There are four nice sized elevators but by the time a fourth person gets in some of them the buzzer is going off saying it is over full. They hold 2500 lbs so they were not full. This leads to a very long line waiting for an elevator especially right after an event lets out.I spent time here for a friend's birthday weekend. I think the accommodations were OK, but definitely not stellar. The 2 suites she'd booked were of a decent size. The kitchenette was a bit cramped, but the dining and living area were more spacious. I appreciated the view of Baltimore from the 31st floor, though. The bedroom and closet were spacious and nicely appointed. Overall they weren't anything to write home about, but were well-suited for our needs. I really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. We had a late breakfast on Sunday and really enjoyed the omelette station. The potatoes were remarkably good! They also had other common foods like bacon, sausage, scrambled and hard-boiled eggs, cereal and fruits. It was definitely better than most complimentary breakfasts I see at hotels. My biggest gripe was with the elevators. They are terribly slow. The elevator bank has 4 but only 2 seemed to operate during the time we were there. They should get that checked out.The hotel doesn't have its own parking, but there is a public garage a few steps down from it. It's directly to the left of the hotel. The price wasn't bad - I was there all day and only paid $5.Overall, it's not bad. Again, it's not the greatest, but it gets the job done.Overall a very nice hotel, I would recommend to travelers who will not be "overly" disappointed by hotels minor flaws. ProsLarge rooms with room to spread outVariety at breakfastClose parking garage at discounted priceConsWalking distance to harbor is doable but rough after a long day. Elevators are slow during peak times (breakfast, dinner, check-in)Breakfast and happy hour very crowded so get there early or WAITIn room Bathroom door would not shut completely, shower drained slowly, odd positioning of microwave an mini fridge making it difficult to use.Beds were fantastic!Top floors can hear the elevator cables rattling in the wall all night. Restaurant food is disgusting. Left over uncooked bacon, and how can you screw up Mac and cheese? The have figured out a way. Worst hotel food ever. Fitted sheets on mattress are all for thin mattresses so they come off on the corners. Place, overall SUCKSGot them to replace the sandwich and it was WORSE. Brown avacado and cheese that was hard and turkey roll was slippery meat. The health dept should check this kitchen and close it down. The staff doesn't seem to care.My husband and I were attending a concert in Baltimore. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Check-in time wasn't until 4pm, but I decided to take whatever room was available because I was traveling with an infant that needed a nap. My room was on the 26th floor. It was big and spacious for the 3 of us. Starbucks in the building! Breakfast was a plus...but it is why I like the Embassy. Cons: The room had minor cosmetic things that stood out (i.e. shoddy repair of the ceiling in the bathroom, the vent in the living room was dirty and looked as if it needed to be repaired).The seat cushions in the breakfast area could use a simple upholstering. That would be a quick fix or simply replace them. My suggestion to management is to take a look at the entire facility and make the minor changes. It will show us that attention to detail matters!I'm currently here on business for 6 weeks and I feel like I'm right at home. The staff are amazing, hard workers. The rooms feel like tiny apartments with a kitchenette. The gym has a nice variety of things to do and there's a little laundry room to do your own if you'd like. The best part after a long day: free happy hour!!Not your typical Embassy Suites, this hotel is a reincarnation of an old downtown hotel and Embassy did a pretty good job. My only comments are that the fitness center is far too warm for exercise. This could be resolved by adding shades to the windows. Also, the restaurant where the Embassy Suites free breakfast is served is a bit cramped and dark, but hey IT'S FREE!!! The staff is very professional and friendly and the rates are usually reasonable. Parking, like most downtown hotels, isn't convenient and costs $16 overnight. All together this is a great place in Baltimore. It's just a few blocks from Inner Harbor and neighborhood restaurants and bars.Is there an option for no stars? Seriously I'm that upset! My fiance and I spent 6 nights in this hotel. The first night we stayed in a queen suite which unfortunately was situated right next to the elevator. All night long we heard banging and noise from the elevator. The walls were so thin we even heard people talking inside of the elevator! My 6 month old son was up crying all night and none of us got any sleep! The next morning we asked to be switched to a different room. We got a king suite on the 33rd floor. The sound problem was better however every time we tried to use our keys to the room the doors would not unlock. We ended up having to go up and down the elevator 4-5 times to get "new keys" for the room (which with an infant and traveling up 33 floors was annoying!) we repeated this routine several times a day for 2 days. One of the days this almost caused us to miss the train to Washington DC that we needed to catch! On the 3rd day I told the front desk the problem was not with the keys it was with the door lock. They said it probably needs the battery's chanted and promised to get the changed while we were gone for the day. We arrived back at the hotel at 9:00 only to discover they never fixed the door! They promised to send some one ASAP. By 10:00 we were tired of waiting and went to bed only to have the repair man knock on the door at 10:30 waking us and our infant son up to change the batteries in the door. On top of all that the last 3 days of our stay our room was never refilled with clean towels or complimentary soaps. On our last day I went down to the harbor with the baby and returned to the room around 4:00pm wanting to give the baby a bath and lay him down for a nap only to discover the room had not even been cleaned....the bed was unmade, no soaps, no clean towels, dirty towels everywhere, and overflowing trash cans. I called down to the front desk 2 times only to be transferred to housekeeping both times and reach a voicemail. After 45 minutes of waiting for someone to come clean the room I went downstairs to personally talk to the front desk. They promised to send someone ASAP...15 minutes later they arrived. Unfortunately they left behind dirty towels in the bathroom and still did not refill the soaps. I wish I could give this hotel a better rating...its location was perfect for us (walking distance to inner harbor and short taxi ride to train station). The beds were comfortable and rooms were large. Breakfast buffet was delicious. However on weekends they don't open buffet up until 7:30 which meant large crowds of people stood in line waiting to get in and eat and once inside it was a disaster trying to get food. Not everyone sleeps in on the weekend and many people still have places they need to be! The breakfast should be open at 6 everyday of the week. Wifi internet is not free..they charge you $14.00 for Internet. They give you 2 free bottles of water on your first night but won't replace them if your staying multiple nights. The bell boys were helpful and they flagged cabs quickly. The staff was friendly but with the problems we experienced here we will not be back! Sorry embassy suits this location disappointed us!In town for Morgan State University's Open House. Enjoyed my 2 day stay Thurs 4/2-Sat 4/4. Cost for 2 days was $220 non suite on Expedia. 2 queen beds, fridge, microwave, sink. Parking is $32 a nite with valet or there is a parking garage right next to the hotel which was $16 a night. About 5 blocks (walking distance) to the Inner Harbor area. The included breakfast buffet (eggs, bacon, toast, sausage, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, apple, orange and cranberry juice, made to order omelettes including egg white only and im sure i missed a few things) was well worth it and don't forget the complimentary reception hour(530-730pm) aka FREE LIQUOR lol i had (amsterdam vodka and cranberry, hubby had bloody mary)also included were budweiser and i think coors beers. Customer Service was good easy check in and out. Only complaint with service was my daughter called the front desk and said the clerk sounded a bit annoyed. But when we needed additional wash clothes they were brought up within 10 mins of calling the front desk and a clerk called to make sure we received them.The only other complaint i have is the bathroom was a bit small. They could have lessened the size of the walk in closet and made a bigger bathroom. We did stay in a corner room so that may be the reason. Neither complaint is enough to lose a star over 5 stars GREAT!!!Overall...anytime I'm in Baltimore I will be staying at Embassy Suites-Inner HarborWe had a wonderful 4 days staying here. The staff is very friendly, courteous, and helpful. The suites are very spacious & comfortable. I love this place and hope to visit again in the future
review_content_20: Comfortable rooms look the part, but the noisy ass elevator sounds disrupt your sleep and kills the comfortability. Sorry guys, but you need to fix it!Very kind service here and they were generous to upgrade us when we stayed during a snow storm.  Very comfy bed, spacious room, and superb complimentary breakfast (best I have had in a hotel actually!! yum!!). Great complimentary coffee as well!  Thank you! Only downsides are that the internet pricing is not conveniently listed and cell phone reception is not great on higher floors (to be expected).  The rooms are rather quiet but noise does transmit a bit with a rowdy neighbor.  Also, the alarm clocks should be turned to 'OFF' when the staff turns the room around: no fun waking up at 7am when the alarm (not set by me) goes off.Disappointed severely. The room wasn't ready when I initially checked in at 4pm, so we waited about 15-20 minutes. No too bad. However, I am upset that I had to check with the front desk manager to inquire if the room was ready, they did not volunteer. There were two events when I visited the hotel over the summer - gay pride and the comic con. There was a large volume of people, more then usual and I don't believe staff were prepared for the crowd of guest. After voicing my complaint to corporate - the hotel staff were concerned about my needs and addressed my needs. I was very happy about this - it felt good that I mattered.  This hotel decor is modern, contemporary & chic. There are parts of the hotel that is old and charming. Check out the old Masonic area on the fourth floor and have your socks blown away. It's gorgeous with high decorated ceilings and crown moldings . It would be a wonderful place for weddings and other events.We loved our stay here! Everything was just perfect. We came in earlier than expected but the concierge accommodated very nicely to our needs. We were up in a room within 5 minutes. The room itself was clean and large complete with a lounging area, desk and swivel flat screen. I was greatly impressed. I think my favorite part about the Embassy Suites is that they provide a more than satisfactory complimentary breakfast AND alcoholic happy hour. You should hit up  the breakfast early, it can get pretty crowded and the seating can be a bit competitive. Very happy with this service, especially after a heavy night of drinking...it was just what we needed. The complimentary happy hour was just the cherry on top. They provided great drinks, a couple of bartenders in the resturant area. Premium costed a couple of dollars but oh well, still cool! The munchies consisted of chips, salsa, and some chex mix, its not gourmet but hey...not coming for the munchies are we..there are plenty of nearby places for that! I definitely recommend coming here. Cheers!This place is an absolute joke.Where should I start?  First it's in an absolute horrible part of town, even though the police station is right across the street, nothing but ghetto, street trash stay here. So on 10/12 I was invited to a brunch here.  Parked the car in the deck next door and went inside to ask the receptionist where was the brunch located for the individuals that invited me.  She said "There is no record of any reserved area for brunch or record of people staying here by that name."  Alright fair, lets try a couple different names (I wasnt sure who's name the actual room was booked under).  She said "No. I am not sure what to tell you... but no one by any of those names are staying here".At this point more invited guests came in inquiring about the same thing. Alright, being patient I decided to make some phone calls to see if I could get in contact with someone that was there.  No luck.  So I asked the lady at the front desk to speak with a manager.  Her response "No, I do not see any reason why you need to speak with a manager... "   WTF  I discussed that I need someone to absolutely make sure that a reservation was made and to report the lack of customer service.  She refused.  In a matter of PURE COINCIDENCE someone I knew walked by and I quickly grabbed them.  1) The reservation was indeed booked under the name given2) There couldn't have been any possible way that the front desk lady missed it.  She obviously refused to even lookOn to the actual hotel based on my observation.  It's slammed busy, seemed that there was not enough staff to assist with the guests.  I was told the hot breakfast buffet was included but I cant verify that.  But I will tell you it looked like not enough food was put out and the tables werent being bused fast enough.  I saw people standing up against walls trying to eat. This place F*ing sucks.  Go and stay elsewhere.Check in and valet parking were flawless. My room was on the 35th floor and we had a great view!  The room was very very spacious. My only complaint was that the carpet had so many stains. It's time for some new carpet asap!  It was so noticeable and really was odd considering everything else was so clean and the hotel was well managed.This was a much better experience than NC.  Although the rooms again were only one room they were a good size room.  The staff could not have been any more courteous. Gym was nice, happy hour was great.  Breakfast went smoothly even when very crowded.  Good location, within walking distance of everything.Solid hotel located in Baltimore's Downtown Area. Its Location gives you walking access to the Inner Harbor, Mount Vernon and Midtown (and if it was warmer probably Little Italy and Fells Point). Rooms were large and well kept. Staff was courteous and informative. They have valet parking for extra ($32, not too bad). The lounge also does a free happy hour for 2 hrs on weekends (cheese cubes, draft american beer, wine by glass, and well drinks) which I find to be a great deal. They do lack a large hotel lobby store, but considering a 7-11 is within a block this isn't a big deal.While the staff at this property were well meaning and mostly courteous the property itself is very poorly managed.  There is an apparent level of ignorance and poor training that is pervasive in this property. Issues with hot water, valet communication, amenities not delivered and mis delivered.
