Wedding gift bags -25% of guests never received them. Shout out to Shannon and Jon at valet area.  However one valet did not know how to start my sons car (VW) so we went down to the 4th level of the garage to drive it up ourselves. All in all a very poor property. A well discussed topic at the bar one evening. I will be writing a detailed letter to Hilton.Stayed here for a weekend night downtown. Went downstairs and asked to use the lobby bathroom and we're told that "if you are a guest in this hotel you should just use your own bathroom..." yeah, never staying here again based on that one comment. Whack wanna be bougie ass hotel. GfyGreat room for the price. I came down for a business meeting during the week and got a great price from the HIlton site. The room was clean and large. Great workout room. I did not try the pool because it opens after 8 am. Breakfast was good with good selections. Keep in mind it gets busy because there are a surprising number of rooms in the hotel. There is a Starbucks I. The lobby too! Staff was friendly and the beds were comfortable. The room was dark and quiet at night and there are several charging ports in the room. Very good experience. I will be back.Expensive, but standard for downtown.  I stayed for 3 weeks.The rooms are nice, with a small kitchenette, a couple TVs, comfortable bed, and several couches.  Breakfast (6-9 M-F, 730-1030 S-S) is buffet style.  There is a customer omlette bar, but otherwise the food is just standard fare found at a Hampton Inn.  Parking is next door in the garage ($16/24 hours) which is expensive, but it is a 24/7 garage.  Valet parking is also available for $32.  Internet is free if you are a gold or diamond member, but it is extremely slow.  Otherwise, it's some $10/night.  I'd stay here again, though I would look around at some other hotels first.Incredible hospitality. Free happy hour. Free hot cooked to order breakfast. Free internet. Inexpensive parking at the city lot next door ---don't valet!  Free local trolly takes you to the inner harbor. What's not to like?I was scheduled to stay here on May 2, but due to the curfew and other uncertainty the wedding I was planning to attend was moved.  Embassy Suites (Hilton) refuses to work with their clients and offer a refund under these circumstances.  This is not the service I have come to expect from Hilton over my ten years as a Hilton Honors member.  Time to go find a hotel brand of choice.Stayed there for 4 nights for a professional meeting. Short walk to the Convention Center is convenient. Free breakfast was above my expectations, a big plus. The guy that makes omelets does really great job and is pretty efficient in serving customers fast without creating a line. The other big plus is the happy hour with free drinks, which got rather lively on Saturday night. Rooms are comfortable, beds are soft. TVs are fine, and I got free in-room WiFi for signing up for HiltonHonors for the duration of my stay. That was a big plus. Staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful. Also, there are at least three restaurants with very good Yelp reviews within one block, which is very convenient. I checked out the turkish place and the noodle place.Thermostat in my room read 80F all the time, even though it was obviously less, around 72-73F I'd say. But since it was a comfortable room temperature, I did not complain. Also, the bedding gets a lot of static electricity for some reason; I saw a few hairs stuck to it (probably in a dryer due to the static or something, did not look like it was from previous occupants; pretty sure it was washed). Also, room soundproofing is not great, and I could hear elevators going up and down. I can see how this can be an issue for someone, but it was not for me. Overall, a very pleasing hotel experience for a business trip.We stayed the Embassy Suites for my brother's birthday weekend. While the staff were very nice and helpful, the building itself is awful. I'm aware this is an historic building; but, I really think more should've been done to renovate the building. First, the elevators are terrible. It took 10 minutes for the elevator to arrive in the lobby. And the elevators are very small. The room looked nice at first glance; but, there was a terrible smell in the bathroom. Almost as if someone used it before we arrived in the room. Also, the sink in the bathroom drained very slowly. Another reviewer noted how thin the walls are. I can attest to this. You can hear people in the hallway clearly as if they are right in the room with you. In the bathroom, you can hear your neighbors in the next room clearly through the vent. And there isn't an exhaust fan which would've been helpful for that foul smell we experienced when we arrived. On the positive side they have a social hour in the afternoon with free drinks and snacks for guest. The breakfast they offer sounds good. I'll experience that tomorrow. However, this will be my last stay at this hotel.I have had many hotel stays this year and this hotel stay was the most comfortable. The parking situation was not good but it worked out in the end. The bed was more comfortable than my home bed! The  room was  spacious and a beautiful city view. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great experience over allWe stayed here 8/21 - 8/23/2015. The hotel is beat up. Carpeting is dirty, furniture old and damaged, and stairs between floors of this 30+ floor hotel dirty and narrow - a danger in case evacuation is needed. There aren't enough elevators so wait time to get one can be over 10 minutes. To add insult to injury, they tried to charge valet parking when we did not use this service. They also hosed us for over $60 in long distance charges when one of the kids tried to call our cell a couple of times. Finally the free breakfast was terrible with crowds so large it took almost 2 hrs to get through it. Stay elsewhere. Lots of other good choices.Perfectly located in downtown Baltimore....close to all and the best is that the free bus service for anybody in the downtown area is out front of the hotel. The reason this is important is because parking at the harbor or any where in downtown Baltimore is expensive and hard to come by. I left the car with the hotel the two days, paid the $32 a day and took their free bus service. If you start taking the car out, going from lot to lot you are going to pay $20 for 3-4 hours and the pay to put back in the hotel and you have to deal with the traffic. We had a room with two queen beds and a small kitchen with a microwave. If they give us a kitchen why no napkins, garbage bag or silverware? fridge is a mini so not much room. Room was clean, nice large lcd in room, but bathroom was tight... poor layout if you ask me, no need for the large walk-in closet between the bedroom and bathroom. Staff was very friendly always looking to help, just ask. Free breakfast that included an omlete station...fruit, bacon, coffee, bagels, english muffins, and cereals...very good!!!I stayed at Embassy Suites Baltimore - Inner Harbor last month and found that it still was an excellent place to stay... having excellent facilities and staff.  Customer service is superb!  My attorney, who was on a business trip with me, agreed.Whereas many hotels start out great and quickly show their age, I think this favility has only become better.
review_content_40: Do you like cold showers? If yes, this is the place for you. Stayed here for a conference and out of the 15 people asked, hot water was only available half of the time. No matter morning day or night. That's just not right.BEAUTIFUL BEAUTIFUL HOTEL!!!Very spacious rooms. Here for a special Yelp event. Had an absolute blast. The place is beautiful and classy. The study we were in had the most exquisite Grecian(Roman?) artwork/murals and beautiful stained glass windows. The seat was incredibly comfy and lush. The piano and the pianist were delightful. The staircase was marble and study as well as beautiful.THE BATHROOM WAS LIKE. OMFG. THIS IS A BATHROOM? Fucking marble columns?! This beautiful area to sit and wash your hands in?! FULL LENGTH MIRRORS EVERYWHERE?! Ladies lounge in-fucking-deed. Love it. Seriously just check out the photos. It's a perfect venue for hosting large events.Seriously I would probably never stay here again. Bathroom was dirty when I got into room, and the shower ceiling looked disgusting. (Room 32) The elevators were the worst part of my stay, as it takes FOREVER and I mean FOREVER for them to arrive, and when they do, they can only fit about 5 people. It is the most horrible elevator system. It is close to where we needed to be so it was convenient. But I would not stay here again.This hotel is ok at best. Not worth the price. Jay at check in was wonderful and helpful. The breakfast was good. The room was a good size. However, our rooms carpet had burn marks in it and looked old and dirty. I didn't want my son crawling on it. The room smelled musty. There wasn't many channels on the TV. You have to pay for WIFI and 16 a day to park your car that you aren't allowed to take in and out of the garage. The location isn't that safe, we had people asking us for money and people digging in the trash outside of the hotel. Lastly, my husband wanted to go to the hotel bar after site seeing all day and both nights the hotel closed at 8pm! Really?! They gave us no explanation and suggested he walk down the street to a bar. Ya right and have him get robbed on the way back to the hotel?! Ridiculous! We won't be back and won't recommend this hotel.I gave this hotel 1 star because of the very rude customer service. I checked in on Friday night ,of course i inspected my room. Under my bedding i found 1 strand of hair. No , i didnt complain since it was only 1 strand. I did bring my own linen for the bed but i was too tired to put it on completely , so i just placed it on the bed and lied down . The next day i notice that there was a lot more than 1 strand. There was so much hair on this big comfy bed that it was nauseating . When the complaint was made, i was totally disregarded . It seemed to be a regular complaint in that place. I will never stay in this hotel again. . Also, my family was in a room where the tub was stopped up with water backing into the tub from someone elses tub...yuck...it took them 3 days to fix it ...but only after we really showed out. The 1 star is for the delish omelet that you have to wake up with the roosters to get to. It was not worth the 189per night at allNice, clean hotel ! Our room was on the 33rd floor with a great view of downtown Baltimore . The room was spacious and clean . I loved the extra touch of a microwave , sink and table which the Embassy Suites is known for . It's within walking distance to downtown Baltimore . The staff was very accommodating and were eager to please . Complimentary breakfast was great but please get here early or right before the end of breakfast because the lines can go right out the door! They also had a complimentary happy hour which is a great kick off to any other plans you may have for a night out! However , if you are checking out try to go a half hour before check out because the elevators are small and get filled quickly! I will definitely stay here again!My family and I stayed here two weeks ago. It was overall a pleasant experience. The staff were friendly. As soon as we checked in, we were informed that there was a shortage of room keys and could only get one per room (4 of us shared the same suite). It wasn't too much of an issue for us, later on they got more. As soon as you step outside this hotel at night, you do have to be careful while walking in the streets as it was a little sketchy. During the week they have something called a managers reception which was around 5:30-7:30pm which was fantastic. They had complimentary cocktails, beer, wine, and soda. They also had chips and salsa, pretzels, crackers, and an assorted cheeseboard. Plenty of seating in this area. The complimentary breakfast was great, made-to-order omelets, eggs, waffles, bacon, assorted breads, juices, etc. The wifi in this hotel wasn't the best, I had to turn it off and use my data plan at times. The one-bedroom suite was spacious and had a mini kitchen. The bathroom was on the smaller side. One thing which didn't affect my family was which we were informed about them shutting off the water for a few hours around 12pm so be aware of that. I didn't swim but the pool looked clean but on the smaller side. The fitness center looked nice with modern equipment. The business center came in handy for us because we needed to print out tickets. They had a mini snack shop by the front desk which was reasonably priced compared to other hotels that make the price of something there five times more expensive. The parking was expensive but I believe anywhere in baltimore parking is like that so its normal. Overall, a pleasant stay.I'm torn how to rate this place. On the one hand, I thought it was in a good location, relatively close to the Inner Harbor. The room was a good size and pretty clean. On the other hand, the shower made loud rattling noises when we tried to change the temperature of the water, and it took forever to get the water hot. We also had a room next to the elevator and could hear every ding and door opening and movement up and down as the elevator traveled between floors.I was very pleased my boyfriend and I were able to snag a room for New Year's less than three days before. Needless to say, the hotel was packed with revelers so it wasn't until 3 am or so before it started to get quiet.Unfortunately, housekeeping came by three times in the morning, and the neighbors kept slamming their doors.My friend just moved to Baltimore. I helped her check into this hotel in the morning - they didn't have her room ready, which is fine. So she checked her luggage into storage, we went to brunch, hotel called us a few hours later saying the room is ready. We get back and guess what?Her backpack was gone from the locked storage unit.We are talking laptop, iPad, iPod, passport, credit cards, books, chargers, all the essentials that a person needs and keeps dear and close to our hearts. They checked the security cameras and clearly recorded an ethnic male entering the room and stealing her backpack. The police were called. Guess what? They already responded to a similar incident, with the EXACT same person caught on camera, a week ago!! Of course, management did nothing in prevention. The two female clerks at the front desk never offered condolences or apologies, in fact even had an attitude/smirk on their faces. Manager was supposed to call my friend, never did. We had to track him down. No offer to reimburse or discount her room, nothing. They did promise some compensation, but there's more value in those possessions than what money can buy. VISITORS BEWARE. do NOT trust this hotel, do NOT trust the people working in this hotel. If you got your things stolen, I would complain HARD to the management. If you left this place unscathed, consider yourself lucky.We loved our stay here. Excellent customer service & great breakfast. Our suite was beautiful, on the 33 floor with a great view. I loved the kitchenette with microwave & fridge. Great location & modern rooms. There is also a complimentary evening reception that ends at 7:30 (that we missed). This was my first time staying at an embassy suite & I will be returning.Stayed here for the first time ( still here) and it is a fabulous place. Checked in a Little early and Damien said it wasn't a problem and he was so friendly and helpful!He gave me a map circled points of interest informed me there is a hot shuttle (which he said he would be more than happy to call ) as well as the charm circular ( which he said he would show me where to catch it) we opted for our feet and it was awesome. Stayed on the 20th floor, room was awesome! View was breathtaking at all hours! Had a slow draining tub called Damien at the front desk and he quickly sent .someone to fix itVery quiet ! Beds are omg you cnt feel the person next to you move! Cons: women's sauna was a little creepy , had a " someone is lurking behind the door vibe due to the other women's locker room door lead to another door the men's (opted out for the sauna and locker room) lolTugs: um we walked down around 10 people were at the bar drinking , bartender was very friendly and engaging, didnt see anyone eating although I was starving opted for a water ( place closes at mid night) food is rather expensive no traditional bar foodOh also booked thru Priceline and Inputted the wrong date.. Priceline said it couldn't be modified (will never use them again) but booking.com contacted the hotel and explained and it was modified w/out any fees thanks Angela!Afraid I couldn't recommend staying here to anyone. For the price, the complimentary breakfast is rather weak. The from-concentrate orange juice was rather acidic and made me ill for most of the day. The rooms have no insulation to speak of. From my room, at the end of one of the halls, I could regularly hear the elevator chimes, like some sort of perverse high-class water torture as I attempted to sleep.While I am grateful for the existence of the sofabed in the King room, despite being relatively new, it was not a pleasure to sleep on. Approximately the same as sleeping on a large couch. I am not sure what kind of suite Lillie Z. had, but I can certainly tell you that it is not representative of the "regular" rooms at this hotel. The bathroom was a cramped little affair tucked away in a corner, not some Grecian-columned marvel.The staff, however, seemed absolutely wonderful, and I give them the highest regards.I stayed here over the summer to watch a baseball game and spend sometime in the city. The only thing that is really bad about this place is the elevators. Not sure if they ever fixed them but they were SO SO SO SLOW when I stayed there. It was kind of pathetic how such a nice hotel could have such crappy elevators. The only other feature that is nothing to brag about is the pool. It's okay. It's kind of located in an awkward part of the hotel, it's surrounded by buildings and a concrete wall, so theres not much sun getting into the pool area. It's also small so not a lot of people can be in the area at once.The positives at this place, however, are the suites. They are SO SPACIOUS and the furniture is so great and modern. I couldn't believe how much space we got and each room is also a decent size, with a TV and a nice sized closet. I almost didn't want to leave the room because it was so cozy.The location of the hotel is really good as well. The are about one block from a little shopping plaza that has a liquor store and a grocery store. You can also catch the bus (go for the free charm city circulator, not the people standing outside the hotel who will rip you off for a ride to the harbor). You can also easily walk to the harbor from the hotel if you want, it's just a straight line down, so getting lost is virtually impossible.I hate to leave the hotel has great service and a great staff! I'll be back and certainly will return! We had the best bunny reunion ever. I can't thank you all enough for your hospitality!I give this hotel five stars due to the attentiveness of the staff. At first glace the front desk area appears cold and unwelcoming. Do not let that fool you. We pulled into valet parking and were promptly approached by the valet to take our car. The valet and bellman (Damien and Devante) were friendly, welcoming, and helpful. This attitude was continued at the front desk where we were greeted promptly, warmly and professionally. In fact, I have never experienced such a nice welcome in all my travels. We arrived early and went to Starbucks that is adjacent to the hotel to wait for our room. The front desk notified us that our room was ready before the check-in time. Our room had two queen beds and a nice sitting area. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The beds were quite comfortable. I did not mind the smaller bathroom because there was a larger walk-in closet/changing area. We did not use the kitchen. The TV worked perfectly and we received free in-room WiFi for signing up for HiltonHonors. Nice view from the 30th floor. Room quiet and we did not hear any outside noise. We enjoyed the evening reception that included free munchies and drinks. Had a glass of red wine and enjoyed the friendly ambiance. Bartenders were pleasant and accommodating. We also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. Large selection of good food and the coffee and orange juice were tasty too. We had a late lunch at the B'More Bistro. The vegetarian wrap and chicken tacos were delicious. The pizza was nothing special and pricey but we did enjoy ourselves. Overall I we enjoyed our stay and will return.We booked this hotel at the last minute after a boat trip. We decided to stay in the area and I was VERY pleased. The hotel is undergoing renovations but I wasn't inconvenienced at all. I was placed on the 33rd floor with breathtaking views of the city. The suite was clean, modern and had all the amenities, microwave, fridge, coffeemaker etc. The shower was hot INSTANTLY and stayed that way until I was ready to leave (I had to be pulled out) :-) The staff was friendly and helpful; check in and checkout was a breeze! Parking was incredibly reasonable. For the price I paid...THIS IS AS GOOD AS IT GETS!!!Very nice embassy suites hotel. Not your typical embassy suites but this may just be better. Amazing views. Immaculate room. Great breakfast. Located convienently downtown. They even have a Starbucks. Staff is extremely professional and helpful. Wish I could of stayed longer.......I WILL BE VISITING AGAIN TONIGHT. HOPE TO HAVE A GREAT TIME AS I DID LAST YEAR.I was looking for a reasonably priced hotel near the Inner Harbor and found this place. Lucky me!Entering the hotel, you are not necessarily taken back, as the registration desk, which is off to the left and is totally understated. However, once you work your way around the corner to the elevators, you begin to understand the quality and stateliness of this hotel. Yes, there are slight indications of wear resulting from the age of the facility, but really in some ways it only added to the appreciation of this hotel.When I got to my room, I was really impressed the the size and appointments of the room. Straight ahead there were two queen beds, nicely done, and a decent sized work table. To the left was a walk in closet, which also doubled as the entryway to the bathroom. On the far end, an alcove that contained a kitchenette that hosted cabinets, a fridge, microwave, coffee brewer and sink. The bed, from which I am writing this review, was very comfy and blessed with many pillows. There is also a nice sized flat screen TV in the room that provides access to a larger than normal selection of channels.I visited the 4th floor, where they have their fitness room. The room itself was decent sized and had with about 4 machines and a stretching room. The real find, however, on this floor was the locker room complete with a sauna! I can count on one hand the number of hotels I've ever visited with a sauna, but it is the only one I've ever visited where it wasn't part of a costly spa!Off the lobby is a deli, while I didn't enter, I did peak in and was impressed with the selection incorporated into its case.Compared with other hotels in the center of Baltimore, heck you can include nearly anywhere, this place is an absolute bargin in terms of price! Sadly, it will soon become a member of the Embassy Suites family, which means that the nightly prices will likely double. That said, in comparison to many of the other choices available in the center of Baltimore, I'd still consider staying here again.Excellent stay! The front desk was incredibly accommodating, the staff, fright from our first encounter with the valet service all the way through our stay was some of the best we've received! The rooms are clean and well arranged and the location is great! Evan and the rest of the staff at the front desk was amazing! I whole heartedly recommend this hotel!Rooms near elevators--not good. Go somewhere else or insist on a room away from the elevators...
review_content_60: Great location, great facility, great staff.  We had a really great experience here during a graduation extended weekend.  The facility has been updated from the old Tremont Hotel, still a 10 min walk from Inner Harbor, 2 block walk to Purple Circulator bus which gets you to mt. vernon and fed hill neighborhoods. Unreservedly recommend.My company recently booked this hotel for me for a 3 night stay, and I have already let them know to NEVER book me at this hotel again. - Upon check in the "lobby" was a single desk with a single person who was tasked with working the desk and apparently answering all of the hotels incoming calls also. It took about 15 mins to get checked in and I don't think the guy said more than 5 words to me since he was constantly on the phone.- once I finally got to my room the TV wasn't plugged in, nor was the telephone. - the ironing board in my room was literally so broken that it couldn't stand up. It also took 2 days and about 5 requests for them to send mea replacement. - The maid service was TERRIBLE. I got fewer and fewer towels each day for some reason, and my soaps and shampoos were NEVER replaced over the course of a 3 night stay. - the elevators are terrible and se,I scary. They take FOREVER to arrive on your floor, or even to the lobby if that's where you're waiting, even though there are 4 of them. Once your inside they move slowly as well. They also beep like heck and refuse to move if there are more than 5 ppl inside.- don't bother calling the valets ahead of time to bring your car around because they say they will and then won't. This happened at least twice.Wish I could give no stars. Elevator was broken for hours had to walk up and down 20 flights of stairs . Even when they got it running it was so slow and packed full everytime I got in it . The air con didn't work and the bed sheets stink of fish . Rank hotel .This place is sooo cool.If you stay here, be sure to walk over and tour the Grand.It used to be a Masonic Temple and is full of history.The women's bathroom is one of the 10 most luxurious in the country, make sure you peek in there.I just stayed here a week ago with family for two nights. They said it's their grand opening weekend, which they just bought the property from another hotel and did renovations to it. When we just pulled into the valet area a dark skin guy came straight up to the hotel and help us and waited patiently for us to get our stuff out of the car and to check in so he can bring our stuff up to our room, he was probably one of the helpful guys their (I wish I remembered his name). Our room was big and comfy for 3 adults. We had a suite so personal bedroom, dinning area, kitchen, decent size bathroom, it was a great room. After spending a 30 minutes in our room we decided to go down to the inner harbor but did not want to drive so we went down stairs and ask for a taxi number they said we have a van to take our guest to places which was helpful and convent. The first night I was sleeping on the bed that was in the couch very uncomfortable. There were no extra blankets in the room so I called down to see if I can I have one sent to my room, the lady on the phone said it will be right up. 45minutes almost an hour still no blanket so I called again and a gentlemen answered and I told him I called already 45 minutes ago to get a blanket and no one has came. After 20 minutes after calling a second time house keeping came with a warm blanket.For managers special was nice they just need to open up more table area for the amount of people that went. It was tight and not enough chairs.Breakfast was nice. The next day we went out to go for a drive. We walk outside to pick up our car from valet. We stood their for a good 20 minutes until we had to go inside to have the front desk call down for our car. After waiting a little over 30 minutes and employee that was talking to another employee the whole time decided to come over and have the courage to ask us if we been help after he knew no one even came over to help us and saw us go to the front desk.Overall the hotel was amazing but the customer service and all the employee's that I did talk to and came across was not helpful at all only the dark skinned man that was outside doing valet was helpful.We booked this hotel as a birthday treat and it was the best choice. Granted there is some construction going on but the helpful staff made an effort to ensure our stay was pleasant and disrupted as little as possible. The location is great, we were able to walk to the inner harbor or get a cab easily, and the views from our room were amazing. I, and my friends, look forward to the next weekend we stay here.Review based on one night stay in a double room suite on the 24th floor:PROs:+ Suites are very spacious (2x bedrooms, 2x bathrooms, dining room/kitchen, and living room)+ Beds are probably the most comfortable I've ever experienced from a hotel.  Super plush and easy to get lost in and drift away+ Walking distance from Inner Harbor+ Free WIFI+ Free complimentary bottled water+ Happy, cheerful staff+ Street noise wasn't too bad on this floor (though the hallway noise from doors seems to come in)CONs:- Mold in one of the showers- A/C control is a bit quirky, but understandable with the sizes of the rooms (1x control for bedrooms, 1x for rest of the suite)- Room service was definitely a sore point.  We ordered desserts and was told about 20-40 minutes (wich seemed like an awful long time for 2x desserts).  After an hour, still nothing.  You know its bad when room service calls you back after over an hour's wait to ask if you still wanted your order.  Molten lava cake and strawberry shortcake was definitely not worth the wait or the $20+This hotel was definitely a surprise for never hearing of it before.   Very impressed with the size of the suite when we first arrived.  Room service definitely took away from the overall experience (even though it was only on this occasion).  The beds are probably going to be the longest lasting memory.  SOOOO Comfy!  Definitely has the Embassy Suites vibe, minus the breakfast.I only attended a conference here so I can only review the conference facilities. The facilities in one word is breathtaking. The first thought when I stepped in was " I wish I had my wedding here". The catering from the hotel was also very good and had a "high end" feel. The only negatives were uneven cooling of the conference rooms and confusion regarding the two sections of the hotel.Stay: Fri 11/30 - Sun 12/02Top-shelf quality that was so affordable...the attention of the staff was excellent and the rooms surprisingly expansive....the close proximity to the Inner Harbor area was another pleasant surprise, so much that we did not move our car once the whole weekend! We definitely plan to return! ...now the Wife and I are from and live in the city, so the presence of the "neighborhood" folk and the panhandlers offering door service at the 7-11 (best hot cocoa!) are no big deal to us but if such is your concern, just be prepared...not at all threatening, just present...but hey, it's THEIR city, we're just visiting!By the way, you can avoid the higher priced valet parking by using the city parking garage right next-door (parking is definitely a challenge!) On the weekend, it's only $5 per day which for us -not moving our car at all- meant only $10 for the whole weekend! (less than one day in the hotel's valet parking)...the challenge though, if you must leave/re-enter the city garage, you must pay again, but even then, it will still be less expensive...A caveat about the price review...I found a great deal on-line, this is clearly a much more expensive hotel at the regular rate...I've stayed in worse & better places.  This was my second stay here in 30 days.First time w/ wife & some of the kids - stay was fineThis time w/ my loudly snoring brother (should have brought my moto earplugs)Same type of room - 2 Queen beds, very comfy within a nice large room.  Big Bonus is they have a kitchen w/ refrig - keep them drinks chillin.Bathrooms could use a make over, due to older fixtures, but everything worked & was clean.I used hotel tonight app to book & saved myself $70. Good StuffStaff friendly - No worriesI had out of  town visitors book a room here through Hotwire as a secret hotel. It was an incredible value, at $56 a night. They were upgraded to a king suite upon checking in. With the Manager's special (free drinks and snacks every day during Happy Hour!) and the hot breakfast buffet, the hotel was such a steal. The staff were incredibly enthusiastic and helpful. Really remarkably so. When we pulled up in the car, the four valets immediately approached and opened the doors. They were standing outside in the cold waiting for guests. And managing to genuinely smile at the same time.The room was not luxurious but clean and comfortable. The downside was the $32/day valet parking.I would definitely recommend this hotel, and find it on Hotwire if you can. It was 3.5 stars on Hotwire. What a bargain.I was here for a conference so I cannot attest to the hotel accommodations for overnight stays.  The conference facility was very nice and the architecture is really something to marvel at.  The rooms are cavernous and there was a bit of a challenge with keeping the temperature consistent but considering the 20+ foot tall ceilings and tons of stone, it's easy to understand why.This building is a restored Masonic Grand Lodge from the days when the Masons were in the money.  The Tremont has done a very nice job with the restoration.  Very nice place.After RUNNING out of the Radisson Lord Plaza Hotel just a couple blocks over because it was DISGUSTING, we found solace when we entered this hotel and spent the weekend here.  Thanks for saving us Tremont, we appreciate it.  We would definitely stay here again.Rooms: Spacious and Clean.Staff: Friendly.Elevator:  About as slow as your 90 year old grandma MildredThis place is very deceiving. It's under construction so the pull up and lobby look completely unlike any of their photos. It was a bizarre check in experience. The room itself is very nice and comfortable. However, maid service never gave us new towels the second day so we had to ask for them and when they did come they were just thrown into the room. Lastly, upon check out, they gave us a bill for $96 stating we used their valet service three times for overnight stays. We used it for 1 hour upon checkin which should have only been $20. Now we have to fight them to change the bill. One more thing - their paperwork in the room says there is dining options but when I called it was busy so then I called the front desk and they said it was out of date information. It's hard to call this one since we liked the room but the service was terrible.First time here and even though we came on what may have been there busiest weekend EVER (2 family reunions and 1 wedding) he staff was still prompt and super friendly. Con - the vast amount of people here has created a slow moving elevator system. Granted we are on the very top floor so I'm being understandable of the wait.The deli attached is great. While on one of those long elevator waits we met one of the staff members and she was super friendly. Went into the deli and she was still on duty. We ordered two sandwiches, got two sodas, two bags of chips and six pack of canned beer (canned coronas who knew) total came to $36.00 and because of her great customer service skills she will be leaving today with a nice tip from us.Back in the room the space is amazing, mini kitchen area when first walk in, a sitting area with desk and around corner the bathroom and bedroom. The bed is very comfortable and well decorated. The room as a whole is clean and well maintained.Will I be back that would be a hell yes.I really loved the whole set up crazy but it had an historic feel to the place the marble and the ambiance was lovely. Might seem crazy but the ladies room totally drew oohs and ahhs from me it was like a palace I felt under- dressed. Would love to see how the outside looks once construction is complete.Had another good stay here, but the place was under rennovation and my room smelled a bit.  Other than that, I had a nice kitchen in my room, the TV was large, the bed and linens were unbelievably comfy, the toiletries in the bathroom were fabulous, and the price was more than right!!!!  Thanks for another great stay!!!My husband and I decided to get away for a weekend and visit the Baltimore Aquarium While in the city we decided to stay at the Tremont Hotel. I was unaware of the renovation until I called a week after making the reservation. I didn't think it would be too bad because they were allowing people to book rooms and stay at the hotel. I was wrong about that.When we walked into the hotel to check in there were loud construction noises. I couldn't believe people were actually having conversations with the employees at the front desk because I could barely my husband standing right next to me.There were four elevators but only two worked. The two that worked too FOREVER to arrive and at one point we decided, along with the two other people waiting, to take the stairs down. We were on the 9th floor and I was surprised by how fast we were able to get down to the 2nd floor. The stairwell, however, is not those who are claustrophobic. The only way to travel on the stairs is single file. Quite frankly the elevators weren't much better. They were cramped and made some perplexing noises. When we were leaving we called for the elevator (going down, of course) and it brought us an elevator going up. We had to take the elevator to the 23rd floor just to go down. It was awful. The room wasn't bad; in fact it was pretty nice. It was very big compared to others I've stayed in. It had a nice TV that rotated so you could watch it either from the couch or bed. I was able to maneuver it so I could watch the TV while dressing the closet area so that was nice. The room was hot so we had to turn the A/C on to get it cool. It still felt clammy even when it cooled down some.The bathroom was right next to the elevator but it was one that wasn't working so we didn't have to listen to it during our stay. The bathroom was ... oddly designed. The sink was at this weird angle and there was a floor length mirror in front of the toilet. I would have understood if there wasn't another floor length mirror in the room but there wasn't. The water pressure wasn't that great and even with the water not coming out at high pressure the tub had some trouble draining. If I showered for any longer the water would have been up to my ankles instead of just covering the bottom of my feet. The towels were comfortable, not like your usual scratchy hotel towels, except they left fuzz all over me.We only stayed for one night and planned on eating at the hotel's restaurant. When we returned from our adventure we stopped at the front desk and asked if they had a menu. No, they didn't. Why? Because the restaurant wasn't open. Luckily I knew they had a deli connected to the hotel so we went there. It looked pretty bare and empty. I had my doubts about them but they proved me wrong. I initially ordered a turkey and ham club with bacon but they were out of bacon (!) so I went with a turkey sandwich with Muenster cheese, and honey mustard. They were out of roasted turkey and suggested pastrami turkey. I was skeptical, to say the least, but they offered me a slice to taste it and it was pretty good. It was a very tasty sandwich and they were very friendly employees. Kudos to the deli next door!Overall, the experience was meh. I wouldn't stay here again and I wouldn't have stayed here if I had known it was under so much construction. The elevator situation was REALLY annoying.We came here to celebrate my wife's birthday and our stay was outstanding. I left a note when booking that the reason for the stay was her birthday, and they upgraded us from the single King room we requested to a full suite with a living room, dining area, and kitchen. The complimentary breakfast was one of the best hotel breakfasts I've had, and the complimentary cocktail hour was fantastic as well. The location is great, right in the heart of downtown and a very short walk to Mount Vernon. The Charm City Circulator's Purple Route has a stop on the same corner as the hotel, providing a fast, free way to get to and from the Inner Harbor, Federal Hill, and Penn Station.Can't say enough good things about this hotel.This hotel is going through some renovations right now and every guest in the hotel knows it.First off, the valet for the hotel is really out of sorts. When we pulled up from the airport, there was a car blocking the entire valet and he was talking to an employee, so we just sat idle in our car waiting for him to move. After a few minutes, he, nor the employee were acknowledging that we were sitting there waiting. Finally, after about 6 minutes the employee yelled at us that the driver had locked his keys in his car and was waiting for a locksmith and we should pull around. When we did get our car in the right spot, we told another valet who was there that we would be valeting for the night, but we were just going to check in, drop off our bags, then come back out to go get some lunch, so don't take the car in the garage yet. He agreed it was fine and told us to come down when we were ready and he'd have our car ready to go.Fifteen minutes later we came down and our car was there, but the valet was nowhere to be found. We waited about 10 minutes for him to finally show up so we could get our keys and we left. Little did we know, the would be our experience every time. At every turn, we were waiting 20 minutes for a valet to show up with our car. Even when we called it in from the room 10 minutes early. They were very understaffed.When we check in, the counter only had one employee there trying to service about 4 people and more and more people kept filling the small lobby. The little store in the hotel, which is supposed to offer amenities didn't have good stock. There wasn't even bottled water available. The rooms: luckily, we asked for a got a newly remodeled room, so it had all the right "visuals" or a nice room. fluffy bedding, decent big couch, nice flat screen, granite countertops. But, the room was layed out really weird. The wet-bar area, which was just a small room the held the coffee maker, ice bucket and mini fridge was bigger than the bathroom. Speaking of the bathroom, it was really tiny. I mean the corner sink area was so tiny, there was no room to put personal items on it. The toilet was also crammed between the tiny sink and the decent sized bathtub. A bathroom that size needed a shower stall.A few other things that were crappy: 1 ) the first night we were there we couldn't get any hot water. We called the front desk at 30 minutes later they sent up a man at 10:30 to our room and all he did was tell us to turn on the faucet and wait a while for the hot water. It never came. 2) He was also sent up because it was so hot and muggy in our room and the air wasn't pumping out cool air. He also had a non-helpful answer to that: the air works by sensing if people are in the room and will cool off accordingly. We had already been in our room for 2 hours before he came up. 3) There were only a few plugs in the room and none of them were located near the bed. Two of the four plugs in our room didn't work also. 4) The sheets were itchy. The were pressed, white and smelled like industrial cleaner. I bet at most they were 150 thread count. 5) This is a picky one, but the TV was in a weird place. I mean, you couldn't lay in bed and watch it because it was on a perpendicular wall. 6) Oh, and the music in the lobby was SOO LOUD! 7) only 2 of the 4 elevators were working and this hotel has something like 28 floors. So, you had to wait literally 5 whole minute for the elevator!For the price per night plus the valet fees, this place was awful.
review_content_80: We visited Tremont Hotel over Spring Break, and what a wonderful surprise.  We got a great price from a Living Social deal, so I wasn't expecting very much; however, like some of the other reviews stated:  the rooms are large and well kept.  The entire hotel is undergoing construction, but none of this bothered us because we were out and about all day long.  The person that took our luggage was kind and upbeat, and Damian, at the front desk, is awesome!  In addition, we left our baby's blanket at the hotel, but thankfully Damian, Sofia & Gera, from housekeeping, helped us locate it.  They went beyond their jobs in helping us.  Thank you to the Tremont Staff!We spent five nights at this hotel for my daughters volleyball tournament.  The rooms were spacious, very clean and nice.  The bed was so comfortable with soft sheets and a nice down comforter, I slept like a baby!  And having a mini kitchen was just great as well.  The location is also excellent with walking distance to the harbor area with nice shopping and restaurants.  And of course close to the convention center.But honestly the best part of this hotel is the staff.  Every person greated us with a smile every time we interacted with them.  I know they call Baltimore the Charm city and I can say the Tremont definately has the Charm.  They also delt with two teams of 15/16 year old girls with grace and professionalism.  What a great experience.Stayed here for a work conference.  The rooms are great and spacious.  The best part is the bed.  It is not often that I have a good nights sleep while on the road.  The sheets are ultra comfortable and so it the mattress.While planning a friends bachelorette party, we scored an awesome deal through LivingSocial, paying only $109 for a King Suite.  That's $327 for three rooms, which would've cost us well over $600 at full price.  Unbelievable.Check-in was a breeze.  They asked if we wanted the rooms close together, and I said yes if possible, but instead we were on the 19th, 23rd and 32nd floor.  Not a big deal though.  The rooms were very spacious and well kept.  Decor was attractive and updated.  And man, did they have fantastic views of the city!  I had called the day before and asked if they could provide champagne glasses since we were celebrating and they were happy to accomodate.  Some of the girls checked into one room earlier and when I had noticed that there were no glasses, the phone literally rang that moment with the concierge asking which room to deliver the glasses to, since we had three of them!  Perfect.  Some of us grabbed some food from downstairs and everyone thought it was pretty good.  Tug's had messed up one order, even though they were the only customers in the place, but they fixed it.When it was time to go out, the doorman was quick with hailing us two cabs and made sure the cabbies knew where we were going.  When we returned, they were patient and politely held the door open for us as we, ahem, carried one of the gals in.The beds and sleep sofas were very comfortable and the sheets were fantastic.  I meant to check what brand/material they were but I forgot.There was some minor confusion when we checked out because the invoices we received under our doors showed an outstanding balance but when I checked with the front desk, they said all I owed were the taxes, which was only $8/room.  They will valet your car for $25/night or you can park in the garage right next door for $10.  It's a secure garage so I had no issues with leaving it there.I noticed the scaffolding outside but didn't notice or hear any construction activity during our stay, though it was a Saturday-Sunday trip.My husband and I came to visit this lovely hotel with a Groupon on our anniversary week back in October 2012. The room was cute, the view from the window was great, and the bed was VERY comfy. This hotel was in walking distance of the harbor where we were able to go site seeing and visit the local aquarium. We would of spent more time then 3 days and 2 nights, but it was a bit pricey or we would of stayed longer =)When you walked into this hotel it was very beautiful. The lobby was small however it was nice. The staff was very attentive and helpful. I had arrived around rush hour and the bell hop was eager to assist me with my luggage out of the cab. I had acquired this hotel via Priceline and this name just popped up via "Name your Own Price" Option. I had never heard of this hotel but I was not disappointed. The room was very quaint and felt very much like home. A plus was that the hotel was close to area restaurants as well as walking distance to the infamous Baltimore Harbor. I would definitely stay at this hotel again I had a excellent experience.The hotel is great.  Staff is great at check in and valet parking as well even that there is remodel going on. Only down is deli staff which is not owned by hotel but I got package that includes it, staff there dirty, doesn't seem to care about guest or anything.Beautiful, beautiful hotel. It must have been renovated recently because everything looked so beautiful and new, and the interior design was great. Everyone was very nice, helpful and friendly. My stay was very pleasant. Such a great value for a NICE free breakfast and FREE wine every evening!Spacious and clean rooms. Super friendly and helpful staff. Can't beat this hotel for the price.I can't get over how rude the staff is! We stayed in the hotel for one night for a wedding (which wasn't at the hotel).  From the moment we got there we had one bad experience after another with the staff. The room was OK.  It was spacious but definitely needed some updating.  Our biggest compliant was the way the staff spoke to its guest.  Many of our friends staying in this same hotel felt the same way.  We ordered room service and accidentally fell asleep before it arrived.  They said it would be up in 30 minutes but it took over an hour for it to come.  We woke up to someone practically kicking down the door.  The lady who brought it up SCREAMED at my husband for not answering the door right away.  SO RIDICULOUS! I would never ever stay here again!The next time I want to be wildly inconvenienced, made to feel uncomfortable and unsafe, and then patronized for having valid concerns, I'll stay at the Embassy Suites Inner Harbor again. -"suite" was a lot smaller than you'd expect for the price, awkward set up (you must walk through the closet to get to the bathroom)-great location (easy walk to the inner harbor and short cab to Fells Point or Federal Hill)-only 4 elevators for 37 floors, plan to leave your room 10-15 minutes before you want to leave the hotel-don't bother with the valet, we parked our car on Friday night in the municipal lot next to the hotel and left on Sunday afternoon and it was only $10-staff needs professionalism trainingThis is could be a great hotel, but if you run into any issues you're out of luck. There was something wrong with our door and the way it shut so the lock didn't always catch even though the door would be closed. We didn't find this out until 3am when we returned from a night out only to find our door wide open. We called security and a guy came upstairs with just a piece of scrap paper and wrote down "door was open." They didn't even give us the option of switching rooms considering the door was totally unsafe. We were fortunate enough to not find anything missing, but we wanted security to check their tapes to be sure no one went into the room or tampered with the lock while we were gone. As it turns out, THE HOTEL DOESN'T HAVE ANY SECURITY CAMERAS IN THEIR HALLWAYS, and all they could do was have their "engineers" reference the lock the next day to see if any maids had gone in the room. The next morning when we went to breakfast we had the same issue with the door even after we took extra care to be sure it was closed. We asked the front desk about it but the security team never told management about the situation from the night before. The manager on duty told us there was probably just something wrong with the door because of the cold. She started rambling about how with concerns about the door we probably didn't sleep well... but she never offered us anything for the trouble we had. I spent an hour in the middle of the night trying to get some sort of answer from their security team about whether or not the lock was functioning and the hotel just brushed it off. I demanded that the security team actually look into this because I don't want someone else having the same issue. The next day they called me with the "results" and told me that in the future I should make sure the door closes. Okay, I'll start repeatedly re-checking that doors lock as if I have OCD as soon as your hotel starts valuing their guests' safety concerns.The Tremont is located in the 'safe' part of a sketchy city.  The rooms are spacious and clean, with a large common area and nicely laid out bathroom.  They have a restaurant and bar, but neither are open very late.  There's also an overpriced convenience store on the first floor with horrible coffee.The security guard / parking attendants out front could be a little more friendly when dealing with hotel patrons, and the front desk staff was downright stupid when it came to simple questions.There's a Caribou Coffee, supermarket, and a few small bars and restaurants within walking distance, in addition to the downtown waterfront ten minutes away.  Cabs are very easy to come by in front of the hotel as well.All in all, this spot might be a tad overpriced for some - there are many affordable hotels within walking distance of this one.The hotel is nice- clean room, friendly staff, and the architectural charm was fascinating.However, it seemed like the elevators were slow.overall, it was a nice stay.I signed up two days before actually staying there for a room with two queen beds for my buddy and I.  We showed up at 9pm that night to be told that they had overbooked those rooms and that we get an upgrade.  The upgrade was a room with a king and a sofa bed.A sofa bed?  I'm paying $200 a night for my friend to sleep on a sofa bed?  That really pissed me off.  How that was an upgrade I don't know.On top of all that, there was mold growing all over the ceiling of the closet in the bathroom.  They don't have any fans or anything so the moisture just builds up and rots the place.  So gross.I mentioned it to the staff about my displeasure at the room and the mold and they just brushed me off, please sign the bill sir.I'd rather spend $60 staying outside of the city and renting a car than stay here again.An incredible venue for a wedding reception. My wife and I were married on April 27th in the Edinburgh room.  It was exactly what we wanted.  The event staff  for the venue and our wedding planner made sure everything went as planned.  Cocktail hour was held in the Oriental room and we heard nothing but great things.  The reception was back in the Edinburgh as the staff was able to flip the room relatively quickly.  The room setup was beautiful.  The rooms themselves are great.  The architecture and decor of the venue is something to see.  We worked with Amy and she was fantastic. The food was great.  Our guest pretty much loved everything that was brought out.  I would definitely recommend to a couple looking for a venue in Baltimore.  Not to mention that the bride and groom suite was huge.  Highly recommended.I was here for a week-long conference for work. The rooms are breath-taking - almost all of them retain the old-fashioned Masonic lodge decor; only a few are the more modern, generic-looking conference spaces I'm used to. I will forever remember the Oriental Room with its wash of dark reds and golds - on the walls, the floors, and even the ceiling. The main room where our keynotes were held was just amazing, a cathedral-like room that required a few seconds of awe as soon as you walked in. It was nice, too, that one hallway included a few exhibits on the history of the place.With that said, the old-fashioned huge rooms were a bit of a problem. The Oriental Room, though fashionable, was also kept very dim - not the best place for active critical thinking. The main Masonic room was fine for large keynote addresses but the smaller sessions were swallowed up by the room. The projection screen was fairly useless for anyone in the back row as well. For some reason, the rooms were always set up with circular tables - strange for a conference. I would have expected the majority of rooms to be simple rows of chairs. The tables made it difficult to get close enough to the presenter for each session and gave a haphazard, spread-out feel (though they were great for the few group projects we did).Went to Baltimore for the weekend and stayed at this hotel. We stayed in the studio style suite, which included 2 queen size beds, a kitchen, tv, and a spacious closet. It was just the two of us, but that was the smallest room they had, which to us it's pretty big for just the 2 of us. The closet space was so spacious we could have 2 other people stayed inside. As a matter of fact it seems like they were expecting someone to perhaps sleep inside the closet or something because there were extra blankets and pillow inside the closet.The beds were ridiculously comfortable! The pillows, blankets and everything about it was so soft and fluffy that we both slept an extra hour than intended. If my bed were like that at home I'll be late for work every day. We ran out of toothpaste, which their deli store did not carry. And all the stores around us were already closed, but luckily at the front desk they gave us toothpaste. On our last day we needed a cab to bring us back to the station, but there weren't any cabs at the time of our departure. The bellhop was nice enough to drive us to the station, but it's the same charge as a cab ride.The bar area was pretty neat and they are open until 12AM and you can take your drinks out of the bar. There's also jazz nights on the weekends, which we didn't check out. The gym was pretty nice, but haven't used it. The stay at this hotel was really nice and I would come back here. However there wasn't a nice view from our window, so all we saw was a cement wall and the sky.Did I mention how comfortable the beds were? I secretly wanted to take a pillow home with me, better yet the entire bed!My husband and I loved our stay here. From the fact there are only 10 rooms per floor to the fine service from the staff. Especially Jeremiah, the doorman. The hotel is within a 10 minute walk to the harbor which makes for good exercise. We look forward to staying again when we come back to Baltimore.I can't believe anyone would give this hotel less than five stars. Our stay over the 4th of July was fantastic! The rooms were very nice (especially for the price) and clean, the staff were very friendly and provided excellent service, and the hotel itself is very accessible. We had a problem with the a/c in the room we were in. I called down to the front desk and they sent someone up from maintenance very quickly. Once he determined our thermostat was faulty, they immediately moved us to another room, upgrading our accommodations to a full suite! I was very impressed. We'll definitely be going back.This review concerns only Tremont's reservation system.I sought to cancel a reservation with them. First I sent an email, replying to the emailed reservation confirmation they sent me, and asked for a confirmation of the cancelation.Two days later, after no response, I sent a follow-up email, again asking for confirmation. Two days later, after no response, I called to the number listed on email confirmation. The agent could not ever find my reservation, despite repeated attempts and providing her with all of the information contained in my reservation - confirmation number, name, arrival date. She indicated something about reservations that are made with the front desk aren't necessarily viewable by this "after hours" desk, and have to be canceled by the front desk. She asked me to call back on Monday, because it's "after hours" for the front desk (on Saturday early evening - really?).  So, in effect, I was asked to make up for the inadequacies in their reservation system, by trying a FOURTH time to cancel the reservation. I refused. I consider this level of service to be sub-par for a Motel 6, let alone a supposed good quality hotel in a city center. Good to know, so I didn't have to actually stay there to find this out.

review_content: This is a great hotel with an amazing location.  It's right next to the convention center (sky walkway) and walking distance to the inner harbor, little italy, and other downtown attractions.  Being long time Starwood preferred members, we can't compare to the other local hotels, but I was very satisfied with this hotel.  The staff was very helpful and polite, the room was spacious and clean, the club lounge served hot breakfast with 2 automatic espresso machines, and exercise room was nice as well.  There is a separate room with treadmills and bikes and then another room with free weights and some benches.The pool is just a wading pool and the chlorine had a weird smell to it, but that was really the only complaint.  For me, the location was so nice, having the ability to walk everywhere we wanted to go.  The hotel does give some passes to be able to leave the garage if you need to w/o having to pay for re-entry which is nice.Just stayed at the hotel for two days. The good:  All but one of the staff were very nice. The rooms were decent. Centrally located. Gym was nice for a hotel. Access to Mortons steakhouse or hotel restaurant. Although both were 50-100% higher priced than a non tourist located restaurant.     The bad:You have to pay for Wifi-really!? It's 2015!!Parking is still $27 a night for self park, as a guest. The garage is not directly connected to the building. You have to go to G2 and follow a tunnel to the hotel. The garage roof is very very low. I have an expedition and made it by 1 inch or less. If you have a larger vehicle or a Thule on top there is no way to fit. For 2 days I had over $100 in just tax,tourist tax and fees. That is crazy. The room was NOT well cleaned. My young daughter found dirty panties and shorts under the bed. (Adult dirty). Nice Sheraton, try explaining why some other girls panties are in your room to a 7yr old girl. The swimming pool is a joke. It barely larger than a decent jacuzzi. Deepest area is 4.5ft. I would not recommend for kids over 10 or they will be very disappointed.  The pool was also very cloudy, to the point you couldn't see the bottom. Although nicely located I couldn't believe the large number of homeless that constantly badgered my family, and I come from the DC metro area.  It's that bad.So annoyed. Checked in and asked for an upgrade. They said that would be $30/night unless I joined Starwood Preferred Guests. Joined Starwood Preferred Guests. Still $30/night. Seriously? And still no harbor view. Boooo!Sheraton is the low-end of the high-end hotel chains. They offer decent priced higher end hotel rooms without a lot of the fuss. That is not, however, to say that Sheraton hotels don't have high-end amenities. In fact, the Sheraton Inner Harbor is the perfect example of a mid-range (price) hotel with an enormous number of great benefits. By far the best thing about the hotel is the staff. They are just so darn on top of everything. You have a problem with your AC unit in the room - call the front desk and someone is at your room to fix the issue in minutes. Coming and going from the hotel frequently, I had the pleasure of interacting with the doormen on a number of occasions. They were the nicest guys. I mean it - the staff are great: from the front desk reception to the valet departure, everyone is top notch.The location is also a huge plus. If you have business in Baltimore, the Inner Harbor Hotel offers easy access to just about anywhere. In addition, there is a great morning run to be had around the harbor on the contiguous board walk. Certainly the hotel could use a bit of upgrades (note: They recently upgraded the Club Lounge and moved to a larger space with more food and drink options and a great harbor view), but all-and-all - it is a great place for the business traveler or the family on vacation. The staff are the best part.Trying to keep this short! In sum, having stayed here numerous times, I can honestly say this is the first hotel I try to book when staying in the Inner Harbor area. Having visited nearly every hotel in close proximity, the Sheraton is my first choice. Even if you're not happy with something their staff is on it pronto and will fix any issue you could possible have. I typically stay on the club level however the standard rooms are just as nice. For those who are unaware, they relocated and upgraded the club room to what was likely a suite space that wasn't being utilized as often as they'd hoped. Great deal for us as the new club room (as of Spring 2015) is awesome! So much more space than the old club room! They probably doubled the space and the view is a million times better. Not cramped like the old room. The early morning view of the harbor in particular is just spectacular. Plus those staying across from the club room don't have to hear the slamming of the door as people constantly come and go for early morning coffee. Great move on behalf of the Sheraton! The gym is much better than the comps in the area and parking is plentiful. Also love the pool. Thanks Sheraton for providing a space we can count on!The worst hotel I have EVER stayed at in my life.  Room  Smelled like mold. heating, cooling unit not working, was like 90 degrees in the room. RUDE,UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF. Don't expect any help from the manager he was the worst of all! Was told it was pet friendly brought my 5 lb dog with us. My husband and I went out and when we returned an hour later our dog was not in our room. HE WAS GONE!!! THEY TOOK OUR DOG WHO JUST HAD SURGERY A FEW DAYS PRIAR AND A CONE ON HIS HEAD OUT OF OUR ROOM!! The manager was belligerent, cocky, and he was a LIAR! He said we didn't have the dog in check in which we did.It was like we were in some kind of weird twilight zone. NOTHING and I mean NOTHING about this hotel stay was pleasant! Do yourself a favor and stay as far away from this hotel as possible!Thank you to everyone that works at this hotel! We had our wedding this past Saturday and had the most amazing experience. Special thanks to the Events & Catering Director, Vaneska Adams the chefs, Sam and Mike, Banquet Staff and Front Desk staff for making the entire weekend stress-free for us. Luckily the Orioles were in town and guests were able to walk one block over the next day to watch a ballgame. It was certainly the Best Day (Weekend) Ever!Average Sheraton, seems to be in a little bit dodgy part of town but walking distance to inner harbor and federal hlll so decent options. Rooms are OK, though dated. Overall, a standard Sheraton experience.Every time I stay in Baltimore I stay in this hotel.It is located in the best part of Baltimore the Inner Harbor. It is conveniently located very close to all the major tourist attractions like the National Aquarium. Many fine restaurants are in the immediate area. It is well within stumbling distance of all of the  my favorite local dive bars.On the downside it is on the pricey side so get someone else to pay for it and it is not within walking distance to the train station so you have to take a taxi.My dad was born in Baltimore so coming here always reminds me of him.I'm honestly kind of disappointed in this hotel. I guess I expected more a Sheraton. I was at a conference and stayed for 3 days. My room smelled like cigarette smoke. And other than the pillows being flat once they were slept on the linens and room was fine.  Got a view of the stadium. The front desk staff was not the most courteous. When I made a call to inquire about something I just simply got a "hello", I guess bc they knew I called on their phone , but no "how my I help you" or anything.  Our valet was attentive and prompt and polite. The grill staff seemed short at times and annoyed to be working honestly. The podiums for the conference were all banged up and dented and scratched. But they had nice chairs. There was a vegetarian meal served for a luncheon and there was only one person at our table that finished the food. Work out facilities were nice.  The weight room could use a good sweeping. I just called the desk and asked for a late check out and they told me I couldn't.  There are 350 people here for this conference and we have to carry around our luggage to meetings. This just wasn't quite what I expected from a Sheraton.All I did was call to check on a reservation and the person who answered the phone was extremely short and rude. He also kept interrupting me while we were on the phone. I hope my stay in a few months isn't awful like some of the reviews I have read. However, after that one phone call, I don't have much hope.If you want to catch something, stay here!!! This place is filthy!!! Room was not cleaned during my stay, and the carpet looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in days. There was some food on the floor when you get off elevator, and to my surprise it stayed there for 2 days!!! Actually it's still there as I write this review.  I HAVE ONLY ONE THING TO SAY....DONT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!! I will never make the mistake of staying at this Sheraton!!!!!!!!!!!!!They didn't clean my room, and when I tried to get someone to do it they hung on me three times. I'm a platinum spg member so if they treat me this bad I can't imagine how they treat others. Horrible hotel and poorly managed staff.It's been an experience, & we've only been here an hour. We check in & they tell us that the two double bed room for our three people was booked as a king. After a few angry words, we settle on getting a free roll away bed. A little later the desk informs us they are out of beds. After a few go arounds & asking them to cancel our reservation & find us another room, they came back with a much more expensive hotel. We finally agree to take extra blankets (to sleep on the floor) and the room at half price. To make matters even worse, while dealing with the front desk attendant, she had to continue to check with her supervisor three people over. Not once during our issue (even threatening to cancel the reservation) did he bother to come over and address us. Such terrible customer service. And for the cherry on top, we went to get a diet coke from the vending machine in the hall and a regular coke came out instead, and that was our last two singles. Hopefully the floor is comfortable, and guess who won't be back. Otherwise, the room is very nice, clean, etc.Looking at the reviews I was not expecting much but what we found was a truely 5 star experience! The hotel is located one block from the waterfront will shops and restaurants galore. The hotel is luxurious and the bed was to die for. Loved staying here.Staff is really friendly and professional. I stayed in the "club house" on the 14th floor and paid a lot for it but it's not worth it- the free drinks and food were not good. Powder eggs and dry sausage for breakfast both days and the evening fair was only cheese and grapes with free sodas. Definitely not worth the upgrade in price.Besides the disappointing upgrade the hotel itself was very typical. Great place to stay if you want to be within walking distance of the inner harbor or the Orioles stadium. They even have a shuttle to the casino if that is something you are interested in.Hubby and I stayed here for my recent birthday weekend in Baltimore. The GoodLocation was within short walking distance of the Harbor waterfront as well as the Water Taxi, various restaurants, Camden Yards, and the convention center.  We drove up from NoVa but didn't need to use our car the entire time.  The room was spacious and clean which is typical of other SPG properties. The staff were courteous and attentive. The BadWhen my husband booked the room, he was told we'd have a king room with a Sweet Sleeper bed.  What we got was a Murphy bed.  Not the most uncomfortable hotel bed, but definitely not what we are accustomed to at SPG hotels. We called to have our room changed, but there were no available rooms so we just stuck it out.I don't expect sound proof hotel rooms, but the walls in this hotel are THE thinnest in my hotel stay history.  And this is coming from someone who has spent countless nights in hotels all over the world.  We could easily hear our neighbors' conversation as well as the TV on both sides in addition to every door opening and closing in the hallway.  I assume they heard the same from us as well. This was particularly perturbing when the kids next door were up at 7AM on Sunday morning when I would have liked to sleep in after being out late on Saturday night.As there are other hotels nearby, I can't say that I'd stay here again, mainly due to the noise level. I like my sleep or else I'm cranky.More accurately, 1.5 stars. I got a sweet Expedia deal (something like $78/night) to stay here recently for a conference at JHU. I checked in around 10:30PM (avoiding a near-death via stampede by a busload of Indian and Chinese tourists, also checking in at the same time). The 7th floor room was adequate, if run down - frayed carpet, visibly outdated bathroom tiling and fixtures, a not-so-subtle musty smell. I wouldn't have chosen to stay there more than one (short) night. I made it the next morning to the gym, which was surprisingly well-maintained for all you LifeFitness treadmill fans out there. Staff are underwhelming. My Expedia deal came with free Wifi, but I spent at least 15 minutes at checkout getting the Wifi fee erased from my bill. Be sure to figure that into your checkout time. This is definitely not one of those places where you can feel comfortable walking out without first double-checking the printout slipped under the door!My girlfriend and I stayed there for one night during a work week. The hotel is clean and simple, nothing tantalizing about it. Thank God for the Morton's steak house otherwise I wouldn't have been thrilled with my stay. We had a server by the name William he was great!!! We drove a few hours to get there, once we arrived it then started pouring. So naturally we wanted to eat and wine down.  We actually didn't even have plans on eating at the hotel. I will admit it was a bit pricey for dinner however I would definitely go there again. I really wish I knew the name of the drink that was off the menu but was the best drink I had in a while. I guess for $18 it should be well worth it.Have you ever watched the "soup nazi" episode of Seinfeld? Well I'm guessing it's a  requirement to watch and emulate, for employment considerations here at this Sheraton. The staff here would get upset very very easily, even setting up a wake up call was irritating to them. On multiple occasions the front desk staff would pick up and immediately hang up the phone in phone in a hopeful, yet vain attempt you wouldn't call back. The hotel is noisy and you will get to know your neighbors very intimately. You will get to know their bathroom habits, and hear their arguments. You actually won't have to bother calling the angry woman at the front desk, because you can always count on your neighbor's alarm for a wake up.
review_content_20: Perfect location by Camden Yards.  We were able to check in early.  Staff were friendly.  Bed was a little hard but got a great nights sleep.  Would stay again when in the areaIf you enjoy a broken heater during the coldest months of the year, this place is for you.If you're one of those who like to be awoken by a gurgling drain from the bathroom instead of your alarm, boy, are you in luck. And, if you're one who likes clogged drains and dirty bathtubs with dirt rising from the bottom during your shower, then this place is for you!The staff could not be more rude. I travel for a living and spend more than 6 months out of the year on the road. I stay at SPG's all over the country and can assure you, corporate would be ashamed of this location if they ever knew how patrons were treated. Save your money and go else where!!3.5 stars.This Sheraton has been my home for over 4 months now. Come here every Monday-Thursday and know a lot of the staff by name.+:- Floor 14 and 15 have been upgraded and the rooms are super nice now. Sadly, it's only once in a while that you get one of those rooms.- Gym is very nice, free earphones (get yourself a couple of them)- If you're a status holder you get free breakfast and snacks around dinnertime at the lounge. Nothing too fancy though.- My fave thing though is the location, can't beat a morning run around the harbor!Overall, might be overpriced on some days...I stayed at this hotel for a work event mid July when they were having an extreme heat wave. It was not fun and very humid. Back to the hotel. It is located literally right behind/connected to the convention center. I stayed in  room 1128 which was a corner room with a partial harbor view. It was a pretty good sized room and the view was nice. I loved the king bed. The tv seemed a bit too small for the size room. I did not like the dark brown carpet. It gave me the creeps thinking about what the dark color could be hiding. The first night I didn't have any neighbors or at least they were pretty quiet. The second night I could definitely tell that folks were in the room on each side of me. The walls were not sound proof. I could hear people talking all the time. Not fun when you are trying to get work done. Overall it is not the worst hotel I have been in but not the best. This Sheraton could use an overhaul as well as some other Sheratons I have stayed in. Don't forget to include the meeting rooms in the overhaul.I usually don't write reviews because I am a person that would just brush off minor issues but this I will not brush off. I recently stayed at this Sheraton because my company was in AOTA. The building was whatever, customer service could be better. What made this trip miserable for me was that after my first night in the room, 910, I woke up with hives/rashes and I didn't know why. I asked my co-workers if they had any issues and three of them had some minor skin irritation. We just thought it could be the detergent so that is understandable. I asked customer service up front and they said they would have my sheets changed (they should really think about that option), I was on Benadryl cream and pills all week. The second day I told the manager and he offered to refund my Benadryl purchase and change the sheets again. I showed them my arms and my torso with all the marks but they just apologized without a solution. I stayed there for a week. Slept on the couch and everyday sucked. I came back to California and went to Kaiser first thing and they confirmed these hives/rashes were due to bites...THIS PLACE HAVE BED BUGS. I was sleeping on a bed with bed bugs and they just offered to change my sheets. I hope to never go back to this hotel and will make sure nobody I know will ever go here. Also, their room service food is terrible. Do not stay here.
