The restaurants here are hit or miss. Wit and wisdom is overpriced with mediocre food and mediocre service despite having a great chef. Azumi was delicious with several fish overnight shipped from Japan and great service.Second visit to the Four Seasons Baltimore.  This one was considerably better than the previous.  Hotel is still under construction and thus it is difficult to pull into valet, although very busy weekend.  Food in Wit & Wisdom and the late night room service menu were both excellent.  The hotel staff went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of during check-in.  Concierge was very kind, too.The heat experience at the spa was excellent -- make sure you take advantage, as it is available to hotel guests.  Only negative:  The entire time, there was a high pitched frequency in the room that was borderline maddening every time we turned the TV off (which we didn't want on) -- literally couldn't sleep.  My husband heard it, too; definitely electronic, but couldn't figure out where it was coming from (bad LED light?).  Still, a much improved stay versus last time.Stayed here for a long weekend in June, we were on the top floor in a corner room with a balcony. The room was gorgeous and the view of the harbor was picturesque. They have late night room service which was great, we ordered a bottle of wine to go with our pizza from Fells. The hotel is located in Harbor East and within walking distance to all the nightlife in Fells. The pool was perfect to cool off and has a great view of the city. Wit and Wisdom is downstairs and has indoor and outdoor seating. There are mum ours restaurants with excellent food right next door, if you're in Baltimore you have to try Charleston!I was here on September 18th 2015 for the Flip Flop Festivus in Baltimore. I won tickets and the  event was very good! This event is held yearly.. l must say this is a very good event.  They had a parking garage right next door and the parking was under  $10.00 for four hours or less and we all know that is good for Baltimore. ..We parked in the garage that took you straight into the Hotel. The event was held on the upper level and they had two rooms.  One was VIP and the other was where the event was held. They had all types of delightful appetizers and drinks. Two bar areas set up in the  VIP area and another set up st the main event  room.  They had tables available and areas where you could stand and eat as well.  I  must say l was definitely impressed.Now it's time to unwind.  You can bet that's what we did! The reception started at 6:30pm and the main event started a little after  7pm. The music was on point with the Group named Soul Expressions of Richmond VA.  They took it back with some oldies and then played a variety of music that everyone enjoyed.  I also enjoyed every bite of all the appetizers. Omg definitely no complaints at all.. they also had an auction of numerous goodies such as games and events to attend. Everyone there was so nice and was definitely enjoying the event.  We also got a chance to meet others that are diagnosed with the condition of sarcoidosis.  We had a chance to meet the Dr. At John Hopkins who is working to help with the treatment of this condition. I Got a chance to meet some really cool people. Including the main man responsible for making this happen every year. Between the overall event and the dancing and just everything else in general. It was a very enjoyable  four hours.   This definitely was a Success! I would love to attend this next year and give my support.  So Thank you Yelp for making this happen.  l truly do appreciate it!Like every Four Seasons I have stayed at, the service and the amenities of the room were some of the best I have experienced.  Located between the Inner Harbor and Baltimore's Little Italy, it was in a great location.  Parking was available underneath the hotel as either self-serve or via valet at the main lobby doors.  The rooms and public spaces are luxurious and well appointed with great views of either the city or the harbor.  Plenty of restaurants nearby made for easy dining options.  Its expensive and more of a splurge than a routine stay, but what a treat you get for your money!Not a normal spot for me but I couldn't pass up the "Stay 2 nights, get 3rd night free." special.  $273/night before taxes was too good a deal.  Great room with an awesome view.I was able to get my company to pay for the stay but I had to make up the difference above the limit. I shouldn't get used to such luxury on business but life could be worse.My hubby and I started a tradition last summer to take a 1 night staycation here each August to enjoy the pool and feel fancy for a day. [Luckily he gets a work discount on the room!]We went this past weekend and it was fabulous, just like last year. You really feel like you are transported to a super posh resort outside of the city. The best part is, it's just a 5 minute drive home the next day feeling refreshed. We checked in at 11 on Saturday, thinking we would get a good spot at the pool, and all of the chairs were already full! We were escorted to the top deck level, which was beautiful, but all in the shade. Wah-wah. We decided to grab lunch at the pool restaurant while we waited. They do have a wait list, and by 12:30 they called our cell and notified us that 2 chairs had opened up. Score!We ordered drinks all day and really enjoyed our time here. The staff pamper you and remember your name. The pool is salt water and overlooks the harbor on one side and downtown on the other. The views are truly breathtaking. We stayed poolside until about 5:30 and then we went to our room and got ready for a dinner date at Wit and Wisdom, the hotel restaurant. I did take off a star because last year when I checked our credit card statement we had an extra charge on there from the Splash Pool bar that was not ours, and it looked like the same thing happened again this weekend! [However, for some reason this time there are just a bunch of pending charges. We should have had 3 charges and there were 7, which scared me! However, once they went through there were only the 3 that we expected, so all is good.] The pool staff are super nice and friendly, but it seems somewhat disorganized there, so check your bank statements accordingly.Enjoying a surprise romantic weekend away.  Who knew I could do that in Baltimore? The hubby did a good job, and I've already been spoiled with an excellent dinner, champagne, and today I'm getting a massage.  The check in was fast, service is excellent, and of course the location is perfect.Not your typical bar to watch football but when you're letting the lady pick the spot, whatcha gonna do?? ..LOL The bar/lounge area properly named (Wit & Wisdom), is what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Modern and down right sexy. The bar menu believe it or not is surprisingly reasonable. We had the wings, jalapeno cheese and bacon dip and tuna tartare. All three were super tasty and highly recommended! I started off with the "drink of the day" (can't remember the name) but if you like the Brazilian original Caipirinha you'll love this one. Not quite as sweet as the Caipirinha but just as strong and delicious. Four Seasons drink of the day is only $6 which absolutely cannot beat that! My date who is a walking paradox, runs marathons but loves beer.. Lol Her drink of choice was the Baltimore brewed Heavy Seas "Peg Leg", which is super dark like Guiness Stout but way tastier! The bar staff could not have been more friendly or more interactive. They were top notch! So if you're looking for a cool quiet place to watch sports or to have a drink and just talk, this is one impressive bar and your date will definitely give you two thumbs up!My wife and I went up to Baltimore and stayed at the Four Seasons with my in-laws.  We rented a cabana for the day on the 3rd and also attended the Wit and Wisdom party on the 4th.  It was all a great time, and the hotel is a beautiful property, even by Four Seasons standards.  I worked out in the morning and the gym was well equipped; the pool was relaxing, although a bit crowded.  Rooms are beautifully appointed and have some great views of the harbor, especially from the suites. Staff couldn't be nicer. If I could make one recommendation it would be on the food, which was very good (B+), but not great.  The bagel at breakfast was delicious, as was the chocolate croissant, but the brisket at wit and wisdom was fatty, and the fish tacos were heavily fried and greasy.  But these are minor nitpicky things and definitely not enough to detract from a 5 star review.So, I had won tickets to attend Flip Flop Festivus on Friday September 19,2014 at Four Season Hotel. From the time I arrived on the property I was wowed. As we pulled up to valet just to ask a question even though we were not parking valet lets just say we were treated no different. We were given directions to the garage as if we were paying for valet. Parking in the garage was no problem considering we needed a handicap spot. Found on close to the elevator. Great. Stepped off the elevator and exited and went across the street to enter into the hotel. The doorman was pleasant also. Once in we were greeted as if we were millionaires and given directions to where the event was being held. The lobby was just beautiful. Once arriving where the event was being held check in was easy. We were greeted and given appetizers soon as we walked in. The staff here was just amazing. We arrived just after the event begin. We walked around. There was a balcony just off of the event lobby. It was such a beautiful view of the water from the balcony. So relaxing. Went back in to get a drink. I know i going to mess this one up so please forgive me-----The bartender (Seedy) she was located just before you exited to go out on the balcony. She was on point with the drinks. Her selection was great she started me off with a margarita that was just awesome. She was pleasant the entire night and didn't disappoint. Once the presentation begin we were able to get a seat at a table. Inside the room were amazing appetizers. My favorite being the crab mac and cheese. There was fresh salsa, pita, chicken on stick, veggies on a stick, steak on a stick. Ravioli, Meatballs, Salad, and so much more. I got to meet Gheorge Mursean who stands 7ft. 7inches. It was as if everything paused when he entered the room. The band that played and the singer was beyond amazing. It wasn't hard to keep the floor packed. They held a raffle and someone was the luck winner of a stocked wine cooler and gift cards to restaurants in Baltimore. I was able to see survivors of Sarcoidosis. It was just amazing. The also held a auction. This event was live and benefited a great cause. This was a great place to hold this event. I hope that I am able to attend next year. It is on my 2015 list of things to do. Four Season Hotel keep doing what you are doing. No complaints from me.The best Four Seasons property and I have been to many of them. We got a pretty good deal as we were part of a wedding room block. Even with that it was pricey.Valet Parking is $45 compared to self parking at $16. It works out if you have a car and want in and out privileges. As you enter the valets are friendly, helpful and professional. The decor is tranquil, quiet luxury. Even with a bar off the side it is still very quiet. They offer refreshments as you come in and leave. My room was immaculate. Huge closet. Full bath. Overhead shower. I don't know if every room was a suite but mine was without requesting an upgrade and it had a lovely view of the water. Just stunning.  I would like to come back just to stay in the room without having to run around for a wedding.Stayed here over night (Saturday To Sunday) for a wedding. The staff were extremely accommodating. The wedding was held in the hotel and was nothing short of amazing. Bell boy took our bags up to our room offered us water and to even go get ice.  When we returned to our room that evening our bed was turned down, slippers on both sides of the bed, fresh towels.  They even folded our clothes. When we checked out again the staff was incredible and prompt. We will definitely stay here again!!!Staff - Very PleasantRooms - Very SpaciousBar/Restaurant - Wit & Wisdom (in-house) - great drinksSurroundings - Plentiful as in Restaurants, Stores-Retail and there is even a movie theater playing current up-to-date movies and a Starbucks nearbyStay overall - I plan to stay here again (their customer service is on point)Excellent in every way. Room was very well thought out; amenities were excellent. Bathroom roughly same size as a shitty Mandarin we stayed at the following night but much more useable and convenient. Nespresso machines in Four Seasons rooms are all one needs to know in making a luxury hotel choice.One of the beat hotels I ever stayed at! Hotel staff is so helpful and so friendly! Rooms are really nice and  beds are comfortable with nice views.  Personalized greeting on tv nice touch!  Pool and hottub are amazing.  The small things at this hotel make a huge difference- passing out frozen berries at pool, free bottled water, cookies, infused water and turndown service.  The relaxation room in spa is very relaxing. I highly recommend staying at four seasons.  I can't wait to come back!Did not stay here.  Went to the bar..Wit and Wisdom.  Lobby is elegant and gorgeous.  Lots of glass art and lights that are worth walking in to examine.  Location is right on the water.  Great views of federal hill and the harbor.  See my review of Wit and Wisdom.Great hotel, everything is still very new. Staff was great, pool is awesome, vibe is great. Room was perfect, very modern decor and heat in room amenities. The location is right on the harbor and within walking distance of all the tourist related spot as well as Camden. I travel often and this place is top notch. I would recommend it for anyone willing to spend a little extra money. The only downside, and it's a small one, is that the street it is located on can get very congested at times. Once it took 15 minutes for our taxi to travel 2 1/2 blocks.they are great here. Customer service  is amazing! they really went above and beyond to make us happy. This will always be my go to hotel in Baltimore.
review_content_20: Checked in and were told we'd be upgraded to suite but when we arrived at suite there was no balcony as we requested.  Went down to pool while husband got us moved to original too with balcony.  But no chairs at pool so pool hostess said I could eat at he bar only no tables at bar.  Did I mention there aren't any regular chairs at the bar?  Also very mtv spring break vibe going on.  Defeated and starving I figured I could go sit on my balcony only there is only 1 chair to sit on and it is a straight backed chair.  Seriously?  Just sent husband in search of food outside of hotel.  2 hours at this hotel and very disappointed.Worst hotel service I've ever experienced. On the first day I stayed here I had three people knock on my door asking to fluff my pillows. Then for the next 3 days it took 2 and a half hours for room service to bring a bottle of water and over an hour to get fresh towels. Even when we went to the pool by the time we got out the staff had seated someone in out seats on top of all our stuff. How does that even happen??? For the price you pay the service here is completelyTERRIBLE!! I wish I would of booked my stay at the Mariott. I mean a motel6 has quicker  service.The way they have selective treatment at the hotel is very disturbing to me in particular the pool management and some staffWonderful property in a great part of town! The pool is an amazing place to hang during the day. The service can be slow at times especially when the pool is crowded. Otherwise, the service has been good. Also, a great place to take kids!This is by far the best hotels for business travels! Everyone in every department is genuinely nice and makes it an experience when You come to visit. This is a five star hotel for a reason! They have everything you could possibly want! I'd HIGHLY recommend coming here if you have the budget of course.This past weekend I stayed at the Four Seasons in Georgetown for the first time. The experience was just amazing. The Spa and Gym are big but are not like the Ritz Carlton's Equinox where it is a public gym and can be completely packed all the time. The reception area was as expected, beautiful. The aspect that sets the hotel apart vs. others is the service and hospitality. Specifically Michael Chase the Concierge. We had several dilemmas and he took the time to actually help us figure out each one. Michael was able to get us into the best and most desirable restaurants in the city at specific times and with only a few days notice. Even when our stay had concluded he continued to help us figure out our plans for the following weekend. Service like this is the real reason that there is no question in my mind I will stay at the Four Seasons from now on when I am in Washington D.C.When you first look at their prices, it can raise some eyebrows. It is the price of some people's monthly mortgage. However, after your stay here...you realize it was worth every penny. Every detail is scrutinized and perfected. If you are worried about something, they already took care of it... if you forgot something... they already have it coming to your room before you pick up the phone. Sometimes, the bellmen address you by your name as you get out of your car for a more personalized service. It's the finest hotel you can stay in Maryland. While we were waiting to check in, they brought out a red flyer cart full of small plush toys for the baby. While we were leaving, the bellman brought out another toy and two bottles of water for the trip back. It is located close to some limited upscale shopping but close enough to walk to neighboring tourist areas if you don't mind a 15-20 minute stroll.Absolutely fabulous customer service. Extremely professional and courteous staff that does not no the word "no". Clearly lives up this hotels reputation.We stayed at the Four Seasons for the July 4th fireworks. We (2 Adults and a 19mo. old boy) showed up earlier than our check in time and had no problems getting our room.  We received complimentary cake lollipops for our son after mentioning it would be his first time seeing fireworks.  The valet were extremely helpful and attentive to my requests,  Greg from the front was particularly nice to my family and even found us while eating to give my son a stuffed animal.  I requested a late check out so I can enjoy the pool and Brunch at Wisdom & Wit (another review but in short - fantastic).  The pool bar and infinity pool overlook the harbor and quite relaxing although very small and you want to show up early for "premier" seats.  I typically try to stay at 4-5 star hotels and this one is the very reason why, Although the Marriot and Pier 5 are within 3-5min of a walk away and also very suitable (location wise);  I believe the service you will receive here at this Four Seasons is second to none.  It is a 7 minute walk to the Aquarium. 4 minute walk to a Whole Foods. 1-7 minute walk to all sort of restaurants.  We ate at Wisom & WIt, McCormick and Schmick's, and the Aquarium Grill)Oh.... the pillows are very thin on the bed and needed to be doubled up if you're like me and like them a bit firmer.This  hotel was amazing. We absolutely loved our room the service and the professionalism of the staff.   I was treated to a weekend getaway for my birthday from my wife and well worth the surprise. The room was immaculate. The bathroom was amazing separate shower and bath and water closet. It had marble throughout and a  in the bathroom mirror. The closet space allowed for garment bags and suitcases with a privacy light  so as not to disturb other sleeping guests. The view was impeccable. We stayed on the top floor and had a view of the entire harbor. The technology that was vested into just this one room was above and beyond. There were no Do Not Disturb signs but simply a button to push at your bedside that  on a red light at your door that relayed to the staff to not intrude. We enjoyed every moment of our stay.The surgeon I work for surprised myself, his wife and 4 other women in our office with a spa day and I must say it was the best surprise I've ever had. As soon as we pulled up we received complementary valet for being a spa guest. We arrived at the spa and there they were greeting our party by name as soon as we walked in. We loved the relaxation room. After a dip in the jacuzzi I had a cup of cucumber water and could fall asleep to the beautiful view overlooking the harbor. The robe and slippers were also so comfortable. My massage was amazing. I've never had a male masseuse but he was very professional and gentle as I requested my massage on the light to medium side. By far the best massage I've ever had and I get them on a monthly basis. We then had a great lunch at Wit and Wisdome. The grilled shrimp salad was delicious. The shrimp were large and so flavorful. Everyone in our party enjoyed their lunch. All in all we were there for about 5 hours and had an amazing time. I would have stayed all day if able! Thank you for pampering us and making our day one we won't forget!The hotel is beautiful,  the bed is comfortable. The amenities in room are not up to expectations for a four seasons hotel. Arriving late, check in was smooth  the desk very friendly and courteous. The room was very clean and neat - aside from one not so clean "rag" left at the side of the bed. The problems began the next morning. At some point the television switched it self on to the menu of hotel services. No big deal.   I awoke around 4:45 to find that the television channels were not available -  when you attempt to change channels the TV would reboot for lack of a better word.  Being so early and the fact that I was planning on an early start I did not want to deal with maintenance at this point.  So I just moved on. The Nespresso machine was the next issue.  Choosing to make a short coffee  I was unpleasantly surprised by the fact the water would not stop on its own and I needed to pull the plug out of the wall  to make it stop.Sadly, when checking out shortly l afterwards, no offer of any sort of compensation (I.e. discount on current or future visit, or even a voucher for a free coffee at the coffee bar on the premises).In short, it's one of the nicest looking hotel in the area and if everything worked properly would have been a great stay, but the high prices don't equate to the actual expectations of a flawless experience.Would absolutely recommend staying here.Oh yeah, this place is NICE. We have stayed here a few times as special treats...it exceeded our lofty expectations each time. It's not  a picnic traveling with a two year old...however, this place has made her feel special each and every time. I made advance arrangements for a feather-free room, crib and fridge (careful...rooms come with refreshment sensors with built-in sensors which charge you if you even jostle them). Even though I am a Marriott Platinum Elite member, they NEVER get my advance requests right, even though they are saved in my profile. But at this hotel, not only was everything perfect, they even set up the crib with baby supplies (moisturizer, baby oil, diaper, wipes, etc) and a little stuffed animal. They even pulled out a wagon at check-in to let her pick out another stuffed animal (she got a jellyfish and stingray this time, crab in the past). There was a welcome cookie in the shape of a crab, and two pails of Parmesan popcorn and cokes to welcome us as well. Wow.On top of this, the service was refreshingly friendly and efficient...no attitudes or snottiness even though we were dressed like bums. Carmen at the front desk, Garrett the parking valet, and Greg the bellman were all standouts. The room was amazing...stunning water views  and attractive modern decor which was elegant and luxurious (in direct contrast to the modern decor at W hotels which is uncomfortable with poor function). The  down alternative duvets and pillows were impossibly soft and fluffy...I've never slept on a more comfortable bed in my life...unfortunately, it has ruined all other beds for me.If I were to nitpick some things (and I always do), I was somewhat surprised, considering the relative newness of the hotel, that some things were falling apart. The heavy glass door to the water closet was missing one hinge such that the door torqued when closing...and a wall hook for the luxurious robes fell off the wall. Finally, turndown service was hit or miss...sometimes no music, no slippers, and never any chocolates. These were minor issues, though, as we felt pampered and were oh so appreciative of our treatment. The location in the newly developed East harbor was fantastic. I can't wait to come back!Everything here was perfect. From the valets and porters, to the front desk, to the room itself, we felt welcome and comfortable at every point. Very friendly and unpretentious. Gorgeous room, comfortable bed. The bathroom has a rain shower, a TV in the mirror, and a phone next to the toilet. Robes, safe, L'Occitane toiletries... they thought of everything. Great location, too: Easy walk to the National Aquarium and the rest of the Inner Harbor, and all the bars and restaurants around Harbor East. Highly recommended.guest accommodation is definitely a 5! =) This is my first time visiting Four seasons for an event. I got a quick tour of the fitness and spa/pool area and I"m already convinced that I will love this place if I had the opportunity to stay overnight.Employees make effort to be extra friendly and helpful.  I had a great experience with the PR rep AND the front lobby reps. I parked in their garage thinking that the odds of getting my parking pass validated would be easier if I went with valet parking. Wrong! The parking garage is through the city so makes validation difficult since it has no direct affiliation with the hotel.  I told the PR rep my situation and explained to me the situation and that I may have to pay for it but she went ahead and signed my pass hoping that it would help. I took my question to the front desk rep and an [attractive] gentleman appeared out of no where and offered me the validation pass. The entire team seemed to be on point to ensuring guest is satisfied and indeed I was.Four Seasons Baltimore CongratsFor all you worldly people no this location can not hold a flame to ATL or Bora Bora but its a step in the correct direction for Baltimore. When I arrived at the hotel the valet was beyond courteous and attended to my needs like a mother & a newborn. Once I told them I was there for a massage valet immediately mentioned valet was free as a result of my scheduled spa services. Once out of the car I received full instructions on how to reach the spa. I stopped past the concierge desk to first inquire on my upcoming stay. The desk attendant was polite and appeared to have some interest in why was I staying, business, play? I advised her that my future stay is for my birthday however r today I was having a maternity massage. OMG she was elated as if she were expecting. I adjourned to the spa- where I was greeted with fresh water with lime slices. Once in the back the attendant quickly ran through the locker and relaxation area. I was not rushed but she had to get all the information out including showing me that awesome pool they have been hiding -yummy.Pregnant brain forgot the name of the masseuse but not his hands. He rubbed my muscles with just enough pressure. Very patient with the changing of positions (unlike my husband)during the massage. All in all I have to say the Spa alone was out of this world. Can not wait to go backI come here for all my business trips and I love the four seasons. How can you not??? It's got the best of everything. I love their bed and everything about it. I sleep like a baby when I'm there. I can't wait to go back again!Awesome porters, front desk crew and staff. Great comfortable rooms. TV in mirror in the bathroom, great waterfall shower. Very comfortable bed and amazing views.  TV didn't work but after a tech came a couple of times it worked fine.  Only bad thing was the food. The food staff was great, but understaffed and poorly managed. Had lunch outside by the pool and waited about an hour and a half for simple meals.  Wasn't the waitstaff fault, but you could tell they were running around aimlessly.  Plus the food was disappointing. Even room service late at night was pretty awful. Overall a good hotel. Impressive roomsStaff was great and everything was on oar with price. I would recommend. Location is great also.
review_content_40: Extremely nice hotel, but verrry pricey. We booked a hotel package so luckily our parking was free because valet prices are crazy. They greet you right when you walk in and walk you over to the front desk.  This hotel is also PET FRIENDLY for dogs under 25lbs which is amazing.. and you don't have to pay an extra fee. They even offered to send up a dog bed and food bowls for my dog which she loved!  The partial water view room was HUGE.  It had a huge king size bed and a living room area. The bathroom is also massive with double sinks and the best part about it...there is a built in tv in your mirror with surround sound. Its amazing. I also am a big fan of hotels that have turn down service included. Its so nice to come back to your room and have it clean before you go to bed. We would definitely come back again for a special occasion.Let me start by saying the stay was very regular.I expected a little more the room was nice and I loves the tv in the mirror it's no Andaz or Ritz Carlton.The breakfast gave me the runs.My man and I stayed for just one night and I left all my makeup products and my makeup bag at least 600.00 or more worth of makeup.The first time I called the lost and found and the lady that pick up was a jerk.So after crying and throwing a tantrum speaking with my sister she was like you need to get manaGment in the line.I called back and the Manager Derrick Lockhart found it and shipped it to me the next day.Im very appreciative that it was returned and un touch.So I'm giving him a 4 star the hotel it's self is about a 3 The food and the lack of hospitality is why I rate this place so low.Besides that it would've gotten a 5My favorite hotel in Baltimore. Bar none! Stayed for one night to have birthday celebration dinner with my special someone. Top class service is apparent when the hotel staff helping bring the luggage calls us by our last name. Also upon walking in to our rooms you see your names being welcomed in the big screen tv.Walked out of the room to have dinner at Roy's and upon coming back there was a small cake waiting in our room with happy birthday sprinkled all over the plate it was served in. Been to a few fancy hotels but the service and the room of this 4 Season definitely ranks among the best hotels that I've been in. Too bad it was still too cold to be enjoying the outdoor infinity pool overlooking the inner harbor.This is definitely a better 4 Seasons than the one in DC since its newer and located in a quieter part of town. I love everything about this place. Will definitely be my go to hotel when in Baltimore.I have hosted my wedding here, been here on spa date, and dinner and every single time I get the same results.... WORLD CLASS CUSTOMER SERVICE.  From being greeted and remember by the valets and front desk staff, to the service I have received from every aspect of their service.  If you are every planning an event, call Martha and Natalie in Sales.We were here for the Sarcoidosis Charity Benefit Flip Flop Festivus. This review is only for the actual Four Seasons, not that event (which was wonderful). Overall this is a nice Four Seasons hotel, typical of the chain. Luxury and class and bit of pompousness which I like. We had a second floor ballroom with a private lobby area. The best part here was the balconies on the back of the lobby area right outside of the ballroom. They overlooked the water right above Pier Six. It was beautiful up there and the ballroom was equally well maintained. The food was relatively good, with some stations set up and roving waiters with appetizers. The panko crusted mac and cheese was a crowd favorite. My only real complaint here was the bar service. It was open bar and we tipped appropriately however after three drinks in the course of almost two hours for me and my girlfriend, the bartender said we were a bit intoxicated and needed to slow down. I know my limit and also wasn't driving that evening, as we choose not to risk it. While I respect the bartender keeping patrons safe and not letting drunk people be overserved, it seemed to be a more of a "I want to save the house liqour and not serve anymore" more than a "Let's keep people safe."We SO enjoyed our stay at this Four Seasons- they made our romantic getaway weekend celebrating an anniversary especially memorable with 5-star service and expert attentiveness.  I must commend Preston Rooks, a Les Clefs d'Or Concierge and Trey, for their help and feedback on Mister's restaurant choices, reservations and guidance on what not to miss whilst in Baltimore.Our corner room was spacious, comfortable and so FAB, it was hard to leave every morning.  I loved the shower and TV within the bathroom mirror (I MUST have this in my bathroom).  Our King bed was AMAZING.Working out in their immaculate gym made me feel toned and fit- what a posh place. We'll definitely return to Baltimore and to this Four Seasons.One of the nicest hotels I've ever been in. The TV in the bathroom mirror is incredible. What truly makes this hotel special is the staff. Everyone looked you in the eye and greeted you. The people at the doors always rushed to open them. And when I brought up Baltimore the staff lighted up with positive remarks about their city. It's a great place to visit!We switched hotels to the Four Seasons after a terrible experience right next door. They completely saved our trip and brightened our day. There was even a little bag of candy saying "we hope your weekend gets better!" when we got to our room. Best hotel experience ever!I am here for a business trip and glad I came across this hotel as others close to my work were booked.  It is a beautiful hotel and service is great.  The staff goes out if their way to please you. It has amazing views and restaurants and shops are just footsteps away.  Great place !!!Everything about the Four Seasons Baltimore is superlative.  I loved the beautiful room with a sweeping view of the harbor and a balcony.  Enough good things cannot be said about the staff, who were without exception friendly, responsive, thoughtful, and welcoming.  I travel extensively and have been fortunate to stay in many wonderful hotels.  The Four Seasons Baltimore will always be at the top my list.  I cannot wait to find the next reason for being in Baltimore.  Oh, wait, I just did -- the Four Seasons!I have been to Baltimore, MD twice with my girlfriend in the past year or so and both times stayed at this hotel.  Both times we had a pleasant experience at this hotel from the courtesy of the staff to the quality of the rooms.  The first time we had a city view room which was nice but the harbor view room the second time was definitely better.  My only complaint was that the pool's bar was located outside our corner room so it blocked half of our view of the harbor.  The valet here is good as well as the self parking garage.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in Baltimore.Exquisite service, lovely accommodations, very costly food and drink but oh so worth it.THE BADCell reception in the hotel is just horrible. Not very conducive for business which is highly unexpected for a new hotel. I heard multiple people at the meeting which I attended complaining about it on multiple devices and networks. Also, the tap key card lock in the elevator is cumbersome. I missed my floor 4 times trying to get the card to allow me to select my floor. I get the security, but the same method is used on the doors at the rooms. How much security do you need?THE GOODIconic lobby and uber-friendly staff. Kelli at the front desk is cute and awesome! The rooms are HUGE and the bathrooms are the best. 2 headed shower options, in-mirror TV. Could not be better. They also do 2 days of free Wi-Fi which helped with the reception issue.The gym facility is huge and has tons of options. The pool deck is ideal with a view of the bay complete with a bar and infinity pool. Awesomely designed.Overall I'd say this is a great hotel. Can't go wrong with brand new.This is a fabulous hotel with impeccable service.  We arrived at 1:00 PM and went to the pool while our room was getting ready.  Upon arrival to the pool you are transported to a vacation.  There is a wonderful bar/restaurant, an infinity pool, a reflecting pool, hot tub, and amazing views.   Children are permitted but clearly discouraged.  They had music going, but it was not oppressively loud.  We ended up staying at the pool for several hours talking and people watching.  It was clearly a "scene."  I then received a call that our room was ready and that our bags had already been brought up.  The room was spacious and modern.  We had dinner at Wit and Wisdom.  The food was spectacular and I highly recommend the lobster pot pie.  Spend the extra money and stay here!!Maybe I'm just used to the Best Western, but this place was amazing.First of all, the staff is there to please. I needed a little space for a small ceremony because the weather outside was looking questionnable, and they hooked me right up. The icebuckets are filled in the room when you arrive. When you turn on the TV, it greats you by name. We checked our bags with the bellhops while we went to the pool, and they took the extra step of taking the leftover cake we had from the ceremony and putting it in their roomservice fridge. The bed was comfortable, the roomservice food was delicious, the view was great, etc, etc, etc.The pool is amazing. Staff members are constantly refilling water glasses and when you get out of the pool, there was always a fresh towel waiting for us.If you can swing it financially, you and your significant other should do their romanting getaway package.WOW, that's all I could say as I entered my room and glared at the television while it said "Welcome Mr. Adams and Happy Birthday Leah!" I was there to celebrate my girlfriend's 30'th birthday and it was probably one of the best experiences I have ever had. Special occasion or not, this place knows how to treat people from start to finish. From the moment I entered the hotel, I was royalty. Great staff, great location, amazing rooms with phenomenal views. Pay the $500/night it costs and be prepared to experience luxury.The Four Seasons is pricey however, it is pretty much as good as it gets. The staff is very polite and helpful. The rooms are very elegant and comfortable. Most of them have a great view. The pool is awesome. I stayed for a weekend and planned on going out and seeing the city however I could not get away from the saltwater pool with beautiful views and fantastic service.Again this hotel is pretty pricey however you get what you pay for.This place is amazing!  An oasis within the inner harbor!!!!!If I am ever staying overnight in Baltimore again it will definitely be at the four seasons! The hotel staff was amazing ... friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. My wife and I stayed in one of their suites, and it had the most amazing view of the harbor I have ever seen. I think the guy at the front desk said something like 80% of their rooms have harbor views! The restaurant wait staff was great; attentive without being overbearing. The Sommeliers were able to pair up our meal with excellent selections from start to finish. The bartenders there are world class (mixing different herbaceous ingredients to make tasty cocktails) and friendly.Bottom line is ... if you have the scratch to spend, I highly recommend the Four Seasons Baltimore.I got married here in the end of April. Simply impeccable service from beginning to end. My family, guests, husband and I were treated so incredibly well and all of our needs were attended to. A special shout out to Martha Morningstar, who made our event an incredible success.
review_content_60: I really love this hotel. There isn't much to say about it that hasn't been said in other reviews. Fantastic location, fantastic rooms, fantastic staff. Check in was fast and easy, they were even able to accommodate us when we arrived early. We chose to self park instead of valet which was easy and convenient since valet was almost $60 for one night but it's to be expected coming from such an upscale hotel. I will definitely be returning to the Four Seasons.Really great area to stay while in Baltimore. Some shopping, but plenty of restaurants and 4 blocks from the Italian area if you want great food.Like every other 4 seasons I've stayed at the staff is trained very well, the rooms have great appointments and the bed was very comfortable.Some people have mentioned the poor cell reception in the hotel, and yes it was not great.If you love coffee, then you have to try the Lamill coffee from California. Even the decaf tastes like the real thing, and they have wonderful pastries. The staff there was as friendly as the hotel staff. Not so with the Michaell Mina bar and restaurant.Better places you can walk to for a glass or wine or cocktail, and with better service.Wish the hotel would take over that part so it would on a par with everything else the 4 Seasons does.Stayed here September 16-20 for the first time visiting from Seattle. The hotel was as nice as expected and we enjoyed our time here, for the most part. First, I will say what I liked and then what was not so great.What I liked:-Beautiful lobby, fully-stocked gym with a nice view, great spa with amenties available to any guest (manicurist was friendly and did a nice job), lovely room (floor plan and decor), fantastic Michael Mina restaurant.What ruined our stay:-The bed. Simply put, it was horribly uncomfortable. I can't say it enough, I was confused and unhappily surprised the entire time and how uncomfortable the bed was. My boyfriend and I kept wondering if maybe room service forgot to put the mattress pad on because there's no way such a nice hotel would have such a hard bed. It was like sleeping on wood. Mind you, we stayed in one of the executive suites, so it was an above average room in the hotel, which further made it confusing to us. My shoulder started hurting after our second night and was sore for a few days. Finally, on our last night I decided to bring it to the concierge's attention and he seemed utterly perplexed by my mention of the bed. About ten minutes after getting back to our room the phone rang, it was the concierge, and he said a bellhop was on his way up to bring something that would make it more comfortable. The guy showed up with a down comforter with no cover. We put it on the bed and tried to lay on it, but immediately jumped off because of the prickly feathers that were sticking out of it. In the end, I turned my big pillow to lay vertically and slept on the pillow the rest of the night. Sadly, I don't think we will choose Four Seasons again after this experience. A comfortable bed is one of the most important features of a hotel, especially when you are on vacation looking to relax. The beauty of the hotel did not outweigh the discomfort of the bed.I was in town for a meeting at this hotel.  It's fairly new and everything seemed like it was running smoothly.  The staff was fantastic, from the time I arrived at the valet all the way to check out.  It's what you expect from a Four Seasons, but I still noticed.  My room was great.  Spacious and clean with a great view of the harbor.It's a beautiful place, top-notch service, great location. On a rainy day, you can sit in the bar/restaurant area on some comfy chairs and look out the windows at the harbor. What more can you ask? Well, this review would have had more stars if, as I was writing a couple of Yelp reviews in my room after lunch, a maid hadn't opened the door to my room without knocking. WHAT? When does staff enter a hotel room without knocking? Besides that, a great place.Awesome hotel! Spent our first night here after we got married. Room was well portioned, there's a TV in the bathroom and service was impeccable. We told the bellboy we just got married. Next thing we know, when we came back after dinner, they were sending us a bottle of proseco and a plate of cake & chocolates! We ordered breakfast to be delivered to our room tomorrow and again the staff was very pleasant, food was delicious. Valet parking is very expensive (I think it cost us $40 for 1 night) which is expected from this establishment. The hotel itself is not as fancy as some other Four Seasons I've been to but is very elegantly decorated. We didn't use the restaurant, spa, gym/ pool, etc so cannot really comment on that. Highly recommend this place for special occasions in the area.The hotel is gorgeous, but the service is not where it should be yet. I was there for a conference and there was drilling and construction noise that could be heard throughout the day. Getting ice took 3 phone calls and an hour and a half. There are 2 mediocre beers available at the bar. Parking is $40/night.No seriously, this place is the REAL DEAL. Elegant without being over the top, attentive but not tip grubbing. The beds are wonderful, as are the views from the rooms. The spa is worth visiting if only for the steam room, the sauna, and the ludicrously soft bathrobes. The cafe coffee is responsibly sourced and the baristas are as knowledgable as people who make their professions in coffee should be. The whole experience was just wonderful; totally luxurious without the feeling of total extravagance or tacky excess. I hoped to go back one day (when I have the dough...)First, a truly stunning hotel right on the Inner Harbor and in the heart of the scene in Inner Habor East.  Having stayed often a Four Seasons Hotels I was very disappointed in the bar service.  The bartenders appeared very disorganized, took quite awhile to get served, and an indifferent attitude toward guests.  There are better alternatives nearby.Just spent 7 weeks at the Four Seasons Baltimore while my DH was being treated at Johns Hopkins.  With all the stress we were under, the staff did everything in their power to make our stay as easy and welcoming as possible, and they fully succeeded.  They made us feel like part of their family.The staff is responsive to every request, and no request is too small or big.  We were delighted with our stay.This Four Seasons has amazing customer service and provides guests with a luxurious, comfortable stay. The hotel itself is inspired by Asian interior design is beautifully located right in the Inner Harbor. Many of the rooms have views looking out over the harbor. I highly recommend the spa as well. Whether you're on business for a night or looking for a romantic getaway, I cannot speak highly enough of this Four Seasons.An unbelievable experience with all the luxury you could ask for.  The service is amazing.  The rooms are topnotch; basically an upscale apartment.  Every detail has been thought of.  Harbor East is a very nice area as well.I stayed for the Yankees - Orioles series and had a terrific time at this hotel.  I would recommend this to anyone wanting to treat themselves when staying in Charm City.Staff very nice, views of Harbor exceptional.
